Review0.Review: Unfortunately, this is a place that seemed better days. We had their famous fried rice that they made at the table, and it was a soupy mess. Also, the chicken dish was full of potatoes and very little chicken. And the crispy chicken potstickers had a heavy sauce on them, and it was totally overdone. Last time visiting for us

Review1.Review: We three were lucky enough to be guided ar lunch  by Mr Peter Fang himself.He found the right tea for one of us who cannot touch caffeine: had the staff brew up gogi berriesHe chose dishes that were just right for us, including__an onion pancake with a sweet glaze—tempura style shrimp with a secret ingredient: apples!—A striped sea bass filet that swam in a tank only minutes before, served hot: so perfect, so tender, it was like eating the sea

Review2.Review: This place is awesome and burst of amazing flavors. I definitely recommend it.

Review3.Review: Subpar greasy food. Service was not great. Restaurant was not busy but they chose to drop a bin of dirty dishes next to our table. They gave us one glass per person for the water and the large beer we were splitting. Had to ask for glasses for the water. They brought us the main dish before the appetizer and without the side of rice. Not sure why any restaurant in a city like San Francisco would think that’s ok. We asked them to serve the dishes in the intended order: appetizer followed by main, alongside rice. Not unreasonable expectation. Ambiance was not fitting for a restaurant neighboring some of the top hotels in the city. Really bad experience.

Review4.Review: This restaurant exceeded our expectations.  We had pork belly bao buns and scallion noodles with beef.  So delicious!

Review5.Review: Fang is an experience. The food is next level and you are presented with new dishes that wake up your tastebuds.

Review6.Review: The food was excellent. I'll be back. Interested in trying other dishes.

Review7.Review: I was truly looking forward to having dinner at thisauthentic Chinese restaurant￼.  We ordered several different apps and the food came out luke warm and each dish lacked favor.  One of the 2 entrees had cold bok choy! Lastly the fried rice, which is usually a staple at Chinese restaurants, was so disappointing. Needless to say - we were crushed. ￼

Review8.Review: Fangs made a perfect experience for my family start to finish. The food was fabulous and service wonderful! We will be back!

Review9.Review: Service was not great.   The server didn’t check on us and served us crab fried rice, instead of the chicken fried rice we ordered.The chicken tenders was the best of the four dishes we had.  The Mongolian chicken dumplings were also decent, but not great.   The broccoli had way too much sauce which made it our least favorite.

Review10.Review: It’s always a great experience at Fang! A lot of times, if you’re bringing people who have never been, the owner will just take care of you. Giving you a selection of food that meets everyone’s dietary needs. Fantastic food!

Review11.Review: Fabulous meal. We had a vegetarian in our party and we were looking over the menu and Me Fang said he would take care of us about what to eat.  It was all so good. Fun table side sizzling fried rice.

Review12.Review: After eating at House of Nanking many times, we dined at Fang tonight. It’s just as incredible as HONK! Everything was delicious! We started with White River Fish Soup with Wontons and Rice Noodles because we saw it being served to the table next to us. Oh my! It was the best soup I’ve ever eaten! The fish was melt-in-your-mouth tender and the flavor was divine.We also ordered an amazing broccoli dish with the most delicious sauce, Fang’s crispy honey chili short ribs with bok choy and Szechuan noodles La fun. Oh, and we got the tea with the flower that opens up. It was all just perfect! We will definitely be back.

Review13.Review: Always a treat and you don’t even have to order.  Boom.  💥 yummy dishes just show up. Can’t wait to go back.

Review14.Review: The owner offers you a “package” without asking or mentioning the price. Absolutely disgraceful

Review15.Review: Delicious. The ribs, fried rice, pork buns and garlic broccoli were fantastic!

Review16.Review: This should be a go to Chinese restaurant while in SF. Unique spin on some dishes.

Review17.Review: I’ve been going to Peter Fang’s restaurant since the early 90’s. The House of Nanking was alway a must when visiting San Francisco. His new restaurant. Fang, is next level! Since I’ve known Peter so many years, when he comes to take our order, I just say “bring us whatever you think is best”. That’s an insider tip. Don’t order off the menu. If Peter is there, let him order for you. Just tell him generally how hungry you are and if you have any allergies or restrictions and he will hook you up with the best Chinese food on the planet!

Review18.Review: One of the best meals we’ve ever had!  Can’t wait to go back to try other menu items.

Review19.Review: The food was incredible.  It was so hard to choose but everything we had was phenomenal.  The pork belly buns, the seafood stew was loaded with seafood and very flavorful rice,  and the honey chili short ribs just melted in your mouth.  I cannot wait to go back!

Review20.Review: Great experience. Food was delicious. Love the twist to the dishes.

Review21.Review: Delightful meal. Attentive service that is not intrusive. Food was outstanding. Love the experience.

Review22.Review: We had high expectations of this place as it was recommended to us by a couple of locals.  It fell short of all we had heard.  First the owner, Fang, came to our table and asked us if we had any allergies.   One person in our party has an allergy and when we conveyed it to Fang, he got irritated and told us his dishes could not be altered.  Oookay… Then why ask?  He really made us feel uncomfortable.   He also wanted us to eat whatever he wanted to bring us, and having read some of the reviews here, we declined.  The dishes we did choose were just average at best; rice looked like it was from a Chinese cafeteria.  Overall, we were not impressed and would not be returning.

Review23.Review: The famous fried rice had an off taste and wasn’t very exciting. Potstickers were pretty good. The short ribs themselves were delicious but the onions and bok choy were severely undercooked.Service was lacking, at best. Not rude but not friendly, welcoming, or attentive.Seated by the window which was nice. There was clutter all around however, especially on the way to the bathroom. I question the overall cleanliness given how things were stored in the open.Overall a good dinner but we won’t be returning.

Review24.Review: Was looking forward to dining at Fang, considering Ms. Fang’s family legacy. There are some creative, surprising dishes on the menu—the tofu and broccoli for example—sweet/salty and doused in a creamy sweet sauce. As most reviews state, the service is borderline-abysmal. You have to wonder if staff training is simply non-existent or if there is a concerted effort on the part of management to simply not care. Am genuinely interested in this answer. I’d come back in a larger group where I’d be too distracted to care about the sub-par service.

Review25.Review: I wanted to try this place after watching Chef Dynasty on the food network. MyHusband and I have been long time diners at Nan King. My Hub started going when it opened. It was the meal I wanted after having my daughter. We went a year ago and were so disappointed. So I was hoping Fang would have some of Nan Kings dishes, they did. As luck would have it Peter was there and he remembered my husband and they chatted and he ordered for us. My daughter is gluten free and Peter had the chefs make all the dishes gluten free except one. My daughter and her boyfriend loved the food. My only feedback is the sauces were a little heavy. We didn't order rice and that would have made a difference with the sauces. The dishes we ate were apple and shrimp, tofu and broccoli, eggplant and sweet potato, pork spare ribs, a chicken soup (pictured) pork buns, and sesame bean paste little cookies hot and fresh.  My daughter had two cocktails, a lychee martini and a pomegranate margarita and neither were very good. I don't believe cocktails are their jam. We will definitely be back!

Review26.Review: Staff is incredibly unfriendly and basically rude and not appreciative of your business.

Review27.Review: Met Peter Fang and he picked all the dishes for us, it was fanulous.

Review28.Review: Fang is one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Go there, ignore the menu, and have them just bring you out food until you can’t eat anymore. You will be very happy. ￼

Review29.Review: The food was amazing. It’s always great to see Peter Fang and have him make recommendations! The service is always friendly and the food arrives quickly.

Review30.Review: We ate lunch on Sunday after a visit to MOMA for our anniversary. I looked up Hunan restaurants open on Sunday nearby and came upon Fangs. When we first sat down and poured some water, I noticed that the container was very sticky. Then I noticed that the bottom of the container was green. We were sitting near the window during the day and may not have noticed the green if we weren't. This wasn't a great way to start off a meal. We ordered soda and notified the waiter at the end of our meal about the water and they saw it and apologized. I ordered one of the short rib dishes. The sauce was wonderful and loved the bok choy but over half of the extremely small cubes of beef were all coating and fat. The dish is quite expensive and I was pretty disappointed.

Review31.Review: Good food , been here a lot in the past and same great food , service was a little off but nothing  terrible — loved the traditionalist items

Review32.Review: Cibo ottimo. Piatti abbondanti. Servizio e atmosfera ok. Ci hanno invitato ad uscire alle 21 perchè chiudeva.

Review33.Review: We ordered Mongolian Beef Short Ribs, Sesame Chicken with Sweet Potato and Lotus Chicken. We enjoyed all three.  We also ordered the House Fried Rice which is an experience watching them make it table-side but we would have preferred just white rice instead.We made reservations but probably didn’t need them at 7:00 on a weeknight.  There was no rushing to get us to vacate our table so we were able to stay and talk after eating.

Review34.Review: Second visit to Fang!  Excellent both times.  My favorite item is the pork belly bao buns!!  Still thinking about them the next morning.  Our friends said it was the food they had ever had!!! Try it, you won’t be disappointed!

Review35.Review: We were celebrating my son’s birthday and everything was lovely! We started with the Jasmine tea where the flower opens from a tight ball when it heats up. We had two tasty appetizers, a noodle dish, prawns with apples, a pork spare ribs dish and a chicken dish. All were flavorful with the right amount of spice a such wonderful creativity. They brought him sesame balls stuffed with red beans with a candle and they were delightful. A wonderful meal and terrific celebration!

Review36.Review: The food was fantastic. We had chicken, green beans and ginger - very flavorful. Then some sort of apple shrimp which seemed similar to honey walnut shrimp - also very good.  As for our starch, we had chicken fried rice and forgot to order w/out egg (my friend hates egg) so I got to eat it all and it was verrrry goood!!

Review37.Review: Outstanding, one of the best Chinese restaurants in San Francisco with fantastic food and great service.

Review38.Review: Food was amazing, but the menu online was more robust than what was offered at the restaurant

Review39.Review: The food was spectacular! It was a quiet dinner service time. Service was a little slow ( too much time between ordering apps and taking our order for the main entrees). First time we have visited. We will be back for sure!!

Review40.Review: Fantastic meal. Our large group had not been there before, so the waitress picked for us based on what people could eat, allergies, etc. We had a great variety of food and had the place almost to ourselves (for lunch on Friday).

Review41.Review: By far my most favorite Chinese restaurant!!! Amazing food, great service and I never order off the menu. I always ask the owner to decide for us  and always great experience.

Review42.Review: Amazing!!! The food was very good, the staff was very helpful, and we were left with the desire to absolutely go back again. Highly recommend!!

Review43.Review: Dining at Fang for the second time.  First of all, we walk in and Peter, the founder, was there.  He was very gracious and took pictures with my husband and me.  He took the orders, also.  The food was delicious and freshly made.  We had noodles, fried wonton with peanut sauce and a house speciality.  All delightful!!!

Review44.Review: Love this place. Owner always makes us a great meal.

Review45.Review: Kathy Fang helped us choose dishes and each one was absolutely delicious. Will certainly return

Review46.Review: Dinner was crazy delicious. Can’t wait to go back.

Review47.Review: Bring an appetite, so many dishes you will want to taste.

Review48.Review: Not a good value at all! The owner asked to order for us since it was our first time there and proceeded to bring out 5 to 7 dishes that were OK. The bill was over $300 and not worth it at all!!!

Review49.Review: I wanted to go to Fang after seeing the restaurant on Food Network. It met all expectations. Great food and service. Flavors were unique and excellent. Definitely will be back on a future trip to San Francisco.

Review50.Review: What an amazing experience. Mr Fang found out we hadn’t been before and just started bring out dishes for us to try. The best experience!!!!

Review51.Review: Amazing food!   Spareribs melt in your mouth!  Honey Shrimp delicious!

Review52.Review: First time to Fang and it met every expectation. Staff was attentive and the food fantastic.  Got lucky and Peter Fang was in the restaurant and choreographed our entire experience

Review53.Review: Owner/chef approached table and offered to chose dinner selections.   We loved the concept and agreed.  Assumed we would get chef’s best offerings but the food that arrived was less than stellar.

Review54.Review: Incredible experience and food, highly recommend.  Great for family style with a big group.

Review55.Review: Amazing food and atmosphere. Highly recommend tou family and friends.

Review56.Review: Fang never disappoints. Especially when Mr Fang himself chooses your menu! Food is amazing!

Review57.Review: I don’t usually leave these reviews, but this place was A+. Chef Fang sat us and the first thing I said was “do you have a menu”. Chef Fang laughed, knew this was our first time and said “he would take care of us”. That he did. He brought us out a variety of options - everything was delicious, popping with flavor. I will be going back next time I’m in San Fran!

Review58.Review: Good food, convenient location from Moscone center and the team really loved it!

Review59.Review: The food was good. The person that took our order, kept rolling his eyes at us.

Review60.Review: Wonderful food. The sizzling fried rice was some of the best I've had in a long time!

Review61.Review: Really enjoyed a late lunch service and food was excellent 😊

Review62.Review: Peter Fang is amazing. He told us not to worry about Menu. He made stuff for us. It was great.

Review63.Review: Met friends for lunch before visit to SF MOMA. Very convenient. We shared four dishes. All were great. Best was sizzling fried riced prepared at the table.  Great show. Highly recommended.

Review64.Review: Their food is simply awesome!! Worth every bite, a must try place

Review65.Review: The food at Fang continues to be as tasty as it was when the upscale sibling of House of Nanking first opened, but the vibe in the restaurant never returned to it's pre-pandemic levels. It's feeling tired and unenergetic.What used to be a fun night out feels more like a cramped neighborhood restaurant — with boxes and supplies piled everywhere. Yes, there are pre-mixed cocktails available. But there is no bartender to make any sort of preferred drink.

Review66.Review: Was really expecting a lot more fromthis restaurant. Firstly, the reservation I made was not acknowledged. Even though we were seated promptly (restaurant was half empty), the host didn’t seem to care when I told him we had reservations. The descriptions of the food I read wasn’t reflected the food we ate. The food generally was very oily. The Chau Chau chicken didn’t have much flavor and the chicken was really dry. The sweet potato in sesame chicken wasn’t complicated cooked through - it was a little hard. The best thing we had was the pork belly and duck buns. Wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone. And probably won’t be back.

Review67.Review: Amazing experience. 7 of us, with reservations, sat us right away. Gave us amazing service. The food never fails us. Delicious every-time. The owner chooses our dishes and it’s always bomb! Must try!

Review68.Review: Food and service were excellent. The short ribs were amazing. Loved the steamed buns, well we loved all the dishes.

Review69.Review: Best Chinese food that Ive had.  I saw a bunch of pics of the owner/chef with famous folks + an excellent review from Marc Benioff while wait for our table.We were sat & to my surprise, the owner/chef (that was in all of those pics) came out greeted us & took the menus away from us as if they were not needed & he could read our palates.  He asked if we had any food allergies.  From there they brought a plate of everything and everything was off the hook! Hands down best!

Review70.Review: Kathy is the best. Great food, great service. The buns and garlic noodles were the best. ￼

Review71.Review: Fun atmosphere Great meal. Dun and tasty flavor combinations. It was busy so courses came out  as cooked and available - too many at once. The menu innovation and flavors are terrific. Had their soup, short ribs, duck, and Fried rice prepared table-side. A must go if you are near the Moscone.

Review72.Review: What an experience! We did not know what we were walking into when we entered Fang. The place was BUSY! Stressed-out servers were running around everywhere and we began to doubt our choice of restaurant. Chef Fang motioned us to a large table and calmly introduced himself. He said he would create a special menu for us. A mystery dish came out one by one and it was incredible! Everything was delicious, creative, and exciting! In all, we had 11 entrees, and the final "fried rice" presentation (I'll keep that as a surprise) was amazing! This place is a GEM! An experience like nothing I have ever had! This is as unique and delicious as it gets. Sit back, relax and enjoy!

Review73.Review: We went to Fang for a business dinner and asked the chef to bring us what he wanted. Dish after dish after dish of the most amazing food I've had in a long time, every one with unique flavors and different proteins. The bill was surprisingly low for the value, service and quantity of food. HIGHLY recommend!!

Review74.Review: We started out with shrimp wontons and couldn't believe how delicious it was! We decided to eat "family style", which is easy here due to the generous proportions, and ate: charred broccili, fried rice (prepared table side), and spare ribs. Every single bite our eyes popped opened in amazement and a constant "mmm!" could be heard while eating as our conversation slowed to fully enjoy the food. Due to the peaceful room, although large, we were able to enjoy our conversation, atmosphere, and we both claimed this was easily in the top 3 best meals we'd ever had before. Fang is a MUST!!

Review75.Review: Very good food, quick service. Peter came in & was so friendly & accommodated our request for pictures. Love this place & will definitely be back, but not before visiting House of Nanking! That is our next stop in the next 2 weeks. best Chinese food I have ever had!

Review76.Review: Excellent Chinese food. I ate way too much! I would definitely recommend the chicken and green beans dish and go lighter on the eon tons. The soup is excellent. As was the service.

Review77.Review: MSGEntire family reacted to the food.Food came out so fast, and with no order.

Review78.Review: Where has this restaurant been all my life?! We’ll definitely be back!!

Review79.Review: Neutral food offerings, odd but okay. Service was very disappointing, no interaction and staff was annoyed with questions. No niceties and pretty much felt like they didn’t want us there. We will not return.

Review81.Review: Delicious foods. Creative combos. Great choices for vegetarians and pescatarians.

Review82.Review: This was the best meal we had on our Spring Break trip!  Fried rice done tableside was my favorite, can't wait to go back!

Review83.Review: Good for bringing business guests and expensing large meals. The restaurant does basically “omakase” but for Chinese food while taking into consideration any dietary restrictions or special requests. I think we had a total of 10 dishes for 9 guests, always nice to be seated at a round table to talk to everyone very clearly too.

Review84.Review: The woman taking our order is extremely rude and impatient, tried to upsell on a “set menu” by taking away our menu after we said it’s our first time. We refused and wanted to order a la carte, and she became extremely rude.

Review85.Review: Fang is always on point. The food is always incredible. And if/when Peter or Cathy are there, just let them know of any dietary restrictions and let them do the rest. You will not be disappointed.

Review86.Review: Wonderful lunch with friends.  The owner ordered for us, so we had delicious spareribs, chicken in steamed dough, shrimp skewers, clam soup, short rib cubes, and countless other goodies.

Review87.Review: Love Fang. It is best to work with Peter Fang - share food desires/requirements with him, and let the kitchen bring out the best selections for a special evening of dining. It is my preferred way to experience Fang.  The food is exceptional, and they are skilled at working with groups. It is truly a treasure, with a great location and plenty of parking around Moscone Center.

Review88.Review: The menu is strange. Mostly fried chicken dishes. We ordered salt and pepper prawns. Not a speck of pepper visible. We ordered chicken with chili sauce and long beans and asked that it not be too hot.  What we got was chicken and broccoli in a white sauce, which turned out to be mayonnaise and mustard seeds. The person who served it to us said it was chef’s secret sauce. She didn’t know. The original server thought he was being helpful.My husband liked beef and there was one beef offering.We were disappointed in the selection, the execution, and the experience.

Review89.Review: The owner greeted us and insisted he order for us. He brought out food we didn’t want or like, such as soy braised hard boiled eggs, short rib cubes, sweet fried chicken, raw bok choy, etc. The water for hot tea was tepid as if from a tap, definitely not boiled. I paid $300 for a meal I wanted to spend $150 on. Food is swathed in sweet sauce and all of it is fried. I was not impressed by any dish and will not return. Overall the experience was underwhelming.

Review90.Review: I had seen the show House of Fing on TV and knew that Peter Fang was quite a character. I was looking forward to meeting him and co-owner and daughter Kathy. When  he found out it was our first time at the restaurant. He asked us a few simple questions and told us he would order for us, each course was delicious and satisfied all five guest. It was quite an experience having someone else order and explain what the entrées were. It was worth every penny I would go back. It was a great experience!

Review91.Review: This was our first visit to Fang.   We were a party of 4 seated at a table for 8.    We asked for a different table as plenty were available.    Request denied.     We are an elderly group and somewhat hard of hearing - so making conversation across such a large table was difficult.   The host at the door seated us and he was friendly enough.   The service experience once seated was rather dreadful, even bizarre.     A white-haired man wearing a mask came to our table several times - offering to create a meal for the table.    He was difficult to understand but persistent and pesky.     I don't know who our actual server was - as we just flagged down someone who was rushing by when we wanted to order or make a request.     None of them were friendly or helpful.    No one smiled.    We felt like an imposition.     The food was average at best.

Review92.Review: Fang was absolutely amazing. Attentive service and incredibly delicious food.

Review93.Review: An excellent experience. A prompt service. A must to have a reservation otherwise might be a long wait for the table. Food is fresh and delicious. I will be back for more!

Review94.Review: I do not come here if you are diabetic. Every dish that the owner chose for us was sweet, chicken in a sticky sweet sesame sauce, beef with a sweet sauce even the broccoli had a sweet sauce drizzled over it…. If you like sweet and savory then it might be for you as the food was nicely cooked and service was good.

Review95.Review: We really enjoyed our meal.  The flavors were delicious.

Review96.Review: First time customer, this was absolutely fantastic experience. Will absolutely return!

Review97.Review: Everything was amazing, our best dinning experience by far in SF area.

Review98.Review: Amazing, as always. Fang is my first reservation on every trip back to SF!

Review99.Review: Since we watched the food network which featured Fang, my husband and I couldn’t wait to visit this restaurant. We were both pleased with our trip to Fang. There were so many delicious dishes and we couldn’t decide. Peter Fang made some recommendations. Every bite was scrumptious. We can’t wait to return.

Review100.Review: Pete Fang brought us to our table and told us he would bring out the dishes. They all were amazing. If you are in San Fran it’s a must stop! Great service and awesome experience

Review101.Review: Excellent food as usual. However service was terrible - rushed, not at all attentive and actually somewhat rude.

Review102.Review: We ordered the dumplings with eggplant which is a must have, the black sesame noodles, a few types of baos and the beef with Bok Choi. Everything was delicious. Not your typical Chinese cuisine but a creative twist to it. Service was prompt and the environment was warm.

Review103.Review: 老闆跟員工服務都很親切，菜色也好吃 重點是價格也不貴，CP值頗高，如果來舊金山想吃中餐的話，是一個好的選擇，推薦給大家

Review104.Review: Have to acknowledge that the restaurant was clearly understaffed. Wait times for drinks and to take our order took way too long. No one came to refill our empty water or tea kettle. Food was good, some was great. We had made reservations for an office bday lunch. None of that was acknowledged either.

Review105.Review: Peter Chang personally took orders, and even suggested that because it was our first time he would recommend the dishes. It was a varied selection, all a bit more innovative than a standard southern Chinese menu. Our favorites were the chicken buns appetizer and the broccoli/shrimp/cubed beef (both highlighted on the Food Network). The soup had clams and shrimp and crispy rice in a gentle white broth. The egg/fried rice was finished at our table on a sizzling cast iron pan: a nice flourish for basic egg/fried rice with peas. We loved the citron-ginger tea where the lemon zest has been soaked in sugar syrup. We saw some noodle dishes and potstickers go by and next time we’ll order on our own.

Review106.Review: We wanted a vegetarian meal.  The owner talked to us and we agreed to have him order for us.  He created an interesting menu, and the dishes were all great.

Review107.Review: We love Fang and have been eating there for a decade at least.  Cathy and her father are always so welcoming and they sometimes have the time to make us special vegetarian dishes which we really appreciate.  It's an amazing place, and we couldn't recommend it more highly.

Review108.Review: Amazing food and service! And the vegetarian selections were incredible! We were a party of seven and each of us was thrilled with the food!

Review109.Review: Food is stunning my advice would be to ask them to choose the food for you. We asked for a pork, chicken and beef dish. Unbelievably good.

Review110.Review: Excellent food great service, and overall amazing experience!

Review111.Review: This place is just okay, standard Chinese food but quick and good service.

Review112.Review: Excellent as always in the last 10+ years - thanks a lot Peter

Review113.Review: Best Chinese food I have ever eaten in the US.Was created by the owner, felt very special

Review114.Review: This was a spectacular experience. The food was authentic and delicious. Mr. Fang waited on us and chose our food based on our likes. He didn’t disappoint with the choices. Very personable and attentive. We wish they were located in Los Angeles. It was worth the trip.

Review115.Review: Fantastic place! The chef/owner came up to my family, asked if we had allergies, and what kind of flavors we liked. Then he asked, "do you trust me?" Custom menu just for us, and it was amazing!! Looking forward to our next food adventure there!

Review116.Review: I dined in by myself and sat for a very long time. I had a reservation and was seated immediately, but then nobody came to wait on me. Eventually the host who seated me noticed I had been seated for a long time came over and took my order.

Review117.Review: Had an incredible time for my husband’s birthday. We had a group of 15 and everything tasted amazing. Staff is super friendly too! Would definitely come back.

Review118.Review: I was really looking forward to this restaurant as it was highly recommended. I was so disappointed in the quality of the food.

Review119.Review: Amazing meal with a group of 10 for lunch. Served family style with a fantastic variety of authentic dishes

Review120.Review: Best food I've ever tasted. Arrived to the tables so fast. Each dish was amazing and greatly presented. Great Value also! Kathy Fang was so friendly and greeted us when we arrived. I would highly recommended to everyone!

Review121.Review: By far and away the best Chinese meal in the world. Without a doubt.

Review122.Review: Our experience at Fang was outstanding. We were seated immediately at 5:45. Mr. Fang came over and offered to order for our table after inquiring if we had any allergies. We were served 6 courses including a dumplings, bao buns, a crab wonton soup course, spare ribs, beef, shrimp and broccoli, with the finale being a sizzling fried rice prepared table side. Kathy Fang also came by our table at least twice. We were a party of four and our check was under $200 including blossoming Jasmine tea. I read some of the poor reviews in Nov and Dec and our experience was lovely and memorable.

Review123.Review: The inside was filthy, the staff was not helpful, we had to get up and ask for drinks, then get up again to ask to order appetizers. I would not dine there again because of the filth…

Review124.Review: Open only until 9. We arrived at 8 and orderat 8:15. Recommend ordering earlier.

Review125.Review: Food is very good, service was just ok. This is second time we have been. I recommend, just know service can be rushed and not friendly.

Review126.Review: Fang is best in class. The food is unique and delicious.  If you get the “surprise me” option, service is awesome.  They keep the food coming and somehow always hits the mark.  Always a delight to eat at this establishment.

Review127.Review: Had a wonderful experience and the food was delicious

Review128.Review: Server was inattentive and slow. Food was great. But not inviting service.

Review129.Review: Our team had a fantastic meal here during the JPM conference, thank you for the great experience.

Review130.Review: Amazing food, prepared and presented beautifully.

Review131.Review: Always a pleasure visiting Fang and catching up with Kathy and the team!

Review132.Review: Top notch experience.  When the chef owner heard my daughter has allergies he offered to let us trust him as to what we should eat and made us a one of the best meals we have ever had. Couldn’t recommend Fang more for quality of food and service!

Review133.Review: If given the opportunity to have the owner/chef curate your meal, jump at it and leave it in his hands!

Review134.Review: Wonderful chef’s choice dinner. Everything was delicious and accommodating to all dietary needs. Festive atmosphere but also very comfortable.  We will be back!  Thank you!

Review135.Review: The only reason I am not leaving (0) star is because the owner was kind enough to greet every customer which I thought was very nice, however, after the initial drink order we never were approached again. After watching every table around my family and I have their orders taken and their meals subsequently brought to them all, my 12 year old son and my elderly mother and I were left sitting at the table hungry for over half an hour. We were asked by one waiter if we had ordered at which point we informed them that we had not and we were still made to sit for another 20 mins while they brought food and drinks to the tables adjacent to ours who had arrived significantly later then we had. When we finally decided to leave, the patrons at the table next to us apologized for having to watch us consistently being ignored although we received not one apology from any staff of the restaurant as we left even after they were informed why we were leaving after not being served for over half an hour.Due to my family and I being on vacation and staying at the nearby W hotel, we were looking forward to eating at this location given the amazing reviews but we ended up having to walk a half a mile in the rain to eat. I am beyond disappointed and embarrassed by this experience and I hope that no one else has to go through this and will challenge this establishment to treat all of its patrons fairly and equitably especially due to Fangs representing this beautiful city to the world on the Food Network.Horrible service

Review136.Review: The food was DELICIOUS and Authentic! You could taste how fresh everything was. The Bao buns were hands down the best ones me and my friend have ever had and I’m a legit foodie. If you want a taste of home cooked food, this is your place.

Review137.Review: Food was okay but service was a bit disappointing for the price. It felt like they were annoyed we were there.

Review138.Review: A little advice: just go with it - It'll be one of the best eating experiences of your life!

Review139.Review: the owner's practice to taking order meant we sat over 1/2 hour awaiting opportunity to place an order.  a waiter finally agreed to take it.  dishes we ordered never arrived.  had to beg for rice and tea refills.   awful place even though food was ok.  will NEVER return or recommend

Review140.Review: Fantastic meal and service. The food was so flavorful we can’t wait to go back.

Review141.Review: Superb. Mr Fang himself chose our food: we wanted to share appetizers and had the best fried broccoli with garlic and shrimp we've ever tasted. Plus the best potstivkers in sauce.

Review142.Review: Mr. Fang was fantastic! He offered to order our food for us and he did not disappoint! Got to try food I probably would not have ordered left to know own devices! Mom even got a picture with him!

Review143.Review: We were excited to try after seeing the show on Food Network. We were surprised by how the restaurant looked dated and messy inside (things stored all over in the open and things stacked on the bar like a work station). The server immediately came to our table and asked if we were ready to order. They seemed to be rushing us and were not very helpful or welcoming. We thought this was the more modern Fang location and expected good service after seeing the show which seemed to say they were modernizing the family restaurant with a big focus on high quality service. The food was really good. But it seems this restaurant could use some attention and some focus on quality service.

Review144.Review: We were not greeted at the door, especially by anyone serving as a hostess. A waiter sat us, we were a party of four.  Mr. Fang looking very down trodden (someone let him stay home on a week night pls) wisked away our menus and ordered for us. Sadly I had my order ready because I’d perused the menu in advance, very excited for certain dishes. The staff began placing dishes on our table, 3 spare ribs, 3 shrimp, eggs with cucumber, three tiny cubes of beef, and it went on and on, apparently he ordered us the chefs tasing menu. I looked at other tables and people had massive platters of entrees, sign me up for that next time! Service was beyond sub par, I had to hunt someone down for the check, and the bill was 300$ bf tip.  Honestly we could have ordered what we wanted and paid significantly less!  The restaurant is dirty, piled high with junk by the bar, aluminum pans, supplies, filthy by the bathroom. I was shocked by the experience start to finish and very embarrassed I took friends there, so disappointed. And still starving when I left, as I don’t eat beef, or pork shrimp even in microscopic portions.  Maybe let guests order their own food?

Review145.Review: I love this restaurant.   Ithas the most delicious  food.  I go there every time I go to San  Francisco!!!!!

Review146.Review: Mr. Fang was charming and did a nice job picking out our meal.  The staff were not friendly.  Several times we had to ask them to please slow down bringing out our food. I was confused as to why they were doing that as they didn’t need to flip the table. It was one of the worst paced meals I ever had. The food was reasonably priced, as were the cocktails.

Review147.Review: Hands down Fang is the number one favorite Asian cuisine!  I live out off state and dine here when I’m in town.

Review148.Review: Fang—and Mr. Fang especially—always amaze and delight!  If possible, let Mr. Fang order for you and enjoy the delicious food adventure! His recommendations are fantastic. We had a wonderful time and it was a great place to celebrate a lunchtime special occasion with a group!

Review149.Review: We dined at Fengs years ago and found it by chance not knowing how fabulous the food would be.I was going into S.F. for a play and revisited Fengs.Omg it was yet again a fabulous meal. Love their pork buns.

Review150.Review: Chef Fang asked if it was our first time at the restaurant and when we said yes he took our menus away. He said he would choose our meal and he did not disappoint. The wonton/clam chowder soup was unique and delicious. Highly recommend.

Review151.Review: Best Chinese food you will find ANYWHERE. Enjoy this place before you can't get a reservation there for months :)

Review152.Review: Sesame tofu and garlic broccoli were absolutely amazing

Review153.Review: I was looking forward to dining at Fang. It had so much hype around it and I was disappointed. The food was good and I do recommend the restaurant for the food, but honestly you could just do take out and skip the dining experience. I think I was expecting a better ambiance and friendlier staff.

Review154.Review: I booked Fang for the dim sum and group dining offering but was disappointed by the food. There were very few dim sum items - spare ribs, a bun w chicken and lots of very saucy meat based dishes, some unrecognizable. When I requested a dumpling towards the end, it was the saddest, thin skin with peas inside (a veggie dumpling w peas?). It was a lot of food but I would not go back. Food network should have been a warning I guess.

Review155.Review: We loved that Peter Fang was there. We accepted his offer to choose the dishes for us! Each was delicious and we loved each dish! A wonderful dinner! We can’t wait to go back!

Review156.Review: Loved the food! Let the chef select your menu. It’s been absolutely delicious every time!

Review157.Review: Amazing fried rice!  I would definitely head back to this place

Review158.Review: I would definitely come back. We went with the Chef's recommendations and they were a hot with my entire party!  Clam wonton soup was excellent!

Review159.Review: Awesome in every way! Food was outstanding, with quick service and reasonably priced!

Review160.Review: Was a great experience! Let the chef choose your meal! It’s the way to go!

Review161.Review: Everything we hoped for! Asian food prepared with authentic authority! A stellar experience! Thank you Fang!

Review162.Review: I would not return. The service was your typical Chinese restaurant where there was no service. The food was bland and had no flavor. It was a disappointing experience.

Review163.Review: Food seems to have shifted away fromPrior excellence.  Is it “new” recipes from daughter?  Even simple classics not done well.   Steamed fish arrived with cold crunchy spinach leaves on top rather than nicely wilted greens in sauce.     It’s quite expensive and Now just not enjoyable cuisine.

Review164.Review: Outstanding enjoyed the service the owner was nice and took our order

Review165.Review: We went to House of Fang hoping to have an excellent meal and it did not disappoint    I had the ginger martini which was original and tasty.  Chef Fang personally takes the orders and when we told him we couldn't wait to taste his food he asked if we wanted him to order for us.  It was a 5 course meal and we truly enjoyed every course.  You can't go wrong ordering anything off the menu.  Atmosphere is what you make it, casual or fine dining.  Very reasonably priced.  Thank you for the culinary experience.

Review166.Review: Food was great but the service was extremely slow. The tables were ontop of eachother making it extremely difficult for staff and guests to navigate through restaurant.

Review167.Review: It was quieter than the last time I was there. It was very relaxing. The service was exceptional. Our favorite dish was the eggplant with pork dumplings!!! Outstanding.

Review168.Review: We were so happy to see that the owner was our waiter!! Great experience and food choices were amazing

Review169.Review: Heavy, greasy food with overly sweetened and heavy sauces.

Review170.Review: Terrible service. Great food. Waited 18 minutes for the bill and to go boxes.  Waited 20 minutes to be seated with a reservation and half empty restaurant. Got two menu  items  wrong.  No explanation or remedy. Food came out in random time intervals, the longest period bring over 20 minutes after the one before it.

Review171.Review: Arrived and the server took a couple of minutes to shuffle through menus.  Felt if the menus were better organized, that would not have happened.  We ordered an appetizer/starter, entree, sizzling fried rice and the green beans and potatoes.  The entree came out first and rice was the last thing brought out.  Maybe that’s how it is done but most places bring appetizers first.  Food was tasty but service wasn’t great.  Only other comment I have is that a good, deep cleaning is long overdue.  The artwork, booths, and bathroom vents have A LOT of dust, which is not appealing to see.

Review172.Review: This my second time going to Fang and I was disappointed with the experience.  I had recommended this to my colleagues and the service was poor and the food was ok. The server couldn't help answer any questions on the menu or drinks.  She asked no one what they liked or didn't like.  It was rushed and she basically "took our order" in 60 seconds for a large party.  If she had taken more time to find out what we liked and enjoyed, the food options would have been better.  Also, many of the dishes were bland!  Sadly, my experience this time around was significantly less positive than my first time.  I won't be back or recommending the location.

Review173.Review: I've been to Fang prior to COVID, but, more tellingly, prior to the airing of Chef Dynasty: House of Fang. The first two visits were very nice, including Peter ordering for a table of 8 (fortunately, my company was footing the bill). I'm sorry to report that our most recent visit was a complete disappointment. We had a 5:30 reservation because of a show we were seeing that night. The door remained locked until 5:35 and there was no welcome or hello offered, just an unlocked door and someone turning on their heel away from us. We were then shown to a table in the front window, where other diners were soon seated on either side of us, presumably to give the impression of a full house. What became most annoying were the kitchen staff yelling behind the pass ... and then a crying baby was added to the mix (not a baby belonging to any guests, mind you). Service was brusque, the food uninspired - when you see "fried potstickers", they mean it - not pan fried, but deep fat fried. While Fang's steamed buns were passable, the Mongolian short ribs were not.We would have ordered more to taste but the whole experience was a first-class disaster. It's as if the Fang's have enjoyed their 15 minutes of Hollywood fame, and now just want to milk the convention center trade without any concern for locals and the restaurant's reputation. It's a hard no for us going forward.

Review174.Review: They could do a better job at house keeping, my wife said extremely dusty. A bit loud from kitchen staff. Slow service at end of meal to get check and boxes for left overs. Parking was difficult. Over all food is Great, worth the experience.

Review175.Review: We went to this restaurant after seeing their offerings online. What we received was something as close to idyllic as possible.  We were a party of five and we appeared to be a bit discombobulated when a gentleman approached our table. We had been admiring a picture in the restaurant that featured Keanu Reeves with this same gentleman. He then told us that he was both the owner as well as the cook at the restaurant.  He suggested a family style offering that sounded truly delicious. However, we informed him that we had a family member who was Delia’s. Without missing a step the gentleman (Mr. Peter Fang) told us that he completely understood and that he would handle that extra ‘wrinkle’.  His staff proceeded to serve us the most incredibly delicious nine course meal that was accompanied with a distinct separate but equally delicious nine course meal for our extra special family that was the most generous offering anyone could ever have expected or imagined. Needless to say that this entire experience was a unique one of a kind heavenly offering that will forever have us returning to eternally thank Mr. Fang and his staff for their gracious and more than delicious meal. If anyone desires a super meal with great people , well you found it here at Fang’s in San Francisco.

Review176.Review: Had business lunch here with my colleagues. The server was gracious enough (like they usually do at House of Nanking) to say that they will take care of the ordering for us. They accommodated 5 of us (three vegetarians) nicely. Food was delicious and the prices were very reasonable for downtown.

Review177.Review: Great food, good to take recommendations from the chef.

Review178.Review: interesting coming here when convention at moscone is happening.food delicious, service was good, great for our group to enjoy a brisk walk!

Review179.Review: Took a group of first-year college students, including my daughter.  Table of 7.  Mr. Fang introduced himself and waved for us to give him the menus.  We obliged and I wish we had not.  Some things were good, but the volume was unusual. We got a massive platter of sweet potatoes, which were tasty, but followed by chicken with sweet potatoes. This didn’t make sense. The sweet potatoes needed something to go with them like green beans or anything really. Main dishes were very sweet and saucy, and needed steamed rice to balance them out. However, the only rice we were served was in the form of fried rice, which was fun to watch them prepare a table, but the flavor was more like Spanish rice. Overall, we could’ve done a lot better by ordering all the things we wanted. We didn’t get any noodles, which is something we really wanted. We did not get the pork belly buns which Fang is known for. Fresh fish was amazing, but I felt terrible, because the amount they brought could have fed 20 people.  Chef Fang may have just been having an off night, but he seemed very tired. In fact, the whole place looked tired. They have let garbage pile up at the front reception, desk, and the walkway to the bathroom is a dingy and dirty storage space. Overall, this was a major disappointment.  Do not recommend.

Review180.Review: I will remember this meal for the rest of my life! We let the owner chose our meal fully and couldn’t not have been happier!  So fresh, so new, so balanced. THANK YOU

Review181.Review: Our first time there, the owner asked if we had any food allergies and if we trust him. OMG, absolutely. What an incredible experience, more than just great food. A must-go, and must-go back restaurant!

Review182.Review: Love FANG, favorite chinese food in San Francisco.

Review183.Review: Smoke (albeit the smoked BBQ ribs are very good) & Mirrors - the vanity. Great disparity too when entrusting Peter to order for us - we received the boring “white washed” table-side fried rice, roasted pumpkin, buns, a tasteless sticky-plate of potstickers. I wasn’t disappointed but also wasn’t blown-away - the place is super loud and service is at a minimum.

Review184.Review: The staff was GREAT....I wanted a quiet table and they gave me all sorts of options once we got there.  The food is outstanding...we loved every dish and I really do not think you can order anything boring.I love the vibe in this place....no nonsense...no pretense...just good solid service and good solid food.I mean really...what more do you need?

Review185.Review: Kathy surprised us with some yummy dishes.  It was a busy but she managed to come over and talk to us and made us feel like VIP.  I loved the soup and the eggplant dish.  Both Kathy and Peter were super friendly and down to earth and the service was great.  I will definitely go back.

Review186.Review: This is the best. Hands down. Peter, the owner, couldn’t t be more accommodative, humble with absolute focus on quality. I never go to SF without having either lunch or dinner there. If they offer, have them choose your meals. Outstanding.

Review187.Review: We live in the Bay Area and took our relatives here because they had watched the show and always wanted to go.We were met with the Father coming up to the table and telling us he would take care of us. We would have been happier ordering ourselves but he walked away and very quickly food started to arrive. Heavy sauces full of sugar and grease, nothing fresh tasting, Just not great food.We eat in a lot of restaurants in the Bay Area and Napa and when the food is incredible and high-priced you leave feeling happy because the meal is amazing. In this case the food was not great and the outrageous bill left all of us with a bad taste in our mouths. We did not feel taken care of by the Father, we felt taken advantage of.

Review188.Review: One word- unbelievable. From the service to food, this whole thing has left me thinking about this meal for days

Review189.Review: We have a chef just send things to our table instead of ordering. It was very good and I do recommend that it was a chance to try lots of different things instead of just getting bigger dishes. The only thing I would change is that they brought all the food virtually at one time and I would’ve preferred if they brought all these small plates over a period of time so you could enjoy each thing and it would all stay hot.

Review190.Review: Wonderful dining experience. We requested that Mr Fang choose our food and he picked things we typically would have selected.  Super yummy

Review191.Review: We let the owner order for us so beware the food keeps coming until you say stop and it comes out fast. The dishes are also large.  Overall, the food was uninspiring. I agree with the saucy comments.  I thought the fried rice was bland. The best dish was the BBQ pork ribs and the Bao. I hate to write a mediocre review but I probably wouldn’t return with so many amazing options in San Francisco.

Review192.Review: We celebrated our daughters 20th birthday at FANG. The omokase dining experience was fantastic. The food was incredible and the service was warm and friendly. Every person in our party had a different favorite dish. My daughters were raving about the food for days.

Review193.Review: An amazing experience. Best Asian cuisine we have ever had!! Super nice staff and owner is amazing and created a great experience for us.

Review194.Review: Food was beyond excellent, though we felt a little rushed by the staff. It all came out at the same time and they seemed to be cleaning up throughout our visit, even though we only had a 7:30 reservation (not like we were the last people there). Made it a little uncomfortable at the end.

Review195.Review: It was our first visit to Fang and celebrating my daughter’s 25th birthday. Everything on the menu sounded wonderful. As our table of 4 tried to decide our order, Mr. Fang himself greeted us. He offered to order for us, and we couldn’t be more excited. It was all absolutely delicious! Edamame salad, chicken bao buns, spicy sweet potatoes, onion pancake, seafood soup, short ribs and zucchini, broccoli with crispy honey shrimp and beef, and the famous house fried rice. Our glorious meal ended with complimentary warm sesame balls and coconut cookies. Mr. Fang and his staff were lovely and made us feel so special. Highly recommend and can’t wait to return!

Review196.Review: Good place to eat with a group. Food is always solid.

Review197.Review: Superlative in every way. The work ethic, dedication and love for their craft that the Fang family and the staff put in is evident in both the food and the dining experience. As good as it gets

Review198.Review: I saw zKathy Fang on Food Network multiple times. She is amazing!!! We visited San Francisco & made reservations to dine at Fang.It wad absolutely the best food ever!!!The famous fried rice was so good along w our enrreesThank youWish we could have met her but no luck

Review199.Review: We had a group of 7 and was offered the 7 course chef's choice fixed price menu which we took.  They brought items we had planned to order and ones we would not have ordered.  Everything was delicious and enjoyed by everyone in our party!

Review200.Review: Possibly the worst Chinese food I have ever had. I lived in China for 30 years.

Review201.Review: Food is amazing!! Must try when in SF! The apple prawns are my fave!

Review202.Review: Excellent food and service. Very enjoyable experience.

Review203.Review: The experience we had was a very unfriendly server, we were greeted with no welcome smile or conversation of any type. Threw the menus on the table and walked away. The restaurant is filthy and the restroom is disgusting. The food was ok. Will never go back

Review204.Review: The food was very good with beautiful presentation. Talked with the owner while she was taking our order and she was very interested in interacting with us and other customers. I would definitely recommend it and go back there.

Review205.Review: The food here is always incredible, even with a group of more than 20. You always feel like you are getting personalized service from the owners and are part of the family. In some ways, this place is a hidden gem of San Francisco but given how busy it always is, I suppose its not quite the secret that only us locals know about! We come again and again, especially when we want to impress our out of town guests with the best food in town. Thanks for keeping it real and keeping it excellent!

Review206.Review: We were celebrating my sister’s birthday at Fang primarily because we had both watched and enjoyed the Chef Dynasty House of Fang series. We were happily surprised to see her adorable dad greet us and take our order. Kathy came over to our table numerous times and I shared that we were celebrating my sister’s birthday. And just like that - Kathy appeared with an appetizer that was not on the menu ! All our food choices were amazing- especially the fried rice prepared at our table. We will definitely be back !! My sister is from Michigan and we had made this reservation months ago - not realizing that Dreamforce was also in SF at the same time. Service was great!

Review207.Review: Excellent food. Ignore the menu and have them just bring you food.

Review208.Review: We had an 11:30 AM reservation and were seated immediately. When we got to the restaurant, we were greeted by Kathy Fang, which was a beautiful surprise. She took our order. Food was exactly what I was expecting, delicious. Also had the pleasure of meeting her dad, Peter. Will definitely go back and would recommend this place to anybody! ￼

Review209.Review: Definitely 5 stars for service and food. The owners Kathy and Peter were very accommodating, even picked our food for us and we were not disappointed. The beef cubes were very tasty and tender, the shrimps with honey apple were scrumptious, and we enjoyed watching the fried rice prepared for us on a sizzling plate.  We had a 7 course meal, my friends and I were stuffed! If you're looking for a different palate experience, try Fang's. Highly recommend!

Review210.Review: The food was delicious. The chef/owner came out and talked to us and thanked us for coming. It was very reasonably priced. Couldn’t have been better

Review211.Review: I love sharing this restaurant with locals and out of towners. Great options for interesting fare for both meat eaters and vegetarians. Please consider offering brown rice!

Review212.Review: Staff was nice. Food was very sweet. Drenched in starch and sugar.

Review213.Review: Thought the staff would be friendly, especially the owner, not so much. Very robotic. Best Chinese we have ever had. Food was great! Service was very cold .

Review214.Review: The food was delicious. The staff was fabulous. All three of us enjoyed everything.

Review215.Review: Fang was gave suggestions to change dishes to please the needs of a vegetarian.

Review216.Review: Great food. Great atmosphere.   Owner walked us to the table and provided some great recommendations.

Review217.Review: I’ve been in FANG many times and each time I got the best food, service, experience and vibe.They are Vegan friendly & ohh dear!!! The Vegan food is amazing; I asked my friends, by the way it was their first time here. They enjoy vegan & Non vegan food, last night they were in loved with both vegan and non vegan food.We had the best time!!!Thank you FANG.

Review218.Review: We did the Chef's choice menu, which is reasonable and quite fun. We got to taste 7 savory courses and finished with a sweet touch (sesame mochi and red bean), none of which we would have chosen on our own had we ordered a la carte and it did not disappoint. The food is fabulous. The service is very efficient, although not very personable. Overall, we loved it.

Review219.Review: Great food...fast service....great to see the owner workin with cuatomers

Review220.Review: Did not honor reservation time. Entrees were served in the wrong order. Very chaotic

Review221.Review: Love the place, the food is amazing and service was on top of things!

Review222.Review: Awesome as always as Chef Fang took care of us and it was amazing!

Review223.Review: One of the worst service experiences ever!- Made a 7pm reservation. Not one staff person went near the host stand or checked their reservation system the entire time - it was gathering dust behind the very unsightly/messy host stand area. Stood at the door until 7:30pm with almost zero staff interaction until Mr Fang checked in with us. We told him we had a 7pm reservation. He walked away gruffly with barely any acknowledgement. Why do they even bother with reservations? - While waiting, we saw a staff member dragging a tethered plastic bussing bin with dirty dishes in it loudly across the floor, right by tables with dining customers. Weird and very off-putting!- Once sat, service continued to be poor. Asked a few questions, staff hardly paid attention and were not well versed in their menus. - My friend ordered a glass of wine which was corked. Since no one was checking in on us at all, she went up to the bar and was told the bottle had been open for a several days. - No one wished my friend a happy birthday even though it was mentioned in my reso notes AND we told at least 2 staff members, including Mr. FangI could go on, but I think readers can get the gist. Suffice it to say, this place might have decent food (and honestly, it’s not the best Chinese I’ve ever had) but if that is all I wanted, I would have ordered take out. Going to a restaurant should be a thoughtfully curated experience across ambiance, food, and service….it’s called HOSPITALITY. There are many other reviews for Fang that report terrible service - it’s clear that the Fangs don’t care otherwise they’d rectify this. Maybe some folks are enamored enough by the fact they have a show on TV to turn a blind eye to how bad this operation is, but for those looking for the magic that can happen in a restaurant that truly understands and cares about hospitality, I recommend going elsewhere.

Review224.Review: Get there early, as it does get a little  crazy! Explore the menu.

Review225.Review: The chili potstickers were too hot to eat, the front doors of the restaurant looked ugly and ruined the effect. The apple shrimp was very good, as were the short ribs, the duck  buns were wonderful. Was a treat to meet one of the owners, Peter. Would have been good to see Kathy in the restaurant.

Review226.Review: We were approached by the owner to pick our food for us. It was an excellent experience and the food was unbelievable!

Review227.Review: Unimpressed with this place.  I probably would not return as there is nothing special here.  We ordered potstickers, a chicken bao bun, shorts rib with bok choy,  and the special house sizzling fried rice. The meats were cooked well, slightly crispy outside and nice and tender on the inside.  They use frozen wontons here and dress them up with their own sauce. I really expected them to do a homemade wonton at this place. The Bao bun was acceptable. The bok choy in the short rib dish was not cooked which is OK if that’s what you prefer. With the special rice, we wanted beef and pork but we got shrimp. No beef and pork at all.  The service was good, and the people were attentive.

Review228.Review: What an amazing meal -- one of the best in SF. The food was terrific and even more so Mr. Fang choosing our prix fixe menu based on our dietary preferences. This is a must go to restaurant. We couldn't have had a more enjoyable evening with great food and the careful attention of this celebrity chef. Thank you Mr. Fang!

Review229.Review: Terrible Food and scammed into ordering things I didn’t want by Peter Fang.

Review230.Review: great food.  Very crowded.  Little space between tables.  Get an early reservation or you will be standing outside waiting.

Review231.Review: Amazing food, limited space, so their may be a bit of a wait after reservation time, but we’ll worth the wait.

Review232.Review: I usually don’t post any reviews, but this was the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant. The service people were rude, not communicative, and worst of all, the food quality was bad—it was like paying for a very expensive, premium meal but receiving a Panda Express level of Chinese food.

Review233.Review: We had the steamed buns with pork belly, crispy pot stickers with pork, sesame chicken, Mongolian beef, and fried rice. The meal was spectacular! Order the fried rice for the table side presentation! The bao buns with the pork belly nearly made me lose my mind. So good! Everything was excellent.

Review234.Review: Mr. Fang personally came by our table and ordered for us, which was so special and resulted in our trying new dishes we had not had before. Everything was delicious. Excellent experience all around.

Review235.Review: Always enjoy a great meal. Quick service and great prices. ￼

Review236.Review: Phenomenal food and service. Every dish was perfect!

Review237.Review: We put our trust in Peter Fang, and he ordered us the perfect meal! Each dish was outstanding. I generally don’t eat pork, but the spare rib appetizer was fall-off the bone tender and delicious. Absolutely fantastic!

Review238.Review: There was an issue honoring our reservation time.  Once seated the server didn’t understand a martini as a cocktail offered and we wrote it for her.  But all in all the food is so delicious we were fine with any and all hiccups.  We will continue to come here as well as The Nan King

Review239.Review: The buns are heavenly. The eggs for the fried rice were cooked on the skillet tableside to mix with the rice so it's full of aroma and tasted super fresh. The cold duck and the pork bellies are on top of my list of must eat as well. Staff are super friendly and very attending. Visited 3 times last month and will definitely go again whenever we visit SF.

Review240.Review: everything was excellant, hot/sour soup outstanding , neighboring diners lots of fun, definite go back.

Review241.Review: Food arrived before the soup. Everything I ordered was smothered with red onions, what were they thinking? Some of the food was burned.  Not good at all. The room was hot and had very little air circulation.  Very, very disappointed.  Don't go there. Avoid the place.

Review242.Review: Overall, it was a good experience.  Upon arrival, we were not greeted by a very nice lady. She came to the table abruptly to take our food order. Didn't even ask if we wanted a drink. Mr. Fang came to the table later on and made it much more enjoyable.I would not recommend this to my friends. Made a point to uber across town from our cruise terminal, just not worth the time and money.I was so looking forward to have a great time as it looks like on TV.

Review243.Review: One of the best meals we have ever had. We wound up with a tasting experience which we didn’t ask for, or was it discussed with us-In the end it didn’t matter because the dishes chosen by co-owner Peter Fang were perfect. This was absolutely an evening we will talk about for a long time.

Review244.Review: Food comes out insanely fast. Well seasoned and crispy. Would definitely recommend for someone who wants a quick bite. They absolutely PACK this place, so not the most comfortable. Luckily I'm here for the food.

Review245.Review: We had Fang on our bucket list after watching House of Fang on the Food Network. The chef, Kathy Fang was there! The food was so good! Short ribs, pork belly & the spicy chili oil fish all on point!

Review246.Review: Fang is a slightly upscale version of the fabled House of Nanking, and both deserve all the accolades they get. Peter Fang and his daughter, Kathy (she runs both House of Nankin and Fang now, though her dad is still around a lot), are wonderful chefs, with excellent offerings on the menu - and if you're lucky enough to get to talk with one of them directly about the food, you may just get something extra special off-menu. Just trust them if you have this opportunity. Generally, there's something for everyone here, including vegetarians, meat eaters, seafood lovers and those who like it hot or those who do not. Order a variety of dishes and share so you get to taste more of their unique creations.

Review247.Review: Food was spectacular! Some of the most flavorful food our group has ever had. Going to Fang when we visit SF has become a staple part of our trip.

Review248.Review: We were surprised when the Chef/Owner told our group of nine that he would select the items for us, taking us completely out of the position to choose what we wanted to eat. Basically, saying "no" was not an option. The food was very good and very nicely presented. Some of the out-of-towners who don't have access to Chinese food in the same way we do in the Bay Area thought the food was the best they'd ever had. Our bill was $900!!! Two people had one drink each.

Review249.Review: Chef Peter Fang welcomed us and created a special tasting menu for us, which was outstanding.  His staff, ambiance, cuisine, service, all of it was top notch stellar!  We will be back!

Review250.Review: I was very much looking forward to eating here and the food was just ok. The service was sub par and the ambience was non existent.  Very disappointed and would not go back.

Review251.Review: The service was very abrupt and not friendly.  There was no greeting - Mr Fang just motioned to the menu with his pad and paper.  A server tried to clear our small table to make room for the next plate, but there was still food on our dishes that we asked to have back.  There were three bins of cleared plates stacked up on the floor across from me.  The food was fine, but not as described.  A strangely sauced broccoli and the "SPICY" wonton was not spicy at all.  The food was fine, but overall it was a disappointing experience.

Review252.Review: The owner came to our table and introduced himself.  He asked if we had any objection to him ordering for the table, and checked for food allergies/intolerances.   While that turned out to be significantly more expensive than  if we had ordered directly from the menu, and the last white fish dish went mostly to waste, it was  a very fun experience and we definitely sampled items we would not have selected on our own.  We all enjoyed the dinner tremendously.  We would all do it again.

Review253.Review: Everything was wonderful and meeting Kathy and Peter was the icing on the cake!

Review254.Review: The food was very good, the service was a little slow as they never came and asked for drinks again, the food never came at once. We had to wait for the rice 20 min after we finished all other food.

Review255.Review: Great spot and amazing food. We went with their recommendations and it was fantastic.

Review256.Review: Have been many times, great experience always.  Food was not as plentiful as usual, make sure you order from Mr Fang, his daughter is more concerned with turning tables fast and Mr Fang is all about the experience and hospitality, I never miss the chance to visit when in town

Review257.Review: Wow!!!!! Fabulous Chinese Food. Your stomach will be happy with this exceptional cuisine

Review258.Review: food is okay.  service, they bring food pretty fast, but they are not very friendly.been twice now, probably won't go again. owner Mr. Fang was there walking around, the people next to us tried to talk to him, and he pretty much just stared at them, like why are you talking to me.  don't quite understand that.

Review259.Review: Food was excellent with large portions. Short rib was phenomenal and the fried rice is a must. Fast service and food comes out quick.

Review260.Review: It’s okay. Doesn’t live up to the hype. Our noodles were very starchy. Dumplings warm, insides a little cool. I was a little worried eating them. The chicken dish was bland, but potatoes crispy and tasty. All the food was underwhelming but not terrible.

Review261.Review: Peter ordered for us, we loved it all.

Review262.Review: Absolutely delicious and great value! The portions were very generous.

Review263.Review: The food was outstanding! This place definitely caters more to groups so if I were to go back I would go with a group.

Review264.Review: Loved it!  The food was delicious!  Got a group pic with Peter Fang and he was so sweet!  Worth the trip from Tucson!

Review265.Review: Excellent food. Mr Fang picked out dishes for us, which was  helpful as everything on the menu looked delicious and we were having difficulty in choosing.  We enjoyed our experience so much we came back a couple days later with our entire family.

Review266.Review: This is one of the most amazing food experience I have ever had.

Review267.Review: Solid food. We went around 8 PM and sensed the staff was tired and impatient.

Review268.Review: We love Fang, they are passionate about the food, last time we were in, we didn’t order they just brought us food, stuff we wouldn’t normally order, this time, we ordered the same thing and it was fantastic! Short ribs with bok choy

Review269.Review: Love that they assume you need menu help (We did) and ask about restrictions, and just take it from there! All dishes flavorful, served family style, with plenty to satisfy all. A favorite from way back, and I'll stay a customer!

Review270.Review: The owner was so accommodating and orchestrated our meal.  We have eaten at House of Nanking and my daughter insisted we try his new restaurant.  Some of the featured sauces were a bit too similar but all in all it was an excellent experience.  The Korean rib appetizer were outstanding.  And clam wonton soup?  Who would believe it!

Review271.Review: Service was ￼impersonal!  It’s like they were rushing, no contact. Food was good, but not exceptional.

Review272.Review: First stop in San Francisco and we were not disappointed. Service was impeccable. Food was amazing.

Review273.Review: Mr. Fang took charge and ordered for us. Food was excellent. Experience was great. Parking was terrible. Parked in the garage a block away which closed at 7pm. Our car was locked overnight, had to pay over $250 (parking & Uber fees). Wish restaurant had access to parking.

Review274.Review: It was a bit smoky in the restaurant but the food was delicious and service was great

Review275.Review: The atmosphere was what you expect from a busy restaurant in downtown SF. The service was busy so seemed stretched thin. Maybe it was the section we sat in, but a bit of a wait at times. Peter and Kathy were not friendly. After seeing their show on tv and Kathy a chopped champion. I wish I just would have went else where to eat and not let the visit ruin expectations from what you see on tv. The food was ok, nothing to special, pot stickers were dry, and the soup was warm.

Review276.Review: We had a great time at Fang. Peter Fang came to our table and let us take photos with him. He ordered all of our food for the table. The food was great and it kept coming out. We even tried food that we probably would not have ordered. Great experience, would definitely recommend

Review277.Review: Had reservations for 2pm, upon arrival we were informed that it it was “last call” my daughter arrived 3 minutes late and we were rushed the entire time. The sweet potatoes were not cooked all the way through I asked for chili sauce and they  forgot, asked second time and was served a beer??? At the end we ended up eating with the staff as it was their lunch break. Awful service. They should not accept reservations after 2pm this was an early Father’s Day lunch RUINED. Do not recommend.

Review278.Review: The food here was fantastic! The spare ribs and sesame chicken were so good!

Review279.Review: Good food at a reasonable price. Tables are very close together. Staff are fine but busy so not over the top service.

Review280.Review: Absolutely disappointed, didn’t get our table prepared fried rice, received two wrong entrees, servers were hostile, Peter, who seems endearing on tv is just rude? The food we received was delicious but not as what is shown on TV…so sad that this is how I chose to spend my 21st anniversary

Review281.Review: We made a mistake to pick this restaurant, we thought they’re famous, in Food Network Chanel and a fine dining restaurant but the fact is the service is worst than a fast food restaurant. We had a very bad server that was very rude, unprofessional. He never greeted us even we said hello to him. When our guest asked his help to take 1 picture for us, he yelled at us in Cantonese ( we guessed cause we didn’t understand) and walked away after he just put the food on the table. We’re very shocked:( Also, he picked-up our soup without asking first, and our guest told him that he was still eating the soup, and he just threw back the pot in front of our guest without apologizing. He had a very angry behavior. It was really embarrassing for us to invite our guests and got treated like a garbage:( We told the owner that it would be nice if the server was friendly or even just smiled. The owner told us just  “ What do you want me to do? Fire him?!, why don’t you just enjoy the food!” We were so shocked and disappointed! We tried to continue our dinner since we had our guests. We noticed that they’re super busy, they just want you to eat, pay and Go! They needed the table for the next customers. We booked Fang restaurant cause we wanted to have dinner at an upper class Chinese restaurant , we didn’t know that Fang is just a Chinese fast food restaurant with China town level service. I guess the owner doesn’t care as long as they’re making money.It is really sad, we wish that the business owner should care and train the employees to be professional servers, friendly ( since they’re in a service business) and also it’ll be better if they can speak English too. Thank you.

Review282.Review: We booked a business lunch for 10 people. Fang seated us in a quiet nook and took care of ordering by bringing delicious entrees with the perfect amount of food. They even brought out a special dish for the one person in our party with shellfish allergies. Outstanding! Thanks, Fang Restaurant!

Review283.Review: Great food!  The pork belly bao was crunchy & yet delicate. Also appreciated that pork belly took up all the space in the sandwich. Too often the piece of meat is too small. We also had the fried chili fish with charred broccoli. The dish didn’t look like much but was amazing. The fish melted in your mouth, the broccoli was still crunchy & the sauce was delicious.

Review284.Review: We actually took a short vacation from Spokane WA to San Francisco with our primary objective being to have dinner at FANG. It did not disappoint in any way.Peter Fang was taking orders. He asked us if we trusted him to order for us. We did and every dish that arrived at our table was spectacular. The food was great and like nothing we would ever get to try anywhere else.

Review285.Review: The food is amazing. We had the chefs menu and I highly recommend it. Each dish was so delicious we couldn’t wait for the next.  The rib was so amazing as was the pork belly bun. Amazing.

Review286.Review: All the food was served at one time.  We barely started our soup and everything arrived. We felt rushed. Our tea arrived when the meal was just about finished.

Review287.Review: Food was great.  Service was horrible.  Who spends over 1.5 hours at a Chinese restaurant?  I’m very disappointed.  And it was a business meal.

Review288.Review: Upon arrival, I was ignored and stood there waiting for the host. I was obviously seen by others from the staff but no one came over. I wait 2-3 mins without an acknowledgment.I sat at the bar to kill some time because I was there early. No one gave me a menu nor asked to take my drink order.
