I had to flag down someone.Same issue once I was seated with my wife. We had no menus and had to flag someone down for menus. Then took a long time for someone to take our order. The place was busy but felt disorganized.We ordered and food came out quick. No complaints on the food, it was very good. When leaving the places, no one even bothered to say thank you. I was hoping for a wonderful experience given all the hype this place got but it was a big disappointment for my wife and I.

Review289.Review: Food was fantastic, and we were fortunate enough to get Peter Fang to decide on what food we should get. Service was lousy. Food was just dumped on the table and was even hard to get water refilled.

Review290.Review: Read the reviews do wasn't sure whether hit or miss...but their food was fantastic....giant portions...some unusual dishes; we were two, should have been four.Everything on the menu sounds great, and everything we had was great. The service may seem a little gruff...but we were not rushed, allowed to order dishes at our own pace. We closed the place at end of their lunch service and no one rushed us out the door. Started the day at SF MOMA and Fang is around the corner. Will definitely return. So many places have closed in this area...happy that they remain.

Review291.Review: Peter Fang met us at the door and escorted us to table - a real gentleman.  Food was very good, fresh, with good sized portions and reasonable portions.

Review292.Review: Food was very good. I highly recommend the steamed buns. We had the duck and they were out of this world. We got the dumplings and eggplant which was delicious but unusual. Think sautéed eggplant mixed with unfried potstickers. It came on a large raised serving platter with tea candles underneath which kept everything warm. We also got the scallion oil tossed noodles with chicken which was much spicier than we expected but still good. We each got cocktails but they were awful. We did ask the owner who took our order which would be better between two dishes and he just shrugged his shoulders and said whichever you want. I would have preferred a recommendation.Service left a lot to be desired. No one refilled our water pitcher. It took a long time for someone to take away empty serving dishes (we had a tiny table). The waitress finally took our dishes away, confirming we were finished but then never brought our check. We couldn’t get anyone’s attention for our check for about 30 minutes after we finished our meal.

Review293.Review: Food was sadly bland, even though was listed as "chili" spicy.   Food was not horrible, but non-memorable.  The cost was 10x what it should have been.

Review294.Review: I was excited to try Fang, but perhaps my expectations were too high.  The food was good, but the service left a lot to be desired.  For upscale Chinese cuisine, this is a great place, but different than the House of Nanking and the lacking service really lowered my rating.  I would give it another shot, a second try if you will, but I'm not understanding the hype.

Review295.Review: We had an amazing experience! The food was delicious, the service was extremely attentive! Every time our waters were low the server was right behind filling up our glasses. The food was unbelievably good, they do bigger portions where you share with your party. All in all, a very enjoyable experience.

Review296.Review: Long wait to be seated despite reservations.The food was mediocre at best with everything tasting the same .Noodles were over cooked, food was cut up in big chunks.We had to lay our own table, had to keep asking for our rice and drinks that we had ordered. They finally came when we finished our meal.The servers were rude and non communicative and very unhelpful.Everything was really rushed once we were seated and we did not feel welcomed.The icing on the cake was when my husband paid with the handheld reader and put in a custom tip the server insisted we had not tipped and needed to. She was very aggressive and somewhat threatening. Really very very disappointed with the overall experience.Don’t buy into the hype. I would not recommend the restaurant.Customer service is some of the worst I have ever experienced.

Review297.Review: Food was excellent. Kathy the owner ordered for the table and she didn’t let us down

Review298.Review: We've been long time fans of House of Nanking and Fang has been on our bucket list especially after seeing the TV series. Took my son and his friends here last night and were greeted by the owner who came back to the table several times to ensure we were comfortable with the menu and ordering. She suggested that she put together a sampling menu for us of which every dish was out of this world. Our experience far exceeded our expectations. Thank you Kathy and staff!

Review299.Review: As always, the meal, food and service was outstanding.  We always let whom I believe to be Mr. Fang decide what food to serve us.  He has never let us down.

Review300.Review: Do not miss an opportunity to dine at Fang! The food is simply outstanding. I have been a few times and I always just defer to the chef's choice. You'll receive a few courses to share at the table and it really is a wonderful dining experience.

Review301.Review: Delightful lunch for my team. We trusted Fang to select our meal for us and we’re not disappointed! I recommended them to a friend who was in town for a convention at Moscone and hope he had a chance to try the restaurant.

Review302.Review: Run, don’t walk to Fang. Kathy and Peter Fang are the ultimate hosts and are involved in every aspect of the restaurant’s operation. The food was delicious and if you’re lucky like my husband and I were Kathy or one of her knowledgeable staff will select your meal for you. I don’t think it gets any better than that!The five spice white fish was so good that my husband even ate the vegetables that came with it. My only regret, our cruise ship was leaving the next morning and we couldn’t go back. Make sure you go, you won’t regret it!

Review303.Review: Service was extremely poor, food was okay but sloppy and not well seasoned, and the ambiance was crowded and loud

Review304.Review: Très bon restaurant chinois.  Mr Fang nous a commandé ces petits plats. On lui a donné carte blanche et on a pas été déçu.  On a eu le fameux riz qui vient à la table avec des oeufs brouillés qu'il fait cuire devant nous. On a eu les shortribs. On a eu assiette de crevettes aux miel et pommes.  On a eu la soupe won ton avec bouillon lait de coco. Tout était très bon et goûteux.  Le service des plats à été rapide.  Bon rapport qualité prix.  Bon appétit.

Review305.Review: One of the best meals my friends and I have ever had. Chef Fang himself came to our table, asked for dietary restrictions, and then provided us dishes recommended by him, without us having to order off the menu. I have never had such a thoughtful experience at a restaurant before. And the food was all AMAZING. Would absolutely come here again.

Review306.Review: We loved the food. Lots of vegetarian options. I would definitely go back.

Review307.Review: Amazing food. we had a large group and the service was excellent. They are kind and inviting and accommodating.I would highly recommend this place.

Review308.Review: It’s always a stop on visiting San Francisco. Don’t miss it and get in the habit!

Review309.Review: Even though I had a reservation, it took about 20 minutes to get seated.  The place was full and while all staff were visibly working hard they are way understaffed.  That said, the food is worth the wait.

Review310.Review: Out first time was amazing, will be back. Food was so delicious.

Review311.Review: There was no maître d’ at the desk and several parties were waiting (with reservations !) when I finally flagged  down a waiter who started to help seat the groups. It was busy and a bit noisy as it is ￼a small, packed room with an open kitchen. Once seated and settled, however, the service was fine. Mr Fang was circulating as well as his daughter, the proprietress. Both were attentive and gracious, and Ms Fang sat down at the table next to me to chat for a few minutes with a woman who was a great fan of “Chef Dynasty” and who was celebrating her 81st birthday. A little while after Ms Fang left some sweets and a candle appeared with their compliments. The food was delicious and an interesting variation on traditional Chinese fare - and the portions were big! I loved the tofu steamed buns and the garlic charred broccoli (amazing - I want to figure out how to make it at home!). Can’t wait to go back!

Review312.Review: Loved every meal that we ate, the vibe, service etc! everything was just perfect there every time.

Review313.Review: We waited 30 minutes before anyone acknowledged us, or any of the other groups waiting to be seated.  Allof whom, including us, had a reservation.  When we finally did get seated we had to make a request to order because we were ignored for so long.  The food is fine, but basically it is House of Nan King.  I was looking forward to trying Fang.  I won’t be back.

Review314.Review: FANG is a San Francisco treasure. Peter and Kathy Fang have created a culinary experience that is truly spectacular. Both Fang and the original, House of Nanking, are two of the best Chinese restaurants in the world (I'm a world traveler). Their unique – Hong Kong – style recipes are unlike typical American Chinese. Don't order from the menu. Ask to speak with either Peter or Kathy, tell them your food alergies, preferences and allow them to create for you a dining experience that you'll remember and want to repeat over-and-over. I have been a guest of Peter Fang's House of Nanking and now Fang for over 25 years. In all those years, and hundreds of visits, I have never had the same meal twice. Simply spectacular!!!!!

Review315.Review: Great food and very reasonable prices for the quality

Review316.Review: This was hands down my best restaurant experience ever. The owner Kathy Fang greeted us, took our drink orders and asked us to trust her with the food. We did and every bite was outstanding. The experience was amazing and it was unbelievably tasty. I will go any time I visit San Francisco.

Review317.Review: Delicious food and excellent customer service! We had a reservation and were seated right away. Our food came out rather quickly considering how busy it was! The pomegranate margarita was yummy and strong.

Review318.Review: I can’t recommend this anymore highly. We had a fantastic time at the food was just out of this world! Go!

Review319.Review: Fantastic meal.  Family style at its best.  Creative twist to all time favorites.

Review320.Review: Really tasty food but oversauced at times,  especially on the veg- the flavors were very sweet. Portions very generous, service excellent and a great casual vibe. Maybe let the flavors of the veg just stand out on their own a bit more?

Review321.Review: This was our first trip to dine at fang restaurant, and the service and food were mediocre. Unfortunately, I will not return to this restaurant in the future.

Review322.Review: LOVED it ! The food and the experience was amazing ! Wish we had one in Montreal ❤️

Review323.Review: I have been to Fang for lunch many times and had a good experience.I came for dinner on Mother's Day eve. with a friend.The service was terrible and one of our dishes had absolutely no taste.It was the fried rice that the put together at the table and is listed as a favorite.Not sure what happened.I was disappointed since I recommended the restaurant to a friend who came from out of town.

Review324.Review: Best chinese food and dining experience ever. Go for family style, you won't regret it.

Review325.Review: First customers of the day. First two dishes arrived pretty quickly - appetizer and protein entree. Famous fried rice that was so overrated took 25 minutes. By that time the salty short rib entree was cold. Pork dumpling that the server recommended was definitely frozen store bought. When i started to ask the server about the fried rice she cut me off before I could even finish my sentence and said the rice was coming. Obviously they knew it was taking a long time. Servers wore stained Fang t shirts and food was served on chipped plates. Restaurant is completely glamorized on TV. Read reviews before dining there and don’t get caught up on the popularity of the Fang owners.

Review326.Review: Very affordable but high quality food. Everyone was really happy with it!

Review327.Review: Food great, but no customer service - only saw server during order and when food was served..wanted knife and a refill but no one came by.. same for their sister restaurant house of nanking (went the next day)..Customer service needs improvement

Review328.Review: Great food, great service, great all around vibe!  Lately I have found myself not wanting to cross the bridge to San Francisco due to the traffic but Fang definitely made the trip worth it.  Can't wait to go back.

Review329.Review: Chicken Jajang mein was not on the menu but you can still order it. It's a Chinese variant, not Korean, and was very tasty, will definitely order again!

Review330.Review: Very impressed with their vegetarian options! They created their own menu for our group of 12 and it was very tasty.

Review331.Review: Best short ribs ever. Sizzling fried rice was fantastic. Everything we had was great!

Review332.Review: Specifically asked not spicy and it was not eatable, the Mongolian beef was so dry but good meat quality, we did not get our plates in the order and they had forgotten some orders,

Review333.Review: The food was so fresh and so good!! I'm very happy we went there last night!

Review334.Review: The food was amazing, we literally just allowed the owner to bring us his favorite dishes.  The service was a little lacking, but the food outweighed that for us.  Definitely would go back when we are in the city again.

Review335.Review: Incredible meal, highly recommend this restaurant..

Review336.Review: We were excited to visit Fang's while in San Francisco being culinary enthusiast and Food Network regulars. I have to say while the food was very good, we seemed to be rushed through the dining experience and it just didn't have that warm ambiance and friendliness like we experienced in other restaurants in the city during our stay. I would also recommend NOT boarding the windows up while the restaurant is still open with customers, kind of made us feel a little unappreciated. Though the ambiance wasn't the greatest the food was memorable.

Review337.Review: Food was good, not great.  Ordered two dishes and they arrived about 10 minutes apart.  We were never asked if we wanted a second drink.   Wouldn’t rush back.

Review338.Review: Very disappointing. Food so so; decor ok. Wait staff inexperienced. Two wait persons and bartender didn’t know what a scotch Manhattan was, nor could they find scotch bottle. I ended up with Makers Mark.

Review339.Review: So bummed . The food was actually terrible overall. The fried rice was bland.  The salt and pepper shrimp was meh. The chicken dish was way over seasoned. Just a mess overall.

Review340.Review: The food was good although I feel that a lot of it might have been pre made. Parts of a dish were cold. Like the dumplings in the eggplant and dumpling dish. All the dishes came up very quickly.The service was borderline rude especially the two men working that night. The older man couldn’t be bothered to give any advice if what I ordered was too much food. He merely shrugged his shoulders and almost rolled his eyes at me. He was clearly exasperated with my one question. So, good, not great. Not memorable in my opinion.

Review341.Review: Great location and easy to get to by Muni train. Food was super fast coming out and very good. My only criticism would be that the tables are packed together so tight you cannot move around at all to get to the washroom etc.

Review342.Review: Very disappointed…all our food tasted the same and had the same mustard sauce on it..I’ve eaten a ton a Cantonese food in my life and despite the reputation, I wouldn’t eat here again.  Very average and that’s a compliment.  Waited 30 mins for our bill and never got asked for another drink.  Clearly not enough wait staff but they were friendly…just not enough time for all diners.

Review343.Review: What a delicious meal and great service - this experience completely explains the reason the Fang family has built such a reputation and been in business for so long serving the SF scene all along! I can't stress enough to trust the server for what they will bring so you can almost avoid the menu and just let them take care of it!

Review344.Review: The pork belly is melt in your mouth good

Review345.Review: The food and service were disappointing.  The waitstaff were not engaging or friendly.  The quality of food was not what we expected for the price point.  The war wonton was gritty from the clams, cold duck was dry, chow mein only tasted like soy sauce, egg rolls were burnt, and the potstickers had a sweet mustard that was overpowering. There was also MSG in the food but that was not listed on the menu or posted in the restaurant.

Review346.Review: Had to wait a long time to have our order taken and wait for a beverage. Staff was not very kind. The fried beef and noodles dish we ordered had too much vinegar and left a bad aftertaste. The buns appetizer on the other hand was good. Was also very pricey for the amount we got.

Review347.Review: Enjoyed our time at Fang. I did not realize it was connected to House of Nanking until we walked in. We love House of Nanking. The owner was there and offered to order a pre-fix meal for us, which there was no menu for so we were a little skeptical. I asked him to make sure we got the sesame chicken (we love this dish), and then we waited to see what we got. It was amazing food. Almost too much for 4 of us! Wonton soup, 2 appetizers (chicken buns, ribs), sesame chicken, 5 spice fish, a beef, shrimp and broccoli dish, and lastly fried rice. We had just enough room for the small sesame balls for dessert.Everything I've had at House of Nanking and Fang is always yummy.

Review348.Review: The owner took care of us and recommend the menu and it was delicious. You can feel the love and passion of this place.

Review349.Review: The service was exceptional. The owner offered suggestions that were delicious

Review350.Review: The Nanking Sesame Tofu is my favorite! Green beans are amazing as well.

Review351.Review: Amazing food, nothing like any other Chinese restaurant that I have eaten at.  If I could give Fang more than 5 stars, I absolutely would. It was an extra special evening to meet both Kathy and Peter, after having watched their reality show on The Food Network.

Review352.Review: Everything was amazing. We spoke with the owner and asked for her to bring us anything she recommended. We loved everything from potstickers in mustard sauce, table side fried rice, shrimp and broccoli and Mongolian beef. 😋

Review353.Review: Food was good, but not great. Our initial interaction was with an older gentleman who made us feel like we were wasting his time in ordering our apps and entrees (he also never returned to our table as he did with others to check in). Both appetizers and one entree arrived at the same time, while the other entree arrived once we had consumed everything else. Not ideal when dining as a couple and you expect to have rice with the meat entree. It was also interesting to see our spicy cucumber appetizer looked like leftovers cut with a butter knife…we thought this was normal until our neighbors ordered the same thing which arrived neatly sliced and piled high.Most seating is very intimate with your neighbors.Safe to say this was not the first time dining experience with FANG that we expected.

Review354.Review: Been to Fang a couple of times with large groups and always a fantastic experience. Food is phenomenal and with a large group Kathy Fang pivots to family style and the food just keeps coming. Never had a single dish that wasn’t delicious.

Review355.Review: A Chinese restaurant full of OK Chinese food. Pork belly we had was actually decent.

Review356.Review: The Chef introduced himself and asked if we trusted him. We let him pick our whole meals. It was absolutely incredible!

Review357.Review: Most special dinner of our vacation!!We arrived and were surprisingly greeted by Mr. Fang!!  We were Star struck and he was beautiful to allow me a selfie.  We told him it was my husband’s birthday.  He asked if we had any dietary restrictions or religious beliefs and he said he would be back with what we would eat.  No decisions, not fretting over what to order…weird and beautiful!!  It turned out so special!!  Clam wonton soup, the BEST white fish and greens dish ever, ribs, of course the table side fried rice, snap pea salad and shrimp/pork and broccolini.  As I said, special, special, special…and delicious!!

Review358.Review: Amazing food. Very nice chef.However, worst service, ever. Servers did not clear the plates and then ended up puttin the new dishes ontop of the dirty plates.  So new plates were stacked on top of dirty plates. They wont pick up the phone on the weekend when the restaurant is busy. If you want a SF-standard quality service, go on a weekday. Weekend is a beautiful mess when it comes to service.

Review359.Review: Fabulously delicious food, especially when our meal was personally selected by Peter himself. He never fails to exceed the diners expectations!!!

Review360.Review: Great good and service , also got to meet PeterKathy Fang

Review361.Review: Super weird experience with our server, after asking if we had any food allergies, they took away our menus saying they would just bring us some food.  Very strange!  I liked the food after we got our menus back and we’re able to order.  My wife didn’t.  Again, very strange dining experience.

Review362.Review: Fang lives up to my expectations.  The only problem I had is that I could not order everything I wanted to try on the menu.  But that means I will have to return to try some other menu items.

Review363.Review: Very small and crammed area to eat comfortably.Not enough tables to seat anyone.Food was sauced a lot. Seemed like the same sauce on every dish we had, and we had about 5 dishes.Would not return.Before you go be sure to ask for a table in main dining room. Not on the side area where you are crammed in.

Review364.Review: Mr. Fang ordered for us - the dishes were delicious!

Review365.Review: Chef Kathy selected the menu for our table which is the way to go! Outstanding!

Review366.Review: Not what I expected!The Owners dad greeted us very dry, then we were seated. The dad again took our order no enthusiasm at all.  We asked a couple of questions, and we got this mumbled sound from behind his face mask.  The appetizer was good, some kind of wonton dish.Then we had broccoli in a kind of sweet sauce as our veggies. It was the highly recommend item.  I guess the highlight of the meal was the fried rice cooked at your table. It was just ok. The meal was reasonably priced compared to some of the other places we ate in SFO. Then we left.Overrated is the final word for this review. We did see the cute little owner there assisting the customers.

Review367.Review: Excellent food and gracious owner/chef too great care of our table. We put our dining experience in his hands and it did not disappoint!

Review368.Review: The sesame chicken and beef short ribs were very tasty!  The service could be improved.  We received our appetizers and main entrees all at the same time, within 5-10 min after ordering (super quick).  However, we also ordered the sizzling rice, and that did not arrive until 35+ min after the rest of the food!  By that time, we were wondering if they forgot, but also noticed other tables experienced the same wait times.  Ideally, you’d like to have all main courses arrive within a few min of each other.  In addition, recommend more active wait staff be in place to check-in on guests / ask if everything is ok/anything needed.

Review369.Review: The food was absolutely divine.  My husband and I have travelled throughout China for many years and have experienced many different types of Chinese food.   It was wonderful to experience the flavors in the Chinese food at Fang.  Superb!  My husband speaks fluid Chinese and he was able to speak to Kathy’s father which was a real treat. Thank you for a great evening!

Review370.Review: The food is great as always.  Service has some problems and issues.  They don't seem to care.  There will come a time when I may stop going there.  This is intended to be a helpful comment for them to improve.

Review371.Review: I had a double lung transplant in December of 22.  I am not allowed to go out very often so when I get a chance to go to Fang I jump at the opportunity. The food is all fantastic, especially the fried rice cooked at the table.  I love it.i

Review372.Review: We loved the hostess ie Cathy Fang's personal touch coming to tables and asking how things are. She's amazing as is her father Peter-both incredibly nice. The service was a little slow as there was no one at the door to take our reservation. I don't know if they were short of staff but when it's busy and the door line gets longer, you can see frustration on customers faces. Some even talked out. They need a door host ASAP! The foos was good, not great. I do NOT like spicy foods though it was moderate they really should make an alternative to the spicy foods ie less spicy. Fang definitely needs more vegetarian fare, but what was on the menu was okay.We'll go back in give it another go some time into the future.

Review373.Review: The owner took our menus and said he would take care of us, and did he ever! Extraordinary flavors, service was amazing, wish I lived closer.

Review374.Review: This restaurant is overrated. I came here with excitement on the food especially on the taste, but to find out that the taste of the food is average, sometimes below average. Overhyped restaurant!The food portion was decent, service wise is normal. Parking seems to be abit hard to find where you need to park behind the restaurant (leave by 10pm)

Review375.Review: This was a fun experience because we watched the show on Food Network !  We were greeted by Peter the amazing patriarch from the show !! He seated us and then asked if we wanted him to pick our meal and we were like , Yes, please!!! Normally we would have gone with our “safe” favs we order at any Chinese restaurant, so it was a treat ( even my picky 12yo loved everything)!! The food was delicious! And it came out quite quickly . I would have preferred cloth napkins or at least better paper napkins but maybe that’s just me . The whole experience was super fun because of having Peter there and him popping over to the table.  Was very casual ( servers in tshirts promoting House of Nanking) and not the trendy you saw on Tv… but it was a fun experience!!

Review376.Review: Under whelming compared to the hype on food net work.

Review377.Review: Horrible. Had reservations. Had to wait 15 minutes. Rude staff who barked at us. They seated us near the toilets. Peter Fang took our order and was very rude. They got our orders wrong. Brought our food out separately!! How can you bring rice last at an Asian restaurant?? I will never go back. What a waste of time. Panda Express was better

Review378.Review: Food was amazing! Highly recommend if you are in from out of town and staying in downtown. Get the wonton soup, like no other I have tasted before, my wife and I want to fly back just for the meal!

Review379.Review: We still haven't tasted any of Kathy Fang's food--she's never there when we are--but patriarch Peter's food and personal service is always a welcome treat.

Review380.Review: As a lover of The House of Nan King since the 90’s I couldn’t wait to try out Fang when I visited San Francisco for a workplace reunion. It did not disappoint. It was unpretentious, filled with family joy and personality. The food as expected, was filled with unexpected flavor and I wish I could have e tried everything on the menu. Can’t wait to go back. AllUs girls loved flirting with cute Peter, especially when he plunked down in one of our extra seats for a break. Such a casual vibe filled with humor and much love.

Review381.Review: This is a great spot with an inventive menu that takes Chinese cuisine to the next level!

Review382.Review: Peter Fang was great and sent out an amazing array of food to celebrate our son’s 21st birthday!

Review383.Review: Fang did not disappoint it exceeded our expectations!  What a treat this restaurant was, we loved every bite. After being seated the Chef owner came by our table and when we told him we were visiting from Florida, he took our menu’s away, asked our food preferences and then proceeded to WOW us with every course he served. It was a culinary experience that closed our California trip in the most perfect way!

Review384.Review: Great experience. Enjoyed meeting Peter Fang and having him order for us. food was phenomenal.

Review385.Review: What a disappointment... the show reflects a completely different vibe than the reality of this place.After standing at the host stand for 5 mins without any acknowledgment, we were finally seated. Once seated after 12 minutes of no one coming over, I got up and headed to the kitchen area to ask if someone was coming to take our drink order... they acted as if we were bothering them.After receiving my drink (canned coke and glass of ice) I began to pour my coke into the glass when a DEAD FLY floated up to the top of the glass... 😳I returned the drink to the OVERCROWDED AND JUNKIE BAR, to let the server see it. Gross!!!The Father then came to the table, very unapologetic, and not very welcoming to take our order and then walked away.The food came out fast but was DISGUSTING. The sesame chicken was wayyyy to orangey, the crispy honey glazed short rib was tough, and the rice was cold.Not to mention, this place was one of our main reasons for visiting SF.What a waste. BTW, Cathy, you need to get in there and get ur restaurant in better shape. It was not a great experience at ALL.THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT NEEDS TO MAKE A VISIT.

Review386.Review: A once in a lifetime experience. We were greeted by Mr Fang and his daughter at the entrance and Mr Fang himself chose all our dishes. We loved this! Everything we had was incredible, especially the sauces and the fried rice fajita-style at the table, we had never experienced anything like that. The service was typical of a busy Chinese restaurant in the way that it's not about the service, it's about the food. I'm sure some people will complain about that but we didn't mind at all, it's very typical of Chinese restaurants and is very authentic. The most amazing Chinese food I've ever had in my life.

Review387.Review: By far the best Chinese food I’ve ever had! The owner was amazing. He could tell we weren’t quite sure what to order so he asked us to trust him and boy are we glad we did. What a wonderful experience!

Review388.Review: Fantastic experience. It was delicious and everyone, even our kids all loved the food!!! They made us feel like special guests.

Review389.Review: The place was very disorganized and the service was horrible. We arrived a little early for our reservation and there was already a long line of others with earlier reservations. They sat two tables before talking to us, even though they came in with later reservations. It took 20 minutes to get a table, but an additional 15 minutes to even get our order taken. They didn’t bring water for another 10 minutes. They brought our food a while later before bringing napkins and utensils. The food was super salty with an excessive amount of sauce. It was hard to eat, so we didn’t finish any dish. We asked for the check, but was completely ignored for 20 minutes. Unacceptable experience. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!

Review390.Review: We came in from Alberta Canada to celebrate our birthdays. Going to Fang was what I wanted to do. Reservations were made back in Jan specifying it was for my 50th. We got there and told them we had reservations, and we're just shuffled to alittle table I don't even think they recognized the reservations. We ordered an appetizer and our mains. Everything came out at once. We had to combine foods onto one plate to make room on our table. Not once did anyone come to see how we were! We managed to flag someone over and order a 2nd drink, but sunrise.. didn't get it. The check was delivered before or meal was finished and we felt like we were just rushed in and get out! I have never been more disappointed in a restaurant then that night. I had been looking forward to this experience for 2 months and can say I will not be going back!!!

Review391.Review: The food is similar to the original, House of Nanking.  However, it did not deliver on a different experience.  And, the service was terrible.  Stick with the original.

Review392.Review: Started out a trip to Sonoma with friends here and Peter Fang ordered for us!   Best food we had on the trip!

Review393.Review: Large portions and food was very goodQuick services

Review394.Review: It smells really spicy when you walk in. I think it would be nice if there was some air vent.

Review395.Review: Amazing meal every time! Always let the chefs recommend the dishes. It will be worth it!

Review396.Review: First time there and we were greeted by Peter Fang. He asked us if we trusted him to order for us and we gladly did. Everything was outstanding! Started with the Open Chicken Bun, The War Wonton Soup was fantastic. Wontons were delicate, broth full of flavor. Then the fall-of-the-bone short rib, and a Special Sizzling Fried Rice full of seafood. Just a great all around experience.

Review397.Review: We dined at Fang after watching Chefs Kathy and Peter on the Food Network show Chef Dynasty: House of Fang.  Peter ordered for us and the food was superb!  The menu offers unique dishes utilizing traditional ingredients in Chinese cooking. Must try dishes:  Fang's Famous buns (we had chicken) and the White River Soup.  The clam dish with silkened steamed egg custard and duck was delicious.  Also good was the stir-fried broccoli with lightly coated shrimps and tender morsels of beef in a special sauce.  Definitely would come back to this restaurant when in San Francisco!

Review398.Review: There wasn't anyone to greet you at the door or check why you made the reservation. It was my birthday and I was celebrating my first outing since my double lung transplant. I was disappointed.

Review399.Review: YUM!  CHOSE FAMILY STYLE FOR FOUR OF US AND LET the restaurant choose for us.  Hard to understand the explanation of each dish from the very young waiter with a mask on in a noisy restaurant.  Regardless, it was all delicious with some unique dishes that we had not tasted before. I would return.

Review400.Review: Restaurant is very dusty and dirty. The waitstaff was very rude, What do you want, we close soon you need to order NOW!Food was mediocre and a bit over priced. The house specialty of the fried rice was a JOKE and terrible. WAAAY to much egg and the rice was super mushy

Review401.Review: Food is good for the most part but pricey.  Wait staff is curt and almost rude.  Nice ambiance - not enough to come back.

Review402.Review: Excellent food, we had the crispy fish & brocilli. It was perfect, with fried rice prepared at our table.  The dumplings were fresh & tasty!!  Overall the food was excellent.  The restaurant over all seemed cluttered and unorganized. The service was slow, but we were greeted by the owner, Mr Fang , several timesSome focus on the housekeeping and service would put them at ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️level. Either way, we will be back!

Review403.Review: Great food lots of great flavors . Customer service was good and parking wasn’t bad.

Review404.Review: Well, what a disappointment.  Upon our arrival at noon no one at the door to greet us and welcome us.  Specifically, I think the waiter said, go ahead and sit wherever you want.  As we sat ourselves, we waited for the waiter to come by, and offer us something to drink.  After about seven minutes we finally got our martini and bottled beer.  We ordered an appetizer and when we bit into the potstickers, the inside was  cold.  We had to send them back and upon their return they were over cooked.  Very disappointing.I ordered the short ribs with bok choy, and to my surprise the bok choy came cold.  I called the waiter over and he said that’s the way it’s supposed to come.A few key notes, the restaurant was dusty and in short, dirty.  Finally, there was an Asian woman in the kitchen, who continually talked extremely loud, thus making the ambiance of the restaurant unpleasant.Will I go back, absolutely not.I certainly hope they can commodify on the reality show that they are on as the food and service and overall experience of the restaurant was absolutely poor.

Review405.Review: The food was outstanding!!!!  The owner chef, and her famous father and owner of House of Nanking were there  and present, and actively working the tables as if they were waiters. It was really an amazing experience to witness their dedication and commitment… and that commitment is reflected in the food that is not only delicious, but just beyond words…

Review406.Review: Chef Kathy and Chef Peter provide a wonderful dining experience.  They create wonderful food and are warm and welcoming.

Review407.Review: Came here with a few friends from abroad and trusted the Chef to choose some dishes for us. Best decision ever. Food was amazing! Would definitely come back.

Review408.Review: Service was chaotic, couldn’t get the orders, correct. Mixed up ours with our next table and we never got all of what we ordered.But they didn’t charge us for the mixed up food.Entrees were over-sauced and under-flavored.Dumplings were good.Noise level is deafening.Heard it was great, we did not think so.

Review409.Review: The owner is a sweetheart.  We liked a couple of our entrees.  But, the fried rice was not good.  The waiter (her dad) was screwing up orders.  The waiters  weren’t friendly. The place was small and over crowded.

Review410.Review: Fang is one of my favorite places in SF. Our company has a dinner there each year and everyone is always amazed by the food.

Review411.Review: My wife and I had a phenomenal dinner. If you are visiting for the first time and have no idea what to order. Do as we did and allow Peter or Kathy Fang to order for you. If you have any food allergies let them know and go with the flow. If you would rather order yourself and want a recommendation try the combo dish with charred broccoli, shrimp and steak bites. It’s a little spicy but so amazing. Also not on the menu is their brazed pork ribs which we highly recommend. Also their wonton and clam soup and Peter’s signature buns will round the meal out. As a nice show piece their sizzling rice plate is great.

Review412.Review: I’ve eaten here before and it was pretty good — not so much this time.

Review413.Review: We went to Fang for my son’s birthday. Everything was delicious. We were seated quickly. Our order was taken quickly and the food was served hot. Everything we ordered was delicious. The Szechuan chicken and the sesame chicken were very good. Their house special fried rice that’s made at the table is exciting to watch and delicious. We ordered two different kinds of potstickers. One had a delicious mustard sauce. The other one was like a chili sauce, and they were both very good. I think the highlight of the meal was the pork buns. They were melt in your mouth delicious.

Review414.Review: Amazing experience. Chef Peter Fang came over to our table, said hello, asked if we’d dined with them before. After letting him know it was our first visit, he asked if we had dietary needs or allergies, we stated no. He took our menus & walked away. Little did we know we were in for quite THE EXPERIENCE!We started with the ribs, then shrimp dumplings, followed by chicken buns, steamed portobello and finally the fried rice!! Amazing experience! And we can’t wait to return.

Review415.Review: Great food, great service wish I lived here so we could go more often.

Review416.Review: Was a birthday dinner. Went there a fan of the show, left a fan of everything. It was perfect. The owner was very nice. She came and chatted with us and was down to earth and couldn’t have been nicer.

Review417.Review: Food was average, not great. Service was poor, got served water twice, 2nd time we had to ask, rarely saw the waiter. Lots of "yelling" coming from the kitchen area. However, the food came fast to the table (I think they wanted to clear out the tables quickly so the next customer could be served).

Review418.Review: Amazing restaurant. Very excited to go back. We loved the table side fried rice and short rib dishes

Review419.Review: The food was ok. The only thing that was good was Mongolian short rib. The fried rice wasn’t that great. Also service was not good. We waited for about 5 mins to get water and that was after we stared down the waiter.

Review420.Review: The food is extremely oily. We were under impression that it is high end Chinese restaurant, it is not high end. Dirty dishes sitting on the floor and it seems like everybody is in a rush to get you out of there. They should really hire an experienced  restaurant manager

Review421.Review: Food was amazing. Service was less than average.Quality of the food was to be remembered

Review422.Review: Amazing food and experience. So excited to meet both owners. Big fan and the experience and food did not disappoint!!

Review423.Review: It was the best time.  My grandson said it was the best thing we did in San Fran.  Thye owner came to our table and talked with us.  Suggestion for additional food items were top!  I will eat there whenever I go back.  The food was specular!

Review424.Review: Held a fantastic team dinner at Fang last night and was so impressed with the downstairs location so we could have conversations and the food was fantastic (get the ribs!) - We'll be back!

Review425.Review: Great restaurant, nice place for authentic food Best Chinese I've hadMet the owner

Review426.Review: This is a great restaurant and a great location for us since we always stay at the St. Regis.  I tried the pancakes for the first time which were delicious.  We had a number of appetizers and then a large to go order which we brought home to Carmel.  Everything has been great.

Review427.Review: Spare ribs a must! Such a great experience and worth the visit!

Review428.Review: Sorry to say this after all the hype about FANG, but it didn't meet our expectations.  Food was just ok, ambiance was meh, and the service was spotty. We left thinking that our meal didn't satisfy our craving for Chinese food,  and thought about going to Panda Express later.  Really disappointing experience.

Review429.Review: What can I say about this restaurant except how wonderful it is. We have been back at least half a dozen times and never disappointed. Everything is absolutely delicious and comes out quickly. On a few occasions, Mr Fang himself has ordered for us and everything was wonderful. Highly recommended!

Review430.Review: The food was fantastic...it was so good that I came back  2 days later for more!

Review431.Review: Excellent food, good service, and an overall fun experience.

Review432.Review: I had an absolutely incredible experience at Fang! I went with some colleagues for a dinner after a work conference, and the food was amazing. I am so glad Kathy’s dad came by our table, snatched our menus, and gave us the ultimate sampling of tasty dishes. Everything was cooked to perfection… incredibly tender shrimp, fall off the bone ribs, and delectable flaky fish. Also glad a coworker who had been before recommended the place. Would definitely recommend to anyone and will go again if I ever make it back to San Francisco. If you’ve never seen seen the Discovery+ series about the restaurant, it is awesome; sure to check it out!

Review433.Review: While our reservation didn't seem to accomplish much in terms of us getting seated in a timely manner, once we were seated we were well taken care of by the owners, with dishes picked for us specifically.  The food was all wonderful and the service (after seating) excellent.   The Spare Ribs and Bok Choy dish was mindblowing.  A GREAT experience

Review434.Review: Great food very comfortable but the wait staff very unfriendly. Not helpful with the menu or dishes they offer.

Review435.Review: I wasn’t sure if this restaurant was going to live up to all the hype? Everything was delicious and the service was great. I’m so happy we decided to try out this restaurant and I will definitely go back.

Review436.Review: Food was fantastic, however house special sizzling fried rice arrived probably about 20 minutes after our chicken entree. We asked the server about 10 minutes after waiting and he said it was coming. Then, Peter Fang asked us how everything was and we said well, we’ve been waiting for our fried rice and now our chicken is cold! It wasn’t until then that our fried rice arrived and to warm up our chicken we added it to the sizzling skillet with the rice.The food was great but service could have been way better including the servers personal demeanor. They could be nicer and put on a smile. They all didn’t seem happy to be there, which is so different that what is portrayed on their Food Network show. This is the reason we visited and came from Las Vegas to do so. Service was slow for a Sunday lunch with not much guests. Our neighbors on the next table told us that the House of Nanking has far better service as they experienced the same service as we did and this became a topic of conversation.

Review437.Review: My first time here and it was a great experience!

Review438.Review: One of those restaurants where you wonder how they manage to get the high reviews they have listen on their GMB. The customer service was lacking, almost to the point that it seemed like serving us was a huge imposition. When our food did come the server simply slammed the food on the table without a word and walked off. To top it off the meal itself was nothing to write home about, especially for the price. Take my advice and save yourself the disappointment that is FANG.

Review439.Review: Fantastic food. Friendly staff.  We very much enjoyed our dinner.

Review440.Review: Food was delicious and loved the person attention by the owners!  Will definitely come back!

Review441.Review: It was an amazing night . Mr, Fang himself set up our order and it was the best Asian food experience that we’ve ever had.

Review442.Review: We made a special trip to this Restaraunt because we watch the food network. I envisioned a little bit different scenery based on what they televise but the food was great! Tasty. We stood at the entrance for a while before they greeted us and I was a little shocked at the cleanliness and decor of bathrooms. From someone who watches the show I guess I expected more/ something different but a friend of our joined us and had no reference on what to expect. They were happy. I would dine here again because the food was very good. Leaving the Restaraunt my car window was shattered at the parking lot 2 blocks down. Don’t leave anything valuable in your car or in plain sight so you don’t have to deal with that after a fun night.

Review443.Review: Peter and Kathy Fang provide an excellent cuisine and ambiance at Fang. We have enjoyed a meal with them 40-50 times…….always excellent.Dr Ron

Review444.Review: It sucked and that’s all the time I’m gonna waste complaining about it.

Review445.Review: This was my second time back at Fang and just like the very first time, it did not disappoint. The pork belly steamed buns is an absolute MUST HAVE! Chef Peter always has the best recommendations and we always leave feeling happy and full. 😇

Review446.Review: Should have been more alert.  Chef came by,  offered to take care of us “family style”, made grand gesture of taking all of our menus.  Asked if we had any restrictions, I told him that my daughter was a vegetarian. He asked, Will you eat a little meat? What?!? The first dish to come out was ribs and I have to say they were amazing.  None of the dishes to follow were outstanding and most were not dishes that we would have chosen to order.  There were mostly fish based which again most at the table would have not preferred.  The chef never came back to check in us. The clincher was that the bill came and we realized that “family style” meant $60 per person.  I really felt taken advantage of.  That was never made clear.  I will hv to go back to website and check if they hv a $60 min for parties of 6 or more. Not a repeat for me.

Review447.Review: We had a wonderful lunchband experience!  Chef Fang ordered foe all 4 of us.  We had a 6 course meal.  Chef asked was this our first time at his restaurant?  When we said it was he asked us to give him the menus and said to order our drinks.  He ordered for our table.  The selection and food was superb!

Review448.Review: Peter Fang chose a 5-course dining experience for the 3 of us. Each dish complimented each other and came out at a good pace without feeling rushed. Chicken Bao, Seafood Wun Tun, Sizzling Fried Rice, Spareribs, and Shrimp Rice Noodles. So tasty and the in right portions.

Review449.Review: Best dining experience ever! We are fans of Chef Dynasty and wanted to try Fang’s! We were in the city for the night and was l lucky to get a open table reservation same day. Was seated immediately and was served by Peter! He was kind enough to let us get a photo with him! We told him we love the show and don’t know what to order so he took our menus away and said let me handle it. He did ask for dietary restrictions before he left. What an amazing experience to have one of the chefs say I know what to order for you. Never done that before! It was very exciting anxiously waiting for the unknown! For starters we were served the wonton soup which was delicious and the steam buns with pork and pork ribs! Our other dishes were so amazing they aren’t even on the menu! We did have the famous house fried rice which you need to have! Everything was delicious the one dish that I can’t forget to mention was Peter’s version of broccoli beef. It had charred broccolini and tender pieces of beef and shrimp this dish isn’t on the menu and needs to be added soooo good and the sauce out of this world. We even got to meet Long and Joshua I was star struck! Was the best dining experience ever! If your in the city you need to definitely go to Fang’s you won’t be disappointed and can’t go wrong with what you order definitely hit up Peter was his choice! Thank you Fang we will be back!!

Review450.Review: Food is great, but it is too rushed. Brought appetizers, soup and entree all at the same time. In and out in an hour.

Review451.Review: I had a fabulous experience at Fang. I was initially a little nervous because there wasn’t much of a greeting and we had to wait a bit without knowing what was happening but I was personally greeted by both Kathy and Peter and it was very genuine. Mr Fang even chose our food. The food was out of this world!

Review452.Review: Food was amazing, service not so much. We were seated promptly, but then waited quite a while before we were acknowledged by a server. We placed a drink order, along with two appetizers and three entrees for fear that we may need to wait again. One appetizer came, then an entree. Had to ask the food runner for our drinks…short story, if you’re willing to deal with haphazard service, the food is really worth the trip.

Review453.Review: Was very bad. Paper napkins with linen tableclothes.  List goes on lol horrible. Main chef should be ashamed of herself

Review454.Review: Amazing experience! No need to order from the menu- let Chef Peter work his magic.

Review455.Review: Mr. Fang greeted us and chose our dishes which were all amazing!

Review456.Review: It was amazing!  Mr. Peter Fang was wonderful and made the most delicious choices for us. Everything was perfect!  We will be back!!  Thank you!!

Review457.Review: Hands down, Fang is a San Francisco experience that all must have! If you are fortunate to have the owner or her dad as your host, let them create your menu. Each time I go, I let the host order for me. I have yet to be disappointed.

Review458.Review: How great is it when the owner not only chooses your meal, but then also sits down to chat with you for a bit. Peter Fang was so sweet and the food was SO good!  Even the “I don’t love seafood” eaters in our group loved the seafood dishes!

Review459.Review: the best food my wife and I tasted in quite a long time!!! wow, will be back soon with my family!!!

Review461.Review: Fang is a hyped up joke of a restaurant.  The service is abysmal, food is mediocre, and the restaurant is filthy.  There was a layer of dust that had to be building up for weeks on all the counters and bar tops.  Floors look like they haven't been swept/mopped in at least a week.  We NEVER got a server, chased down 4 different employees to get service but never did anyone show up to ask us anything.  The hostess just waved at us from across the room and pointed at a table.  Seriously, not worth it.  SF has too many good restaurants to waste time or money on FANG.

Review462.Review: Odd experience. We had a reservation but it didn’t seem to matter. It appeared to be first come first served - regardless of reservation. The father ordered everything for us, which seemed to be their preference. Food was brought out quickly with no breaks between dishes. The servers did not check or speak to us. The ribs were the best rib that I have ever had. The chicken bun was good, but a little bland. Dumplings with eggplant was great. The eggplant was really good. Shrimp with charred broccolini was good. The house special fried rice was boring and the low point of the meal. The meal was not expensive and we were done in less than an hour. The restaurant looks nothing like it appears on TV. Food is good but the experience is lacking.

Review464.Review: We were going to order what we were accustomed to. Our Chef/Host asked if we were open to trying new dishes and we were. We had the most savory taste experience ever for an excellent price for a table of 11.  We will certainly come back!  Great service! Great ambiance…

Review465.Review: We met Kathy Fang and she was so kind and humble.  We loved the food and experience. Definitely will be going again.

Review466.Review: I had a wonderful time, owner suggested he would order for us, since it was our first time there. Did an outstanding job. Food was excellent service was outstanding, would highly recommend it.

Review467.Review: Love Fangs.  I take customers to Fangs for lunch meetings.  Everyone always loves the little different twist on Chinese dishes.

Review468.Review: We had watched the six-part series on the Food Network titled “Chef Dynasty”. This featured Kathy Fang, the owner and chef at Fang Restaurant in SF. She is the daughter of Peter Fang, who owns the House of Nanking in Chinatown, recently honored as a SF Legacy Restaurant. House of Nanking is known for updates to classic Chinese dishes. Fang has a more modern, innovative take on Chinese cooking. We decided we needed to try it out and went there for lunch on the 21st anniversary of our engagement.I had read, in reviews, that guests were frequently greeted at Fang by Peter Fang. He seems to spend a fair amount of time at Fang. I assume he is at his place for dinners. It is also reported that Peter will offer to pick your meal for you and most reviewers have been quite happy with the result. As we entered, we were, indeed, greeted by Peter. We noticed Kathy Fang over by the open kitchen. After being seated, we were surprised to have Kathy come to our table to take our order. We had some conversation about the TV show and that we were celebrating. We asked what she would suggest and she offered to make selections for us. Now the menu is not at all the typical Chinese options, so we were happy to be served. Kathy was very casually dressed in contrast to the high fashion with lots of make-up seen on the program. Very low key. We had several opportunities to chat with Kathy over a leisurely lunch. We started with a skewered shrimp and apple single bite. Next came a large pork spare rib, fall of the bone tender. There was a wor wonton soup with tiny clams and pork wonton in a light cream broth. The main entrée’ was a chili oil whitefish (sea bass) that disappeared quickly. We also had a charred broccolini. All washed down with a Napa Bouchaine rose (this was a winery at which Kathy cooked for a special event of Napa vintners on the program). Dessert was the most traditional dish of sesame rice balls and almond cookies.We look forward to going back for dinner.

Review469.Review: Food was great. Service was not. We had a small issue with an app they remade the dumplings but did not remake the whole dish with the sauce and vegetables so we got dry dumplings only which was a little weird. Normally you remake the complete dish. We ordered ice tea we asked for refills and was told they didn't have anymore we asked if they would make more and we were told they would not be making anymore tonight. We got put downstairs in a corner with bags of linens 5 ft from us. Might have been an off night we were there for valentine's day it was about 830.

Review470.Review: We had an amazing time at Fang! Everything we ordered was delicious . Peter took our order and also took a pic .

Review471.Review: I was really looking forward to dining here after seeing the show on Food Network. Unfortunately, it was rather disappointing. The food was unremarkable, the restaurant felt a little old and unkempt and the service was so slow. So sad to say, we won’t go back.

Review472.Review: We ordered a lot of food! The twice cooked pork ribs and sweet shrimp with apples were the stand outs! Pork belly buns were devine as were the deepfried spring rolls.  The only miss was the cold duck as a lot of little bones.  We would have liked if things could have been timed better as everything came at once.

Review473.Review: Good experience. Food was great and service was helpful. Owner ordered for us.

Review474.Review: The day before we went to Fang we ate at House of NanKing ( Kathy's parents restaurant in China town.)  Today we went to Fang. Fang was amazing. We met Mr. Peter and had great food. The ambiance was just like on the television show. The decor was authentic and pleasing to the eyes. It was a full room but did not feel crowded. The appetizers and entrees came out quickly, hot and flavorful. We loved the rice dish that was prepared table side. All of the staff was friendly and attentive.   We had ribs, pear shrimp  and hot and sour soup  for our appetizers and for our entrees we had  garlic noodles, signature rice, pear shrimp , chicken and shrimp buns, and sesame chicken. Each dish was delicious , well seasoned and palate pleasing.  Parking in the area can be tricky but we managed to park just around the corner in the paid lot. We cant wait to go again

Review476.Review: After watching “Chef Dynasty, House of Fang” on the food network, we became fans of the show and our mouth watered every time Chef Kathy Fang would prepare any dishes. So we had too see for ourselves if the food was as good as it looked on TV. And OH MY GOODNESS, iT was even better then we could have imagined. She is amazing, the staff was exceptional. I have never had Chinese food this delicious, in my life! Fantastic all the way around. From the fried rice, they put together in front of you, to the short ribs, right down to their gin cocktails, made to perfection. This place did not disappoint, we cannot wait to dine at Fang’s again soon. We were lucky enough to meet Chef Kathy Fang, Long and Josh! They were very kind and very Professional.

Review477.Review: The food was exceptional. We had the owner order for us. The buns were to die for. The service was warm and attentive. The only drawback was how loud it was. You couldn’t really talk. I would definitely go back. Might try it for lunch.

Review478.Review: Amazing all around.Kathy was walking around greeting everyone and the food was amazing. Service was great. We will be back for sure

Review479.Review: Food was excellent. When we were there it was really busy so service was a bit chaotic. Reservation is highly recommend.

Review480.Review: Great date night! Fantastic food and fun atmosphere to be part of. Honey shrimp is a favorite.

Review481.Review: The waitstaff startedBy up selling is entrees and options. We each selected a dish and then the server said she willKathy make suggestions. Funny that Kathy never came over to us and we ended up with a greedy mess of a dinner. The sauces were watery and fried items were coldAnd soggy. The fried meat might as wellBeen mystery meat. The coating on it did not seal on moisture. They hyped was there, but the service and food screamed Panda Express.Really disappointed and all I could say was “No Bueno…”Best part of the dinner was walking out the door. The brisk night air provided much relief and calmness. The restaurant was chaotic and not in a good way.Would we do it again? No… would we recommend it to others? No - Too many other restaurants that serve tasty foods, especially for less then the $450 we spent for our party of 7/8.Keep on walking and do not stop.

Review482.Review: Party of 4 with reservations. Seated immediately upon opening.Greeted by Peter Fang, Kathy Fangs dad. He customized our menu items himself and we enjoyed a six course meal. Later, Kathy Fang came over and we took photos of everyone. Nice touch!!

Review483.Review: We were met by the owner, who is absolutely delightful. She offered to choose a variety of dishes for us to share as a party of 6-this was the best idea! Every dish was delicious. The broccoli was a standout for all of us, but we loved the white fish, pork ribs, short ribs and honey apple prawns. It was overall a wonderful experience and I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant.

Review484.Review: The food was good but not great. The drinks were okay but took a long time to get to the table. One came at the end of the meal. Most of the staff were wearing house of Nanking gear. We waited 10 minutes for a terse greeting at peak dinner hour. But most of all the restaurant was not clean. From the disarray at the reception area, to the poor ventilation and the dirty drink glasses I expect a lot more at the price point.

Review485.Review: Everything was delicious and extremely satisfying. The hospitality was also above and beyond!

Review486.Review: The food was phenomenal and meeting Chef Fang was a treat!

Review487.Review: Staff were very friendly and attentive.  Food was great; will visit again next time I am in town.  Already recommended to colleagues the next day and they loved it!

Review488.Review: Fang is probably getting popular from its TV show appearance- the owner is lovely and polite and very personable with guests.  The staff is a little chaotic.  We ordered three items- we got two. Then we got a bill, with all three items.  We asked to have the third item, and instead, we got a bill with the third item removed.  Then we told them we wanted the pot stickers and eventually got them.  It was hard to get the staff attention to get more water or soda, so we eventually gave up and settled for paying for the meal and leaving.  Running a restaurant is hard, but the staff could listen a little more to the guests.... the food itself was fantastic- and they have a great "at the table" fried rice I have never seen before- the next table got it, and I sort of wish we had given that a try.  The buns however, are epic and well worth the visit.

Review489.Review: Super busy but in a good way. Had a terrible table sandwiched between the service counter and stairway. The foot traffic was unbearable so I asked to move and was accommodated. Honestly get rid of that table, $60 for a terrible experience for everyone is pointless. Appreciated them moving us to an actual table. The food was amazing, tasted wonderful and came out fast. We had to flag 15 waiters to get the check, but the checkout was relatively painless and quick. The owner was working on the floor, so again busy, but she and her father were very kind.

Review490.Review: Real mom and pop restaurant experience we got. When we said we all are vegetarians, Peter Fang said no need to look at the menu, and he started sending all different and very delicious veg items. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Review491.Review: Delicious food. Good service. Owners came to greet us

Review492.Review: Poor ventilation, strong smelling clothes, overly salty food and generally one of the poorest Chinese restaurants I have ever visited.

Review493.Review: Tables are very close together so it’s hard to have a conversation. The food is very good and very generous in portion size.

Review494.Review: I let the owner guide our food choices and everyhting was really good.

Review495.Review: We asked what we needed to have and not miss. Peter Fang crafted our experience. It was incredible.

Review498.Review: Very disappointed,  the service was terrible. Food mediocre,  definitely not worth the hype.  I really looked forward to a great experience and was let down.

Review499.Review: Surprised my with with a dinner date and was created by the owner and chef.  She curated a beautiful meal for the two of us to enjoy.  Looking forward to returning with friends for another great experience.

Review500.Review: Excellent and rich food with great and quick service!

Review501.Review: Rude service from hostess to server! Almost hostile!

Review502.Review: Have eaten at Fangs numerous times. This was Chinese New Year and it was crazy. They were trying their best. Looking forward to going back non holiday

Review503.Review: Best Chinese food in the bay area for sure! The owner walks around and makes sure everything is okay and everyone is happy!

Review504.Review: Food didn't live up to the hype. Faux Chinese isn't to my taste.

Review505.Review: The owner took our order and it was wrong!   She didn’t pay attention while she was taking our order and she never said hello or greeted us.  The place is too crowded and the ambiance is harried and loud.  The food was just ok.  The service was non existent.  We were excited to go, but will never return.

Review506.Review: Awesome it was awesome.  Great food. Great ambience.  Fun time

Review507.Review: First time at Fang and everyone from our large party loved their entrees!  Great customer service by all. Will definitely return when in San Franciso. Thank you!

Review508.Review: We had an amazing experience at Fang! The food was phenomenal, every recommendation was spot on and we enjoyed the restaurant from beginning to end. I went in with high expectations as I’ve seen the Food Network show “House of Fang”. However, I did not expect to see Kathy and her dad working there. But, there they were. Kathy seated us, gave us excellent recommendations and told us we had ordered enough, who does that?! Thank goodness she did, we had ordered enough!🤣I can’t say enough positive things about Fang restaurant. It is a beautiful, intimate space with delicious food! If I lived in SF, I might go every day.🙃

Review509.Review: Not so much. All food arrived at once. Then the table was like a postage stamp!  Food all tastes the same.  Eggplant was mushy. Rice wa awful. Would not recommend.

Review510.Review: Wonderful quiet, the specials (labled Fang) were all excellent

Review511.Review: Fangs was wonderful and lived up to it's reputation.

Review513.Review: The Hostess, also our waitress was WONDERFUL.  She recommended the broccoli dish that was out of this world.  She was really helpful, warm and professional.  The food was outstanding..every dish.  I love this place and will return again and again.

Review516.Review: Food outstanding. Didn’t like that someone who didn’t know us or what we enjoyed eating as a group felt that they should tell us what to order not even knowing whether or not c we had any advanced knowledge of what Fang was about

Review517.Review: Excellent food! Friendly! Will definitely go again.

Review518.Review: Dynamite experience! Come hungry and plan to indulge in some delicious fare. Hot sour soup was very tasty and filling. The cubed chicken breast meat was moist and large. Sea bass with spinach addictive and fried rice presentation memorable. Hot tea was super and there’s also wine by the glass. I would go back the next time in the city. Wish Chef Kathy would come to Hawaii to film her show. Mr. Fang and Chef Kathy are hardworking professionals and work the tables with grace. They engage with diners and live and love their Chinese heritage. Thank you for a delightful experience! Aloha, Lisa

Review519.Review: Impressed from start to finish. Started with dumplings and they were amazing! Next sweet and sour soup was even better. Entrees were even better! Food was so good that I am planning a trip to the bay area with my daughter and her family around eating at Fang!

Review520.Review: Worst meal I’ve ever eaten. Terrible service, the food almost rancid. I would never go back or recommend to anyone. Horrible.

Review521.Review: The staff was friendly and prompt. The food was incredibly delicious and came out fast. I’ve recommended this place to many and will return to try the other dishes. I’m a yelp elite and this won 5 stars from me.

Review523.Review: This was our 1st time to the restaurant. From the moment we sat down, we felt rushed. Waitress spent no time with us going over the menu.  They didn’t care how many plates we had on the table. Staff just crowded the table top. The place is overhyped. We would go back, but now with a different attitude on what to expect.Love SFDave

Review524.Review: The food was excellent, service was excellent also.  The noise level was high do to a couple of large parties.

Review525.Review: Kathy and her father Peter are the perfect hosts.  The food was everything I expected. Flavorful and creative.  The pea pods with sesame oil and onions were a symphony of flavors.  The chili short ribs fell off the bone. I highly recommend Fang’s.  Mr. Fang ordered for us so every dish was a surprise and a delight.  I’ll be going back soon.

Review527.Review: Upon arriving, I was surprised at how messy and unkempt the restaurant was. The bar was covered with service items and not usable. The host desk was full of paperwork stacked halfway up the wall. We were seated in a cramped corner with very little room between us and the next table. We had to ask for service multiple times to no avail.  I believe we asked 3 people before a server finally arrived at our table. We ordered the duck bao (strange texture to duck. It is Not roasted as I would have expected). The sesame chicken - very little to no sauce on it, so just cornstarch fried chicken bits with sesame seeds, melt in your mouth pork belly was ok, and the fried rice that had very little flavor. It was fun to see, but just not much flavor rice and eggs with a few bits of bell pepper. There were no other veggies like you expect in fried rice. Overall, I had expected so much more and was fairly disappointed.

Review528.Review: the night we went was very busy.  we had reservations but they never asked for them, just sat us when the table was ready.  it was hard to get any servers attention since it was so busy such as  getting a take out box or getting a check.   The   sizzling rice w/clams and BB sauce was fabulous as was the eggplant and the honey short ribs

Review529.Review: Our table and all three around us had almost identical dining experiences during opening service: none of us got the white rice we ordered, service was almost nonexistent and no one ever came back to ask if we needed any more drinks or anything, and then one man came around — at the exact same time — to give everyone’s check. All unrelated parties at the exact same time, should tell you something. We had to basically flag down and beg to add a cup of tea to the end of the meal and they were very annoyed that either we were ordering ‘more’ and/or they had to re-do the check.

Review530.Review: The food is unquestionably phenomenal. We went because we had seen Cathy and her Dad on the Food Network. The ingredients and preparations were outstanding!

Review532.Review: Buena comida pero el servicio muy malo… parte de la experiencia.

Review533.Review: First time at Fangs and it was so good.  Kathy personally picked our food out and everything that came out was so delicious.  We were celebrating our friends birthday and this dinner made her so happy.  Definitely telling others about restaurant and will be going back again.

Review534.Review: Food was great. It was a packed house which made it fun. Energy was up. Service was being tested but that’s expected given the recent promo on Food Network. Our server Selena was enjoyable and Kathy was very nice and working hard herself. We will be back!!

Review535.Review: we didn't get our drinks until 1/2 way thru the service, wife ordered tea , never got it, the waiter probably didn't hear

Review536.Review: Waited for over 30 min for our reserved  table.Food was a bit heavy.

Review537.Review: We were treated to our server being Peter Fang.  He asked us to trust him then he took away our menus.  He told us that he would make us a family meal then asked about food restrictions.  What came was plate after plate of delicious, hot fresh food.  It was by far the best Chinese inspired meal I have ever had. From spare ribs and chicken buns to poached fish and clam won ton soup.

Review538.Review: We loved our experience at Fang. I made reservations for my husbands birthday. We watch the show Chef Dynasty House of Fang and love it. The food was amazing! Peter came to our table and asked if we had ever been to the restaurant before. We said no and he was really great and ordered for us. Everything he ordered was so good. The only downside of the experience was that we felt rushed. I know it is a popular restaurant but I feel that when you go out to eat and pay the money that you do, you should be able to enjoy the experience.

Review539.Review: Was there for lunch and greeted and seated promptly. Staff checked in to see if we had everything we needed. The fried short ribs were the star. They were crispy with the lightest of coatings and at first they looked dry but as you as you bit into one it was a burst of flavorful juice and tender meat. The Duck Baos were great too with a flavorful sauce.

Review540.Review: Good food. Lousy service.  Very loud and disorganized. 30 late for reservation.  People without reservations were seated before us.

Review541.Review: The food was SO SO delicious and it’s consistent. Every time we go back we try something new and it’s amazing. Highly recommend!

Review542.Review: The Vegetable wonton with eggplant in garlic sauce was outstanding.

Review543.Review: Every single thing we ordered was amazing! Very flavorful food.

Review544.Review: Exceptional off-menu dining experience. Peter Fang greeted and sat us, and on learning we hadn’t visited the restaurant previously, he curated a 5-course lunch for us. Very excited to visit again!

Review545.Review: First time for dinner with friends and the Fang Owner and Chef, Kathy Fang, was not there BUT her father, Peter Fang, chef and owner of House of Nanking, was there.Chef Peter Fang came to our table asked us if we ever had dinner at Fang and he told us, “Give me your menus, I’ll provide your dinner…” 🫢 I was so ecstatic!! Only because I’m the nerd of my group that started to recently watch their reality show on Food Network! 😃THE FOOD!!! Ohmygah!!! DELICIOUSNESS ALL AROUND!!!Bravo to Papa Chef and Daughter Chef!! 👏🏼😁I need to go back to Fang with other friends for more of their creative and I am sure > yummy dishes!HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Review546.Review: The food at Fang was excellent.  The menu was varied and creative and we fully enjoyed every dish.  However the service was more than disappointing.  We were a party of two and seated at table jammed against the wall in a row of very tightly packed two person tables.  Taking out 1 or 2 of the tables would have made the seating a lot more comfortable.  When we finally ordered, our food and drinks were served haphazardly.  First came one of the appetizers, then one of the entrees.  We had to ask for our drinks because they hadn't arrived yet.  We actually waved down a server for the table next to us since they were almost done with their meal and still hadn't gotten their drinks.  Finally our drinks arrived, followed by the other entree and lastly, the second appetizer.  We had ordered rice, and requested it a second time, but never came.  We didn't have to ask for the check which was delivered while we were still eating.  I would call the dining experience the very minimum definition of service.  Also in front of the food pickup area on the floor in full view were two containers where dirty dishes were dumped.  Would I go there again for dinner?  Doubtful.  Takeout?  Maybe.

Review547.Review: Innovative, great food. We didn't order off the menu, but just let the waiter bring us dishes. Fantastic food. Much fun.

Review548.Review: We felt rushed and ignored at the same time. When the wrong entree came out, they argued that we were wrong.Disappointed.

Review549.Review: Went to Fang after hearing great things from their TV show and reviews, but was very disappointed. The food was not great.

Review550.Review: When we arrived, the hostess was also acting as a waitress because they were so busy.  She looked and acted totally frazzled. The hostess station was filled with miscellaneous papers in huge piles, along with cleaning supplies. Behind the bar looked the same.  The food was mediocre.  The dumplings tasted like pot stickers you could buy frozen at Costco.  Not worth the hype presented on Food Network.  We had a better meal, at a better price at a “hole in the wall” restaurant in Chinatown.

Review551.Review: It was good not amazing but good. I would like to try the House of Nanking restaurant next.

Review552.Review: Food was outstanding.  The owner said he would order for us.  It was all delicious.  We appreciated that.  However, when I compared what we got to the menu prices, they over charged us by about $100.  The food was outstanding.  We might go again, but would order for ourselves.

Review553.Review: Absolutely the worst dining experience I have ever had. Me and my friend returned everything and the owner took it all off our bill it was disgusting and just not great experience all around service was rude food was terrible and it was like the owner knew it was all horrible she came over and said you didn’t like it ok I’ll take it off and walked away never asked anything more or tried to fix any problems. I do appreciate her taking it off the bill but it really seemed like she just didn’t care. This restaurant is definitely hyped up over being on tv that’s for sure
