Review554.Review: The food was not innovative, needed salt, greasy and did not live up to the hype of how it was featured on the Food network show "House of Nanking".  The service was awful and the silverware was water stained.  The restaurant felt grubby and the bathrooms were gross.

Review555.Review: As always the food at Fang was really good, prepared with fresh ingredients, with kind of unusual combinations.The service however, has a lot to be desired. When you walk into the door, the person at the front desk did not greet us, and came back and forth from the dining room a few times with out any acknowledgement. We were finally shown to a table after the owner came and asked us how many were in our party, and after several minutes without a waiter/waitress, he came a took our order. When the food arrived, the server just told us what each dish was, and disappeared. We had to call someone over to ask for water, and take out containers at the end of the meal.Service was so bad I was tempted not to leave any tip!  But the food was good so I did leave the very minimum.

Review556.Review: We went to Fangs last night to celebrate a birthday. Food was 10 stars out of 5 stars!! Service was great at first but then we went unchecked for half an hour. We had to get up to ask for help. Tables a little too close for comfort. We know if we sat somewhere different we probably wouldn’t of had issues. Very friendly staff. Cocktail drink was great. We will be back for sure.

Review557.Review: Served by the owner just asked him to pick our meal and it was amazing

Review558.Review: We were very excited to try out Fang when we were in San Francisco this last weekend.  Peter Fang took care of us and brought us what he thought we would like which we really enjoyed.  However, it seemed as though 2 of the dishes had the same sauce and were pretty saucy.  I guess I like the food to shine more with less sauce.  Just a personal preference.  Also there is very little room for parties of 2.  There were 5 tables up against the wall with seating for 2 people at each and probably 5 inches between the tables.  It would be necessary to move the table in order to get in and out.  We made friends quickly!  LOL!  And unfortunately that did not make for us to have a leisurely dinner.  We are 2 to 3 hour dinner people and this restaurant does not seem to encourage that at all unless maybe you are a large table of guests.  Its kind of eat and out.  We will be planning to try the original Peter Fang restaurant The House of Nanking and are looking forward to that.

Review559.Review: Our party of four was eager to try several of the dishes on the menu. Kathy Fang herself came to our table, so we told her to just give us what she thought we'd like. We had 5-6 dishes, all of which were delicious, especially the broccoli and the bao buns. There's still a little confusion among the front of house staff- one person in our party had to ask fro their cocktail repeatedly, but everything else went very smoothly, with dishes being brought out at intervals. The restaurant was full, so there was some noise of chatter, but we were able to hold a conversation across a large round table with no problem. If you're feeling adventurous, I highly recommend putting yourself in the hands of the staff.

Review560.Review: We went with the chefs choice and were not disappointed!

Review561.Review: FANG is a hidden gem that has a fabulous chef.  During my visit, the Chef took it upon himself to send dishes based on our taste.  The various dishes were creative, unique, well put together, and simply delicious. Relative to various Chinese restaurants in CA and NY, this is one of the best. Well done, Chef. May you always leave your customers with such a good taste in their mouth.

Review562.Review: Outstanding and unique flavors.  High energy and busy but a must try for San Fran!

Review563.Review: This restaurant was AMAZING! I made a reservation for my birthday & we all did family style. The chef and owner came to greet us and see how many people we had so he could decide on what to serve us and how much. The food was delicious and I will be going back again and again! It’s a must try.

Review564.Review: Service was quite terrible. The kicked out us even we have a reseravation...

Review565.Review: We were greeted by owner Peter who ordered for us .  First dish was chicken bun, which also have 2 other versions in duck and pork.  This is a version of Peking Duck.  With soft sweet buns.  He only brought us chicken.  So did not tast the duck or the porkNext dish were fried spicy pot stickers that we did not like.  It was deep fried, spiced with Mexican spices and did not meet my expectations of Chinese fusionNext was a fried gailon (Chinese broccoli ) with beef,  way too salty, and sweet,  the freshness of the gailon was lost in the sauce.The specialty white fish in sauce with bok choy, was too salty and too sweet, and heavy handed with oyster sauce.Specially. Fried rice, nicely presented and was also tastyOverall we the food was over priced and not better than any of the downtown Grant Avenue Chinatown restaurants in SF.If we were allowed to order food of our choice our opinion may have been different. 3 out of 5 dishes were fried and we believe that this more Western version of Cantonese food was given to us because my wife and daughter in law are white. They also prefer traditional food and would have liked to choose their own.We might try once more, to give the other dishes on the menu, a chance to be reviewed.

Review566.Review: Food was good. Service was terrible. What they advertise on their tv show is 100% different than what you walk into.

Review567.Review: FANGTASTIC!!!Awesome service.Awesome food.Those of you who complain about this place are probably just negative reviewers and don’t review unless some is bad. You might have had to wait for a table and that set the tone for you. Chill out. Not one thing bad about this place. It’s hands down the best Chinese Food we’ve ever had. And we had tried many places. Thank you Fang for a wonderful experience:)

Review568.Review: Fang senior was our waiter, an unexpected surprise. When we recognized him, he asked if we had ever been there before and if we trusted his judgment. We said first time and sure we trusted his judgment. He took our menus and ordered for us. The best dish ended up being the vegetarian dumplings with eggplant. The broccoli in cream sauce appealed to the vegetarians although I thought the cream overwhelmed the vegetable. The fried rice was entertaining in its presentation, but overall too salty for me.

Review569.Review: Really enjoyed my first time to Fang. Food was delicious, service was great, and the 4 of us will definitely be back. You get the feeling that the owner and staff are all together in this, and happy to bring the customers along for the ride, which adds a more personal dimension to the experience that we really enjoyed. I had never watched the show or heard of the House of Fang, but I'm following them now!Great experience!

Review570.Review: We had such an enjoyable evening at Fang. I had watched the show and saw that someone was able to order a tasting menu off menu— that’s what we did and it was awesome. Definitely the way to go so you can try a variety of dishes. The winners were by far the sea bass dish with spinach in a sesame oil sauce, the pork bun, and the beef “meatballs” that were rolled in a hint of chocolate. Sounds weird but it was different and really good. The main miss was the fried rice. The presentation is great but there was a different herbaceous flavor… maybe thyme or oregano? that was pretty strong and not my favorite. Pouring some of the fish sauce over the rice made it edible. The restaurant decor was a little shocking— but the energy within the place was fun. Both Peter and Kathy Fang were there and she was working her booty off. I’d definitely go back now that there’s a tasting experience, or with a large group in order to try a variety of dishes.

Review571.Review: We had multiple dishes and ALL of them were exceptional. Best food we’ve eaten in a very long time.

Review572.Review: Good food and huge portions. However, dishes were brought in strange order. First came vegetable side dish then soup, then fried rice. Nice old man (the owner?) checked on us a couple of times.

Review573.Review: Oily bland dishes didn’t live up to expectation, waiter was careless and uninterested, spilt soup in our drinks and ignored us asking for assistance twice. Wanted to like and enjoy but left our party disappointed- won’t be back.

Review574.Review: After seeing the new show on Food Network, we decided to give it a try. The food was absolutely amazing and delicious. We got a couple different appetizers and a soup and it was more than enough food for the two of us, and the prices were quite resonable.

Review575.Review: The food was meh -- lots of sugary sauces and coatings that Americans love in their Chinese food.  And weirdly, we were offered no rice.  Even after we asked. I would not go back.

Review576.Review: Recommend trusting the father in choosing the meals for first timers. He'll always ask for allergies and if you're ready to eat great food. Great environment and food, thanks for everything.

Review577.Review: We went with lots of excitement and enthusiasm.  Unfortunately, the food is not up to snuff.  Most of the dishes were bland and disappointing.

Review578.Review: Food was tasty and good. Service on the other hand was slow and very unconnected. All the servers acted and displayed with body language, lack of connecting with the customers, like they didn’t want to be there. The table next to us asked for to go boxes, response and body language to the request was surprising and he came back, he basically threw them on the table.Not sure we will return, lots of choices to eat in SF!

Review579.Review: It was a real treat to get to meet the owner and have him choose our meal for us. We had crispy beef and broccoli, spareribs, chicken bao, and special fried rice. Highly recommend all dishes.

Review580.Review: It was amazing! We were treated to being served by Paul Fang. -who picked all our dishes and they were delicious.  This was an experience of a lifetime.

Review581.Review: Outstanding “modern” Chinese food and excellent service. Can’t wait to go back.

Review582.Review: Amazing, delicious food.  Will definitely be going back.

Review583.Review: The short rib with bok choi is oooout of this world!!!Delicious!!!

Review584.Review: Very disappointing after such a great write up recently. Most dishes tasted the same, not clean, needs a major overhaul and cleanup.  Will not go back.

Review585.Review: Great food - horrendous service.We would just sit their with empty glasses and dirty dishes as every waiter just walked by.

Review586.Review: Amazing food and service as always. The food was fresh and delicious with large portion sizes. The service was attentive and very fast.

Review587.Review: The food is delicious.  The service is serious lacking.  Hard to know who’s in charge.  No host,  and no one communicating with guests waiting to be seated.  The restaurant gets smoky not sure what’s that’s about.  This isn’t an elevated eating experience, but let me end by saying the food alone would have me go back.  Maybe take out is ideal.

Review588.Review: Food was very good, unfortunately service was poor. Was asked to order before getting menus.  Entree came before appetizer. Had to ask multiple times for rice and drink refills. Was given check before we’d finished ordering/eating.

Review589.Review: Fang Restaurant was beyond our expectations. We did not order from the menu but let the chef decide for us. Each dish was marvelously delicious and beautiful. We are definitely going back!

Review590.Review: We were excited to try FANG and in all it did not disappoint with very small expectations. We arrived a few minutes ahead of our reservations and were promptly greeted and sat down.When we ordered it kind of all came at once or very shortly after each plate was delivered which was a little surprising.For appetizers we ordered the fried pot stickers and Bao Buns with Duck and Chicken. The pot stickers were off the charts good mainly due to the mustard sauce that accompanied it was delicious. The buns meh were not as great.We ordered the FANGs wonton soup and that was not at all was expected in a a milk white broth and somewhat spicy. We really did not care for this and should have ordered a more traditional version.We ordered the egg rolls and like the Potstickers had a similar sauce and was amazing. For the mains we had salt and pepper shrimp and the FANGs short rib. The shrimp dish was nothing really special and too much fried zucchini but he short rib was again the winner here. Phenomenal dish and very different.All in all had great service and a great experience. Will look forward to trying again when next in town.

Review591.Review: I highly recommend eating here. Chef Fang worked the floor by taking orders.  Crowded, but great atmosphere. I would eat here again. The bau and onion cake were divine. The sizzling fried rice was quite the show.

Review592.Review: Excellent cuisine and service.  My entire family including children loved it. We will be back and so close to MOMA>

Review593.Review: Great to see Peter again, such a warm smile and helpful style.The hot and sour soup was the best in ages, as was the rest of the food.Such a wonderful return to stellar, inspired Chinese food.

Review594.Review: Our food was delicious and abundant: Fang signature bun with pork belly was a great starter; sweet potato slices with the sesame chicken made a decadent dish seem slight more virtuous; the tableside fried rice had a serious kick, the fried noodles w/shrimp-I would definitely have again!, the scallion pancake was nice and crispy.  I really want to go back to try the dumplings over roasted eggplant, the mapo tofu and the other Fang signature bun fillings.

Review595.Review: Food was amazing!  The restaurant has the feel of an old school Chinese restaurant that adds to the charm.  Can’t wait to go back!

Review596.Review: Creative take on Chinese food, actual fusion. The owners will come and chat with you (the servers won’t, they just move food from the kitchen to your table). Had an awesome time, and loved the attention from the father/daughter owners.

Review597.Review: Had a 6:15 reservation for myself and my daughter. Walked in. Nobody paid attention to us for at least 20 minutes. Had to run around and find a waitress. She rudely told me no tables were ready and disappeared. Again, I had a reservation. No host/hostess to be found. Absolutely terrible service. After we sat down, waitress dropped our food and was never heard from again. Rude staff. Fried rice was boring and undercooked. Go somewhere else, anywhere else.

Review598.Review: I’ll never go back.  Very disappointed in all aspects.

Review599.Review: Did not live up to the hype at all.  Our reservation was at 5;:30 when they opened and the bathroom was filthy, no toilet paper or any servicing at all. You would think it was clean when they opened. Food was overpriced and all tasted the same with the same thick mustardy sauce all over it. Items were described as crispy and vegetables were supposed to be fresh but everything was fried to a crisp and doused in that sauce, making it both burnt tasting and a chewy oily mess. Hot and sour soup was neither spicy nor sour. I asked for some soy sauce and they brought out a dirty soy sauce bottle, sticky and cloudy and about 10%full. No attention to basic cleanliness or care in serving the food. Wait staff were hurried and rude but quick to give you a check. Won’t be going back here or recommending at all.

Review600.Review: Excellent service - Food was on the good to the outstanding line,

Review601.Review: Mr. Fang is a great host.  Very attentive service... Really good and unusual Chinese food....  But it would have been nice if it had been less noisy.

Review602.Review: I told chef Peter Fang I’m a Food Network fan, and that I know about his daughter’ show, premiered that day. He smiled. He asked for allergies, and I told him I’m allergic to black and white pepper, and that I don’t like spicy food. He took our menus, and quickly our table was full of food. His selection was perfect, although spicy for my taste (moderate/mild for any other person perhaps!). I really enjoyed the experience, and my friends as well.

Review603.Review: Excellent food, creative takes on traditional Chinese fare.  Prompt service. Great value.

Review604.Review: No service, greasy food and lackluster presentation. There were 2 decent dishes, the rest was terrible

Review605.Review: The food was good however the service was lacking. The dinner ware's cleanliness was also questionable.

Review606.Review: We only reserved a table at FANG because China Live and Harborview were booked at the 6PM time slot we were looking for. We had eaten at FANG in the past (pre-pandemic) and the food and service was fine back then. On this occasion, getting service was difficult and took longer than it should have been. We ordered the "famous" Peking buns (with duck), pan fried shrimp dumplings, spicy crunchy cucumbers, crispy honey chili shortrib, crispy salt and pepper fish and the house special fried rice (served table side). Our favorite dish was the pan fried shrimp dumplings. The table side special house fried rice looks better than it tastes and the presentation and portion sizes of the other dishes was not worth the price paid. The next time I have a craving for Chinese food at the last minute, Panda Express at Westfield SF will be the place to go.

Review607.Review: Food was very good and at our table quickly However the dishes did not come out at the same time.  The owner took the order and checked on us several times.  But the wait staff was not attentive.  We had to flag down staff for drinks.

Review608.Review: Love it!All of my favorite House of Nanking specialities while being able to make a reservation and not stand on the street waiting for a table…. (Don’t get me wrong- I’d still stand on the street and wait for this delicious food if I had to!)Will be back!

Review609.Review: Probably ordered wrong. Shrimp buns were excellent, but the tails were left on. Mustard sauce belongs on hotdogs not over fried potstickers. Left disappointed.

Review610.Review: The food here is good, BUT, the service is not! If you must eat here I suggest take out. The servers talk to you once. They don’t check on you or ask if you want anything else. The house special fried rice did not come to our table until after we ate all other dishes. Then the table side cook left before the eggs were set and we had to finish cooking the rice. We had been trying to get someone’s attention because there was a plate we ordered we never received. They will not make eye contact with you after you are served.  The check was literally dropped at the table and the waiter just kept going. We pointed out that we never received a plate we were charged for and they immediately turned around and produced the plate. They asked if we still wanted it and we declined. I get that they are busy but this was really bad service. They clearly want you in and out. I tried to reach out to management on social media. They commented that they wanted to hear about my experience, publicly, but never responded to my dm. There’s plenty of other Chinese restaurants in SF. It’s not that special. I’d never go again.

Review611.Review: I’m not a restaurant critic, but I kind of am. Fang was great! Best meal I’ve had in a long time. Beef with Broccoli, tofu cauliflower, dumplings with eggplant, steamed fish, fried rice..all great. Service was excellent.

Review612.Review: I went here on Christmas Day. It was busy so I was glad I had a reservation. The food here is absolutely outstanding. My son and I both said it was one of the best meals we have ever eaten. There are lots of vegetarian options. I recommend the vegetarian wonton soup, the charred broccoli, and the sesame tofu.

Review613.Review: Didn’t want to cook Christmas day. So yummy.

Review614.Review: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous! The food is tasty, served hot from the kitchen. We experienced a symphony of tastes. The depth of the flavors was amazing. We enjoyed beef, fish, chicken and shrimp entrees. The wonton soup was delightful and the fried rice was finished at the table. The owner selected the menu items for us. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Review615.Review: We had a lovely Christmas celebration. The owner selected our food for us and selected great dishes for both the meat eaters and vegans in our party. Happy with the food, drinks, and service. Everyone was so friendly and we’ll definitely go back soon!

Review616.Review: Had a fabulous meal at Fang for Christmas lunch.  The Chef/Owner welcomed us himself.  He took care of ordering for us so every dish was a surprise.  Every dish was delicious.  Our favorites were the pork bun, Potstickers and a Shrimp and Broccoli dish in Curry sauce.  Wonderful service and food!

Review617.Review: Amazing food. Chinese restaurant level of service. They only had downstairs open which was not as aesthetically pleasing as photos on OpenTable. Also the lack of air circulation can be concerning. But have to agree with Marc sales force Benioff, best Chinese food in the city.

Review619.Review: Got very busy right when we arrived. We had a reservation but it took about 20 minutes to seat us.  Ground floor was packed. Owner opened the basement section and host gave us menus. We were looking at the menu when the cheery elder owner greeted us, cheerfully took away our menus and said basically, don’t worry I’ll take care of you. We reluctantly complied as we were caught off guard by the offer. He sent out an appetizer (sticky buns), wonton soup, orange chicken, broccoli beef, a shrimp entree, and dessert. I asked also for sticky ribs, as that’s what my son wanted, and he is a picky eater. Bill came to $300 for 4. Food was excellent, service good. I would not allow the owner/chef to do this again. I think he did it as they were very busy and if the 3 separate basement parties ate the same thing, it would expedite service. Again, all very tasty, but way too much food, and we didn’t all get what we would have really wanted.

Review620.Review: Super busy restaurant and packed to the brim. We were ignored by the servers for a good 15 minutes until one of the owners came by to take down our order. The fastest interaction we had was when they gave us the check and swiped our card. Food was only okay. I wouldn’t go again.

Review621.Review: The food and service is fantastic.Let them order for you based on your preferences and you will not be disappointed.

Review623.Review: We went at 1:30 on a Sunday, they close at 2. There were a few people finishing their lunch. We had to wait for a while before someone came to take our order, we had our 2 toddlers with us. The lady serving us didn't seem too interested. First she got one of the dishes we ordered for the kids wrong. Then the food was coming out in like 5-10 mins after we ordered it. The food was bland and not much taste at all. It seemed like they just wanted us to get out of there. Very disappointing

Review624.Review: They need to improve their service when arriving and getting drink orders served more quickly.  We had a 5:30 reservation and they seemed very unorganized.

Review625.Review: We had a wonderful dinner.  We allow the owner to select our dishes which was fun and we loved every item!  Memorable dining experience, quality ingredients, and wonderful food = we will definitely be back!

Review626.Review: Expensive for me but my dish was very plentiful and delicious . Enough of my dish  to take home for leftovers. Service was not served with a smile and inconsistent. Tang was busy as it was lunch time on a Friday so noise level loud.

Review627.Review: My choice of Fang as the end of the year, “Thank You” lunch for my work team was a happy accident. I chose the restaurant because of location. It is very close to SF MoMA which was where we were going right after lunch. The staff at Fang were very professional and accommodating, and the food was fantastic! I look forward to dining there again soon.

Review628.Review: Great food and awesome to speak to Kathy!

Review629.Review: Hot and sour soup was the best I’ve ever had. Our fish dish was perfectly prepared with generous portions.

Review630.Review: Food was innovative & deliciousRestaurant is very noisy but we had a corner table which was quiet.We can’t wait to go back

Review631.Review: Amazing food. Trusted chef with choices and couldn’t be happier with the food and experience. Will come again soon!

Review632.Review: We lived in China for 9 years and found this restaurant to be authentic with a modern twist.  We’ll definitely be back!

Review633.Review: The short rib was excellent.  The also offer a sampler meal that provides small bites of the popular items from the menu for tasting, which is a great way to try all the dishes.

Review634.Review: I go every time in san fran.  The food is phenomenal.

Review635.Review: Food was good. Waitress was awful. Very rude & obviously did not want to be there.  Threw the menus at us & then served beer w no glass.  Had to ask several times.She was very unpleasant & unprofessional.Had to send a dish back, raw shrimp.

Review636.Review: I’ve eaten at FANG several times, let the staff choose dishes each time and have always had incredible food.  Top notch and  a “must” place to eat!

Review637.Review: There were 3 of us. We each selected an entree and loved every one. The restaurant has great atmosphere. We will,go back. Awesome!!!

Review638.Review: - the bathroom was disgusting - the service was cold, an rushed - there was particles floating on our water… -the menu had food stains all over them, an felt greasy an oily..Very disappointed…

Review639.Review: Fang was great. The menu is not the kid friendliest(spicy food), but they made the food with the sauce on the side for us to all enjoy. We cant wait to go back!!

Review640.Review: Able to accommodate 14 people on short notice!  WOW.

Review642.Review: Best Chinese food in the city.  Ask the server to bring you their best dishes, the staff knows all the best items.

Review643.Review: This was one of the best team dinners! Not only was the food phenomenal, but the staff and ownership took it to the next level of excellence! We will definitely come back!!

Review644.Review: Honey apple prawn has way too much sauce, overpowers the food. Very heavy

Review646.Review: Food was delicious but some dishes were saltier than others.

Review647.Review: We love Chinese food and were looking forward to a good Szechuan meal. The chef approached our table and suggested strongly that he would decide what to bring us. We somewhat reluctantly agreed- our only comments were that we didn't like sweet food and that we liked Chinese green beans. We never saw him again. Good soup, but absolutely everything else that was served including green beans, a fried shrimp dumpling, clams with noodles and a cauliflower/beef dish were overwhelmingly sweet and under-spiced. We should have made our own selections, but I'm not sure that the kitchen makes anything not doused in sugar. I loved my tea, it was beautifully presented, and we had a good crispy rice soup, but don't waste your money or an evening out at this tourist trap. We all left hungry and disappointed. There are a hundred better options in this city.

Review648.Review: We had a great time and the kids loved the food but my wife and I thought it was overly greasy and oddly enough, too much dairy in the soup.  The food did not sit well either.

Review649.Review: first time visitor. they gestured us to a table but didn’t check for a reservation (we had one). Wondered what would’ve happened if it had been full? Anyway, hot and sour soup was awesome, delicious dumplings with cabbage, yummy pickled radish. Would definitely return and recommend.

Review651.Review: Great authentic food and experience. The server was a bit abrupt and interrupted conversation rather brashly. She even stepped in between two people at our table having a conversation more than once. Other than that, the food was delicious and the service otherwise was attentive.

Review652.Review: inventive Chinese Cooking, at it's best.  Definitely top tier.

Review653.Review: Really enjoyable food. It's certainly Chinese food made for the non-Chinese mouth, but it's tasty. The plates used are large, which makes it a bit complex to use a small table.

Review654.Review: The broccoli, my gosh. Best thing I’ve ever eaten. I got the fried rice & it was also delicious. Had a great cocktail too.

Review655.Review: Top tier Chinese food. Every enjoyed their meals.

Review656.Review: I used to live near House of Nanking in the 1990s and was delighted to eat here after moving away from SF.  I loved the ambiance!  It was fun and casual...what I remember how House of Nanking was.  Food was delicious.  There were only two of us and we ordered way to much! But everything was exceptional. I look forward to returning with my family!

Review657.Review: Hands down the best Asian fusion place I’ve ever been to.

Review658.Review: Wow! Experience was flawless and food was incredible. We sat down, waiter asked us if we've ever been and if there is anything we don't eat, and food just started showing up. Flavors and textures were both authentic and fun. The best part was the bill at the end was delightfully reasonable for upscale Chinese.

Review659.Review: Stumbled upon FANG during a trip to San Francisco. The food was some of the best I’ve ever had - the seasoned fried rice presentation was unique. Fresh scrambled eggs are poured on a sizzling skillet with a fried rice dome. As the egg cooks, it is mixed in gently with the rice- creating a creamy multi-textured delight. The staff was incredibly friendly, and we met owner Peter Fang, who we then learned was TV famous in the culinary world. The ambience is cozy, business casual, with a steady hum of comforting kitchen noises and clouds of steam rising from the  freshly cooked food. Try the Crisp Honey Chili Short Ribs.

Review660.Review: My friend loved House of Nanking many years ago.  It was special for us to dine at Fang and enjoy the next generation of this family’s efforts to present excellent Chinese food.  It was a real treat and we enjoyed it greatly!

Review661.Review: The owner came out and gave us a surprise course!

Review662.Review: Great value for money, tasty menu, not the most flexible kitchen for moderation requests.

Review664.Review: Wonderful! The service and food were absolutely amazing.

Review666.Review: 全体的に全てが雑。皿を下げる時、残った汁を新しい料理に垂らしたりあり得ない事が沢山あった。

Review668.Review: The food was plentiful and delicious. Service was very disappointing.  I had to ask three times to check me in via open table. I had to ask for water and I waited for my order to be taken.  The entrees were delivered two minutes after my appetizer and when I asked for one of the entrees to be taken back to the kitchen to be kept warm and pointed out that my appetizer had just arrived, I was given a sharp look with no apology.  When I asked for more water, I was greeted with "attitude".  When the waiter delivered the check I had to ask to have all the clearly finished plates and serving bowls removed.  I specified that it was my birthday lunch-not even an offer of a fortune cookie.  Over $100 for lunch served with attitude-no thanks.

Review669.Review: Chef Fang is a genius. The food was incredibly flavorful, fresh, and each dish was even more impressive than the last. Presentation on point, and the service was fast, kind and no details forgotten. New favorite place in SF for sure! Don’t sleep on FANG!

Review670.Review: I love FANG.  I think it has among the best Chinese cuisine in the United States!

Review671.Review: Fang food is AMAZING!!! Plain and simple…. Everything they make is wonderful

Review672.Review: The Famous Nanking Sesame Chicken, Fang’s Crispy Honey Chili Shortrib, and House Special Fried Rice were amazing! I’m still dreaming of the shortrib dish…

Review673.Review: Exceptional cuisine! Reasonably priced, excellent service

Review674.Review: Too loud, food good; dumplings had sauce already on them, which was a mustard base. Better on the side since not everyone likes mustard. Been to lots of Chinese restaurants all over the country including San Francisco, and never had dumplings with sauce poured over them. Entrees we’re delicious (Szechuan chicken and a shrimp/charred broccoli entree). Lots of food.

Review675.Review: Chefs special meal was excellent for lunch with extra to take home and at a reasonable price!

Review676.Review: In town for a getaway, picked Fang because of reviews and reputation of the owner chef. Restaurant was average busy so we were able to get table right away, decor was very nice and had a nice vibe about it. Staff was attentive at first but service declined as night went along, because were sat in a corner and felt ignored mostly.. food was ok and fast, but expected better because of reviews, timing of meals were terrible as our main dishes came out right away but without the star of the order which was the signature fried rice, did not show up till we were almost finished like it was forgotten..really felt like they are just trying to get you in and get you out? Overall, average experience, but perhaps it was a off night for the kitchen & waitress, sadly since we were in from out of town, we only got one crack at trying it..

Review677.Review: Food was decent despite the waitress getting our order wrong. We had a reservation for 8:15 and were rushed through the entire process. When we tried to get appetizers and drinks we were told that the kitchen was closing and it was last call for orders despite the fact that we just sat down. I wish the place would have limited the options for the  reservation so we could have gone to a restaurant where we could enjoy the experience and take our time. The main dish arrived along with the appetizer. The staff was slamming buckets and clearing tables to clean up and close down the restaurant within 15 min of us arriving. It made for a disappointing experience

Review678.Review: The staff recommended that they bring our table some of their most popular dishes. It was perfect. The food was SO flavorful. Recommended this one.

Review680.Review: Always a great meal.  Everyone enjoyed and I highly recommend!

Review681.Review: The owner and staff are charismatic, warm, and welcoming. We had the pleasure to be seated by the owner, who then offered an impromptu tasting/chefs table offering for our lunch. The food was heavenly., and a much needed treat during Dreamforce convention. Can’t wait to go back.

Review683.Review: The food was outstanding! Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious. The vegetables were abundant and excellent in each fish.So glad we found this restaurant!

Review684.Review: Very very good Chinese food! All of your favorite take homes are on the menu and they are of top chef quality! Interior of restaurant might throw you off but disregard that it’s part of the charm. Agree that in the heat of the summer it might be warm but not really a problem at all. Highly recommend if you want to sit down or take out in San Fran.

Review686.Review: We were surprised when the owner came to our table and said he would choose our dinners, and a little nervous as some of us are slightly picky eaters.  But we decided to roll with the adventure and my oh my the food was absolutely delicious! Our only complaint is we ran out of stomach capacity and weren't able to finish all the food!

Review687.Review: Great experience and so appreciate the birthday treat!!

Review688.Review: Menu was wildly out of date, and when we showed up, none of the items we sought were currently on the menu, so we left.If you're looking to eat anything somewhat resembling Chinese food, this place could be good. If you want dim sum, or any particular dish, don't rely upon the published menu on their own site.

Review689.Review: The inside did not look like the pictures. The menu was incorrect on the opentable .The prices on the menu for higher than on the website.When we told them about it they said That the prices were changed a month ago and didn’t update their website with you. So we decided to leave.

Review690.Review: Kathy Fang personally chose the perfect dinner for us in celebration of our 50th anniversary. The food was fabulous and we felt like we were dining with family. If we lived on the west coast, FANG would become a regular food destination!!!

Review691.Review: We came to town for anniversary weekend.  We had been to Fang on our last visit to San Fransisco and had an amazing meal.  The food does not disappoint, amazing as we remembered.  The service was not so good this time, never refilled water and never asked if we wanted a second cocktail.  We sat for probably 20 min after finishing meal with no water, no offer for a second drink, not even the  bill to rush us out.  Just nothing…..

Review693.Review: Food was great.  There was so much smoke in the air everyone was coughing.  The noise level was also very high.  It was also very hot in the restaurant. Had to wait about 10 minutes for our reservation.

Review694.Review: Food was great but it was HOT in the restaurant making the dining experience very unpleasant.

Review695.Review: Great food! Amazing service! This place is such a gem

Review696.Review: Staff was very attentive and fast.  Family style dinning was great and the table side fried rice was delicious.

Review697.Review: I love the food in person at Fang. Due to Covid I ate via door dash and not nearly as good. Probably not the restaurant’s fault. Travel time worsens all food I suspect. As good as the food is in person at Fang I often dread going there due to the blatantly unfriendly staff. As a group they are horrible. I believe it must come from the top. Very sad. There are many equally delicious restaurants in SF where you can can actually enjoy the whole experience. Seek them out and avoid Fang.

Review699.Review: Always a delight to go here.  Cathy and the staff are outstanding.  Let them choose the menu.  Had a great vegan dinner.  Will be back soon.

Review700.Review: Fang is always a great experience. The food is delicious and if Peter Fang shows up to your table and asks you to trust him, do yourself a favor and open up your mind and say yes. It’s a great way to try things you normally would not. This is always our first stop for dinner when we come to San Francisco.

Review701.Review: Every course was delicious, especially the steamed buns appetizer - one of my favorite dishes in all of SF... truly a classic!

Review702.Review: Pretty standard Chinese fare.  It’s a nice looking place and the service is good.  Was somehow expecting a more elevated dining experience tho.  Pretty standard quality of food.  We had the Pork potstickers in mustard sauce.  Tasted old and hard on the outside - not good.  Sesame Chicken with sweet potatoes which was too goopy and sweet.  Fried rice which was prepared at the table - just not good.  Sorry to say but the side of Sautéed green beans were the best thing we had!  Overall not impressive - just average.

Review703.Review: College kids home, a bit of a reunion.

Review704.Review: I saw Chef Fang on Beat Bobby Flay and she won! When I saw that days before our trip to San Francisco I immediately made a reservation.  It was a great experience!

Review705.Review: Everything we ordered was delicious..The hot and sour soup, the sizzling rice, and all the other choices we made. I will return when I’m in San Francisco again. I will tell my friends and relatives in San Francisco about the delicious food that you serve.

Review706.Review: Abrupt server. Abruptly walked away when we politely said we weren’t ready to order. Served me a warm beer. I had to ask for a glass. When I complained (nicely) about the warm beer, she grabbed it and poured it into a plate on the next table. She did bring me a colder beer with a frosted glass.

Review707.Review: The servers took long and when they’re waiting for the orders to come out, you can hear them talking loudly. When our orders came in and there was no room, instead of taking away the empty dishes, they put it on top of an empty one. The food is good though but feel that for the price, the service could be better.

Review709.Review: My daughters and I were visiting and wanted to try this restaurant. It was absolutely amazing. Service was incredible and the food was awesome. Definitely recommend.

Review710.Review: Food came out quickly and is great value!

Review711.Review: We love Fang’s. The most creative food. Such attentive and excellent service. And a really festive atmosphere! The wine pours are generous and there is always great leftovers to take home!

Review712.Review: Food was excellent and came out very quickly. Service was just okay and the atmosphere was just okay too. I would definitely go back though because the food was amazing!

Review713.Review: We were a group of eight and the experience was great.  The food was outstanding and the service could not have been better.

Review714.Review: Good food good ambiance! Didn’t like coming I. To dishes on tables left from lunch???

Review715.Review: Great menu, amazingly quick service, lovely food

Review717.Review: Excellent food! The mustard greens & pork dumplings are a must try!

Review718.Review: Excellent and abundant amount of food.

Review719.Review: The wait staff were incredibly polite and accommodating. The food was served in a timely manner. The presentation, temperature, and taste of the food was delicious.

Review720.Review: Delicious food, helpful staff & charming, well worth hunting this gem out.

Review722.Review: great House of Nanking food but in a quiet, well run dining room.delightful for 2, but amazing for a group if you let the owner order for the table!

Review723.Review: I am wary of the high reviews for this restaurant. Although the staff was very attentive, the food left much to be desired. We started with the panfried shrimp wonton. The baby bay shrimp inside, mediocre taste, and floppy texture reminded us of the samples at Costco. Still hopeful that this restaurant would prove itself worthy of the excellent reviews on Open Table, we ordered the "highly recommended" (per the menu) house fried rice cooked tableside. If you are expecting a show like one you would get at that popular teppan grill chain, you will be sorely disappointed. You will be even more disappointed by the taste and texture of this dish. We each had a small portion and could not eat any more of it. The aftertaste was worse than the initial bites. Not confident that this restaurant could redeem itself, we cut our losses, paid the bill, and went down the street to enjoy a nice Italian meal. If you are looking for tasty Chinese food, I suggest you head to Chinatown and avoid FANG.

Review724.Review: My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed the food.  We especially enjoyed the pan-fried shrimp wontons and house fried rice (which is prepared at the table).  The pork steamed buns and salt & pepper shrimp with zucchini were also excellent. Plan on sharing each serving.  We ordered each serving as we completed the previous course.  Other tables ordered all items immediately and it appeared to be overwhelming when all courses arrived at the same time.  The ambiance is more industrial and casual rather than fine dining.  Tables are set with linen.Service is prompt but abrupt.  We had an issue with a serving and the item was removed from our check without hesitation. We dined early Sunday night but as the evening progressed the restaurant became very busy.  Reservations are highly recommended.Our only criticism - the beer was warm.

Review725.Review: I thought the food was fine, but somewhat on the bland side and not very exciting.It wasn't that it tasted bad, but more just uninspired.The type of place that if I was a at Moscone conference with people that are hesitant about ethnic foods, this would be a safe place to go too.A little on the pricey side for Asian food.

Review726.Review: This place is unreal. Could eat here every night.

Review727.Review: This place doesn't honor reservations.  We showed up for our reservation on time and the place was packed with no large open table in sight, which was fine.  I understand that the speed of service can depend on the speed of dinners and many of the tables just weren't moving.  Plus they were filming something for the Food Network so it was especially packed b/c of the cameras and crew.  But we were happy to wait it out and understood that there would be a delay.  The wait time really wasn't the issue.  The real issue is that after they finally sat us, an the older gentleman (I believe the father of the chef) came over and told us that we had to get up b/c another group claimed to be before us.  The make up of our group was very diverse.  The make up of the other group was all male and mostly white.  At on point the gentleman said "I have to move you b/c they are complaining" to which I responded "So you'd rather us complain than them? We're also customers and it is 30+ minutes past our reservation time." But he didn't care and we still had to get up from the table.  As we we're getting up from the table, the diners at the table next to us told us that the quality of the food isn't worth it and encouraged us to go elsewhere.  I was livid and didn't want to remain in the restaurant but my team was hungry and on a time crunch so they talked me into staying.  We ended up splitting up our group and dining at two smaller tables and I have to say, aside from the Mongolian Beef Shortribs Wok Tossed with Cabbage etc., the food was very underwhelming.  Plus, while we were finishing up, a delivery came through the restaurant and I could see on the boxes that they were dropping off a lot of premade frozen items like dumplings, eggrolls, etc. The pricing of the food is fair for what you get but nothing about this place was worth the terrible service that we received.

Review729.Review: The food was excellent, flavors nuanced, and the servings were generous. The best ever fried rice cooked at the table—fun and delicious. All variations on the pork belly were well rendered and superbly flavorful.

Review730.Review: We were in town for a few fun days in the sun and decided to try out Fang.  It did not disappoint, in fact, the experience was memorable.  The flavors melded well together and service was impeccable.  Will definitely come back next time in town.

Review731.Review: The food was amazing.  So good.  And they allowed us to sit for 2.5 hours.  We loved it.  💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖

Review732.Review: They brought in trash cans through the restaurant while we were eating.  We ordered 4 things are each was worse than the one before.  Really bummed about the whole experience

Review733.Review: The food was tasty. Overall I'd say this is a great spot, great value as well.

Review734.Review: Not your neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Delicious, inventive Chinese food served on white tablecloths. Not inexpensive but portions are huge so easily shared. Highly recommended.

Review735.Review: This was an outstanding restaurant.  Each dish was better than the last. Great service too!

Review736.Review: Open table allowed us to make a reservation for 8.15pm when restaurant closes at 8.30! Thankfully I noticed the timings after on the website and called to check.

Review737.Review: Best Chinese food i've had in a long time.  Service was also exceptional - we didn't even have to order, they did everything for us!

Review738.Review: The best food ever amazing unique dishes all have their distinct taste and flavor staff wonderful must get the fried rice table side

Review739.Review: Having read some of the reviews prior to dining at Fangs,  I was really disappointed in our experience. We thought our food was pretty mediocre and overcooked.   Upon arrival, we decided to use the bathrooms before we sat down.   The bathrooms  were filthy, especially the toilet seats. Both men and women in our group returned to the table and commented on the foul bathroom conditions. One person in our group postponed using the bathroom because of the squalid conditions.  The waiter person took our order promptly and brought us our food, but never checked back with us to ask if we needed anything.We ordered 2 entrees to share: Ginger chicken and the Sesame chicken .  The portion size was extremely generous.   Each order could have fed 4 people. But the chicken in both dishes were badly overcooked.  The vegetables in both entree dishes were very tasty. In addition to our 2 entree orders and white rice, we  ordered spring rolls.  The vegetarian spring rolls were quite enjoyable. The booths near the kitchen offered us some relief from the noise.Given the overall experience, we don't plan to return

Review740.Review: The chef picked our meal and it was fabulous

Review741.Review: Mongolian beef had a strange powdery texture. Soup was excellent, but the other dishes not worth it. First time to be disappointed by OT.

Review742.Review: Food is beautifully prepared and very elegant. Great value, particularly for the neighborhood.

Review743.Review: We had lunch for the first time at Fang. Dinner is more relaxed and quiet. The food was excellent, as usual. We love the fried rice snd their signature dish of chicken and sweet potato. The Fang sister was serving us. Lovely people and food.

Review744.Review: This place is totally different than it looks online. The outside windows and doors were boarded up and padlocked making it appear that it’s been shut down. About 5 min before they opened they took the boards down and inside was chaotic. Dark, cluttered, and dusty! We decided to give the place the benefit of the doubt bc the reviews of food were good. Food was just ok. Experience overall was surprising and didn’t meet expectations.

Review745.Review: Maybe it's a covid thing but we are constantly surprised at how early kitchens close these days.  We had a family dinner arranged for 7:30PM on a Saturday night and were excited that we could get a reservation for 6 people. We were anticipating being able to eat, talk, eat some more and generally socialize. The food came quickly - extremely quickly  - and all of a sudden they were boarding up the windows and telling us that kitchen was closing.Perhaps if we had started dinner at 6:30 we would have felt less rushed but as it was, we enjoyed the food but did not have a nice relaxing dinner experience.

Review746.Review: Employees were yelling at each other and it took a while for someone to take our orders with only two other guests in the restaurant at that time.

Review747.Review: I love going to Fang whenever I'm in San Francisco.  We just let them order the food for us and it's always great.  Each dish is different and delicious.  The service is always on top of things, as we finish one dish another one comes to the table.  Great for large crowds or a date night.  One of my favorites in the city.

Review748.Review: The best fried rice I have ever had

Review749.Review: Great food- so many great dishes.  Very tasty.   Will go there again!

Review750.Review: Incredible service, highly recommended for family gatherings.

Review751.Review: Really bad experience on just getting seated… the rest was meh…

Review752.Review: Fang has wonderful food.  Last night was relatively uncrowded and quiet, so the atmosphere was nice too.  But like most San Francisco restaurants, they are short-staffed, so service was slow.  In fact we intended to place a take-out order midway through our sitdown meal, but we didn't see a waiter or waitress again until we were finished eating and ready for our check.  This was only a minor annoyance - we enjoyed the evening, and will definitely be back.

Review753.Review: It is not open anymore! The building was boarded up and closed. Disappointed is an understatement.

Review754.Review: The shrimp dumpling appetizer was decent. The short ribs, sizzling fried rice, and wonton soup were inedible.

Review755.Review: Don’t order. Tell the chef what your dietary restrictions are, then sit back and enjoy the meal.

Review756.Review: Lived in SF pre-pandemic for years and am intown visiting. I wanted to give my business to an"authentic" SF spot. Underwhelming is beinggenerous when I describe our dinner date at Fangthis evening. We were served a warm Sapporo,scraps of cold sesame chicken (basically just thesmall fried breading pieces), and cold and dryMongolian beef with barely any sauce. We werebasically shoved out the door at 8:29p. Theyturned off the music, turned on bright lights nearus & turned off all of the lights in the kitchen,boarded up all of the outer windows and moppedthe floor starting at 8:15 - while we (and two othersmall tables) dined. The couple closest to us wasovercharged and had to get their bill corrected.Some of the staff had their to-go bags of food,their coats on, and stood and watched/waited forus to finish eating/leave. It was extremelyawkward. We were there a total of 35 minutesand spent/wasted $100.00. Poor food, poorambiance - poor everything. We will not return.

Review757.Review: Just about everything about this meal was a disappointment - I recommend you look elsewhere. The only “good” thing about this meal were the appetizers, but they were average at best. Even the wine was barely palatable. The big let down, though, was the mains. They were bland as anything - a piece of cardboard has more flavor. The textures were…unpleasant. And the quality of the meats seemed to be low. The service was fine, not great. We asked for water several times, but it never came. They saw that we barely touched one of our mains (the sizzling rice that has a “highly recommended” label next to it - it was awful, don’t get it) and removed it from the bill, which was nice of them. But beyond that, we felt like we were an inconvenience to the staff, despite keeping to ourselves, and other than asking for water, having limited interaction with the team. We arrived starving. We left still starving. We will never return.

Review758.Review: Food was outstanding as always. Service continues to be an issue. Indifferent and uninterested. Getting drinks was a challenge. Hope they can take care of that. If not, will consider other options. There are plenty.

Review759.Review: I had a 2pm reservation on Sunday afternoon.My train into San Fran ran a bit late - I called the restaurant at 1:50 and was told to hurry.I arrived at the restaurant at 2:10 - the door was locked and kitchen was closed for the day.Please don’t accept 2:00 reservations w this policy.

Review760.Review: Extraordinarily good food every time. Lovely staff. Great service. Great ambience.  And the food presentation is also pretty. And some dished get made tableside for an added bit of entertainment. Great for special occasions, although you may want to go much more often than that!They do currently check vaccination status.Be aware that like most businesses  in the area nowadays, they must board over the storefront windows overnight. So if you go by outside or business hours and it looks boarded up, don't panic!  It really is still open!

Review761.Review: Great food , a little noisy, and the seating was too crowded.

Review762.Review: As we reviewed the menu, the chef came out and asked if we trust him?…He proceeded to pick foods for our dinner.  Other than the pork bun appetizer, the food was disappointing.  What he ordered for us ended up being $90 with tax and tip.  The disappointing service matched the food offering, a poor value, and we will not be returning.

Review763.Review: Very tasty dishes, well presented, and inventive updates to traditional Chinese dishes.

Review764.Review: The food was delicious.   Different from standard SF Cantonese (Chef Fang also owns House of Nanking), nice spicy heat, well cooked on hot woks, good ingredients.   Worth going for the food alone.  The decor is modern Asian and atmospherically lit.  The restaurant is ... or can be ... an experience.  Chef Fang took our order, as he will from time to time, and he can be imposing.  He rejected one of our choices by saying "that's the worst dish I ever made" and really who can argue with the chef.  There was one unexpected change of protein from our negotiated order, chef's choice I guess.   He sat at a large table next to us by himself directing traffic in Chinese, being bowed at by every server, very much in charge.   But the service was bedlam!  Maybe it was a makeshift staff due to Chinese New Year but every runner was yelling at the cooks in Chinese, arguing with each other, sorting things out, bustling around.   There was no actual server for our table, we just flagged people down.   The dishes came out when they were ready over 20 or 30 minutes according to some obscure priority, meaning an appetizer came out last, a side dish first, you just take them as they come.  My Chilean mother-in-law loved the family-owned feel and "authenticity" and I think had a crush on Chef Fang, he's a striking older man and strong personality, and she went up to the counter to thank him when we were done in a gracious old-world exchange.   We had fun in an after-the-parade atmosphere but it was definitely not a quiet date night!

Review766.Review: The food was wonderful. The Mongolian beef ribs were melt in your mouth tender. I’ll be back every time we are in SanFrancisco.

Review767.Review: FANG is one San Francisco's best treasures. For a city known for it extraordinary food options, FANG stands among the best of the best.The secret to both FANG and The House of Nanking (same owner extremely similar menus) is to go with an open mind and allow Peter (owner chef) to decide what you'll eat. Forgo the menu. Simply ask for the staff to decide. They'll ask you about your food preferences, allergies, hunger level, etc. and soon there will be some of the most scrumptious food on your table.

Review768.Review: The best Chinese Restaurant I've been to, honestly. Walking distance from MOMA and great value. I loved the tofu coconut soup & sesame chicken with sweet potato. Really fantastically fast service as well.

Review769.Review: Our team outing after a long time was made memorable by the FANG team. At the entrance we were asked for our vaccine proof, seated at a good distance from everyone and owner himself makes sure that you having a good time and food. Father Daughter duo is awesome. Highly recommend people to visit.

Review770.Review: LOVE this place. Such inventive but classic Chinese cooking and cool vibe with great sake list. Chef Kathy Fang is an awesome celeb chef and this place is the best.

Review771.Review: Amazing experience. Wonderful food. We will be back.

Review772.Review: The waitress was not pleasant. Food was ok. The restaurant was really busy.

Review773.Review: We let the owner pick the menu after telling him our preferences (vegan etc. ) and the food was delicious.  Would have liked some greens, though.

Review774.Review: We were underwhelmed by the food, the customer service, and the prices. The customer service in particular was horrible on the day we went. The wait stuff was rude – I say staff because it was not just one person – and inattentive to our needs. The food was also surprisingly off the mark. I’ve been here before and the food is usually better. But on this occasion the food was delivered within two minutes after placing the order indicating that it was already premade. The spareribs were terrible. It wasn’t good. Lastly the prices just didn’t warrant the experience.

Review775.Review: Visited Fang and noticed that were very conscience of the new Covid California rules and practiced disinfecting & cleanliness from the beginning.  The food is phenomenal, staff is extremely professional & friendly ( also remembering me and my guest from previous visits), and provided a great dining environment for us and other guest in the restaurant. I would recommend Fangs to both locals and visitors alike.

Review776.Review: Fit the bill. Only complaint, a 22 oz beer for $13 is a little steep, even in the high rent district of SoMa.

Review777.Review: Il riso fritto (consigliato dal menu) si può evitare...

Review778.Review: One of the best Chinese restaurants. The food was great and portions were amazing. Definitely coming back again.

Review779.Review: Delicious dinner! We were  staying at the Intercontinental Hotel and looked for a unique restaurant within close walking distance. We were seated promptly in the downstairs dining area and ordered a glass of wine. Our server was very helpful in guiding our selections based on what we said we enjoy (spicy, crunchy, unique to Fang). We started with the PanFried Shrimp Wontons (6); little bit of spice, large shrimp in a wonton wrapper then lightly fried with sauce. For dinner, HB ordered Spicy Twice Cooked Melt in your Mouth Pork Belly - large pieces of pork with cooked cabbage. I ordered the Spicy Chili  Oil  Fish Filet with mustard greens (really spinach), which was several pieces of tenderly cooked fish filets in a mildly spicy sauce. We then shared the Stir Fried Szechuan La Fun noodles - creamy goodness (almost Italian) with mushrooms and green onions. All were unique, great suggestions. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Fang!

Review780.Review: Peter the owner is incredible. Very nice staff and delicious entrees.

Review781.Review: Food, as always was excellent. Waited 40 minutes to get our reserved table. Customer Service was not-so-much. Would I go again?  Yes!

Review782.Review: Really deplorable service. We were pushed and pulled around our table, brushing and banging off our chairs. Extremely loud, brash and angry attitudes from the staff. Arguing amongst themselves and blunt service to the customers. .They never asked for anyones Covid vaccination cert. I would never return again even though the food was fine

Review783.Review: The food was fantastic! Especially the shrimp dumplings & the vegetarian steam buns. Everything was delicious!Recommend letting the chef order for you!The chef/owner came over to say hi & offered to plan our meal. He set us up for 2 pescatarians & 2 omnivores, family style. Everyone was happy! Will definitely be going back. Loved it!

Review784.Review: I am a frequent user of Open Table…at least once weekly for business and personal use.  Tonight was by far one of the worst experiences I’ve had and this will be my first ever negative review.  We arrived on time for our 7:45p dinner reservation to find a half full restaurant and a line.  The person at the front of the line was arguing with the hostess as there were at least a dozen tables open that just needed to be bussed…they had been waiting for 45minutes on their reservations.  There appeared to be an older woman who would slowly clear a table, hand wash the dishes and put them back in service.  Once we got to the front of the line (15 minutes after our reservation time), they walked us past several dirty tables and tried to seat us in the back, next to the store room entrance with two tables that had piles of dirty dishes on either side of us.  We walked out…and will never return. Food might be good, but there was no way my family and I would eat in that environment.

Review785.Review: The service was a little slow to start but once we finally ordered things happened quickly. Food was great. Totally enjoyed the meal

Review786.Review: Good hot and sour soup!  Also enjoyed egg rolls.  Had chicken and broccoli in black bean sauce.  Also very good!

Review787.Review: Food was excellent.  The service was okay but the restaurant had several large parties which monopolized of servers’ time.  Food arrived quickly and hot.

Review788.Review: Made a 2 pm reservation through Opentable, walked up at 2 on the dot and the door was locked, nobody would come talk to us/help us. Ended up having to go elsewhere.

Review789.Review: Great food and service.  Fang never disappoints.

Review790.Review: Outstanding food and service. Thank you for creating your vegetarian wontons!

Review791.Review: Convenient: right around the corner from SF MOMA, so it was high on Open Table’s nearby lunch suggestions. Judging by appearances and staff actions, we questioned the management’s commitment to keeping the place clean. Small space was noisy--could have been cozier. Found the whitefish that we ordered was limper and gamier than expected from other reviews. Great-tasting zucchini with garlic (dried/powdered not fresh), though. Goji green tea in a large glass mug offered a welcome refuge. Otherwise pleasant service staff ignored our party of two for 20 minutes after we had pretty much finished our meal.

Review792.Review: Staff was inattentive, restaurant empty, food mediocre. I ate here before the pandemic and it was fantastic. Not sure what changed, but I wouldn't go again.

Review793.Review: Super rushed, had a reservation for 8:00 and they were cleaning the entire restaurant and rushing us to leave at 8:30. If they close super early then don’t keep a late reservation timing like 8 o’clock. Food came within minutes of ordering and even though it was good, the entire meal was extremely rushed and servers were incredibly rude.

Review794.Review: Great food, server was very kind and helpful. Service was fast and courteous. One of my favorite spots.

Review795.Review: I celebrated my birthday here with a large group and the staff was very accommodating to everyone’s requests. Food was delicious. 10/10

Review796.Review: Met  Chef Kathy. We asked for a chef’s choice meal & it was amazing.

Review797.Review: The food at FANG is excellent!  High quality ingredients and creative presentation. It was such a treat to enjoy a variety of wonderful dishes again with a group of friends.  FANG truly has some of the best Chinese food in the Bay Area (this coming from a former Hong Kong resident) and the prices are incredibly reasonable. Staff are great and make everyone feel like family.

Review798.Review: Incredible food, incredible service, the location was perfect and I cannot wait to return!

Review799.Review: Food was tasty. But the service was slow to start. Took awhile to get menus etc. but once they came to take the order it was very rushed from there,  including the pressure to pay.

Review800.Review: The Fang family rocks!!!!Hugh from alaska!

Review801.Review: Have to say one of my favorite casual yet elegantly delicious restaurants in the city!  Have big party dinners here and you will be delighted with a family meal experience to remember.  Mr. Fang will often host and enjoy sharing his passion for authentic, amazing food at his restaurants!  Thank you FANG for a great dinner!!

Review802.Review: Hands down the best Chinese food ever! We had the chiefs recommendations and everything was delicious. Go here for the food…you won’t be disappointed.

Review804.Review: Our party of 16 was accommodated at a long table which seated us all.  We had very good service and everything was well presented and delicious.  We badly over ordered as some of our party was delayed and ordered without realizing an initial order had been placed!  We've been to Famg before and intend to visit again soon!

Review805.Review: Poor service. Will not come back

Review806.Review: Service was so lacking.  Food was good as usual.  Didn’t feel like staff cared about much.  Normally the service is on point.  These servers were maybe too busy to care.  We saw 2 tables leave during our meal. I like this place a lot and have even done special events here.  Maybe it’s pandemic attitude.  But hope they turn it around. And the one waiter looked like he just rolled out of bed and barely said anything to us and then when food came he just kinda threw it down.  Normally the owner is there greeting.  Today maybe it was his son who didn’t want to be there.  SMH

Review808.Review: Food is great!! So glad they are back open for business! It’s been a long time!

Review809.Review: Loved the food since we got some really personal service from one of the chefs. The food tasted perfect despite our dietary restrictions!

Review810.Review: This place is seriously tired, messy and cluttered. The food is not that good and overpriced for what it was.

Review811.Review: We enjoyed our visit. Potstickers and hot & sour soup were the best! The other items we ordered-fried rice, short ribs, chicken dish were just ok. Super fast and courteous service. Nice ambience.

Review812.Review: Dam good food.   My only complaint was the Spicy Items were not spicy at all.

Review813.Review: I was disappointed with my experience at Fang. I was very excited to dine here originally. I had a reservation for 8:15pm and arrived at 8:23pm and was told we could not have dinner because they had already turned off the cooking equipment for the night. Ultimately reservations should not be taken in such close proximity to closing if the reservation cannot be honored.

Review814.Review: Always take advice from the owner.  This is the second time we did this and everything was excellent once again.

Review815.Review: The food is always good!!! You will not disappointed!

Review816.Review: Food was enjoyable but service and atmosphere bad.  Cleaning table right next to us and dragged out dirty container to put dishes in and then dragged container accross the floor.   Expected much more for a restaurant in the heart of the city.

Review818.Review: Amazing! Food is always so excellent here, love the vibe and the service is top notch!! Highly recommend!!

Review819.Review: I love this restaurant. We ask the chef to give us dishes s/he thinks are great and we offer our restrictions, e.g., 2 vegetarians, 1 person gluten-free - and it works out really well.

Review821.Review: We went with a  party of nine youngest was 7 yrs old ordered almost everything on the menu lol everything was Delish!

Review822.Review: A great stop for post-SFMOMA.  I had the salt-and-pepper shrimp - yum!  He had his favorite, short ribs, though they weren’t as good as usual.  The pieces of meat were kind of small.  I love the menu here - not your typical Chinese food.  The service was a little slow, and their web site needs to be updated because it says they are open continuously from lunch through dinner, but we were rushed out because they closed at 2, and our reservation was at 1:30.  I think the prices went up since the last time we went there - they were kind of high.

Review823.Review: The food was good but as a SF resident wasn't incredibly impressed. They handled a group very well once we sat down, but we did have to wait a long time to be sat despite having a reservation. We had added 2 additional people to our group earlier that day and they asked us to come an hour earlier than the original reservation to accommodate the change. That was fine, but we did have to rush our plans and it was a little annoying to show up earlier just to wait for like 15-20 minutes to sit. On top of that, when I went to check in with someone (no one was at host stand) I let them know we were here but there was no communication, such as "OK we're working on the table..", nothing... and then other customers in line were VERY miffed that I went over to talk to someone, and they were talking crap to me despite my reservation being before theirs. The lack of communication with people in line created a really uncomfortable situation where I the customer was being aggressively spoken to by frustrated customers because I was trying to see what was going on.PS - TO BE CLEAR : our server was amazing and she handled our group AMAZINGLY and was super nice and I am grateful to her! Nothing about our service at the actual table was poor. The only bad experience was the situation leading up to sitting at the table.

Review824.Review: We made a special weekend trip to SF and Fang was the first of the three restaurants we had scheduled.   We booked Fang because of Kathy Fang's fame of being a two-time Chopped Champion that we had seen as foodies on the Food Network.Fang's seemed to be a tired restaurant, with an uninspiring standard Cantonese Chinese menu fare - decor and news-clippings that had seen better days.   The food was good but all the dishes were dropped all at once (hurried Chinese-style) by our waiter who was wearing the House of Nanking T-shirt, whom we knew from the show is Kathy Fang's family restaurant.  I absolutely hate when appetizers and dinner dishes hit the table at the same time - so I'm biased about this kind of service.We got the signature dish of savory meat baos, eggplant and some beef with greens.  As I said, standard Chinese fare, not the creativity of the show at all.  Well cooked yes but standard local neighborhood Chinese food and service -  not Food Network stuff at all.  Disappointing overall but good food only when we were looking for spectacular.

Review825.Review: No existe, llegamos y estaba cerrado , se veían 2 mesa sucias con platos con restos de comida pero el lugar estaba como abandonado muy raro

Review826.Review: Every dish is an experience and a taste adventure. The food is aromatic and delicious.

Review827.Review: Tasty, flavorful food served in a fine dining atmosphere with impeccable service. Not to miss if you like good chinese food.

Review828.Review: Food was all delicious. Service was excellent. Portions were big. We may have over orders. Got wonton soup which was a unique. Wontons and what tasted like a toasted rice in it. Fried rice was made at the table. Did not really taste the pork but was tasty. Shrimp and apples was delicious. My husband got a steak dish with peppers. Even enjoyed my blossoming tea. We enjoyed our meal.

Review829.Review: Beautiful restaurant literally a few steps from Moma.  Great menu with many unique dishes.

Review830.Review: Simply the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten. The owner/chef came to our table of seven out-of-towers and offered to order for us. It was a godsend. Every dish was superb, flavorful, fresh and was served quickly and pleasantly. Don’t miss out on this exquisite restaurant!

Review831.Review: Decent food, service was good.  We had a couple issues with our water glasses being dirty and some requests being missed.  But overall it was good.

Review832.Review: Loved it last time.  Maybe the expectations were too high.  The steamed buns, chicken and shrimp with apples rocked.

Review833.Review: Great food and value!  Will definitely come back.  Service was not overally personable and there were tables with dirty dishes at time of opening but the food makes it worth it.

Review834.Review: Very good services. Food are excellent. Very clean bathrooms. Will definitely come back! It made a perfect day if you are going to SFMOMA and walk a few minutes to Fang.

Review835.Review: Table next to ours was dirty with food dirt from prior customers and was not bussed the entire time; about 2 hours.

Review837.Review: My best advice: let the chef choose your menu. You will be in for a treat.

Review838.Review: Not conventional Chinese food. We left thinking the experience was “interesting.” Waiter went from super rude and abrupt to very nice and helpful when he realized we spoke Chinese also. Very odd experience overall.

Review839.Review: The food was excellent but the service was abrupt. The server didn’t seem interested in spending any time with us  or concerned about our experience. Food was delivered quickly and then we never saw her again. It’s unfortunate that the service doesn’t match the same level as the food.

Review840.Review: The food here is very good. Taste,  portion and quality.  The service is lacking.   Its rushed despite an almost empty restaurant.  If the service could match the quality of the food, this would be outstanding.

Review841.Review: Excellent service and excellent food.  We loved everything we ordered.

Review844.Review: This is a great spot just around the corner from SFMOMA. We had a delightful lunch and then headed to the museum. Very unique flavors, not your typical Chinese. The staff was terrific.

Review845.Review: We were happy group of friends at Fangs for our third visit there.  As before, every dish we ordered was all about flavors and presentation , all outstanding.  In fact, we almost ordered a second round of the pork belly buns, mmmmmm.  The post-Covid menu seems cut down as does the drinks menu, and the “bartender” was no bartender...but did a fine job with anything standard.  Great staff and service, beautiful interiors and a real pleasure when you can chat with either Mr. Fang or his daughter.  Needless to say, we’ll be back.

Review846.Review: 90s vibe Chinese chic with good food

Review847.Review: They didn’t have everything available and honestly the food was not good at all. Completely over priced as well. No one was in there at 6-6:30 on a Friday night.

Review848.Review: This place was completely closed boarded up!  It looked like it had been closed formonths. Can’t imagine why they are in your system.

Review849.Review: Very delicious Chinese food near Mascone Center. Our new favorite in the city.

Review850.Review: Peter wasn’t there….the food wasn’t the same as usual.

Review851.Review: I had been here once pre-pandemic and had a wonderful meal, great service- a really nice experience.  Was happy To see that they were open, though boards covered windows and there were tell-tale signs of the delivery business in view.  I arrived following a party of eight, and was greeted quickly. I mentioned that I had a reservation though the server did not appear to check and simply pointed to and available two top.  So much for any Open Table points!From that point on we received the most basic of rushed services:  menus tossed on the table, carafe of water, and back 5 minutes later waiting for our order.  Items came out quickly, albeit piecemeal.  Spare Ribs and Steamed Buns were outstanding.We were finished for maybe 15 - 20 minutes before our server returned to ask if we wanted a box.  She returned soon after and we waited another 10 minutes for a check.  It is clear they are working hard, and I hope they will be fully staffed soon.  This restaurant demands better service standards than the House of Nanking, and once that issue is resolved, it will be a solid recommendation.  Added bonus to end the evening - seeing Peter Fang check in on guests.  Have always appreciated his attention to this often-overlooked step, and seeing him here is reassuring that the food and experience remain the priority.

Review853.Review: We had the waitress order for us.  She did a great job!  The short ribs and bok choy was outstanding, as was the sizzling fried rice.  I will definitely be back.

Review854.Review: It was very nice, went in the morning so not as busy as it probably gets but the food was awesome, service was great (we were all impressed that the waiter memorized our complicated order) and the prices are super reasonable.

Review856.Review: It was great to go back.

Review857.Review: I love the tea and soup

Review858.Review: I honestly don’t know what happened to Fang.... it was super authentic and was a sweet spot in the city . Today was a total shock to me. All menu updated and all authentic dishes are gone. Waitress are rude and not responsive.
