Review859.Review: We tried the house fried rice, sesame chicken and the schezwuan eggplant. They were all excellent!

Review860.Review: We ate at the House of Nanking two nights ago and thought we would try the sister restaurant. Fang was a joy in every way. We love both but were blown away by the complex flavors an amazing information from Kathy Fang herself.

Review861.Review: We went in and asked for the recommendations (you give your food allergies and preferences) and they bring out multiple dishes. You do not have to choose a specific dish. All the food they bought out was amazing. and the price was very reasonable

Review862.Review: Don't let the ambiance and non-friendly service get in your way of tasting some of the best "fusion" Chinese cuisine. This place is genuinely good. The food is amazing. The chef cooks with heart. If this place actually presented food in a better ambiance, they could charge double the prices and still sell out. All of their meat dishes are deliciously paired with fruits/veggies that perfect complement the flavors. This is a hidden gem in FiDi.

Review863.Review: The very best, freshest, and most carefully prepared Chinese dishes we have had in a long time. Every one of our five dishes, from appetizers to soup to entrees tasted very different and extremely delicate and delicious. The owner helped us choose what to order and took an interest in all the diners. Service was prompt and efficient but not intrusive. Two of us were very well fed for under $100, a good price in San Francisco.

Review864.Review: Beautifully executed.  Delicious array of both standard and less common choices.

Review866.Review: We made an opentable reservation, came on time and were told that there is a wait of 40-45 minutes.

Review867.Review: Fabulous food.  Good staff.   Having to wait 35 minutes despite making a reservation stunk.

Review868.Review: We had a productive meeting and delicious meal. The experience could have been better had the menu for the meal be revealed in advance. There was no query whether any of our attendees had any food allergies or restrictions. Service was slow yet it was busy. Several members of the service staff did not appear to have strong English language skills.

Review869.Review: Really good!  It was more food than I could finish and I will return on my next visit to this city.

Review870.Review: Very bad experience - we waited for our food for > 1hour, only a few dishes arrived with no visibility for the timeline on the next one. Eventually had to cut our losses and leave the place hungryRude dismissive service, we didn't even have a dedicated waiterThe food was very underwhelming tooNever going back

Review871.Review: The food is great. Fang, the owner and chef, asked if we had any food limitations. With none, he took our menus and the surprises started. Every dish was great. I am really surprised we got in, but OpenTable got the reservation and we had a great meal.

Review872.Review: The food here is FANTASTIC, especially for the price. Ambiance is great as well. Service is a little sporadic  but overall, it was a great experience.

Review873.Review: Most dishes are wonderful.  With a group of six, we asked the manager to select dishes.  He listened, two vegetarians,one pescatarian, and delivered a delicious banquet.  I would give Fang 5 stars, but the crispy noodles and vegetables was nice t good, and very different from past visits.  Everyone loves their short ribs, but this time they were dry and shriveled.Breaded shrimp, little bay shrimp in a soy-honey sauce,  buns with portobello mushrooms, crispy and tender- just amazing dishes!I hope Fang checks on their quality and continues serving the delicious dishes they are known for.

Review874.Review: Great Food, A bit overpriced. servers can be a bit more personal

Review875.Review: Owner/chef was amazing. Customized our meal & every dish was soooo tasty. Would definitely recommend.

Review876.Review: Ate here before a Warriors game. Dumplings were delicious and everything was fast. A great night.

Review877.Review: I really love Fang. It's a different take on Chinese, but frankly, a welcome upgrade to traditional Chinese food. I love that Mr. Fang himself is there to make suggestions. It's best to not even look at the menu and leave it up to him. What I love most is it's like going to dinner at someone's home, but while having the nice ambiance of a restaurant. Definitely, this is one of my favorite restaurants in SF. I always bring my out of town guests here!

Review878.Review: We had a great time celebrating Valentine’s Day at Fang. Each dish was so delicious and the service was great. We definitely recommend it for every day dining and special occasions.

Review879.Review: Fang's is a great location for larger groups.  We had over 30 and they kept food coming and made it all easy.  Everything was delicious.

Review880.Review: If Mr Fang comes by and offers to take order for you family style, say yes. Delicious food and experience. The whole table was impressed and ate everything.

Review881.Review: Fantastic food and able to accommodate a large group on short notice.  They simply asked for dietary restrictions and started bring food for the table.  Fang is my favorite place for a group event.

Review882.Review: Restaurant was closed when I arrived for my reservation.

Review883.Review: Excellent SoMa restaurant. Food is always great, ask for a special based on your personal preferences - they always come up with fantastic surprise dish! It's usually busy so reservations are recommended. Great for groups of 5-15 as well - dishes can typically be shared and they have large tables on the lower floor. Service could be faster but overall very decent.

Review884.Review: Always enjoy Fang for lunch with colleagues!

Review885.Review: Great food.  Let The owner order for you

Review887.Review: Mediocre food. Terrible service. Even when we specifically told them to stop bringing our food out so fast (our table was full with three dishes), they still did (brought two more). I mean seriously, how is that supposed to work logistically?

Review888.Review: Nice experience. Friendly staff with food prepared served with care for food allergies

Review889.Review: Fang is one of my favorite restaurants. It is simply amazing. If you haven't been, go. If you have, you'll likely agree with me.

Review890.Review: This is the dirtiest restaurant I’ve ever been to. I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.

Review891.Review: Great place to eat.  Let them make the food selections.

Review892.Review: Very disappointed with rude servers. Hardly knew english. Restaurant was dirty

Review893.Review: Excellent food. The owner Fang did our menu for a party of ten and it was excellent

Review894.Review: Mr Fang took care of us

Review895.Review: The coolest thing about dining at Fang, is that the Chef just asks if you have any food restrictions and you're completely surprised by what comes to the table. We got a great selection of dishes, all of them delicious!

Review896.Review: Mr Fang came out, took our menus and sent a train of food to our table. Amazing food!

Review897.Review: Best Chinese in SF full stop.

Review898.Review: Chinese food for people who think they don’t like Chinese food. Absolutely delicious!

Review899.Review: Terrific food! Love the greeting from the staff. Service wasn’t great (staff seemed bored w questions), and it got really noisy as lunch crowd grew.

Review900.Review: We walked in just for lunch, the four of us. The waitress handed us the menus and we started perusing. At that point, the owner, Peter Fang, came by, introduced himself, and asked us if we had any dietary restrictions. We all said no. He said that what he really likes to do is serve family style, and are we OK with that? We said sure. At that point he announced, “OK, in that case, you don’t need the menus anymore.“ We handed him the menus. After that, four amazingly delicious courses appeared on our table one by one. We also had the green tea with the jasmine rosebud in it, which was delicious. I can only tell you that the food here is absolutely amazing. And it really wasn’t very expensive given the high quality of the service and the food. None of us knew this restaurant existed, but we all agreed that we have to go back. It’s an eye-opening experience and a gastronomic delight. Don’t overlook this place!

Review901.Review: NOT GREAT!!!  Maybe if you are a regular customer but we came from NY area and can get the finest oriental fusion anywhere and this food was in my opinion far below par!!  Our waiter made 2 dishes for us and said do t worry I know what u want ... terrible!!We asked for lomein and was  served another type of noodle in coconut sauce NOT what we ordered!! We asked for big prawns and got baby shrimp with pumpkin NOT what we asked for!!  Etc.... it went on and on !!! Also place seemed a little dirty .  It was packed so other diners must have enjoyed WE should have listen to our  hotel conceirge .

Review902.Review: FANG was an awesome experience. We had a group of 6 and the owner took our order, recommending that we trust him to put orders in for the table. We took a leap of faith and had a fantastic line-up of food that was just the right about for the 6 of us. Highly recommend for anyone looking for high quality, authentic Chinese food.

Review903.Review: Overpriced, in general pretty mediocre food. It was ok, just really overpriced in proportion to quality.

Review904.Review: Owner is awesome!   We trust him to order for us.    We have never been disappointed!

Review905.Review: Really good dim sum, served a la carte from the menu, not from a cart. We especially liked the sautéd book choy and dumplings.Not much for atmosphere, but the waitstaff was super nice and funny.We’d eat there again if we are in area.

Review906.Review: We were a party of 4. Ordered 2 appetizers and 4 entrees. Only 2 glasses of wine. With tip $229. The food was fair. No help from the waiter in ordering dishes. In fact, he tried to steer us toward d a deep fried beef dish after I ordered the Mongolian beef. We already had deep fried dishes,  why would he steer me toward another?? They forgot our steamed rice - had to ask twice. You can do wat better for the price. Unfortunately their prices were not posted on their website menu.

Review908.Review: Ordered the wonton soup and it was very bland.  Tasted like dish water.  All the entrees were good except for the special house noodles.  Was in a sauce - looked like cream sauce which is strange for Chinese food, which we didn’t like and sent an entire order back.  When we received the check they had charged us for it.  When we mentioned it they did take it off the check, but they should have done that automatically

Review909.Review: One word: HORRIBLE. I had been in the past for Christmas and it was a great and accommodating place (I'm gluten free and soy free). If you enjoy a place that brings out all of the food at random times, continuously says, "We are busy," then this is the perfect place for you! Having a reservation is irreverent and the servers do not check in on you. You have to ask for EVERYTHING (water, checks, where is my food?) If we did not ask, we would still be stuck in this unaccommodating joke of a restaurant. My boyfriend and I ordered 5 things: sesame chicken, green beans, curry chicken, and 2 single rice dishes. 10 minutes after ordering, we received our green beans and wondered where the remainder of our meal was. We saved some green beans to go with our meals and rice since our food was no where to be seen. Then after 20 minutes of getting the green beans, my curry chicken arrived and it was nasty looking and tasting (I did not eat it). We then asked 20 minutes later for the remainder of our food (sesame chicken and 2 rices). The waiter brought out one rice and said "It's basically a medium" and would not bring us another one (but did only charge for 1 rice even though we specially wanted 2 small ones not one "medium" one that WAS NOT ON THE MENU). After 5 more minutes, my boyfriend got his sesame chicken. I wanted to wait to eat with him and my food was cold (I didn't like it anyways but still...it's the principle). They never once asked us if we needed anything and anytime we asked for something, it seemed like such a burden on them...

Review910.Review: Do NOT go to Fang!  It is absolutely the worst Chinese food I have ever had!  My x, the father of my son and a friend is a famous Chinese man now living in HK.  They may have thought I was a Caucasian woman who knew nothing about Chinese food...WRONG!  I have had the best all over the world.  I would give this place zero or negative stars if I could.  Everything from the food to the service was AWFUL!

Review911.Review: Peter Fang, Kathy’s Dad, personally ordered our food.  He made our first time visit very special.  The only thing that could have topped it would have been to meet Kathy!

Review912.Review: What a meal! Every dish was incredible, with a shout out for the fried rice, finished table-side and the prawns and mushroom - so intensely flavorful. We ate every bite and enjoyed the hustling busyness on Christmas night.

Review913.Review: Large portions of good food, poor service and dirty bathrooms

Review915.Review: Always my go to for Chinese when downtown. Had family in town visiting for the Christmas Holiday. We had just been to the SFMOMA and Fang is just around the corner - Very convenient! Also within walking distance to Yerba Buena Park/Metreon for a movie. A Must Order is the Eight Treasure Salad! So Yummy!! Everything on the menu is really good, but if you're going with a party of six or more, let the owner order for you! He will not disappoint!!

Review916.Review: We were pleasantly surprised when Mr Fang offered to order for us!  What an amazing treat!

Review917.Review: Food was fair to middling, the service terrible. It's as if the staff is not trained to deal with people at all. Prices are too high for the experience.

Review918.Review: Food was good but great. Conveniently located though.

Review919.Review: Got there at 12:15 for a 12:15 reservation of 7 people. After checking in we were ignored and two parties of 4 who came after us were seated. When asked about not being seated yet were told "the reservation is really just who gets here first" and then we asked how long the wait was and were told "a few moments" after asking what a few moments meant, we were told "20 minutes". 20 minutes during a week/workday for lunch when you have a reservation is unacceptable.  The ambiance isnt especially nice either. Seems like a large version of a takeout place

Review920.Review: Fang is always our go to restaurant for the most amazingly delicious Chinese food in SF! Their orginal restaurant, House of Nanking in North Beach never disappoints either,  but Fang has a bit more room & different vibe!The owner is always gracious & based on our likes, just brings us an array of dishes that we love!Always bustling, fun place, & great for groups. Accepts reservations too!

Review921.Review: I would rate Fang 0 starts if I could. We had reservations at 7:30 for 3 people and were very rudely greeted by the host. After about 10 minutes of waiting, someone pointed at us and pointed to an empty table for us to sit. No one ever showed up. Tables all around were getting food and drinks. We got up and asked if we had a server and a man finally came and jotted down our order. We still never got drinks or any food. We waited for 50 minutes before deciding to leave. I’ve never in my life had to walk out of a restaurant until my experience here. I have been managing restaurants for a decade and never have I seen such poor service.

Review922.Review: We - party of 5 - thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Fang and hope to revisit soon. At first sight you realize you've entered a restaurant that has passed it's prime with regards to contemporary design standards. But don't judge a book by it's cover! Service was great - throughout the evening by various no-nonsense waiting staff - and at the beginning of the evening by Mr. Fang himself who's recommendations we blindly accepted and didn't regret. Between the 5 of us we had 7 entrees - no appetizers - and loved all of it. We brought our own 2 bottles of wine at a reasonable corkage fee of $15 per bottle. The price/value ratio at Fangs is very reasonable, we'll definitely be back!

Review923.Review: Reservation was not honored. Hoards of people waiting at the door. Impossible to get to the host, who then ignored me after I mentioned my reservation. It was impossible to navigate. Others with reservations waiting for over an hour.

Review924.Review: Will never attempt to eat there again. Had a reservation for 6:45, stood in the crowded lobby stuffed in like sardines and completely ignored, as was everyone else who had a reservation before and after me, for over 25 minutes. Annoyed looking wait staff pushing past waiting parties who were getting no help. We gave up and had to go to Fogo de Chao across the street, who was fortunately able to accommodate our party. I can’t speak to the food but the service is absolutely terrible.

Review926.Review: No aforementioned prix fix meal, never asked how much per person or how many courses preferred. You eat what they feed you. Each dish was presented as one single word. One noodle plate with single layered strings was supposed to serve eight people. Had to request more food. Final bill presented to be around $45 per person. Not worth rating but thought others ought to beware.

Review927.Review: I liked the restaurant.  I called on Friday and said that we would need at table for 11 not 8.  When  we arrived they did not have a table ready for 11, but they got one together quickly.   One man took charge of our group, and I did not care for what he choose ; the kids (5 of them ..Youngest 7.5 up to 13 years old)besides that, I liked the place and I would go back with a large group.

Review928.Review: Forgot my tea. Food was yummy though.

Review929.Review: The food was great. We arrived at 5 so they were still rolling silverware.  The counter was stacked with about 50 napkin packages. We had to keep flagging down our server.  On the other side we did not feel rushed. The food was uniformly excellent and flavorful.  I’d go back again

Review930.Review: I have eaten here 4 times now, i always go when im in town. This past visit was really a disappointment. What happened? Hardly anyone there. Food quality was way down. Menus were old, tattered, dirty.  For $150 for 3 people im not sure i will return again. Hopefully was just a bad night.

Review931.Review: We were a group of 6 that included 1 vegetarian and 2 pescatarians.  We had an early reservation on a Sunday.  We requested the "chef's choice" menu which means that the dishes served were at the discretion of the chef.  They asked if we had any personal requests.The food was outstanding.  The dishes included a variety of vegetarian options, fish, shrimp, beef and pork.  The portions were generous, flavorful, fresh and seasonal.  The preparations varied and were complementary as a whole. Some were spicy but not too hot.We were all very pleased with their offerings and would definitely return.

Review932.Review: Owner Peter Fang greeted us,ordered for us and made our dining experience excellent.The food is inventive and different from other Chinese menus.While finding a parking place was a challenge it was worth it in the long run.  Give yourself extra time for parking.Big kudos for Fang!Thank yo!

Review933.Review: フロアの店員さんの態度が非常にぶっきらぼう。ただご飯は本当に美味しい。地下１Fには16名ほど入れるスペースがあり、そこは会話が皆でできるレベルには静か。会食も可能。

Review934.Review: I love this place for both clients and family. I never order and just let the owner bring me what he suggests. A sure thing for great Chinese food.

Review935.Review: We were initially excited to eat here and were happy to get a last-minute reservation on such a busy night. Unfortunately, the table we were seated at seemed like it was just placed near the top of the stairs as an afterthought...like they brought it out from the back and put it in a small open space. Nevertheless, we found some good looking items on the menu and proceeded to order. It turns out that the chef was out on the floor and ended up taking our order...pretty cool! BUT, when my dining companion ordered an entree she pushed hard for him to order something else (a braised short rib dish, I think...something they’re evidently known for). He begrudgingly agreed and changed his order. Then I ordered the exact same thing he did and she tried to talk me into ordering something different because “no tables orders the same entrees...they order different items and share”. We’re two grown men who had no interest in sharing plates, so I held firm on my order. She was NOT happy - like it was an insult to ignore her advice.When the food did arrive, it was very good. We loved both the appetizer and entrees, and the prices were pretty good too.It’s too bad that the chef’s pushiness put a negative vibe on what was a good meal. Hope it was an aberration and not the norm.

Review936.Review: Xiao long bao was the worst we’ve ever had.

Review937.Review: Salt and pepper prawns with carmelized onions and mushrooms was my favorite!

Review938.Review: Food seems expensive for the value. The service was great however

Review939.Review: If you want vibrancy, stop by for lunch. If you want to relax and enjoy time with a friend or two, come for an early dinner after all the downtown workers commute elsewhere. You might get some convention crowd, but most of those folks are not likely to reach too far beyond what they know. The food here is reliably yummy, and I have enjoyed meals here multiple times.

Review940.Review: Awesome food. Great service Was in town on business from Fort Lauderdale Florida Would dine here again when I’m back again

Review941.Review: Waited 30 mins to sit for an 8 pm reservation. Slow to take our order after having waited, and then we struggled to get a server’s attention throughout the meal. Food was good but expensive.

Review942.Review: No service at all at this restaurant. Lots of people waiting to be seated but no one was there to keep everything in place. People who came in last got seated first. During the meal,  no one checked in. Waited 30 mins for one dish and tables came in later with same order got their food faster. Had to push multiple times to have the food

Review943.Review: My sister was in town for one day, celebrating her birthday. She is vegan. The place I planned to take her was booked, and then I remembered how accommodating Fang is to people with special diets. We did away with ordering from the menu, and let the house serve us what they wanted. Everything was delicious, and some dishes were even made separately for the vegan and the meat eaters. We love this place and also House of Nanking, the mother restaurant. Thanks for a wonderful time!

Review944.Review: Food was ok. They seemed uninterested in the fact that we were there. Food was expensive for a Chinese rest. and not worth the high price. Small tables and huge plates made it also a bit awkward.

Review945.Review: This was a friend's recommendation and she did not disappoint.  Fang's store front is almost hidden and the inside is nothing fancy, but the food was delicious.  Our friend suggested we let the host/owner decide what we should eat and he did.  The food just kept coming out.   I am guessing were served at least six different platers from steak, shrimp, meatball, pork dumplings, fried rice, egg plant and a uniquely presented dessert.  Our party of four also ordered three beers and a tea.  Our total bill came to $200 with a tip.  We would definitely go back for the food, service and value.

Review946.Review: Many pieces of chicken had gristle in it.  The brown rice was overcooked.  Service was perfunctory.  I was given paper napkins and an old water glass while everyone other table had cloth napkins and fancy water glasses.  I cannot believe this place had consistently good recommendations.

Review947.Review: Food was excellent. Service is quirky but owner is super nice. Do it. Very good food.

Review948.Review: Fantastic meal and service. Let the chef select the dishes for you. You will not be disappointed!!!!Highly, highly recommend.

Review949.Review: Why do you make people answer 20 questions for a review? Really annoying, OpenTable

Review951.Review: Excellent food, coming back for my birthday!

Review952.Review: I have been eating Peter Fang's – and now his daughter's – food for over 25 years. It started with discovering The House of Nanking, and later when Fang opened, I have usually chosen Fang (both are excellent).The Fang's mix of sweet and savory is exquisite. Definitely Chinese, yet surprisingly new and different, Peter's recipes always dazzle. I rarely request an item from the menu, or even from memory, preferring to simply ask Peter to cook for the table. He comes over, asks about food allergies, personal preferences, and then minutes later, the table begins to fill with pure delicious magic.I highly recommend Fang. If you're smart, don't bother with the menu. Ask to speak with Peter, or his daughter, and then wait to be delighted. You will be.

Review953.Review: I've consistently REALLY enjoyed the food every time I've visited, and have always felt well taken care of by the staff. Still surprised at how many people haven't heard of this hidden gem, it's a delightful experience I always enjoy introducing to friends and business associates.

Review954.Review: The owner and staff were wonderful.  We were served with dishes selected by the owner and all were so delicious!

Review955.Review: It was Fang-tastic.  Mr. Fang was able to accommodate for multiple dietary restrictions while delivering a delicious meal.  Everything tasted extremely fresh.

Review956.Review: The owner Mr Fang insisted on selecting the menu for us and I have to say after a little trepidation it was a good bet. Every single item and dish was delicious and the whole experience was great.

Review957.Review: The food is delicious, with unique Chinese dishes. The owner is always willing to help you pick your menu for the evening - simply tell him what you won't eat and he will take care of the rest.

Review959.Review: This restaurant was very poorly organized. We had a reservation, and they weren’t able to accommodate us because their kitchen was not up and running. It did not appear clean inside. We did not die in here.

Review960.Review: Underwhelming. Food was cold.  Restaurant is untidy and it was a very blah experience.

Review961.Review: Service members did not come to table after delivering food until requested . Food was good but not all correct

Review963.Review: We arrived asked for two dinners and beer.  Peter took it from there.  Generous portions of tasty stuff.   Enough to take home.  All worked out.

Review964.Review: The owner is rude. He didnt want to let us order our own food. He even tossed a menu at someone saying “you think you know more than me.”

Review965.Review: Pretty great spot for those int eh area for the many events.  Very different take on some old favorites. Haas its own personality.  Has full bar but it would seem most do not ask for those types of adult beverage. But we were able to get two rounds of great cocktails.  Shrimp dumplings a big hit. House special beef was outstanding.  We will return for sure.  Only down was the interior seemed a bit dark and run down.

Review966.Review: Absolutely terrible service. Such rude servers. Took an hour to get our food

Review967.Review: Had colleague and friend visiting from out of town for a conference in Moscone and chose this nearby Chinese restaurant. Chief greeted us and asked if we had ever been there before, we had not so he placed orders for us and we sat back and enjoyed the meal. Terrific meal with fang’s Peking buns (pork belly laid in folded bun), sautéed pork dumplings (with eggplant), crispy honey chili short rib (with chili peppers whole), salt and pepper prawns with mushrooms (and onions), salted pork belly with Japanese pumpkin, and House special fried rice with shrimp and veggies, finished off with sesame balls for dessert. Was amazing.  ($160 pretip). Had a wonderful time and delicious meal. Very convenient to convention center. Had a downstairs portion for large parties

Review968.Review: Excellent restaurant. Staff and owners provided great service. Owner actually ordered all our food for us and couldn’t have done a better job. An amazing experience.

Review969.Review: Mr. Fang himself took care of us! He brought us an amazing selection of food and it was the perfect amount for our group. We all left extremely happy and full and wanting to come back!!

Review970.Review: Horrible service and really bad food.

Review971.Review: Fang went from one of my favorite restaurants to one I will likely not patronize again in one fell swoop.  Strangely, it was almost empty on a Saturday night, and it has always been packed every time i’ve visited before. Nonetheless, the host was aggressively rude, striding away without speaking to us, giving no indication that he expected us to follow to our table. We sat unattended for 15 minutes before finally getting service. The spareribs, described as a house specialty (and usually glorious) were dry and overdone. The fried rice, prepared at the table was mush and flavorless (again, a shocking departure).  We paid our bill as quickly as possible and I doubt we will ever try again. Really sad decline.

Review972.Review: Great restaurant- come every time in town in SF.

Review973.Review: Excellent food! Don’t order from the menu but ask the chef to prepare you something. You won’t be disappointed.

Review974.Review: While the food was good, I felt very mislead — though the website mentions the ability to hos private parties, nowhere is it prominently mentioned that all guests are given set, prixe-fixe menu. Their menus online (including on Yelp) show prices next to dishes — this lead me to believe you could order from the menu and pay the listed price. Unfortunately, this was not the case. The food is tasty, but the style of restaurant — not being able to order a single dish from a menu and always paying a set rate — needs to be prominently noted. Our company dinner here twice the allotted budget, since this was not made clear.

Review975.Review: N/A.  By comparing the quality of their food, their price is little too expensive.

Review976.Review: Fang owner took control of ordering for us and everything was awesome.

Review977.Review: RETURNED FOR A SECOND VISIT TWO DAYS FOLLOWING MY FIRST VISIT WHILE IN SAN FRANCISCO.  JUST HAD TO GO BACK FOR MORE OF THIS DELICIOUS FOOD.  HAD DIFFERENT DISHES FROM THE MEAL TWO NIGHTS EARLIER AND IT WAS FANTASTIC AND STILL THE BEST CHINESE FOOD I HAVE EATEN.  IF YOU LIKE CHINESE FOOD YOU WILL LOVE FANG.

Review978.Review: Best Chinese food ever!  Found this place 9 years ago and this was first opportunity to return since.  It was great back then and even better now.  Not to be missed.

Review979.Review: Service was terrible. Wrong orders, no water refills, had to ask for our check long after table was cleared, restaurant less than half full, and multiple wait staff standing within feet of our table doing nothing. Food was decent, but way overpriced for that poor or service.

Review980.Review: On the website it looks like a design and lounge place but it’s small and smelly and the food is over covered in sauce. The service is very very basic, bier in a bottle type of service.

Review982.Review: Amazing food, good service, very busy!!  Recommend going with the "family style" option where they bring you a ton of food that gives you a chance to sample a lot of different dishes.  Each one was terrific!

Review983.Review: Food was good, service was terrible. Maybe it was that he was annoyed that we had two children with us, but the gentleman who waited on us (I think he may have been the owner) was extremely inattentive. When we tried to order wine while we were ordering food, he told us he would send someone else to take the drink order. No one ever came. The food came very quickly, but it took forever for us to get the bill. It’s a shame because the food was good, but given the service I don’t have any plans to return.

Review984.Review: Fang can be a good dining experience, or a truly great one. Take a leap of faith and allow the kind gentleman (owner?) To order for you. I don't know what we are, but every dish was phenomenal and just what we wanted... Without knowing that was what we wanted! 😊

Review985.Review: Tasty food but mostly deep fried :( Salad was too salty and had some grit in it!

Review987.Review: We had a fantastic experience. The food was fresh, and flavorful. We will definitely be back!

Review988.Review: Seven of us ate at Fangs whilst on holiday, children and adults. We had read the reviews about not letting Mr Fang order for the table as they had been disappointed with the meal. We therefore ordered from the menu but also agreed to have a couple of Mr Fangs choices. All of it was absolutely delicious and especially Mr Fangs options that were not in the menu. Next time we will be letting him order to try it out.

Review989.Review: We asked the chef to choose our menu and were not disappointed! The honey apple prawns were delicious and the so-called pork bun was actually luscious pork belly in a folded dough perfect! Enjoyed the fresh bean salad, beef chunks Nd pot stickers with eggplant. And a full bar. Our second visit and even better than the first time. Perfect location for anything at YBCA

Review990.Review: Marvleous, the owner/chef interview customers as to their food preference and then makes suggestions for dishes from a large menu of delicious and rarely seen here dishes.  A truly unique and enjoyable experience.

Review991.Review: The soup was greasy. The dumplings chewy, the noodle dish with chicken soupy with pressed chicken pieces. Real let down

Review992.Review: First of all, we got "Fanged" which means, if you are new to this restaurant, the owner takes it upon himself to order for the table.  I did not realize that this is what regularly happens to first time customers until I looked on TripAdvisor after the fact.  We were promptly greeted by the owner and before we could open our menus, he took them from the table and implied to trust him with our order.  What a treat!  Not. He asked for food allergies, etc. and I emphatically explained that I was there for Dim Sum and my other sister was there for noodles and traditional Asian.  So the food started coming out, like a conveyor belt, one dish after another, very prompt, but we hadn't even received our cocktails after the first two dishes of fried and fried.  I do not regularly eat fried pork or beef at Asian restaurants, preferring noodles and dim sum but it was fair, two in our party of 4 liked it.  Finally the dim sum, tasty but not as good as the more traditional offered in Chinatown.  He was perplexed that I was not very happy with his food choices, one sister stating that sweet and sour was not her favorite in which he seemed totally stunned and surprised.  He then left and never returned to our table, apparently tending to other new customers to get "Fanged".   My sister and I observed 2 tables nearby who had groups of 4 and were Asian and they were ordering off the menu, they were eating bowls, soups, and the like.  I felt like a target and this was confirmed when I got the bill.  He had ordered double of every sampling for 4 women, the waitress asked if we wanted a "to go" box, but no, we are staying at a hotel!  I complained which did no good, so I payed the bill &  left with a sour (not sweet) taste in my mouth.  As we were leaving, I told a group of tourists that were waiting for a table to say NO to getting "Fanged".  It's a gimmick.

Review993.Review: The food here is great! The atmosphere is fairly peaceful for Midtown and the decor is very pleasant.  The owner Mr. Fang is a creative cook and he’s always there to recommend the best dishes. However he should also let people discuss his recommendations and order what they want! Still I have never had a disappointing dish.

Review994.Review: My husband was almost done eating before my entree arrived. It was cooked incorrectly so it was sent back. No one ever came to check on us to ask how the food was or if we wanted more water. $16.95 for a small vegetarian dish was expensive.

Review995.Review: All of it was disappointing.  We had been here before and enjoyed it, but this time the food had almost no flavor and did not taste very fresh.  We will not return

Review996.Review: Every dish was fresh and tasty.  Good-sized portions as well.

Review997.Review: As many reviews have said they tried to charge me more for one of the items ($19 instead of $13.95). Dishonest!

Review998.Review: The owner makes you feel “special” by personally selecting your dishes however he picks the same 3 or 4 dishes for EVERY table.  What a great way to reduce inventory costs!!  Biggest turn off was the price!  Dinner for 2 with 1 cocktail$100!  This would be $50 max at almost any other Chinese restaurant.

Review999.Review: Incredible food - selected by Mr. Fang.  Try the honey prawns with apples.

Review1000.Review: Peter and his team did a great job as always!

Review1001.Review: Best Chinese food in San Francisco. It is our favorite.

Review1002.Review: A nice double birthday celebration for two of our grown up kids. The dumplings were amazing especially the mushroom and gouda cheese being out of this world. The fish in chilli sauce was another out of this world dish. The service was impeccable.cheers

Review1003.Review: I expected better. While the food wasn't bad, it wasn't great either. Service started out below par but that may have been because we arrived early (5 PM) and the regular wait staff weren't on duty yet (service did improve later on). Cocktails were overly sweet for my taste. The dumplings were boring. The beef dish was better but uninspired. Portion sizes were generous. The brown rice was mushy and unappetizing. Our server explained that the chef didn't know how to cook brown rice and brought white rice (so much for trying to be healthy) while removing the charge from our bill. Since there are too many other interesting restaurants in the city to try, I don't think I'll be back.

Review1004.Review: It was a great place to meet family and we had a great time at Fang.  The food was excellent and the ambience was great.  Half of the group were vegetarians and they brought out dishes that were out of this world.  We were very pleased with the service.  Didn't know that the owner and Chef of House of Nan King, which has always been one of our favorites, has opened Fang with his daughter and now they are doing a roaring business.  Would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Review1005.Review: Great food and the chef took our orders. It was our first time so he ordered for us. The pork belly rolls and shortrib were well worth the money.

Review1006.Review: Our second time to FANG, excellent food with the ordering taken care of by the owner. Every dish was a surprise and none of them disappointed.

Review1007.Review: The food was good but too salty. We had four plates and consistently all of them had too much soy/sauce or salt. Still they were good. Service is normal.

Review1008.Review: Superb meal organized and prepared by the staff.  Consistently imaginative cooking.

Review1009.Review: FANG is the best. The vegan food is killer and it is always an incredible experience dining. Thank you!

Review1010.Review: Food was very tasty and different from other Chinese places! A little rich :(

Review1011.Review: I would have given five stars but for the fact that the food didn’t come out piping hot. Really very good food. Very unusual fried rice. Awesome noodles. Amazing beef n prawns. An older gentleman asked us if we had ever eaten there before. We hadn’t. He took away our menus and we left it to him to order after he confirmed some basic likes n dislikes. Amazing experience of family style dining with very tasty dishes and perfectly ordered quantities.

Review1012.Review: Amazing lunch experience, the best I’ve had in LA. Amazing dumplings, appetizers, delicious tea and the crispy short rib fangs special with bok Choy is to die for. Will definitely be coming back here!

Review1013.Review: The owner came to take our order and asked if we'd been to the restaurant before, when he learned we hadn't he took it upon himself to bring us a series of fun, delicious and unique dishes.  A really great meal.

Review1014.Review: Expensive for oily and sweet entrees

Review1015.Review: Friendly welcome, a menu that was just about the right length, prompt service and really, really good food on a 'Chinese with a twist' theme.  Ambience good but not too noisy.  Correctly not located in Chinatown - this restaurant can standalone in a central location.

Review1016.Review: The food is not stellar for the price. Our service was so inexplicably bad, that the entire experience was tainted by it.

Review1017.Review: Fang made my special occasion even more special when Peter made us a dish not on the menu. It knocked our socks off!! Always delicious and so satisfying, a true SF/Bay Area gem!!

Review1018.Review: Great experience. Outstanding food and fantastic service. We came for a dinner and while wondering and thinking what to order, the Chef came to us and, after a brief introduction of our personal preferences and constrains (we had one vegetarian), he just took all the menus and said that he knows what we need, and he would take care of us. The most amazing part is that it worked extremely well. The choices and the amount of food were just right (sufficient but not too much) and the quality and taste were truly outstanding. And very reasonably priced ($150 for the party of four with beer!!!).Highly recommended!

Review1019.Review: We love Fang Restaurant.  The owner always welcomes us.  People are very friendly.  Food is delicious and though there is always a good crown, the place is quiet.  You can have a conversation there!

Review1020.Review: Just tell the wait staff what you like to eat and let them order for you.

Review1022.Review: Had a quick bite for lunch here. I like the casual atmosphere of Fang and the fact that you can have them select the dishes for you. I wish they didn’t serve so many sweet dishes though but everything still tasted fantastic

Review1023.Review: Awful service and rude waiters/owner. Would not recommend this place.

Review1024.Review: Amazing food and amazing service! Best Chinese in San Francisco!

Review1025.Review: Great place. I love the Fangs. Place is cool, fun and they are always innovating!

Review1026.Review: Our group LOVED that the owner selected dishes for us after chatting with us. The choices were right on target!  The flavors were fantastic and each dish was prepared pretty much perfectly. Delicious vegetables and meats and dumplings and... we wished we had larger stomachs. The portions were perfect so everyone felt they got plenty of each dish and still have a bit left over in case someone wanted to reach beyond their capacity. :) The ambiance was just right for a party of 5 or 6, making the group feel welcome and able to sit without being crowded. The table was perfect size to hold the dishes being served yet we weren't so far apart we couldn't visit and the room was not soo quiet we felt we were disrupting others or so noisy we couldn't hear each other. The art in this place is amazing too! We loved it all!  I use this place to impress my friends from out of town and this place continues to deliver! Definitely going back!!

Review1027.Review: FANG was a big surprise.  A rather plain restaurant with great food, service and value.  Fang himself came over to our table and introduced himself.  We had told the restaurant that one of our party had to have gluten free food.  He knew this and when we told him this was our first visit, he said he would order for us.  His choices were great, everything was varied, interesting and delicious.  As each dish came out, the server told us whether it was gluten free or not.    A great place and we'll return soon.

Review1028.Review: The food came swimming in oil, and was very unappetizing. Will not go back, ever!

Review1029.Review: I brought my sister here, visiting from New Jersey, and she raved about the food. It was one of the highlights of her trip.

Review1031.Review: I used to be a fan of Fang restaurant. But the day when we visited with guests, I felt it very awkward. Instead of leaving choice to guests or taking feedback from guests on what they like or dislike, allergy information, fang team has decided their own choices. I know their food is good but guest service is also equally important.

Review1033.Review: One of my favorite Chinese restaurant s in the world.  If you have Kathy or her father helping, just ask them to serve what they recommend. I have been there many times for lunch and dinner ( thought I don t live in SF ) and even when I take locals they are amazed that they had never been there.

Review1034.Review: We really loved the food and ambiance but there was no beer and the cocktails were not good. Also we felt rushed to leave.

Review1035.Review: We had only picked one thing by the time the server came to take our order, so they offered to pick some things for us. That was great, we got a nice variety of dishes, but it ended up being ~$30/person, which in my opinion is on the steep side for lunch on a weekday. The dumplings with eggplants were great; there was another set of pork bao that were also good; the sugar snap peas were just ok; there was a friend shrimp and pork dish; and also a fried rice dish. It was plenty of food for a group of 4 people.

Review1037.Review: The food was ok... That was a bit pricey for the quality especially in SF where there are so many other choices. The pictures showed a beautiful restaurant where you can even go for a business meeting as it is next to the Moscone convention center. It is actually very dusty, completely outdated. The lamps, the statues, everything is covered with dust, not sure when they changed their filters last I think never... We were very surprised nothing is said or done yet. The service was ok, nothing outstanding. That's too bad as some deep cleaning, not torn and dirty menus, better service, and better quality of food would change completely this restaurant.

Review1038.Review: The food is the only reason i would even consider going back.  The Staff ( hostess, food servers, even the  owner) seemed too occupied to care about a seated at a table.  We had to ask for water over and over, forget about getting a mixed drink or bar drink.  The server assigned to our section knew very little if any English so she kept asking others for help; apparently they were tired of helping her so they ignored her... and us for that matter.  Very frustrated we walked out, after reluctantly paying.   The food however is very good, and was ready quickly.  I would recommend this restaurants with a disclaimer based solely on the staff.

Review1039.Review: The service was  non existent. We had to get up literally to catch a server’s attention. Finally one man got things squared away and we started getting attention. The food is good - not exceptional- but enjoyable. The Salt and Pepper fish was the best of what we ordered. It is very loud and we seated at a round table, group conversation was all but impossible. No dessert except for Sesame balls. We will not go back

Review1040.Review: Great dinner. Food was so good!!

Review1041.Review: Service extremely cold and non-personal.  2 of 3 guests almost done with entree’s before third entree arrived.  Food for another table brought to our table.  Charged for drinks we didn’t have.

Review1042.Review: The pictures they show of the restaurant are not the same as the restaurant itself (or maybe there’s a separate area I don’t know about). Other than that, the food is delicious! We had Chef Fang himself choose our meal, and he didn’t disappoint!

Review1043.Review: Food is really good, doesn’t really come out as a meal but instead in some random order, service is so BAD it takes your breath away.

Review1044.Review: Fang is a regular stop when I am in SF for tradeshow events.  The Shrimp and Apples dish is the best Asian fusion I have ever had.   It is honestly desert disguised as dinner.   So Yummy!

Review1045.Review: Arrived and was told there would be a longer wait for a small table for two...even though we had reservations. They did not seem to care, so we left and went elsewhere.

Review1046.Review: The food is always very good. The service needs attention. We waited a long time to be served and then they rush through it.

Review1047.Review: We loved the flavors and presentation. Really a fun dining experience. We love the chef, Peter. He takes a personal interest in the diners.

Review1048.Review: Fang is an absolutely fantastic Chinese restaurant.  The owner, Peter, came over and was friendly and thanked us for coming. You will be hard-pressed to find portions and quality of Chinese food this great anywhere in the bay area.

Review1049.Review: Chefs choice option is always a fun time.

Review1050.Review: Dirty table. Tables very close to each other. Very noisy. Didn’t stay for the food.

Review1051.Review: A presentable Chinese restaurant to have business lunches. Love the food and the service. Improvement: Our table might happen to be sticky else it would be 5 stars feedback from us.

Review1052.Review: Service is "OK" but the food is of great quality, fresh and overall very good. My biggest nitpick is the fact that the serving dishes are MASSIVE relative to the amount of food that is served. Ordering more than 2 items off the menu means your short on table space. A little annoying but not enough to take away from the delicious food.

Review1053.Review: Some of the best food I’ve ever had! We went back a second time during a 6 day stay and it was just as great!

Review1054.Review: We usually enjoy eating at Fang but this time the sesame chicken had much more sweet potato than chicken and most of the breaded chicken pieces had barely any chicken. The beef tower was mostly bok choy..The flavors were good but the dishes did not contain enough protein to vegetable retio.

Review1055.Review: The owner asked us if it was our first time dining here, we said yes. He immediately picks up all the menus and say he’ll order for us. I asked him what are you going to bring out and he said it’s a surprise. As a chef, I was skeptical to trust him, but it was the best decision. All the food was amazing and reasonably priced.

Review1056.Review: This was our second visit to Fang, as our first, we allowed the owner to pick our entrees and we were not disappointed by his choices! The food was fresh, delicious, and plentiful!

Review1057.Review: The owner (Fang) came by our table to ask if we had ever been to the restaurant before.  When I sad no, he asked to let him prepare a menu for us and he promised we will be happy.  Dinner was delivered and we loved the personalized touch.

Review1058.Review: We had a phenomenal experience. The Chef came to our table and introduced himself and said that he would prepare the food for us. It was the BEST Chinese food I have ever had in a restaurant. I highly recommend the place and will visit again if my travels take me back to San Francisco.

Review1059.Review: We were a party of 7 and Fang himself ordered dinner for us--great dishes kept surprising us one after another. Good professional and pleasant service. So glad we chose Fang for dinner with friends--can't wait to go back!

Review1060.Review: Food was average to good, lack presentation.  The Mongolian beef was not what I expected for flavor or amount but the overall value for the meal was ok.

Review1061.Review: 4 of us ordered from the menu, not just ordering a protein and leaving it up to the chef. Dumplings delicious, in a sauce that was extraordinary. Friends enjoyed the sesame chicken. I had the short ribs, now I know why it's a signature dish! The meat was super tender, with a crispy exterior that was unlike anything I ever had before. Nice beer selection. Glad I reserved a table, as restaurant was busy on a Thursday night. Highly recommend.

Review1062.Review: As usual, Kat Fang delivered what can only be called one of the best Chinese Fusion meals I've ever had.  The food, the ambiance, and the service are among the best in the US.  I can see why Kat Fang is considered one of the best and creative chef's in the country. Well done and thank you Kat!

Review1063.Review: Mr. Fang took our menus and said he’d pick the food and take care of us. The two dishes we asked for were not included in what was served. The food he gave us was mediocre at best. Without drinks the cost was over $50.00 per person. Recommend avoiding this restaurant.

Review1064.Review: Chef Fang was very attentive. It was our first time so he "took care of us" and ordered several great specials.  We look forward to returning.

Review1065.Review: Server chose our entire meal and it was fantastic.  Not just great, fantastic.  Highly recommended.

Review1066.Review: Wonderful service. Freshly prepared veggies and silky noodles and delicious sauces. The best lunch in San Francisco.

Review1067.Review: Fang was terrific. Some of the best Chinese food we have ever had. Learning that it was our first time at the restaurant, Mr. Fang took away our menus and ordered for us. There were 6 of us and we had seven or eight sharable dishes. Each was outstanding. We especially liked the house fried rice which arrived on a super-hot dish on which the waitress poured an egg mix. The egg cooked on the dish and she stirred it into the rice. Delicious. The duck in sweet buns and the beef nuggets were wonderful. We were there on a Sunday evening and it was not crowded so it was not noisy. Definitely would recommend it.

Review1068.Review: We tried the Chef Special Menu again this time. Most of the items kept the same, with one new item which turned out to be the highlight of the dinner.

Review1069.Review: Our team experienced poor service and not good food for a team of 23.  The team was visiting from Dublin.  They were disappointed in the service and quality of food for the price.

Review1070.Review: Needs cleaning up.  Dirty menus, etc.  Food was good.  Good value.Too many dirty dishes on nearby tables.

Review1071.Review: It's an amazing place. Must go if you're around. Slightly dim though, more so of a bar like ambiance. Would have liked a bit more lighting for a restaurant.

Review1072.Review: I had a reservation, showed up on time, but left without ever getting a table. As I waited, the line grew and grew. There was no order or system. After the crowd in the lobby became unmanageable the host staff gave up and left the entire front of house unattended. Everyone was confused and other people with reservations were left hanging as well. I get how things can be stressful when it's a busy night but there should be enough organization in place to handle a dinner rush.

Review1073.Review: Asking if it was our first time at the restaurant, the chef offered to order for us, several dishes to share (china style). His selections were excellent.

Review1074.Review: We had dinner tonight at Fang in San Francisco.  We were seated and presented with menus. After a waiter had taken our beverage order Chef Peter Fang came over to greet us.  He asked if we’d been there before.  Two of us had, and two were newbies.  He asked if we were sharing.  We said yes.  He then motioned for us to give him our menus.  “I’ll take good care of you.  You won’t leave hungry”.  This was what I was hoping for from having eaten there before.  I did let him know that one of our party does not eat anything spicy.  He assured her he’d take good care of her.  We had:Chicken Bun AppetizerShanghai Soup DumplingsCrispy ShortribHoney Prawn with AppleSoy Poached WhitefishEgg Fried Riceand Sesame BallsEverything was fantastic.

Review1075.Review: Brought my cousin visiting from NY who loves SF Chinese food and FANG did not disappoint!  Every dish was delicious and we had excellent service.

Review1076.Review: AMAZING food experience . Owner “Fang” took care of us from the start.... if he offers to pick out all your meals absolutely take him up on it, even if you’re nervous!!!! best dinner we ever had. Thank you Fang❤️

Review1078.Review: Mr. Fang himself came over to our table & asked us if we’d ever been there before, we said no, and he offered for us. Everything that came out was absolutely delicious!! Amazing food

Review1079.Review: I was expecting more veggies with my dish. I ordered a vegetarian plate and requested to add chicken with my tofu.I’m a chef and I noticed that our food was kind of just thrown together. As I was leaving I noticed that all of the other guest’s plates looked great .And not to mention they attempted to put us in the back of the restaurant. My wife enjoyed the food so I didn’t make a big fuss. Definitely a racial matter in my eyes.

Review1080.Review: We went with a large group and the owner offered us to send a few plates to our table and pick for us. Clearly, this was a mistake as we had a massive bill that was not itemized at the end. The food was good but not worth the cost. I would not recommend nor go back.

Review1081.Review: Amazing food and service. We asked the owner Fang to send out HIS recommendations and loved everything we had. Such a fun girls night out with wonderful food.

Review1082.Review: Even though I made the appointment for my team, when I arrived, the greeter seemed unwilling to speak to me, instead pointing me to random tables, then pointing me downstairs despite my cane. When I tried to *TALK* to them, they just shook their head and continued trying to random guess what I needed, which was an elevator in order to be seated with my team downstairs, but also to know where the restroom was before being seated.Not usually a problem I have, communication. I just left and slacked my team to enjoy. #epicFail

Review1083.Review: Such good food! What a great atmosphere as well.

Review1084.Review: Busy and noisy  but great food slow getting the check after we asked for it 3 times

Review1085.Review: Just amazing! we showed up with a 10 top reservation and had four (4) cancel at the last minute.  Fang just moved us to a smaller table and went on like it was nothing.  The family style dining was a delight and required no mulling over the menu.  We were so stuffed when we left we almost rolled to our hotels.  The staff was friendly and responsive. We had a blast!

Review1086.Review: The owner came over and suggested he order for us and he nailed it!

Review1087.Review: Loved the authenticity and quality of the food. The chef happened by our table and took our menus away and said "I'm the chef I'll take care of you". Um ...ok lol. Turned out to be the best Chinese meal I ever had. Outstanding food, cool people and well worth the trip.

Review1088.Review: This is my third time eating here. Definitely need a reservation. Food is amazing high quality and flavors. Huge portions. Service is not so great but it is worth eating here. Convenient to Moma and south of Market area.My favorite dishes fried rice made at your table, sweet and sour soup, ginger chicken.

Review1089.Review: This place is worth a visit.  Very interesting dishes on offer.   The wine list needs a little work.

Review1090.Review: Service was poor. The food was OK.

Review1092.Review: We've come to San Francisco 3 times and we always make it a point to go to FANG. We ask the owner to order the food and it's AMAZING!

Review1094.Review: Love Fang. Fang came to our table and ordered for us and everything was delicious!!

Review1095.Review: We had a reservation for 8 pm and were not seated until 8:25. It was an extremely busy time so this made sense but getting an answer on how much time we could expect to wait was not easy. Some of the wait staff just told us to "Wait" and walked away and others gave us a bit more detail on what was happening with the parties currently wrapping up. Once we got seated, Chef Fang came over and asked us if we trusted him to let him just bring food to our table (since we were a larger party and coordinating items would have been difficult we went ahead and said yes). We had a short discussion on dietary needs and food preferences and were pleasantly surprised with all of his choices. There was some overlap with items we had wanted to try so this worked out well and we really enjoyed items we would not have ordered ourselves. While service wasn't great at the beginning (we had to ask to be given menus), it quickly picked up once Chef Fang took over. Food was coming in fresh from the kitchen, drinks were being re-filled and we felt generally well-taken care of. Definitely will be back (but maybe on a less busy night).

Review1096.Review: One of the owners came to our table and said “Do you trust me? My name is Fang.” He selected a number of items from the menu for all, all absolutely delicious!  Great food, reasonably priced for SF, nice ambiance.

Review1097.Review: Beautiful presentations and prompt service (mostly); felt Americanized and not authentic, but still with a good flavour profile - crunchy short ribs were tasty, the bok choy was also nice, but a little cold for my sensibilities - but fresh. Hot n sour soup heavy on the egg (nice) and celery (interesting, but maybe not so nice). Over all a solid dining experience, especially for the eyes, but not for the pocket book when compared to other Chinese restaurants.

Review1098.Review: Fantastic experience. Been there many times but this time we sat downstairs in family style table. I also allowed Mr. Fang to serve us, four people, without making any choices. We were served all the specialties. We only had to order some beef buns because those are too good to miss! The best Chinese as far as I’m concerned

Review1099.Review: Chef fang was the man!  The rest of the place was odd, including the lights off kitchen downstairs.  We were sat and it was a while (30 minutes) before anybody asked for our appetizers order.  Once Chef Fang got involved, he just kept suggestions coming and they were ALL amazing!  I Highly recommend you just take a bunch of his suggestions if you’re in a group.

Review1101.Review: Still my favorite Chinese restaurant in the Bay. Chef and owner Peter Fang greets us, orders for us, and every dish is complex, textured, flavorful, and wonderfully balanced. His passion for food, his creativity in elevating traditional Chinese dishes, and his commitment to using only the freshest ingredients make his restaurant a standout. Going to Fang is always like going to a good friend's house. We always leave full, satisfied, and thinking of our next visit.

Review1102.Review: We came here for a 7:45 pm dinner. We were sat in basement area where only large parties are sat. The food was less than mediocre. The food quality was pretty bad.

Review1103.Review: The specialty drinks were ok. They were sweeter than desired.  However, the food was so good.  The garlic onion wontons and crispy chicken were incredible.

Review1104.Review: Mr. Fang ordered for the table and the food was excellent-Had to ask the servers to stop bringing food as my table of 10 was full and very satisfied. Highly recommended for large groups.

Review1105.Review: Ok if you let the owner order, he does a great job.  If you have $ limitations, tell him.  He will still do a great job just within your budget.  Food is crazy good!

Review1106.Review: This was a great option for our large team. We were able to find great food options to share for a group of people split 50/50 vegetarian and meat eaters.

Review1107.Review: Always a great experience.  Nothing but empty plates at the end of the meal.

Review1108.Review: If you're looking for a quiet, romantic place to have dinner at, this is not the place for you. We wanted to go to a casual Asian restaurant for dinner and Fang came up with some good reviews. Once we showed up for our reservation, we waited around 10 minutes to get the table ready. The restaurant was half full and very loud with Chinese music playing over the speakers. I felt like I was in China which I loved. The service was a little weird because when the hostess took us to our table, she moved the table next to us where people were eating. They were shocked because they weren't told anything. An older gentlemen came over and asked us if we had eaten at the restaurant before and when we said "no", he walked away. Anyway, we ordered walnut shrimp, hot and sour soup and brown rice which were all delicious. I would go back only because the food tasted pretty authentic.

Review1109.Review: Food was good.  The service was spotty.  Sat at the bar and had to beg someone to get us a beer.  Restaurant was in a state of disarray.  Boxes stacked everywhere and quite a bit of clutter.  Definitely lessened our dining experience.

Review1111.Review: Food was excellent and highly recommend the beef ribs.  The food was served quickly and we enjoyed our experience.

Review1112.Review: Outstanding experience!  Go with Fang's choice.  Skip the menu.

Review1113.Review: Great food, non-commercial ambiance, reasonable priced, and not too loud.

Review1114.Review: Birthday dinner food was mostly very good... service was unfriendly and indifferent... ambience was so so

Review1115.Review: Booked a table for six friends.  Was hoping it wasn’t too loud.  Unfortunately the music was turned up and the speaker was right over our table.  When we mentioned it they didn’t just turn it down they turned it off.  Which really helped.  Still noisy (we were right by the kitchen which is out in the open) but not too bad.Food was excellent.  As others have mentioned, the owner offers to curate your meal.  And he’s pretty aggressive about it.  We would have needed to push back hard to have ordered off the menu.  But we figured it was worth giving in and going with whatever came our way.  We tell him that one person didn’t eat seafood.  They didn’t listen.  A shrimp dish was brought anyway.  Ended up with LOTS of food.  And it came out insanely fast.  That was probably the only real negative of the evening.  We were hoping to have a relaxed dinner and the food was fast and furious.  I’m not even sure how many dishes we ended up with, maybe eight for the six people at the table.  Included a soup, a fried rice, shrimp, pork ribs, short ribs, snow peas, etc.  There was nothing about the food that was “standard Chinese restaurant” fare.  All of it was interesting and thoughtful.Everything was excellent.  The only problem came with the fried rice, which they fry at your table.  The platter they used to fry it was way too hot and burned the rice, which made it inedible.  When we brought that to their attention, the took it away and brought another.The cost of the meal was a complete mystery until the bill showed up.  Ended up being a little over $50 a person with tax and tip (not including alcohol).  Worth every penny.  You could certainly eat a little cheaper by ordering off the menu. Most entrees are around $20.  So even with an entree and an appetizer, you could get out of there for under $40 by ordering off the menu.But I would absolutely go again and leave my ordering up to the owner. Every last dish was great and well worth the price.

Review1116.Review: A dining adventure leaving the menu selection to Mr. Fang himself. He never disappoints. The five course meal had a variety of tasty dishes delivered at a good pace with  portions that were scaled appropriately for the two of us. Giver yourself time to enjoy each bite and don't rush the experience. Bon Apetit!

Review1118.Review: Set your priority for seating away from the kitchen; the noise and traffic made our conversations difficult. We measured the noise at our table next to the kitchen at 85 dB. Tell the kitchen staff and servers to hold down their voices and minimize the clashing of pots and dishes to hold down the noise.

Review1119.Review: This place is amazing. They are warm inviting and truly an amazing experience!

Review1120.Review: First time eating at Fang.  Enjoyed the Mr. Fang took our menus and told us he'd take care of us.  The food was fantastic.  We had Fang's Peking Buns (outstanding), table side fried rice and an amazing short rib dish.  Really enjoyed the meal.  The facility could use a little sprucing up, but I'd go back again.

Review1121.Review: When we walked inside the restaurant I wanted to leave. The place looked like a store room ( napkins piled high on the bar, boxes on some of the tables). The menus were grimy and so old they were taped up. The kitchen staff were speaking loudly to each other. Two of the guests wanted to stay as they were traveling that night and didn’t want to spend the time looking for other options. The owner/waiter started talking about how we didn’t need to order from the menu and that he would do something special for us. I follow a vegan diet so I told him I wasn’t interested. Then he switched from English to Chinese. I told him I didn’t understand. He then muttered in English and accused me of not wanting to talk to him and walked away. His behavior was bizarre and menacing. Regrettably, we stayed and  had mediocre and overpriced food. All the items were deep fried though that was not how they were described on those decrepit menus. There’s a claim on their site that the daughter is the chef. Not so. I don’t tend to write negative reviews but the experience we had at Fang was so very bad, that I felt compelled to share this experience. This is the worst restaurant I’ve ever reserved through Open Table. We should have gone to Hakkasan or Mister Jiu’s, where diners are treated as guests and the food is sublime. We stayed at one of the top hotels in San Francisco and should have asked about this restaurant before we went. We recounted our experience to our concierge and she said that her colleagues had warned her about avoiding this restaurant.

Review1122.Review: We went after a trip to MOMA and said.. “feed us”!

Review1123.Review: Do not let the owner order for you. You will pay more and not get the dishes you want.

Review1124.Review: Outstanding service! The owner (manager?) took care of our table and ordered for us. We had some dietary restrictions, and they went out of their way to accommodate us without any problems. We wish we had been hungrier to eat more, but the courses we had were all fantastic. Highly recommended for excellent Chinese cuisine, which can actually be hard to find in SF, of all places.

Review1125.Review: The owner asked if he could choose the courses for our group and we said yes. Everything was great, he brought items we would not have ordered, but happy he did.

Review1126.Review: Great menu and great service.If it’s your first visit..... let Mr. Fang do the ordering for you. You won’t be disappointed.

Review1127.Review: Food was great. Restaurant was so dirty. There was a film of grime everywhere. Bathroom was awful and I saw open buckets of sauces on the floor of the kitchen. Could be great if they cleaned it up. Won’t be back until I see positive changes. Otherwise the food was pretty good!

Review1128.Review: Great food. Unique dishes. Wonderful flavors and textures. Food arrived in good time. The Mai Tai was excellent. Unfortunately, once the food and drinks were on the table we suddenly became invisible to the folks working our table. I’d have loved another Mai Tai. Even so, we are going back to Fang tonight and bringing friends with us.  The restaurant is hard to spot unless you’re standing right in front of it, but it is worth finding.

Review1129.Review: Great "upscale/modern" Chinese food.  If you are looking for an unique interpretation of Chinese food this is your to go place.

Review1130.Review: Food was great, enjoyed by all in party. But they had not honored our reservation and we waited for too long.

Review1131.Review: Maybe the intent was more of a fusion sort of experience but the food at Fang seemed to incorporate a lot of  Chinese American food cliches.  We ordered the house noodles with pork, the eight treasure salad (didn’t find any treasures) and the xiao long bao.  Except for the xiao long bao the food can be completely described as sweet and salty.  No subtlety, no finesse.  I will say it’s still a step up from Panda Express in terms of quality and authenticity but not much.  I am Chinese myself so maybe I expected too much.  A lot of people did seem to be having fun (New Years Eve) so perhaps we didn’t order well but we were quite disappointed.  What we ordered seemed pretty basic and should have been better executed.  The room seemed understaffed.  We arrived for our reservation but had to wait 15 minutes while the hostess cleaned up a table for us.  Had to ask twice for our drinks, the check.  Will not be returning.

Review1132.Review: The only server on the floor was abrupt and seemed irritated and inconvenienced by every request. The food was deeply mediocre, and at one point I observed the cooks bringing supermarket-style bags of frozen dumplings out from the back and dumping them into the steamer. The "housemade" noodles were certainly no better than your run of the mill lo mein with a very strange sour sauce on them. The honey shrimp tasted strongly of cheap mayonnaise. I was really disappointed and frankly embarassed that we brought my inlaws here, but I suppose I should have known by how easy it was to get a last-minute brunch reservation when Yang Chow was full.

Review1134.Review: Excelente sabor de la comida, condimentos muy diferentes a lo habitual

Review1135.Review: Unfortunately, this wasn’t the experience I was looking for. My husband and I were traveling in from DC and craved Chinese and based on the reviews and stars were hopeful of FANg. We arrived and service was horrible. We waited 20 minutes before our server came to the table to take our order. The thing that bothered us most was that the place was almost empty so we couldn’t understand the delay. Anyways, food came and the last thing the server said to me after being served the chicken ginger was, “this is the last of it.” She slammed it on the table and walked away. Needless to say, I won’t be going back nor will I recommend it.

Review1136.Review: Great food and service.  The owner offered to set us up with his recommendations.  He didn’t disappoint.  We liked everything and a a nice variety was brought to our table hot and fresh!

Review1137.Review: Mr Fang took care of us and selected the food for us. The noodles and fried rice where by far our favorites. The portions are really generous so by the time the pork ribs arrived, we were really stuffed. Service was fast and all tables were busy when. We arrived & left—- good signs! This restaurant was conveniently located 200ft away from the W hotel in the Yerba buena/SFMOMA area.

Review1138.Review: Delicious dinner after a Christmas Day movie. Lively room, delicious food.

Review1139.Review: Worst service I’ve ever had in my life. When you basically don’t have a server, the rest of the experience doesn’t matter.

Review1140.Review: Great food. Horrible service. They were overwhelmed on Xmas Day. I’d go back for the food but never on Xmas Again.

Review1141.Review: While the food was good, it wasn’t in line with the reviews we had read. To be fair it was extremely busy, hence perhaps why my entire meal failed to come out of the kitchen. When we finally were able to flag someone down it wasn’t exactly met with a receptive response. Not sure we would dine here again.

Review1142.Review: We expected better food.  Owner did menu for us, featuring a giant mound of fried rice--little else.

Review1143.Review: Our group of 14 (6 adults, 8 kids from age 9-16) had Christmas dinner here. We'd looked at the menu for a bit and decided what we wanted, then Fang came over, introduced himself and recommended we let the chefs create our meal, so we did. Dishes were good and varied; pork buns, whitefish with greens, sauteed snowpeas & seseame seeds, beef bok choi (delish!), curried tofu, sesame chicken, fried rice...all dishes were very tasty, but not enough for our table of mostly teen boys. We ordered extra chow mein which helped, but ultimately we all went home still hungry. The waitstaff was busy, though the place wasn't full to capacity yet. I would try it again, but I wasn't blown away.

Review1144.Review: I should know better than letting someone order for us.  We asked for lemonade for the kids and got hot huge mugs with hot lemon water with Gogi berries for the kids.  The kids didn’t even touch it.  The owner picked our menu.   He didn’t ask if we had allergies or restrictions.   He insisted.  I asked for chrysanthemum tea and were talked into jasmine.  Which we didn’t receive.  We’re very comfortable ordering Chinese as we’re a  blended Chinese family.  We had to ask a number of times also for white rice.  We had crispy pork belly with a bun. No sauce was served with it.  We were served  an order of pan fried dumplings and only one per person.    The sesame snow peas were fantastic but a small serving of only about 8 snow peas per person.  Crispy beef was really good - crispy and fatty with baby bokchoy. Shrimp dish was delicious but small serving of about 2 shrimp per person.  We were a table of 8 - 4 adults and 4 hungry kids.  Our order came out to close to $300 and NOT worth it.  Next time, I’ll order  myself.   I thought by letting the owner take care of us we would have something “special” not the case at all.   It was what was easiest for them.   Felt ripped off for that price.  Lesson learned.

Review1145.Review: Delicious and authentic food but rly bad service. We‘ve waited for houres to order and to pay!

Review1146.Review: Went here for a late lunch after a  great Christmas Eve performance at the Smuin Ballet. The host/waiter was rude and impatient. The food was mediocre at best, and overpriced. Not the experience we expected.

Review1147.Review: Rude waitress. Didn’t get an item ordered and the food was just so so.

Review1148.Review: The food and service was awesome!  The manager or owner’s father (?) ordered all our food and it was all delicious. If you have the opportunity, take advantage of this.

Review1149.Review: Some tasty authentic dishes were marred by spotty service and poor ambiance.

Review1150.Review: Had a really poor experience at Fang's on my Birthday. Five of us were seated at a banquet table in the basement. The table was bare except for the tablecloth. After waiter started bringing food out, we had to ask him twice for silverware and napkins. Ordered a glass of wine and hot tea, after 15 minutes he returned to say they were out of both items. He served our appetizer order twice, and neglected to bring one of our entrees.  The whole thing was almost laughable. If we were not so hungry and tired we would have walked out in the first 15 minutes.  Would not eat here again.

Review1151.Review: The restaurant was pretty empty when we got therefor our reservation, but it still took them 15 minutes to seat us. The food was over-priced and the service was terrible. We won’t be back.

Review1152.Review: We had a group of 11 for Saturday lunch, including 3 small children.
