We were seated immediately (we did have a reservation but it wasn't packed either) and service was very attentive.  Everything came out in a steady stream and empty serving dishes were promptly cleared (it's all family style).  One of the kids has multiple food allergies and the staff was really great about it, making sure that two of the dishes were allergen-free and never had contact with the others.  The food was very tasty!  Loved the crispy chicken, veggie fried rice, soup dumplings, For reference, we had 8 appetizers, 1 large soup, 3 entrees and 2 sides (noodles and rice) along with 4 non-alcoholic beverages, which was the perfect amount of food.  And to our surprise and delight, the entire bill was $207.  FOR ELEVEN PEOPLE!  We all agreed this will be a regular visit on future trips.

Review1153.Review: I /we have had much better Chinese food elsewhere in San Francisco.  I picked this restaurant because it was near Yerba Buena Center.  The food was served in large amounts on large plates and really did not look appetizing.  We ordered a noodle dish not knowning that the noodles were very thin and did not work with the rest of the food.

Review1155.Review: Their website promotes a lunch menu which is much less expensive than dinner.  We went for lunch and were told they no longer serve the lunch menu so we paid dinner prices which were twice as much and way too pricey for simple Chinese food. Big disappointment. Terrible service. They should remove the false advertising for lunch on their website.

Review1156.Review: It was sad to go to Fang's recently for dinner. I've had some nice experiences there but it seems like it has really gone downhill.

Review1157.Review: Dark, dingy, grimey feeling place that needs deep cleaning and up dating. I really should have followed my instinct and walked out. The food was ok, but for the price it certainly does not have  quality presentation or composition. The 8 favorite salad had 3 ingredients , not 8. It was a small mound of cabbage, apple with about 5 sprigs of cilantro and a minimal dressing that didn’t really help. The shrimp and apple was good, fresh and well prepared. The apple chunks were too large. The pork ribs were served on top of large chunks of cucumber- what is that about?  There was a microscopic amount of sauce. We had a glass of wine and a beer. The bill was $95 for 2 people -certainly high for dishes missing ingredients and served with nonsensical components.

Review1158.Review: All I can say is WOW!  We had both the pork and shrimp dumplings, which were fantastic. When we told the server that we weren’t sure what to order as it all looked good, she said she would choose and asked what things we liked and didn’t like. What came from the kitchen was fantastic. It started with the short ribs. They were crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside...not to mention very tender. The sauce and bok chit were great accompaniments. We then had the poached fish with spinach. It was so good. Cooked to perfection. To top it all off, they provided us with a table-side preparation of fried rice. It was great!This place was fantastic and one I will visit again!

Review1159.Review: Food was okay. Not as great as I expected. Most positive reviews came from people who did lunch/dinner during the week. Perhaps it’s just better to go then?

Review1160.Review: Very good food. The entrees came before the starter - there was no space on the table - we weren't asked if we were finished with a dish before it was whisked away. They brought the check pronto but the dirty plates when we were finished sat on the table for a long time after we finished _ indeed we hadn't finished talking and so ordered more teas so as to not sit with nothing - however they still didn't clear the plates. The attitude from the server when I asked for a slice of lemon in my coke was so rude it was almost comical - almost. Shame - if the service didn't suck I would eat there again. It's not cheap and I don't need to pay to be treated rudely!

Review1161.Review: Tops, as always.  Let Peter the owner order for you.

Review1162.Review: Food was good, on the greasy side, they rushed us too much bringing one plate after another without pauses, that did not help to the overall experience

Review1163.Review: One of the best Chinese meals of my life. And I’ve been to China, twice. Chefs menu: 5 courses. Each dish was unique and delicious. Dinner for two with 3 beers was $95

Review1164.Review: This was our second visit to FANG and once again it did not disappoint. Peter, the owner, selected an array of delicious dishes for our group of three adults and two children from the menu. As the chef/creator of the food served, each dish was mouth watering in its own way. It was the perfect way to end a Saturday late afternoon performance of The Velveteen Rabbit at Yerba Buena, a half block walk away from FANG. I would highly recommend this very special spot!

Review1165.Review: Chef greeted us and once he realized we'd never dined there before, he took out menus and said he'd "take care of us." After that, delicious food just kept coming out! Everything was super-yummy and unique. My favorite were the beef cubes that my boyfriend said were like a cross between steak and cotton candy. Sounds weird but they were amazing. it was a bit pricey (compared to House of Nanking), but worth it.

Review1166.Review: This establishment has gone waaaaaay down in the last few years.  The soup was served cold, the egg rolls were overcooked (almost burnt) and the place is so dirty.  Dirty menus with tape holding them together, dirty hanging light fixtures, and the soy sauce bottles were so unsanitary.  We had to ask for hot sauce 3 times.  I honestly will probably never come here again.

Review1167.Review: Great food and efficient service. Owner made sure we were well take. Care off

Review1168.Review: This was the perfect spot to celebrate a birthday! They accommodated a group of 15 and served us family style - great food, great service and great fun!

Review1169.Review: Great night out w the kids. Everyone enjoyed the food. We let the owner pick our dishes and it was the best meal I’ve had at a Chinese restaurant

Review1170.Review: Love that they made the fried rice at the table.  I have eaten here several times now ordering several dishes each time. Everything is so delicious. Never had a dish I would not get again. This is a favorite!!

Review1171.Review: I loved Fang, the food was amazing - they really take a new look at Chinese food by incorpating new ingredients to traditional plates. The flavors uniquely mixed well together creating a flavorful blast in your mouth. I also really appreciate peter fang for choosing all of our plates so the group didn’t have to think about it! Had a fun time and the blossom tea and pork buns are a must have!

Review1172.Review: Amaaaazing experience. Don’t expect to go in and have a standard dinner. The owner goes from table to table asking what type of food you like. Based on your answers he has the kitchen prepare dishes and they are AMAAAZING!! Highly recommend this for either business or a fun night out.

Review1173.Review: Dingy and depressing; run-down. Service was random. Servers wore rubber gloves.

Review1174.Review: Oh just YUM!  Short ribs are just incredible!  Correction everything we ate was incredible!!

Review1175.Review: Group of 7 staying at the W Hotel.  Glad we made reservation here on open table rather than eating at bar in hotel (Due to strike). Great food.  Delivered fast. Price was good for SF - $250 including drinks and tip!

Review1176.Review: Poor service and food was okay, at best.

Review1177.Review: The Grandpa (old chinese guy, maybe the owner of the restaurant) select all dishes (recommendation) for us. it was fantastic. however, it could be a bad point for someone who want to know explore menu by himself or herself. all dishes are very unique and valuable.

Review1178.Review: As much as I enjoyed mr fangs recommendations to set the meals for us, he ordered way too many plates for us, party of 3. The bill obviously reflected that which we were very disappointed in. It would have been nice if he checked in with us to make sure not only if we like the food but make sure the portions are correct. We’ve not only wasted money but also wasted so much food, which is a shame because they were good. Service overall could use a lot of work as we had to wait for our reserved table, never gotten our drinks refilled and had to flag down and deliver our bill to your staff so that we could get out of there. Food was great but everything else was not.

Review1179.Review: A local favorite. Peter and Kathy are terrific hosts.Dr R

Review1180.Review: Excellent food. Owner came over and took care of the menu for a group of 12, including excellent vegetarian options.

Review1181.Review: This was truly one of the best meals and dining experiences I have ever had. We went for my sisters birthday and the staff was so friendly and came over and let us know they would pick what we ate for the night. AND IT WAS OUT OF THIS WORLD! One thing was better than the next and it made the entire experience so unforgettable. 10/10

Review1182.Review: Not sure what’s changed since ive been here last.. not sure if Mr Fang was having a bad day... not sure if all his staff is new but almost everything about this visit was not good.  We came in when it wasn’t busy.  I knew it was going to get busy in a few minutes so I wanted to get our order in but Mr. Fang lectured me that my guests weren’t there yet (they were outside finding parking) and that it only takes a few minutes for the orders come out. Once our guests came in, I couldn’t get anyone to take our order for a full 30 minutes. He acted like we were annoying him while he took our order and he left in the middle of taking the order. This is not the same person I remember when we ate here last. I could hear him verbally reprimanding many of his staff throughout the night. Other than that, the food was ok... this experience definitely removes this restaurant from my recommend to friends list as it was an embarrassment to our guests.

Review1183.Review: I love Fang’s! The food is consistently outstanding and there is a nice variety of Chinese dishes.

Review1184.Review: Fantastic! One of the best Chinese meals I’ve ever had! I will be back and will tell all my friends!

Review1185.Review: The food was nonpareil, but some of the appointments were the worse for wear and tear. The hardcover menus dated to the Ming Dynasty; the covers were literally taped together, and the prices were handwritten beside crossed out earlier iterations.  Not a good look -- which gave us pause to reconsider ordering.  But we were glad we stayed.

Review1186.Review: Went for sunday brunch, Opens at noon.  Food was good. Try the short rib!

Review1187.Review: Very good restaurant with wonderful service.  They have good Chinese food.  They are a pricey place though.

Review1188.Review: This is our go to restaurant in SFO.We love getting to know the owners and their staff all are such beautiful people.Let Mr Fang create  your dinner for you if it is your first time.

Review1189.Review: We truly enjoyed the Japanese pumpkin pie belly and the blossoming tea.

Review1190.Review: So delicious and unique! An SF gem that you don't want to miss! #thebestchinesefoodever

Review1191.Review: Great meal with friends in the downstairs section which was quieter, and cozier than upstairs. Flavors are unique and refined, each dish with a distinct subtlety. The owner saw our large group of eight and took care of us without us even having to look at the menu. We had a chicken dish which you served yourself on a crisped rice ‘cookie’, very good. Then sautéed eggplant. A fantastic fish dish, the favorite of the table, was followed by a crispy beef dish. They also included a shrimp dish and of course, I almost forgot, the fresh pork bun starter, which was very good as well. Everything was excellently prepared. They even served a fried rice dish that was made at the table with a fresh omelette mixed in right before being served. The only knock on the food was that the beef dish, which was delicious btw, was slightly over cooked.

Review1192.Review: wonderful food and service; the owner will cater to all of the food desires and allergies/intolerances of the guests (including gluten free, no shellfish, no red meat, no mushrooms, yes eggplant, yes pork belly, etc...  Price is reasonable.  Flowering tea is delightful

Review1193.Review: Lunch on Friday afternoon was very busy, noisy, and smokey. We were seated immediately ordered quickly. The smoke coming from the kitchen was really bad when we first arrived, but lessened as lunch progressed. The pork confit eggrolls were really spring rolls and the confit was mushy and the whole thing drowned in a ton of a very tasty mustard sauce. Really not good. Happily this was the only misstep in an otherwise great lunch. The Eight Treasure salad was really vibrant, refreshing and crunchy. The salt and pepper fried fish with zucchini was hot, crispy, peppery. Yum.  Shanghai soup dumplings also great.

Review1194.Review: Service is terrible...that makes it charming!

Review1195.Review: Great for business meetings and large groups. Love that you can just tell staff the dietary restrictions and they order for you!!! They have large spaces for big groups.

Review1196.Review: The three of us enjoyed the apple honey prawns, Veggie pot stickers (great texture),  Salt and peppered white fish and the pumpkin and zucchini dish.

Review1197.Review: We loved Fang! The food is delicious - we walked in, had no idea what to order, and the owner took care of us without another word (beyond asking any food allergies we might have). Then the food deluge began.First off, it was all great. We're in the middle of a Chinese kick, but thought the flavor and substance of the dishes were above a lot of the fancier places we've been recently.Service was fast and attentive - our interactions were efficient bordering on brisk, which was perfect since we were starving when we got there.

Review1198.Review: Food was good but service was so slow... nice variety on the menu though.

Review1200.Review: Awesome, creative Chinese food. Not the run of mill. Absolute recommend!

Review1201.Review: One of the best Chinese restaurants I have been to Fang ordered for us and it was a feast of delicious plates of incredible variety and favors

Review1202.Review: Really incredible service and meal served by the owner himself! I felt me and my group were beautifully taken care of!

Review1203.Review: Food was only okay. Greasy, several people had upset stomachs after eating here.

Review1204.Review: Was in town for a meeting at the Moscone Center and went out for a later dinner with a friend. With a recommendation from another colleague, we went to Fang. We were told that is we went there with a group of folks, Mr. Fang himself could pick a fabulous meal for us. Since we were just two, we were looking at the menu and trying to figure out what to get. Mr. Fang noticed us and came over and asked us if he could come up with what we should eat. We eagerly agreed and he came up a with a fabulous menu. We had the house special beef, a fabulous seafood soup, pork buns and the house special fried rice. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Would definitely come back to eat.

Review1205.Review: Overpriced for what you get. Could be done a lot better. Service left a lot to be desired!

Review1206.Review: If you book a reservation make sure that it’s not too late because service and enthusiasm declines closer to closing.  I had a party of 9 people for a birthday and it was apparent that our server did not have a lot patience for our group and rushed through the meal. The food was good which somewhat made up for our lack of service. Overall, would go again for the food and smaller groups.

Review1207.Review: The food was great. I went just before 5 and it was quiet and not busy.

Review1208.Review: Awesome food.  The waitress ordered for us and it was fantastic.  The chicken fried rice had the egg cooked at the table.  pretty cool.

Review1209.Review: Fang rocks.  Very reliable cool vibes set up. I love the trust me service and cool flower teas

Review1210.Review: I use Fang when I have a large group of people to take out to lunch.  Mr. Fang always welcomes you and helps create a great menu of delicious options for you so you can relax.  Their service is fast and courteous.  I would definitely recommend Fang!

Review1211.Review: So disappointing. I made reservation for 15, appreciate the private space. We sat down and food just started coming. There was no communication (they hardly spoke English) about a fixed menu. They brought food out as if we were speed eating. It was like Panda Express. Gross. To boot it was $40 p/p plus appetizers. So it came to $1150 for that. I was entertaining customers and everyone was pit but I was so embarrassed.

Review1212.Review: Fang's was on my must eat at list.  One of the chef's was on Chopped and the intro about the chef and the cuisine sold me.  I was not disappointed, the food and service was fabulous.

Review1213.Review: Fantastic food. Low key dining room but so what. Food is Devine.

Review1214.Review: Couldn’t find anything without MSG. Meal was dripping either in oil or mustard

Review1215.Review: I love FANG and I get back here as often as I can. The food is superb and the service can't be beat.

Review1216.Review: Food was delicious! Service was lacking.

Review1217.Review: I made reservations 24 hours in advance asking that they seat us near a window and away from the kitchen and bathrooms. They sat us next to the kitchen and bathrooms-no window. We waited 20  minutes and a waitress showed up and put a karafe of water on our table, holding her hand over the opening and made no eye contact and said nothing. Another 20 minutes of waiting and they take our order. They got spooked by the diners in our party with food allergies. They messed up the order. They forgot our drink orders and part of our food order-despite asking twice. One of the diners at our table got sick (MSG). The bathrooms are FILTHY-dirty floors, overflowing trash cans, the soap dispenser is broken so the pump on the pump soap is black. I wish we could give reviews with zero stars because giving Fang one star on any rating category is a star too much. Ew!!!! Don’t go to this restaurant.

Review1218.Review: Great dinner.  But the highlight was our superb waitress who really took care with everyone in our large group

Review1219.Review: Enjoyable mapo tofu with brown rice. Shrimp dumplings (pan fried) were the stand-out.

Review1220.Review: Service was terrible.  Waited for a waiter to come to our table for 15 minutes and 20 for them to clear table and get the check.

Review1221.Review: Very disappointing. I love The House of Nanking and was excited to try this place.  Well, the food was subpar, and the service was ridiculously slow.  First, the restaurant opened an hour later than was posted on the web.  When we were seated, we had to wait a good 15 minutes before our order was taken.  We continued to wait forever for our order and, 30 minutes later, were told that they didn't have the dish we ordered.   After we ordered a second time, we had to wait another 20 minutes or so for our food.  In the meantime, we had some egg rolls that were overcooked (dark brown) and hot and sour soup, which was okay.  Our main dish, vermicelli noodles with shrimp, was also overcooked and oversauced.  Not good.  The bill was $38 for one meal, a cup of soup, and one appetizer.  Would have been worth it if it was as good as The House of Nanking, but it wasn't.  I can't believe these two places have the same owner.

Review1222.Review: Great food. We especially enjoyed the apple/shrimp, the green beans & the short ribs. The house made noodles were also delicious but did not arrive with veggies (although we were charged for them). We also were charged for veggies with the fried rice which were not received.  If not for that, the service score would have been higher.  Pomegranate margarita was tangy & refreshing but not much like a real margarita- nevertheless I would order it again. Looking forward to returning for another great meal.

Review1223.Review: Went for an early dinner on Saturday (4:30 pm).  The restaurant was nearly empty so it was quiet and our food came fairly quickly.  Service was OK, although not really attentive.  Food was well prepared and well-spiced.  The eggplant in garlic sauce and white fish dishes were excellent.  Generous portions.

Review1224.Review: It's always a pleasure dining here, especially when we have the privilege of running into the exquisite chef and Fang co-owner Kathy Fang, whose gracious hospitality only enhances a great dining experience.

Review1225.Review: Amazing dining experience!! When we told Peter it was our first time he treated us to an amazing dining experience by ordering for us & surprising us with each course. It was delicious & authentic tasting & the service was awesome!!

Review1226.Review: There was food on my clean dish so I swapped it with the neighboring table.  I also was not wearing lipstick and noticed some on my glass.  Could do a better job on dishwashing, all else was good.

Review1227.Review: Good with flavor! Waiters that will order for you if you can’t make up your mind! You’ll want to come back for seconds!

Review1228.Review: We enjoyed a variety of dishes and were pleased with every single one! Our hands-down favorite was the signature Honey & Chili Crispy Short Ribs - simply spectacular! Our other “do not miss at all costs” were the pork belly buns The food was delicious, the service was excellent and we loved the vibrant atmosphere. We have a new food memory that we will look to re-visit when we are next in SF. After all, there are a lot of dishes we want to try next time!

Review1229.Review: It is very popular with the tech crowd. When we got there at 6, 3 people servers kept coming over before we even had a chance to look at the menu. The situation was reversed when we were done and wanted our food to be packed to go. No one ever came back to take care of us. Will not be back.

Review1230.Review: Experience is typically ok at this place. That day was a disaster. All the main dishes came out and one potsticker/ dumpling type appetizer never came. When it was brought to their attention, they brought the wrong one. So they had to remake it. To make matters worse, one of our other companions had an allergic reaction to her dumplings and we thought it was MSG. As for the dish that came after the mains incorrectly, they still charged for it. A companion of ours ordered a side of rice and they brought him a whole big bowl. Service is minimal at this place. Mr. Fang is pushy when it comes to ordering for you family style. We missed his daughter Kathy’s presence coz she is always up to par and really takes care of her guests. What a bummer. I’d go back but my companions wouldn’t.

Review1231.Review: The food is always an experience here. I ate a couple of the Peking buns with shrimp. Two of us went, we also ate the portobello mushroom which was delicious and had the five spice white fish which was fantastic and together was great combo with some rice. That was plenty to eat — really love the flavoring in this place.

Review1232.Review: We love Fang for their wonderful vegetarian food and their personal service. You can order straight off the menu, but you can also just ask the chef to choose dishes for you (same is true at Fang’s sister restaurant, House of Nanking). We prefer to ask the chef to choose—and we’ve never been disappointed. Every dish was wonderful and so thoughtfully prepared. Sometimes vegetarian dishes can be an afterthought at restaurants, but not so here—you can tell that the dishes were designed with real care, and the meat eaters in our party loved them just as much as the vegetarians did. Also, the owner dropped by our table several times to tell us about the food and make sure we had enjoyed it. Such a nice personal touch!

Review1233.Review: We've been to Fang many times, however, this time the prices were insane.  Our bill was $72, before tax & tip, no drinks, 3 vegetable dishes and a small field green salad which cost pennies was $14, crazy !  The food is good no question but not for the price.  There are so many really good inexpensive Chinese restaurants in SF, next.

Review1234.Review: Das Essen hat sehr gut geschmeckt. Uns wurde ein Familienmenü empfohlen, was passed war.

Review1235.Review: Great food always. Been here many times and the owner really does a good job ordering for us without trying to rip us off. Great value meals and good service. I’m a regular here.

Review1236.Review: This is our fourth visit to Fang. We always let the manager pick a sample of items for us, and he never disappoints.  We had the crispy beef short ribs with bok choy, the five spice white fish, the honey apple prawns, the house fried rice, crispy rice cakes with vegetables, and steamed pork buns. The meat in the pork buns could have been more crispy and a sauce would have made it more enjoyable , but they were not bad. It was overall a great meal with friends.

Review1237.Review: There is the basement where our large party could be nicely accommodated.We did leave the food order up to their recommendation, that's all great - yummy!

Review1238.Review: Came here for a team lunch with my office mates. Found it through OpenTable but upon making the suggestion, found that many of my teammates had been there.Getting in and seated was a little bit of a challenge, because there was a long line of people just picking up food they had ordered on MealPal. Once we did get seated, an older man, I'm assuming an owner or manager, just asked if we'd like to have our food family style and when we said yes, said he'd take care of us. Food was delicious! We got brought out a lot of things. Highlights for me included: eggplant tofu, fried rice where the egg was cooked right in front of us, green beans. My coworkers who eat meat loved the beef and bok choy, and the whitefish. I wish we could have had more control over when the meal was over. We were done at one point, but they brought out another course. We flagged down the same man who started out talking to us to let him know we were done. Then we sat quietly for a little while until we realized we had to flag someone down to ask them for the check. That was a little awkward but it didn't take away from how good the meal was.Ambience was nice. There were nine of us at the table and we could all hear each other talk, which made for good conversation. We do team lunches frequently, and one of my team members said that this was her favorite one we've done yet. Will likely come back in the future.

Review1239.Review: Great food. Fun for a big group so can try different dishes. Chex was a little pushy but all good!

Review1240.Review: Very good Chinese food, family owned. The oenet recommends the right menu.

Review1241.Review: Our first trip to Fang delighted us in every way. We were seated promptly and on time for our reservation despite a wait for walk ins. A manager (or owner?) asked if he could take care of ordering for us and we took him up on the offer. We enjoyed every dish starting with fava beans and pork dumplings, moving on to a short rib dish, a lightly breaded sauteed shrimp dish, and finishing with sizzling rice and a fabulous dessert. The portions were perfect for our group of three. The cooking here, at least for our menu selections, was elegant with robust flavors from every dish and delightfully presented. It lacked the heavy sauces so common with many chinese restaurants. Without question, the best chinese meal I have ever enjoyed .

Review1242.Review: The service was very lacking this time. Our first dish was brought out without any rice or utensils and we had to wait awhile before we got these so we could eat. The prices for the dishes are also quite steep.

Review1243.Review: The best Chinese food we've ever had (and we've been to China).We put ourselves in the hands of the chef and were presented with 4 courses of amazingly delicious food.The pork bao were excellent examples of this dish everyone has had before, but rarely of this quality. This was followed by crispy short rib with bok choy ... crispy cubes of succulent meat in a savory sauce that was lip smackingly good. Next came soy glazed whitefish with Chinese spinach. The highlight of the meal ... perfectly poached fish in a sauce that was sweet and savory and oh so good. Sizzling fried rice was prepared tableside and had crispy bits reminiscent of Korean bibimbap.Our drink order was forgotten and we had to catch someone to finally get them, hence the ding on service, but the food made everything worth it.

Review1244.Review: The portions were very large so we were able to share two dishes with tons of left overs. The food was delicious and the service was fast.

Review1246.Review: A noisy and crowded venue, but just right for the task at hand, delicious and subtle flavors of basil and garlic and spices and various proteins cooked perfectly.  There is a comfortable casual warmth and security when all know the Universe is balanced and Time extends throughout the Multiverse of your Table reflected in Infinite Mirrors.

Review1247.Review: Great Great food with amazing flavor.  Service was quick and efficient.  For the price the food was well above expectations.  Its busy - get a reservation!

Review1248.Review: Wow what a treat this was- we were staying in San Francisco for one night with our two children when we decided to eat here. We were seated quickly a high chair was available for our youngest. The hostess selected the dishes for us and they were delicious we had a beef short rib dish that melted in the mouth, a white fish dish and prawns with apple which I would never have ordered but was so delicious. Even our usually fussy children loved the dishes. Overall cost was around $110 including all drinks too. The best Chinese I’ve ever had wish it was on our doorstep

Review1249.Review: The food was extra special.  A wide variety of dishes and unique flavors.  We especially enjoyed the vegetarian dumplings and the vegetable chow mein

Review1250.Review: The food is very mediocre. The fish is really old. The pork is overly salty. The duck is not authentic style. Many of the dishes is just below average. What made it worse is that they charged more than what’s on the menu! We didn’t realize this until we left, that the price on the receipt is 1 to 5 dollars more than the price on the menu for each dish! This is deliberate fraud! Please just avoid this restaurant or pay close attention to the final bill!

Review1251.Review: Had a wonderful time at FANG and will certainly return.  Just wish I could give it a FIVE STAR as it really should be one.  But it's not. Not hard to turn into but employees are just not gracious or friendly.POSTIVE1.  Food is delicious.  Fang was there that night and very modestly introduced himself and ordered for us.  DELICIOUS!  And he was respectful of my dietary needs2.  Quality of ingredients is stunning.NEGATIVE1.  Mentioned several times we were there celebrating our friends 60th at her suggestion.  Didn't bring out a special dessert or drink really even respond to my statement or prompt. Gift was on table so between my mentioning in reservation and at greeting with every employee and gift on table it was clear we were there to celebrate.2.  Besides Fang ordering for us, etc servers are absent. We ordered a bottle of wine and poured it ourselves. They never touched the bottle after opening it.3.  Employees are really not warm and welcoming or friendly.  They appear busy and harried and not interested in engaging. So that was disappointing.But food was back and when we return hope Fang will be there to order for us again.  I honestly will call and if he is not at work I think I will cancel.

Review1252.Review: Felt very rushed, out in a corner next to a party of 6 men and the conversation and noise level was too much. Food came and tasted much better than it looked. Nice big portions but again rushed and was cold. Servers weren’t overly friendly and weren’t happy when I tipped $10 which I felt was more than gernerous. Not a bad place if you want a quick Chinese and isn’t too expensive we were just expecting a more classy experience.

Review1253.Review: I've been to Fang on one previous occasion and ordered - Sesame chicken  and house-made noodles with chicken. It was the best I had in years! During this last visit we ordered  the exact same dishes. The Sesame chicken had double the amount of the sauce which was way to thick. They brought us a different kind of noodles than the one we ordered. When we talked to the waitress about it she said that those were the only noodle they had available. I refused the order of noodles. Then a few minutes later they came out with the original dish we had ordered. It was good but it had huge pieces of red onion and barely any noodles. I will visit Fang again and hope they were just having an off day!

Review1254.Review: FANG was GREAT! We had a large group (15) and the chef (Fang himself) came out to introduce himself and asked us if we'd like him to choose our menu for the evening. We said yes and I'm SO glad we did! We got dish after dish of amazing food, it was fun to try new things and be surprised with each course. This is definitely a great place for groups and I would highly recommend taking Fang up on his offer of selecting the menu if he asks.

Review1255.Review: Lots of fun. There were 5 of us celebrating some work anniversaries. The waitress offered to bring us the best dishes, family style. We let her pick and the food was very good. Food comes out fast and hot and very tasty.

Review1256.Review: I LOVE this place. It's such a treat to go here. The owner is so nice and friendly and the food is fantastic. So delicious! We had a colleague visiting from abroad who loves Chinese and he was thrilled with the choice. The decor has the right level of class for a nice business outing.

Review1257.Review: Had a reservation at 8:30. They close at 9:30. At 9:15 there were four tables in the restaurant. They dropped our check at 9:00pm while we were still eating - didn’t ask if we wanted anything else. Put all the chairs up on every non occupied table, even the one 10inches away from us, swept the floors around us and turned off the music. You might as well have had a big neon sign that said “get the hell out - we want to go home”. Incredibly rude to us the the other 3 tables still eating! Won’t be back

Review1258.Review: Terrible. The worst food and service. Stay clear. Awful I could not imagine a worse dining experience on all fronts.

Review1259.Review: What a great find!  We had 10 relatives in town as part of a surprise party...since we were the ones who were being surprised, we had to scramble for evening dinner reservations after the surprise lunch.  At 5p on a Saturday afternoon, we found a restaurant that could handle 12 people for a 6:30p dining date. We were seated on the basement level, which is configured for large groups.  We had an awesome, secluded table.  The proprietor (Mr. Fang) visited our table personally, and offered to "serve us" and he chose the menu selections and number of courses.  We had 7 or 8 delicious entrees, nicely varied between pork, fish, prawns, beef and veggies.  It was a perfect amount of food, and every delivery of a new course was more tasty than the last.Impromptu dinner and drinks for ~$50 per person, including tip.  I will definitely be back to visit.

Review1260.Review: For our reservation, they offered only a tiny table in the corner that we would have had to climb over people to access, so we declined.

Review1261.Review: Dishes were delicious and a definite cut above your average Chinese cuisine.  Service was friendly and professional.

Review1262.Review: It took four try’s for us to receive a food menu, they kept giving us a drink menu for a business lunch. When we finally did receive the correct menu, we were rushed to select a meal. (Got the impression they had to turn the table several times for the lunch hour). Four different waiters approached us to take our order so we really did not know who our server was. My client ordered a glass of wine and after tasting it determined it was rancid and ask that the wine be replaced. Food was at best mediocre, service terrible and the venue was extremely loud. Very difficult to have a conversation. Will not return to this establishment.

Review1263.Review: Food was excellent, yet while there were plenty of people around to assist and check on you, it just seemed as though they were doing you a favor by serving you.  Not sure where all the attitude was coming from (?)

Review1264.Review: We love Fang; we eat there all the time. We’re never disappointed. If the menu overwhelms you, simply ask Peter or Kathy Fang to order for you......they know the most popular dishes. Be sure to make a reservation. Have fun, Dr R

Review1265.Review: Amazing food and service. No need for menus as they chose for us, such interesting unusual flavours very special, whilst still remaining authentic.

Review1266.Review: Food selected by the owner, Mr. Fang. Much easier way to eat and he made great choices!

Review1267.Review: I have had the pleasure of dining with Peter at the House of Nan King.  This meal was yet another wonderful culinary experience.  The staff is always attentive, and Peter is always on top of the food coming out of the kitchen.  The Fang family has always shown a passion for food, and this meal was spot on delicious.  I would highly recommend it to any and all.  Thanks Peter and staff for the hospitality, and great food.

Review1268.Review: I was amazed to be waited on my a Chopped Champion! Kathy Fang recommended an amazing meal thatbwas low carb. Tasted great, reasonably priced. Well worth the visit on my first night ever in San Francisco.

Review1269.Review: Vacation Sizzling rice soup lukewarm and coconut flavoredNo sizzleCrispy ribs greasy fat flavor with all spice flavor

Review1270.Review: We loved the way the owner/chef volunteered to provide us the best of his fare by suggesting we surrender to his expertise and talents and allow him to make a special meal for us. We let go of controlling the menu and let him do his thing. It worked great and we had a fabulous meal, well balanced, wonderful complimentary tastes yet contrasting to the point of being a complete and wonderful meal. We will go again and do the same thing as he engendered in us a level of trust that would ensure a great meal the next time.

Review1271.Review: Food is not really good. Price is high for what you are getting. Could easily go other place with different ambience or better food for similar price.

Review1273.Review: great food but the service is lacking.  Too bad as it sets a poor impression for what is a great meal.  Apparently the 'boss' (owner) wants to take everyone's order, which is great, in concept.

Review1274.Review: Bustling spot that combines traditional Chinese restaurant features such as large tables  diners that share with other diners and family style large plates.  Excellent food and if you let the server choose your food, it's extra fun.  I was treated so I don't know what the bill was - my guess is it's pricier when they bring what they choose.

Review1275.Review: We have been here several times since moving to the Bay Area with both small and large groups of individuals ranging in all ages. I cannot tell you specifically what the menu holds as we always get what the chef is cooking along with some steamed buns. With the chef menu, you are going to get a well rounded meal that allows you to taste some of the best of the menu. If there are allergies to foods or preferences, you simply let them know and they accommodate, even some of the toughest ones. Everything is fresh served family style and we leave full, yet wanting more of the deliciousness.

Review1276.Review: Some of the food was really good, but the noodles were not the right ones.  They used curly Italian imitation cheap noodles.Also, after you cross a certain price line, you have to use cloth napkins and not flimsy paper ones!

Review1277.Review: Fantastic! Owner came to our table . Asked what foods we like and surprised us with delicious dishes. Something that we would never have ordered ourselves off the menu! It was very delicious.  And service was impeccable. Would definitely go back.

Review1278.Review: I went to Fang once five years ago while on a business trip to San Francisco and I've raved about it to everyone since. When my wife and I were visiting last weekend we had to go, and we weren't disappointed. The food is outstanding. We weren't sure what to choose so we asked the chef to decide for us. We got four dishes that were unique and delicious. Best Chinese food I've had since my last visit to Fujian. The staff is also great. One of my favorite spots to eat in the world. More Fang.

Review1279.Review: Had the best time and an incredible tour of dishes selected by Mr. Fang! From the fava beans to apple shrimp to spare rips to sesame chicken to flavorful fish and noodles. Absolutely delicious!

Review1280.Review: Food was great and Chef make time to meet us and serve his favorite dishes. Great experience.

Review1281.Review: Saturday afternoon at SFMOMA, and decided to visit this rates restaurant. Was surprised when our crispy pork belly wasn’t crispy at all. Maybe it was an off day for them.

Review1282.Review: Service was extremely slow, client had to leave the table before the check came because the waiter forgot about us after the food came out

Review1283.Review: Great huge family style portions of the most delicious dishes I ever tasted n a Chinese restaurant

Review1284.Review: The food was delicious and the service was prompt and friendly. Easy to make reservations on the website

Review1285.Review: Fang is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants.  The food is reasonably authentic  -  certainly more so than in the average Chinese restaurant.  And it is very good.Mr. Fang owns House of Nankai in Chinatown, which has excellent food and horrible atmosphere.  His daughter runs Fang.  It has the same food in a much more comfortable setting.

Review1286.Review: We had a wonderful time celebrating Father's Day at FANG!  The food was amazing and the servers were all very nice and cheerful as well.  I have already started recommending this restaurant to my friends.

Review1288.Review: Food was great however service was less than desirable. If not for the food, I would not recommend this place. Server was late and had to be reminded we were still waiting to place the order. Was grumpy throughout the time. But food came on time and was really tasty.

Review1289.Review: We went bc owner won Chopped! What a disappointment. They brought out 2 dishes that were not what we ordered & weren't bothered by it. No apologies. The food is really sub-par, like a below average Chunese take out place. Certainly not what we expected from someone who won Chopped! Will never go back.

Review1290.Review: We made reservations at FANG due to it's high rating on Yelp.  While they were able to seat us in a reasonable time, it appeared that they weren't tracking our reservation at all.  So, after being seated behind the bar, in a tight corner, and where one had to ask the table next to you to get up and move so you could be seated (really strange) we looked at the menu.  We order drinks/cocktails, appetizers, and entrees.  A few moments later one of our party's entrée showed up.  When we inquired about our drinks and appetizers and to why one entrée would be presented before the starters, the entrée was removed and presumably set behind the counter somewhere, as when it arrived for the second time (after appetizers, but still before our cocktails) it was room temperature.  Wait staff was friendly but never checked in on us other than to drop off food selections at random times. As for the food itself.  Meh.  It's typical Asian-fusion food.  Nothing spectacular to write about. Even their signature chicken dish was "ordinary" and the sweet potato pairing was uninspired and disconnected.  Nothing was bad, nothing was exceptional either.When the bill arrived we asked to have the early-arriving entrée removed from the tab.  They were quick to remedy the situation.  Still, for the price, strange service, and so-so food I wouldn't return.

Review1292.Review: Had the Pork belly and pumpkin---a highlight.  Mongolian beef, spicy wonton soup,  white rice, and had them special order a plate of stir fried bok choy as the veggie items are a bit limited.Everything was medium spicy --hot and savory but not overly powerful.  Great place with round tables with lazy susans to make food sharing easy.  Very good prices for value.

Review1293.Review: Stack of menus on our table were filthy. Chewed up corners and covers and food and grease splatters all over them. Waiters t shirt was also filthy. Turned completely off by this. Food was sub par.

Review1294.Review: Fang is easily the best Chinese restaurant I’ve ever been to! As we were looking through the menu, the owner actually came to our table and when we told him we had never been, he took the menu away and said he will take care of us. Half of our group was vegetarian and every single thing that came out was delicious. I will be back every time that I’m in San Francisco!

Review1295.Review: They brought us a delicious array of dishes--veg, fish, prawns, noodles, meat--in succession and we were never at a loss for new flavors, even as our appetites gradually grew sated!

Review1296.Review: Excellent food and service. Chef heard it was our first visit and treated us to a blind tasting. Everything was amazing!

Review1297.Review: Very torn about this place. On the one and most important hand, the food was excellent. Mr. Fang pretty much insisted we let him order for us, and while that wouldn't make a lot of people comfortable, we rolled with it and it was great. But the music was terrible and way too loud for Sunday brunch, and the service was indifferent. If they brought up their game on those two fronts, it would be a fabulous place.

Review1298.Review: What a wonderful experience. My wife and I were wanting some great San Francisco Chinese on our first night in town and Fang brought it. As per the recommendations online we asked the older gentleman (I believe Mr Fang?) to order for us. Wow it was several courses and we enjoyed every bite. It was just the right amount of food for two. Every bite was delicious and I’m sad that I can’t find equivalent Chinese here in Austin. I will be back.

Review1300.Review: It was for lunch, before we went to MOMA. Mostly good food.

Review1301.Review: Excellent food and service. Kathy and Peter present wonderful lunch/dinner menus, which will fit any palate. We are frequent diners.....it’s always good.Dr R

Review1303.Review: Owner said that count on him not select from the menue.Beaf with vegetables was great, soup with dumpling and nodules was taste so good.Fried rice is bit oily.

Review1304.Review: Great food — amazing selection. Chef took our menus away and just brought us food, and everything was phenom.

Review1305.Review: Great Chinese food, a bit crowded seating, service is quite basic but the food compensates for a lot.

Review1306.Review: I have eaten Chinese food all over the world And I have to say without exception this was the absolute worst I have ever had

Review1307.Review: We booked Fang at random and had a great meal..... followed the proprietors menu recommendations and were pleased we did. The menu is quite eccentric, so its worth asking for some advice. Very good value for money.

Review1309.Review: The food here is so good...but the service continues to be terrible.  While the food cones quickly, there's no actual wait service per seat.  They take your order, and slam your food down in HUGE bowls that mean there's little to no room to fit everything in on the tables for 2 or 4.  They seem like automatons, and never engage.  And it took 30 mins to get our check this time.  There's other places we can spend our money, but it's a shame this place doesn't up their game.  Also, a year since our last visit and the elevator is still broken.  Meaning no disabled access to the nicer lower level...

Review1310.Review: Great food at fairly reasonable prices. Truly authentic Chinese fare, including the kitchen discussions going on. I would highly recommend this place!

Review1311.Review: They seated us even though we were late, which was nice. We sat in the back near boxes in the bar, but the waiter was fast and good, finding his way to our table.Zucchini buns were delicious, yellow curry was delicious. Spicy noodles with cod was good too.Quick service, family run restaurant with fresh food, good sauces and spices.

Review1312.Review: I dined at Fang about two years ago and the food and service were much better.  This time, we were seated next to the service line where the noise level was annoying due to the constant chatter of the cooks and servers.  Our server spoke practically no English and simply deposited the food on the table with no comment.  Mr. fang was seen wandering about but never bothered to stop by to see how we were doing..  The food was good and the value was good.  There are too many good places to eat in San Francisco, we won't be back at Fang.

Review1314.Review: We came here on a Saturday evening because we wanted authentic Chinese food, and the reviews were pretty good and the food looked delicious .However, the experience went from bad to worse from moment we walked in. We told the first server we saw (a woman) that we had a reservation. She said she'd setup our table and walked away. Three other people then asked to help us, apparently unaware that we had already been helped. A fourth person then sat us at the bar while we waited for our table. There was no one behind the bar to help us. A server did come up and poor a glass of wine for another customer, but he did not acknowledge us at all or ask us if we wanted anything.  After being ignored and seated at the bar (rather than a table), we decided to leave. This is too bad because the food did look  and smell really good. But we just did not appreciate the sub-par, inefficient, and extremely disorganized service.

Review1315.Review: A traditional Chinese restaurant with some unusual and tasty twists.  We started with lightly pickled and slightly sweet cucumbers, a refreshing start to the meal.  The pork buns, open steamed buns with rich pork within were delicious and had us wanting more.  Fang's signature honey chili shortrib was cubed, a nice surprise; we liked the crispness of the accompanying bok choy, but it didn't have much actual flavor.  Noodles with clams and pork was unusual and tasty, although the noodles a little overcooked.  Garlic eggplant with vegetable dumplings were a nice combination. Their wine menu is better than most Chinese restaurants, but I tried a special cocktail with apple, ginger and vodka which reminded me of cough medicine, so I'll stay away from those on my next visit.    We left the food selection to the chef, Peter Fang, who was walking around and happy to recommend options.

Review1316.Review: Overall an average experience. The food wasn’t up to expectations followed by poor service and cleanliness. At the least, be friendly to your customers.

Review1318.Review: Delicious food! Great service as well. Thank you to the staff and chef.

Review1319.Review: Biggest disappointment in years of dining in San Francisco!  Tasteless food, poorly presented, gummy noodles that tasted like they were cooked yesterday, surly service...almost as bad as House of Nanking which had previously had been our worst dining experience in the city.  Don't waste your time or money at either.

Review1320.Review: Vegetarian and vegan friendly, just make sure to tell the server on any food restrictions. The Sauteed Garlic Peashoots and Panfried tofu with yellow curry sauce, and seasonal veggies are one of the many highlights on the menu.If you're feeling adventurous, have the waiter order for you.

Review1321.Review: I wish the noodle/rice dishes would come first. Our 5-spice fish came before our xiao long bao appetizers. Food sequence could have been better.

Review1322.Review: Really awesome food, convenient location after a Sf Moma visit!

Review1323.Review: Unfortunately I found a long hair in my food. The restaurant staff were not very friendly too.

Review1324.Review: What a great place to eat!  The food was interesting and fresh.  I took a couple of clients there and we all loved our meal!  It was suggested that we let the server bring us several of their choices for us and I'm glad we didn't order off the menu.  It was perfect.

Review1325.Review: Fantastic array of dishes brought to the table. We only made a couple of special requests, they were honored excellently. Will definitely come here again

Review1326.Review: Chef offered his own selection to our table of 6.  Each dish exceeded expectation.   Bravo.

Review1327.Review: It was not good... not what it used to be. Now they use too much sugar in their sauces (the sweet potatoes/tofu dish had a marmalade sauce) and their other sauces are based on store bought mayonnaise....    it is too bad. It used to be a very good restaurant.  They have gone lazy.....   this is my second bad meal there.  I think that was my last attemp.

Review1328.Review: We had a very nice meal here.  It wasn't very busy on a Sunday night and we ate early.  We saw tasty looking food on tables either side of us, and we weren't sure what to order, we both like Chinese and were just looking at the menu and the server suggested doing a tasting menu.  So we did! She told us how much it was, and we thought it sounded very reasonable.  They kept bringing over food and everyone kept looking at us jealously!  We liked everything they brought across and were very happy with her suggestion.  We thought for the amount of food delivered it really was very reasonably priced.  Perfect with the two of us, we tried far more dishes than we would have, if we'd selected larger dishes.  Service was friendly and efficient the night we went, and overall we had a great experience.  I would eat there again on a future trip to San Francisco. It was very close to the Convention Center, Marriott and Intercontinental.

Review1329.Review: The pics they post are deceiving. Not classy or quaint. Busy, loud, crowded. Even if you asked for good to come out in a paced fashion so that you can enjoy it it won’t. They bring it when and what order they want. I don’t know why they list appetizers, ours came out the last item of everything coming out at once. The tables around us had the same issue. Instead of a nice dinner out all we did was eat and hurry.

Review1330.Review: Mr Fang took great care of our group! He selected the perfect variety of dishes and the right amount. The honey prawns are amazing! So was the sesame chicken. And we loved all the appetizers. Everything tasted fresh and delicious. Very reasonable prices as well. We were seated in the basement, which feels a little dungeon-like, but was fine and good for our group of 16 people. The piped music was too loud, but also not a big deal. I’ll be back for more of that great food!

Review1331.Review: One of the best experiences!  Chef ordered for us... everything was excellent !  A definite winner of a place, especially for large groups.

Review1332.Review: The menus were dirty, the good had MSG in it, the water tasted like it had been stored in a metal container. I would not recommend this restaurant.

Review1333.Review: The owner took over ordering and

Review1334.Review: This was our second occasion dining at Fang's and the food was as good as it was the first time.  We always let the owner order for after explaining our preferences.  The food arrives at the table quickly as soon as it is prepared and in an order which doesn't rush your dining experience.  Service is excellent and the variety exceptional.  Highly recommended.

Review1335.Review: Server chose all our dishes which were all great, varied and tasty. Very pleasant scene. Perfect for pre-YBCA performance

Review1336.Review: The dumplings and egg roll was horribly over fried and greasy, those items that were stir-fried lacked flavor after we expressed to our server to “add some heat”!to the dish. The service was annoying, no ambiance, cleanliness was average at best. Save your money and go somewhere on Grant St in Chinatown.

Review1337.Review: Food was good, but service was terrible.  Had to flag someone down to take our order, refill water and even to get our check.  Dishes were never cleared from table and no one bothered to ever check on us.  Food is not stellar enough to justify a return visit.

Review1338.Review: The food was good. Perhaps get it for take-out as the service was horrible. Every time I asked for something, like water or about the menu, the waiter acted like I was inconveniencing him. We didn't ask that many questions or make many requests. When I started to ask my first question, about a menu item, the waiter curtly answered and walked away. We still needed a bit of help, it was our first time there. Our food was practically thrown on the table.

Review1339.Review: The food is consistently outstanding, while at the same time varying from your "standard" chinese fare.  Definitely recommend Fang for a great meal.

Review1340.Review: Fang is a local gem, close to the convention center. The owners and waitstaff are wonderful and for for a “real” Fang experience, ask them to order for you, you won’t be disappointed! Do make a reservation. Enjoy!!Dr R

Review1342.Review: Horrible service and not great food. I was embarrassed to have made reservations here.

Review1344.Review: Kathy Fang is an incredible chef as well as a lovely and gracious person. Her food never disappoints. The staff is young but very friendly and customer oriented. We always dine here when visiting from out of town.

Review1345.Review: Food was good. Had the Mongolian beef and the ginger chicken. Their shao lam bao are not bad, but  not enough broth inside the dumpling in my opinion. They have some duck "buns", but they just we're little taco like dishes with the shell being pork-bun material. Was weird, not great. Service was really bad all around. From being received by the host. To being seated. To getting orders taken. And even getting more water. Really needs improvement. Cocktails are very strong. I think that's good. But one person's drink at my table really tasted like straight up vodka. A full glass of vodka lol.

Review1346.Review: Not your run of the mill Chinese. Prepare to be surprised.

Review1347.Review: Food was good, but ambiance and service were just “ok.” On the ambiance, it’s a little crammed/some of the tables are too close together. On the latter, it’s not House of NK, but not exactly warm either. Also, all our food came at once - no pacing/not a fan of that style. Not really a date/special evening spot. We’d go back if we happen to be in the area and are hungry for casual, tasty Chinese.

Review1348.Review: Terrible service and out of three things we wanted by six o'clock. Natives treated like tourists. Bad move.

Review1349.Review: The food was great, as always. But the service was a complete catastrophe. Super slow, and when a server finally showed up there was a tangible attitude. We asked for a new round of beverages 3 times over a span of 40 minutes and nothing happened. Also found an item on our bill that we had ordered but never received.

Review1350.Review: We wanted Dim Sum as that is how the restaurant was listed.  It was not available.  We ordered off the menu.  Food was excelllent just not what we expected.

Review1351.Review: I first visited Fang maybe 7-8 years ago, when I considered it sort of the "upscale" cousin to House of Nan King, which I've enjoyed for well over 25 years. The food continues to be fantastic. Sadly, the service on my recent visit was not great; not rude or poor, just inattentive and sort of careless. For example, we had a 9pm reservation, and at about 9:45, they came by and put the chairs up on the table next to us, as if telling us it was time to leave. Also, as I looked around the restaurant, the once-fresh decor had deteriorated ever-so-slightly. It needs, if not a refresh, a deep clean.Fortunately, the food (we had the sesame chicken and their signature short ribs, along with the Japanese pumpkin soup and the noodle pot with seafood), was amazing. Still among the best Chinese cooking I've had anywhere. Amazing flavors, textures, sauces/broths, etc. Really perfectly assembled.

Review1352.Review: The owner kept talking us into getting dishes different from what we wanted to order, by saying that you should get B instead of A. His suggested dishes didn't taste well at all and turned out to be expensive. He also misled us into ordering more than we could eat by not providing info on the size of dishes, but his expression gave it away that we ordered too much so I asked him to cut one dish and he explicitly told us he would stop our conversation there and ignored our request. In the end we couldn't finish a lot of the food and the two dishes he suggested were the ones we didn't touch much because they were bad...This is the worst experience I have had at any restaurant. Please avoid this place if you don't want to be manipulated or waste your money.

Review1353.Review: Epic food, Fang is a ledge. Ordered everything for us and it was our 1st time

Review1354.Review: I have lived in SF since the 90s and this was the worst food service experience I've ever had. we waited 20 minutes before a waiter came. he didn't write down our order and had to ask us to repeat the whole thing. we got charged for items we didn't order and items we ordered never came. they never picked up our menus so we had to put them on the floor when the food came to make room. they never asked us if we wanted a second drink so we just started opening beers that were in my backpack, and of course no one noticed.  what a disaster.  homemade noodles were quite good.

Review1355.Review: Best Chinese meal in SF! Ask for house special. Don't order off the menu.

Review1356.Review: Service can be very spotty, but the food is always spot on.

Review1357.Review: terrible service, you have to ask for anything like water, napkins and you may have to ask twice.

Review1358.Review: Great food! Let the chef choose for you.  Everything is amazing!

Review1359.Review: Fang always serves us well for team lunches with 15+ people...plenty of space, food is quite good (including vegetarian options), and they make ordering easy - just ask for help. There’s a full bar and the overall value is excellent too .

Review1360.Review: Great food.  A slightly different take on Chinese food

Review1361.Review: The owner/chef came by and asked if any of us had eaten there. We all said no and he grabbed our menus and said he would take care of us and promised we would like it. We were all very impressed! Every dish they brought us was so yummy! Cannot wait to go back! One of my new favorites now in SF!

Review1362.Review: Overall Fang is still a good restaurant if you know what to order or lucky enough to get a good server to recommend. Not all servers give good recommendations. Restaurant is under staffed for busy hours. A reasonable choice if attending the convention nearby.

Review1364.Review: For starters, my middling review was for this visit in particular. This was my fourth (and may be my last) visit to Fang's. The first three times I've gone were excellent. We were well taken care of (once with 4, once with 8, one with 18) on all those occasions and the food was great.This time however.... all the food was WAY too salty and our server was the pits. She wasn't listening when we were asking questions while considering our order. Was unhelpful in making suggestions (in fact, the other three times the server - twice it was the owner - were quite pleased&helpful in making suggestions). She brought out white rice (which we had to remind her to do after she brought all the entrees) instead of the brown rice we had ordered. When clearing she was leaning over the table and pulling dirty dishes from the other side of the table right in front of my face and proceeded to stack all the dirty dishes right next to me.It was so bad that we actually left less than 10% tip which is SUPER unusual for me (in fact, i can't remember the last time I did such a low rate). I'm not saying I won't go back but I certainly won't be the one that recommends it. Feels like, this past Friday,  they used the wait staff from House of Nanking... their sister restaurant. That place has a reputation for busy, low-touch service but you go in their expecting in (the good, when I've been, has been excellent though)

Review1365.Review: The head chef treated my group of 20 to a blind menu that just blew our minds dish after dish.  What a great treat, and great space for our large group.

Review1366.Review: A bit disappointing, I think the restaurant has seen fresher days.  The menus lacked care…and pages, the food was OK, but not exciting, in general, the restaurant just seemed a little tired.

Review1367.Review: In a town not known for great Chinese food, Fang was very good.   Much better than anything in Chinatown.  Never been to their sister restaurant, Nanking, however. Some dishes could use a bit more spice or flavor,  but overall a decent effort. The place could use a refresh to decor/menus. Would return.

Review1368.Review: The food was amazing. Kathy Fang is an incredible chef. Everything we had was delicious and I look forward to going back.

Review1369.Review: Great food- though, service is slow and sporadic. Definitely recommend, just "go with the flow" and don't be in a rush and you'll enjoy it more!

Review1370.Review: Good food, served family style for large groups. Quite a variety. We had a great time.

Review1371.Review: Food was very good and the service was ok.  The pan fried veggie dumplings were outstanding and worth a try.

Review1372.Review: Slow service (understaffed). Mistake on the order (meat on vegetarian requested meal). Creepy manager.

Review1373.Review: The worst food i had in SF since moving there 4 months ago

Review1374.Review: We had a great meal, complete with several vegetarian options, fish and crispy spare ribs.

Review1376.Review: Above average Chinese food.Reasonable prices for generous portions.If not for the very poor service this would score high. Not a feel  good experience

Review1377.Review: Excellent experience. Mr. Fang himself ordered for us. The dishes were outstanding with unique use of customary Asian ingredients. The vegetables were very fresh. The tastes were amazing. Thank you Mr. Fang!

Review1378.Review: Excellent food and fast service. The location was very convenient to our hotel as well. I highly recommend.

Review1379.Review: We had a nice meal for 6. The food was delicious and the owner selected a few dishes for us that were very tasty. Food arrived quickly however the waitstaff was not very attentive. Had to ask for water a few times and they never asked us if we were ok or needed more drinks.

Review1380.Review: The service was not very friendly and the restaurant was not very clean at all.  We were sat near the kitchen where it was really hot, which was not ideal at all. They need a better ventilation system in there, you smell like food when you leave and for the rest of the day. The food was really good though.

Review1381.Review: This was our third time dining here when we come to San Francisco the food is awesome!

Review1382.Review: Our first time, would definitely return.Everyone enjoyed the meal.Beyond our expectations.

Review1383.Review: Let the owner / chef  pick your appetizers and entrees, he knows what he's doing.The spareribs were melt in your mouth amazing!

Review1385.Review: Friend’s entree did not arrive, and we waited about 10 minutes, until someone checked.  When it did arrive, it was not chicken breast (as per menu) but dark meat.  Fang did not charge her, but she left hungry.  My entree was OK, not bad— kind of fried chicken with sweet and sour sauce.  But possible there are better things on menu.

Review1386.Review: We had chefs choice. He catered towards our taste preferences - eg. No spice. We had the fish stew (which is the restaurant special), pea sprouts, and a pork dish. Overall great service but avoid getting the tea, it is 4 dollars per cup which is a lot for a Chinese restaurant. I did get a bit of a small stomach the next day though, it might have been the milk used in the fish stew.

Review1387.Review: Disappointing meal. Invited a friend who is a vegetarian, and just started to eat seafood. Usually the owner sets a good selection for us, but not this time. The tofu dumpling got replaced with zucchini dumpling which was okay. There was no vegetarian dish at all, instead two fish dishes. Half fried fish with curry, not that great and expensive ($27) and filet fish with fresh spinach in hot oil was okay($18). Chicken with yellow bell pepper came has way too much cumin ($18) and not a good combination. The beef and baby bok choy is still very good. Next time we will order from the menu. Also, Chinese flower tea usually come in a pot. It came by the glass,  too strong and expensive.

Review1388.Review: I love eating here. Mr. Fang himself will design your entire meal once you tell him your dietary restrictions. The remainder of the waitstaff are okay but slow movers. The food is incredible. The Honey Apple Prawns and Chili Shortrib are amazing

Review1389.Review: Love that we don’t have to order and the kitchen just brings out wonderful dishes.  The crispy short ribs were out of this world.

Review1390.Review: The service seemed completely un-interested in our presence, which was in contrast to other reviews I had read indicating that they applied a personal touch to ordering. We ordered some appetizers, and had to flag someone down after quite a long time to order drinks and entrees. I was only able to place one drink order, since they didn't come back for over 30 minutes after we ordered mains. I might have ordered more wine, but I guess they're not super concerned with margin? It was a confusing experience overall - I'd read good reviews, I had understood the place to be more upscale than it was in the live experience (maybe the neighborhood? or the branding?) and I grew up going to House of Nanking which was always excellent and vibrant and it seems they're somehow related. But, the overall experience was mediocre and sort of disappointing. All the food we ordered was oddly sweet, except the hot & sour soup. Even the xiao long bao was too sweet; not a dish I expected that from.

Review1391.Review: We had two vegetarians in our group.  When placing the order (pretty sure it was the owner who took our order), he asked if we had any vegetarians as he could tell by some of what we were ordering and how we were ordering.  Since he could tell we weren't sure about what we were ordering (our first time here based on recommendation of a colleague), he said, "let me take care of you."  So he decided a couple of our dishes for us and boy are we glad.  He did an awesome job.  I'm not vegetarian, and I loved the vegetarian dishes we had (we got a couple with meat for us carnivores).  Really good, tasty food.  Service was mostly good.  Had to ask for more hot water for our tea (more than once as waitress forgot), but really, overall, it was very, very good.  Definitely coming back.

Review1392.Review: The food here is wonderful. My friend and I ordered hit and sour soup, spare ribs, and fried calamari.  These dishes can be boring, but not at Fang.  Each dish was prepared in a different and delicious way.  All I can say is Yum!

Review1393.Review: All the food we ordered was so mediocre to poor that we would never order the food again. Service was poor.I will not return.

Review1394.Review: Food: colorful, cooked well, but seasoning mainly MSG. No depth to flavoring. Service: rushed, inattentive. Took 5 asks to get a bowl of plain rice. Wverything brought at once except rice, then salad after. Staff in a hurry up mode, rushing to clear table and hovering unpleasantly. Ambience: so noosy it made my head hurt.Overall I would not eat there again!!!

Review1395.Review: A great little Chinese restaurant. The food was amazing and there was a great variety.

Review1397.Review: Food was excellent. Service was weird. The owner rushes you &zidovudine the only one taking the order. Unfortunately, his rudeness was put into the employees, whom he yelled and screamed at, in the restaurant.

Review1398.Review: This was our first time at Fang.  I believe the problem with our experience was that we didn't order well.  The short ribs were delicious and perfectly prepared!  The hot and sour soup  was mediocre, at best.  The pot stickers we ordered because the menu said they were served with  Fang's signature Sweet Chili Mustard Sauce  -- the sauce tasted like prepared yellow mustard PERIOD.  We will probably go back because  the short ribs were delicious, some of the food at nearby tables looked quite good, and  many other reviews on YELP were favorable.  So we're going to chalk this up to poor choices on our part.

Review1399.Review: Our first time there, we were a table of 8. The owner chef  Mr Fang came to our table and asked if it was our first time. He then asked if there were any dietary restrictions. We had  a couple of vegetarians in our group. He asked us to let him order for us like a chefs “omakase”. OMG! We had 9 delicious dishes not found on the menu. From the fava beans, pea shoots, portabello mushrooms and vegetarian potstickers for the vegetarians to the regular  potstickers, deep fried pork belly, honey apple shrimp, rock cod, housemate noodles with clams, every dish was unique and wonderful. This is an innovative restaurant neither Cantonese nor mandarin in style  but a delightful can’t miss SF experience.

Review1400.Review: Best Chinese food in town  -- special attention to ingredients and fascinating recipes created by Mr. Peter Fang, who was already famous for his House of Nanking tiny place in  Chinatown.  If you want, Mr. Fang will create a combination of dishes for you after you have told him the kinds of things you like.  Always special!

Review1401.Review: Excellent food! Especially the short ribs and shrimp.

Review1402.Review: The food is average, but the service is absolutely terrible. We didn’t even order our entrees and they put the check down on the table.

Review1403.Review: As always, the food here is incredible. Some of the best Chinese food in San Francisco. We ordered a shrimp dish, short ribs, pea shoots, and mei fun - rice noodles the size of ramen. We also ordered rice. We received all of our dishes except for the rice, which we had to request *four* times before we received any. The food here is fantastic and the place is always busy, but the service started out less than stellar and has not improved since they first opened. If you have the time and patience to deal with the service, I recommend Fang. If poor service is a hot button for you, don't bother.

Review1404.Review: Enjoyed Fang's excellent food and service, until a major MSG headache hit after eating the (delicious) peas shoots; my friend felt it too.  The server was not able to answer questions about MSG other than that yes, they used it in some things.  Please use less or preferably no MSG, and let customers know so they can avoid MSG.

Review1405.Review: Absolutely delicious. First time there. Manager took over and ordered for us. Could not have been more pleased.

Review1406.Review: Everything was wonderful, but the wonton soup was especially amazing!

Review1407.Review: You might go here for the homemade noodles or because it is right next door to SFMOMA but the restaurant is very tired and not very inviting.

Review1408.Review: Very good food.  Exceptionally poor service.

Review1409.Review: I was not surprised by the meal format because I read previous reviews.  Otherwise I would be confused.  The chef asked "do you trust me?" and we said we did.  Then he proceeded to order our dinner.  Dishes kept coming out until  we said we were full.   Each dish was something I wouldn't think to try and it was all very tasty.  The raw bok choy in one dish and the cold pumpkin salad were interesting, not sure I would like that again.  Our dinner was on a Wednesday night with Dreamforce happening a block away so the restaurant was pretty busy.  I didn't feel rushed to finish and leave.   For all the yummy dishes we got the price was reasonable.  I would come try this place again.

Review1410.Review: They will order for you. I recommend. They brought out a great variety of apps and entrees.Food is ridiculously great.

Review1411.Review: Great food but be aware when they tell you they'll get the food for you and you don't have to order from the menu.  Ended up with a $140 lunch bill for 3 people!!! Order off the menu. Otherwise very gracious staff and good service.

Review1412.Review: This was a great experience. We had a few different types of special needs eaters and the owner basically just brought us out a bunch of items - all of which were amazing. I love when the chef just brings us the best cross- section of what a restaurant does best - this is the best way to discover something new and get outside your comfort zone! Highly recommended and great with a group because you can sample many different items. Served quickly as well.

Review1413.Review: Inventive delicious Chinese dishes.  Great stop before or after MOMA.

Review1414.Review: Poor service especially by the owner. The food Isn’t good enough and the ambience not nice enough to justify the surly service. Much better, no MSG Chinese food in the City.

Review1415.Review: Delicious lunch!  Salt and pepper shrimp was amazing

Review1416.Review: We found this gem while in town for business and we make sure when we return we have a meal or two there. Great staff and creative meals. Just love this place. Thank you.

Review1417.Review: The owner and wait staff prescribed food and made the meal a fun experience for the group.  Overall, the food was good and the atmosphere was lively.

Review1418.Review: Great noodles , great service. I'd definitely go back!

Review1419.Review: I have gone to Fang and House of Nan King several times since childhood. I have grown to rely on the Chef's special because it allows me to try new dishes and the price is always reasonable. We went for mom's 69th birthday this time and for a table of 15 with 5 children. We were seated downstairs and it was really noisy as there were a few big parties. The food was great as it always has been. The service was extremely lacking because of the language barrier and intrusiveness of the wait staff while we were dining. I can normally put up with that. However, at the end of the meal no one checked on us and it took almost 30 minutes to get us the bill. To my shock that bill was a whopper. When the waitress presented it to my she made sure to tell me that gratuity was not yet included. I'm sorry but while the food was tasty it was certainly not worth that price in my book.
