When I averaged out the price for the number of people it was over $50 pp. there were five children who barely ate a spoonful. I'm still scratching my head as to how it got to be so expensive since there isn't a breakdown of what I was charged.

Review1420.Review: We had a group of 15 colleagues that was comfortably accommodated in the dining room downstairs. I recommend going for the family style option as it's the easiest way to get enough food for a large group and allow people to sample multiple dishes. Everyone loved the food and it was quiet enough to have multiple conversations going at various ends of the table. Highly recommended for groups, especially for business lunches.

Review1421.Review: Best eggplant in ginger sauce.The beef was very tasty.The fried rice was steaming hot n spicyHighly recommend this place for authentic chinese

Review1422.Review: Worst ever. Dirty, poor service , left without getting food

Review1423.Review: We are foodies from Portland and were really looking forward to FANG.  However, the food was C+ at best.  It's a cute place - good vibe.  But we didn't find it to be the authentic Chinese experience for San fransisco.

Review1424.Review: Fang was a very pleasant surprise.  When the owner heard it was our first time there, he took away the menus and started sending over dishes of his own choice, which were all fantastic.  I wish every restaurant owner would do that.  It saved us 20 minutes of asking superfluous questions, and it rewarded us with superb-tasting dishes that we would never have thought of ordering on our own, like the Shanghai fava beans.  We are definitely coming back, even though traffic is murder...

Review1425.Review: We had a large group and this was the first visit for most of us. The chef offered to order for us, and it couldn't have been better. Amazing food!

Review1426.Review: Great food, the owner/manager helped us out greatly while ordering. Highly recommend this place for great food and a good time with friends or colleagues.

Review1427.Review: My wife and I had different takes. I thought the food was ok. My wife thought it better, but when pressed, it was because it was different. I agreed it was different (in a good way) but was still just ok. So I wouldn't not recommend, but with all the good food in sf, hard to recommend. Service was very good.

Review1428.Review: Our office has always enjoyed the Fangs dining experience.  The owner makes it incredibly easy by making dish recommendations.  We have never been disappointed by simply following his recommendations.  As a group, we usually specify that we'd like a "fish", "beef" and "chicken" dish, and he places an order for us.  It's easy, it's fun, and allows us to focus on the conversation.Note:  Make sure you always request the Fangs special crispy shortribs.  They are mouth watering.

Review1429.Review: The food was good, but our experience was poor due to the unfriendly and neglectful service.

Review1430.Review: To be very fair this was a Saturday Night but the tables are very small, you are sitting almost at the table next to you. My husband and I were seated first in a group of about 6 couples.  There seemed to be only one person taking food orders.  All of the other couples were waited on first. Finally, we complained and were waited on.  The waiter made some suggestions we agreed too.  All of the tables got their food, each table had several courses in the meantime we sat there with nothing. Again we complained and proceed to receive all of the several courses squeezed on our tiny table at once.  The good news is the food was great.  The check was wrong when it was given to us the first time. Again another complaint.

Review1431.Review: We enjoyed our dinner at Fang, party of 2, 7:00 on a Friday night.  The sesame chicken with sweet potatoes was enough for 2, and the noodle dish was excellent.  Oddly, my entree arrived a good 10 minutes before my husband's entree. As the restaurant got busier, it got too noisy for quiet conversation.  But overall, it was satisfying.

Review1432.Review: Mr Fang took away our menus as it was our first time. He hand picked our meal and brought us a five course meal family style. Awesome experience.

Review1433.Review: Peter, the chef/owner is very attentive and took very goodcare of us. It was my Dad's 83rd birthday and Peter said, "leave the ordering to me!"  He chose perfectly. My Dad loved every bite.  Not super creative food, but the basics are very good.

Review1434.Review: Unusual, creative dishes. The Nanking chicken was outstanding as was the tofu with eggplant and mushrooms!

Review1435.Review: Wonderful place for a team business dinner. Great vegetarian options and if you have a party of 18 or less, the Tibetan side room is a nice place for a group. I will absolutely book here again!

Review1436.Review: Good food. Thanks It was a very homely setting, liked it all the way

Review1437.Review: Amazing 18 person Birthday dinner!  Chef Fang prepared amazing dishes without us even looking at the menu and it ended up being less than $25 a person, with tip. Creative, scrumptious dishes.

Review1438.Review: The owner was great The food was outstanding This was such a wonderful suggestion from our hotel and it was within walking distance to it.We will be back for sure when in town.Thank you for beautiful dinner Fang staff.

Review1440.Review: Excellent chinese food. Everthing we had was extremeely tasty....and different.highly recommend

Review1441.Review: Food was great. Mongolian beef short ribs were amazing. Definitely a must.

Review1443.Review: Excellent Chinese food in San Francisco. One of my favorite restaurant in SF.

Review1444.Review: The best authentic Chinese food you’ll experience at an upscale place. The owner and chef personally came to speak with us and was receptive to any of our needs. Amazing service and food

Review1445.Review: The server was wearing a dirty t-shirt.  They were out of tofu at 1 pm on a Thursday.  Not sure how this place is in business in SF.

Review1446.Review: Seating is odd--even for Chinese.  Service was distracted and slow.  Evening was saved a bit by better than expected food.  This evening was less made less pleasant by being seated next to a very loud group who were tolerated by management.

Review1447.Review: I was never a fan of Chinese food until now. Fang is absolutely fantastic food. I will be back.

Review1448.Review: We had five people and we asked the boss (yeah their boss is often there to answer your questions) to recommend some dishes to us but he walked away without saying anything and personally decided five dishes for us without asking for consent. The dishes he delivered were expensive and some of them are mediocre. For example, they put spicy oil in a soup that is supposed to be savory and original. Also they put pickled cabbage under duck meat, which is weird. But their fish and a cubed beef are good. And they mistook the only dish that we ordered on our own. When we saw the bill we figured that the dishes they picked for us were kinda above average price and we feel that it's not really appropriate for them to do so. So our overall experience wasn't that good. We suggest the restaurant should really make the customers feel at home and have full control in what they are eating.

Review1449.Review: Owner/chef just brought us dishes. We had read he might do this. Everything was delicious the cubed ribs with book choi were outstanding as was was the duck with cockles and wheat noodles. Tab was about $70 before tip.

Review1450.Review: The posted health department rating of 74 out of 100 pretty much sums up the experience.  Filthy.  Terrible food.  Potstickers actually tasted stale & had been fried for so long they were burned at the edges.

Review1451.Review: We had a group of 20 at a private table downstairs. I would have thought that this would have some degree of attentive service - it didn't.Even though I was clearly the one who was going to pay the bill - I was never asked what I wanted to drink until part way through the meal.The food was quite ordinary - surprising that there wasn't a higher standard for Asian food in San FranciscoAt the end of the evening we didn't even get an itemized bill

Review1452.Review: Delicious food.   Mr. Fang ordered for us and we had a fabulous meal.   Great place for big groups.   Close to Mascone.  More relaxed vibe than at House of Banking.  Overall was really great!

Review1453.Review: We were sadly disappointed in Fang. The staff seemed very unprepared and disorganized. We noted that multiple tables had to send food back because they got the orders wrong. The food itself was so-so, but sort of bland. There are many better options in San Francisco.

Review1454.Review: We never order our food and allow the sever to bring various dishes per our pre-stated needs to the table. So every dish is sort of a surprise and generally a pleasant one. This time around too the food did not disappoint. However, we were seated near the kitchen and on a very hot day in SFO, the temp inside the restaurant was hot. We were all sweating by the end of the meal and couldn't wait to get out in the open air. But, we go there for food and are mostly happy with the variety. Great for folks who love to eat and try new tasty dishes.

Review1455.Review: First, Fang's did not seem overly clean, perhaps since they are serving most of the day they do attend to such small things as a clean floor or a dirty chopstick.  We began with the pork confit egg rolls; the pork was tasty but the egg rolls were burned and the plate was simply dumped on the table.  I ordered the "signature dish" of honey-chili short ribs.  The honey was not in evidence, but a bitter chili was.  It went back and I did not accept the offer of a replacement because of the time required; they did not charge me for the dish.  My wife had the Mongolian beef tower.  This was certainly OK--she was generous in letting me taste--but no different or bettor than I can ,make at home.  Two other things to note: the plates are large and tables are small.  We had two glasses of their house white wine: it was atrocious.  One further note: the  people at the next (very close) table repeatedly said how good their dinner was.

Review1456.Review: I have been to Fang 3 times and each time has been consistently excellent.  I have been for lunch  here and at their sister restaurant, House of Nanking.  I find the experience at both restaurants to be top notch.  Fang knows how to attract the hip SOMA crowd with interesting dishes and cool decor and can deal with anyone's dietary restrictions.

Review1457.Review: Food was okay and came out super fast, but their service was terrible. They were eager to remove our food from the table. When I told them we were still eating those dishes, they just put them on my plate without asking. Don't go to this restaurant if you want to take your time to enjoy food!

Review1458.Review: Excellent food and quick service.  We arrived early while the restaurant was still setting up so ambiance was lacking and the staff distracted. But the service settled down and the dishes arrived promptly. Everything was tasty, the Nanking chicken and the beef being the highlights. Would recommend for anyone looking for tasty modern interpretations of Chinese cooking.

Review1459.Review: Wonderful meal at Fang. Not your typical menu for Chinese food - the varied and creative dishes served family style were perfect for trying different items within the group. The honey short rib dish was absolutely fantastic - definitely don't skip it!

Review1460.Review: I've been a client of Chef Fang for 20 years since I found House Of Nanking. I let him choose the menu, and he never lets me down. Sometimes I drive up from Los Angeles for a weekend, and Fang is a must do every time!

Review1461.Review: Searched for DIM SUM & FANG came up.  It is NOT typical DIM SUM.  The restaurant brings you 5 dishes of whatever they want to bring.  You get NO option to pick& choose.  Also, its "Northern China" or so we were told.  Which means non of the Dim Sum dishes you know & love are offered.   What we are was "ok".

Review1462.Review: After long drove from LA four of us settled down for a meal around 8:45 with high hopes. Owner came to take order but remained focused on larger table near by. Didn't look at us, make any suggestions, and wrote down wrong order.  Dishes all came  in minutes, seemed pre-prepared. Vegetables limp, everything smothered in overly sweet sauces. Nothing memorable.

Review1463.Review: We celebrated our daughter's birthday and as always, we had a great dinner experience. The family style is perfect for a group of people that wants to try out several plates without just committing to one. Food was delicious and service was attentive. We will be back for other family celebrations.

Review1464.Review: Great overall. Don’t bother with reservations as they don’t honour any. Groups without reservations of 4 were seated first as they had more people (we were 3). Food was fantastic and so was post seating service.The old gentleman’s recommendations were spot on.

Review1465.Review: This restaurant was such a nice surprise! We sat down and an older gentleman came up to our table and said he was the chef and would prepare our dishes. I was a bit concerned because he wasn't dressed in a chef coat, but it turned out he was the owner/chef. I also usually prefer to be in control of the ordering, but for some reason I let it go and agreed and the dishes were just delicious! Fresh and perfectly cooked vegetables, tender meats  and perfect fish. What a pleasure! And very good value too.

Review1466.Review: Visiting San Fransisco and my brother, who lives there. We wanted an Asian restaurant with authentic cuisine where there wasn't too much a wait on a Sat night and within walking distance of Union Square. FANG fit the bill perfectly. Good service and suggestions. Nice wine selection by the glass. We had a lot of food at reasonable prices. Highly recommend for visitors to the city.

Review1467.Review: Outstanding Chinese cuisine with a modern twist at very affordable prices

Review1468.Review: We went before a concert at AT&T and had a delicious meal.  The owner said to trust him, and didn't take our orders, and we loved everything he brought to our table.  It was fun and adventurous.  I was surprised at how affordable it was when the bill came for the value of the cuisine that we got.

Review1469.Review: Quick service friendly staff. Full bar very good food. Good place for friends to meet nice for a casual date.

Review1470.Review: This place is very good the ownerAbout the food and he picked the dishes for us and the dishes were very delicious good job I would recommend paying any day

Review1471.Review: Fang continues to be one of my favorite restaurants in SF and have been going there for years.  I always ask Mr. Fang to set us up, don't have to deal with the menu, and his choices have always been spot on!  I don't think I've ever been served the same things twice.  Big thumbs up all around.

Review1472.Review: This is an interesting place located next door to SFMOMA. The owner, Peter Fang, will ask if you are new to the restaurant (we were) and if so will casually collect the menus and order for you (I saw him do this to another table). He will then come by after each dish (there were five of them) and explain each. When asked whether this was Cantonese (which is our guess), he said it was his own cuisine. The dishes were interesting - starting with a pumpkin salad (really more like a cold mash) was very good, and short ribs with bak choy (which was great). Other dishes were shrimp (good not great), buns with chicken filling (also good not great), and a white fish stew (ditto). Closing the meal was a noodle dish that looked and tasted like Chinese spaghetti and was great. The food came quick so I recommend you pace your eating as the staff were waiting to serve as soon as we completed a dish. Probably a bit more expensive than we planned but it was a fun evening with some very good dishes, several we would not have ordered on our own.

Review1473.Review: I thought the menu and food was creative and delicious, with excellent service staff.

Review1474.Review: Fang -- sister to House of Nanking -- is simply one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city. Period. If you're looking for regional authenticity, I can't vouch for that one way or the other. If you're looking for inventive, delicious, surprising, top-shelf Chinese, on the other hand, you'll find it here on every line on the menu. For our best meal here, I brought 15 co-workers. They set us up in the basement room. We asked them, basically, to "bring us good food and decide what it is." They counted us, checked the number of vegetarians, and took off. Soon after, the plates started coming. Dumplings. Seafood. Veggies. Their signature honey-chili short ribs with bok choy. Their other signature, Nanking chicken with sweet potatoes. Eight months after that meal, my team still talks about it and asks when we're going back.

Review1475.Review: You must ask for recommendations! Don't touch the menus, ask Chef Fang, or his staff if he's not available what they suggest. If you have food allergies, vegetarians at the table, etc. just mention that. Then, sit back and enjoy one of the best meals you've ever had.

Review1476.Review: Good was very good. Had the pork potstickers,  chicken fried rice and the short ribs and bok Choy which was different and very good.

Review1477.Review: Unsure if it was a rough Saturday night for the staff but the food was poorly executed and the staff was unfriendly and testy. We ordered the Peking duck buns, the Nanking sesame chicken, and honey apple prawns. The skin on the duck wasn't crispy and it was served without scallions. The sweet potato in the sesame chicken was undercooked and the chicken was over fried. The honey apple prawns were good. I've been to Fang a few times prior to this visit and have always been happy with the food, presentation, and service. The last time I visited was over a year ago. The experience was so lackluster it will be a while before I return.

Review1478.Review: Great location being at the foot of MOMA San Francisco. the restaurant is a little worn looking and menus could use updating. Great bartender and mixologist- interesting house cocktails and very good appetizers. Main dishes over priced for what you get-   Descriptions & prices of main dishes do not live up to the actual dishes;we had noodles, shrimp dish and the main beef dish- all tasted the same and the noodle dish seemed to have used a lot of ketchup in the sauce. I recommend stickering to the  cocktails and appetizers . Passed on dessert- fun wine list.

Review1479.Review: Ok Chinese food for the price.  Had better for less!

Review1480.Review: The short ribs with bok choi salad was excellent, but the veggie rice only had two veggies, mushrooms and onions.  The previous time we ordered it, it had all sorts of vegetables.  The service was good, but the space is a little tired.

Review1481.Review: Fantastic option for those with severe nut allergy issues

Review1482.Review: Oily food with poor service. Used to be nice, no longer is

Review1483.Review: We booked FANG for a business lunch. The  waitress ordered for the group and the food was creative and very tasty. The only dish that the table did not particularly enjoy was an egg and seafood bake. I would absolutely use FANG again for both business and a personal dining experience.

Review1485.Review: Visited Fang and was greeted by the owner who asked if he could order for us. Brought out a series of dishes that were amazing and highlighted all the things they are known for. The chicken buns were awesome as were the asparagus side dish and the short ribs. Would definitely recommend and return.

Review1486.Review: I have never written a review,  but this was an absolute fantastic night and dinner. it was our first time to the restaurant and the owner let us know he would pick the right dishes for us so that we had a great meal and it was amazing. It really was such a great experience and the food he picked for us was fantastic! Can't wait to come back to San Fran to come back to the restaurant!

Review1487.Review: Fang is my favorite Chinese restaurant in SF.  The food is unique and so flavorful, esp if you let them choose a menu for you.  Mr. Fang waited on us; he is always delightful.If you like Chinese or just something unique to try, give Fang a chance.  You will not be disappointed!

Review1488.Review: The spareribs are amazing.  This was our second time there and it did not disappoint.  Be sure and get the tea because it has a very cool surprise.

Review1489.Review: Very good meal. Enjoyed all the dishes we had. Wine was good value too. Definitely worth checking it out.

Review1490.Review: My husband and I were staying in Union Square for a special get away weekend. We had made reservations but no need as the place was almost empty. Despite this, we were seated by a host who basically slammed the menus down on the table and walked away without a word. We waited about 10 minutes and NO ONE came over, no water, no attention at all. We watched a waiter sneeze several times directly into his open hand and continue serving food to others. We left. Can't judge the food. Would never go back.

Review1491.Review: The food was awesome ! We were quite impressed by the variety of vegetarian dishes specially prepared for us.

Review1492.Review: Sauces were not as flavorful as those at Nanking.  Food was well cooked and plentiful.  Price was right.

Review1493.Review: Very disappointing. Fang had been my favorite Chinese restaurant -- always inspired, varied, interesting, fresh, tasty. We always let the owner choose our courses.This time, however,  the flavors of each dish were the same (black bean meets hoisin) and too much of it!  Nothing crisp or fresh -- just run-of-the-mill gluggy stuff.  Sad to lose a top choice from my SF repertoire. ☹️

Review1494.Review: Very poor service. I had to go get a waiter to take our order. Get our own water refill. Ask for the rice we ordered be brought when it didn't arrive with our food. No apologies. No personality. Also, extremely noisy restaurant.

Review1495.Review: Daily special chosen was greatRice soupCrispy short ribs on Chinese broccoli delish. Beans in bean soy sauce goodPrawns in creamy apple sauce was new to us and a killer flavor profile. Great food!

Review1496.Review: The best...,let owner order for you...guarantee you will love every bit Bon

Review1497.Review: They have great service.  I visited twice in a week and both times I left the menu choice to them and they made sure we had a great meal.  This will be one of top Asian places for service & food.

Review1498.Review: I came here based on the recommendations on the Open Table site.  When I entered, it was empty and there were numerous tables with dirty dishes that looked like they had been there for several hours.  The service was poor.  I ordered a glass of wine and went somewhere else.  In the meantime, another person came in and was seated.  She looked around and left the restaurant also.

Review1500.Review: I've been going to House of Nan King for years, so when I saw that Peter Had opened up a new location, I had to try it.  Every bit as good and they take reservations.  A wonderful experience.  We never order off the menu, but rather ask Peter to just feed us.  Never been disappointed.

Review1501.Review: Great food. Owner ordered for us and it was fabulous...

Review1502.Review: We let Fang's owner himself order for us and he did not disappoint! Chicken, seafood, and short ribs were all excellent.

Review1503.Review: We took some out of town relatives to Fang for dinner. It was recommended by a friend from work. We were thrilled with the whole experience. The staff was friendly and professional.  The food was unlike any Chinese food we have had before. No heavy sauces, not oily. Delicious, fresh, innovated choices. None of us had any idea what to order. We took out chances on calamari, dumplings, eggplant with tofu, Mongolian beef and fried brown rice.   We were not disappointed with any of it! The fried rice, dumplings and calamari were my favorite!!!  My cousin ate every bite of the eggplant!!! We can't wait to go back!

Review1504.Review: Based on what meats we preferred, we were given some amazing recommendations: rice noodles with duck, basil chicken with lots of veggies, Mongolian beef with a very satisfying and satiating taste.  It was a lot of food and we didn't think we were that hungry, but we couldn't stop eating!!  Finally there were no leftovers to take home.

Review1505.Review: Without a doubt, the best Chinese food I have EVER eaten in my 63 years. Authentic AAA+,  excellent atmosphere, and great staff. Must try!!

Review1506.Review: Great menu with numerous food options.  Good Service and  casual atmosphere.

Review1507.Review: We booked a reservation through opentable to celebrate my best friends birthday. Turns out the restaurant does not take reservations as late as 9 and cancelled it.  Due to the last minute notice, we weren't able to find another restaurant that we could go to celebrate my friends birthday. Utterly disappointed with opentable and fang. My very nicely planned evening was ruined.

Review1508.Review: A little apprehensive when I saw a health dept rating of 75. We had the Mei Fun with chicken and House Noodles with chicken. The chicken was bland, the Mei Fun was watery, and the House noodles tasted like spaghetti. The pork dumplings were a good appetizer. I would not recommend.

Review1509.Review: Big fan of Fang. Always a hit with out of town friends and family, too! Be sure to get the Apple Shrimp... and, my absolute favorite, the Short Rib. Better yet, just get the family style experience and try everything. Then ask for seconds on your favorite dishes!

Review1510.Review: Awful. We had reservations at 5:45 (and another family at 5:15) and they wouldn't open the doors...with no explanation. We waited until after 6:00 and Fang's explanation when I called was that they didn't know when they were going to open. Disappointing to say the least.

Review1511.Review: We waited 45 minutes outside in the cold. We had reservations and they didn't let us into the restaurant or even tell us if they would eventually open. Many workers and the chef himself walked inside but when we asked if they would open they gave us a non-response.

Review1512.Review: Service was awful. Food was prepared very quickly so wonder if most is pre-cooked. Food just average taste but very small portions. Not good value.

Review1513.Review: We went before a performance at Yerba Buena Center and it was our first time at Fang. The hostess came by and made suggestions for our order, which was nice and we had the most delicious meal! We have 5 spice fish with brown rice and a wonderful noodle dish with shrimp. I am looking forward to going here again!

Review1514.Review: Eaten here several times, this occasion a post show meal with my siblings.  Food is always delicious!  Service was OK this time- food delivered in a timely fashion but servers seemed dis- engaged...like they were over it.  Still efficient but were dragging.

Review1515.Review: My friend and I went to Fang for an early dinner after a matinee performance at YBCA.  We have been to Fang several times before and always had good food and service.  This time was SO different.  When we were seated our table was dirty and we had to literally flag down the server to get it cleaned.  The appetizer was brought out after one of our main dishes and a side dish and the second main dish appeared only after we reminded them that we had ordered  it. Overall the restaurant appeared shabby and dirty - the menus were stained and there was trash on the floor.  We will not be returning.

Review1516.Review: Never fails to excel. Takes decision making out by choosing your meals. Just give them your preferences and they do the rest. Will be back soon.

Review1517.Review: Best Asian food I ever had!

Review1518.Review: I was surprised at how affordable the dishes were considering the ambiance reads upscale and the location is financial/tech industry. The service was very quick and reminiscent of authentic hole in the wall ma & pop type of no nonsense no frills demeanor. This was refreshing to me, because I knew the food was going to be good. It might be jarring to other folks who are used to more flowery type of interactions. The flavors of the food were spot-on authentic but some dishes were lukewarm. Notables to try: the XLB and Japanese pumpkin soup which both came out satisfyingly hot.

Review1519.Review: Fantastic food. I already have recommend to friends.

Review1520.Review: We had a fantastic meal and we allowed the owner to pick the menu for us which was a great sampler of appetizers and main courses. We loved everything and had more than enough to eat. Great value!

Review1522.Review: Keep Calm and let Fang handle it. My wife and I love House of Nanking and when we found out Fang was across the street from the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts and we had tickets for the ballet, it was an obvious choice for our pre show dinner.  Great food as always, great location and great service. We will definitely be back.

Review1523.Review: The owner Peter Fang approached us and asked if it was our first time there. It was. He offered to select the dishes for us. Each course that was brought out was the ooohed and awwwwed over.  It was simply the best Chinese food we had ever tasted. We will definitely go back again!

Review1524.Review: I arrived early (about 5:18 for a 5:30 reservation) and was seated fairly promptly. There were three other diners in the restaurant. After that it all went down hill. A carafe of tepid water was placed on the table and glasses. A menu and wine list was put on the table. When my guests arrived, we made our choices of food and waited for the waiter, and waited and waited. Other patrons were seated and their order taken promptly. Their meals arrived as we continued to wait for our waiter/waitress to return. Our order was finally taken. Brown rice with three entrees. After 20 minutes one entree arrived - no rice yet. A glass of wine was ordered, but we had to ask two or three times for it to be brought to the table. We asked a second waiter for our food and someone came and slapped a bowl of white rice on the table. We also asked twice for ice and lemon for the carafe of water. The final two entrees were delivered to our table. The restaurant was totally full and the noise level had risen substantially. We asked for the check and it arrived quite promptly. We were able to leave at 7:45 after a difficult meeting due to the noise, the lack of service and food and potable water.  It was a very disappointing meal and  Fang's will not be recommended.

Review1525.Review: A memorable birthday for my 16 year old. Delicious food. Amazing service !

Review1526.Review: Got the family together for a meal. I wasn't expecting too much out of this restaurant, but they really did disappoint. So-so service border lining an attitude that screamed 'Can't be bothered'. Food was just ok. Dishes were on the sweet side. Combination soup had a good lemongrass flavor, but I noticed that the one of the fish fillets still had the store sticker on it...gross. They remade the meal, but didn't bother to comp the dish. Overall, below average experience.  I would pass as there are plenty of other restaurants that feature this type of cuisine.

Review1527.Review: We were a party of 6 and the restaurant recommended a tasting menu. It worked out very well for our group with various different meat, veggie, seafood dishes. The taste was awesome and we were able to sample a wide variety of dishes. Highly recommended.

Review1528.Review: The short rib and honey mayo prawn are SUPER AMAZING. Order this!!!

Review1529.Review: The chef offered to order for us since this was our first dining experience. The meal was amazing!!!! Im still dreaming about the crispy short rib dish and sauteed pea tendril dish!!! He is obviously devoted to assuring the dining experience is positive for his customers. Thanks for a fantastic evening.

Review1530.Review: Went with a friend for the first time. Food was first rate!

Review1531.Review: Authentic, spicy, flavorful Chinese food. The potstickers and dumplings are fantastic. Having Mr Fang take your order is part of the appeal - no, he isn't going to make exceptions to the menu so don't try! Skip if you can't handle MSG.

Review1532.Review: Do what Mr Fang says.  He will order for you and although rather brusque he does make great food with serious depth of flavor and imagination.

Review1533.Review: Food was good but service staff was inattentive.  Venue lacked cleanliness.  Would not go back.

Review1534.Review: Fang is a neighborhood gem. We always the food and service, Kathy and Peter Fang have honed the art of excellent dishes combined with quick service. Located at 660 Howard next to the SFMOMA Howard Street entrance.....enjoy.Dr. R

Review1535.Review: Authentic and well-prepared cuisine make this restaurant worth a visit. However walls need cleaning and decor could use a good dusting.

Review1536.Review: Great food. Grumpy waiter. I've gone to fang and the other version house of nankin and food is consistently good and so are the grumpy waiters

Review1537.Review: Every time we make it to San Francisco, Fang is at the top of the must do list. It always exceeds our expectations.

Review1538.Review: Reviews had indicated this is a sister place to popular Nanking Palace and it seemed promising, but it is terrible.  Hardly any customers, weirdly limited menu, and food well below the neighborhood Chinese restaurant standard.  The whole place seemed tired; I had the impression it was closing down soon or something.

Review1539.Review: Got the Famous Nanking Sesame Chicken and Northern Style Dumplings. Over cooked fried chicken pieces in a very sweet, sticky sauce and tasteless dumplings. Service was not friendly or welcoming. Definitely would not go back.

Review1540.Review: The food at FANG is delicious, but maybe its because of the amount of MSG they add. I have not experienced MSG at that level in a long, long, time. Service is spotty at best.  And when we entered, perhaps the hostess could have put her phone down long enough to greet us, or crack a little smile or throw some friendly acknowledgement our way - no she didn't. Is it my last time here? Perhaps, unless my colleagues drag me out there again.

Review1541.Review: I was excited to try Fang - the menu looked wonderful. The dumplings were so-so, some types were good, some just ok. One of the two main courses (beef) was great, the other was mediocre. But the worst thing was that we arrived at 11:30 AM (with a reservation) and it was clear they weren't quite ready to serve food. Our first item arrived at noon. Frustratingly slow service during a busy weekday at the office!

Review1543.Review: We had the most fabulous dinner here, celebrating a special milestone birthday with a party of 6 people. The owner hand picked our menu for us which was a really nice personal touch and the selection of food chosen was awesome. Cannot fault the food or service, would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great night out.

Review1544.Review: Ownership plays an active role, as it has over the years, ensuring both a smoothly run and customer- responsive organization. After a 2-year hiatus, felt as if I had returned home. Had food selected for us by host . . . and experienced gastronomic glory!

Review1545.Review: For my dinner-mates the recommended dishes were great. Unfortunately, the kitchen was only able to produce one dish for my limited diet. Disappointing for sure.

Review1546.Review: For the most part, the food was excellent. The room was very loud, causing difficulty hearing table conversation. Fantastic recommendation in-house for a fresh fish dish with vegetables.

Review1547.Review: Food was good, service really bad, not very clean at all, sticky floor, seats, tables, Glases.... they didn't even cleaned off the table but we were good enough for paying the bill immediately .... wouldn't recommend this restaurant at all - sorry guys .... i would go to china town the next time again to have really awesome food and great service

Review1548.Review: Since my time in the city was limited and House of Nan King is super busy, so I went to the next best thing, it's sister restaurant, Fang! The food was tasty. The menu is just as colorful and flavorful, not to mention the creative to set it apart from the other restaurant. Will I be back to dine here..... HECK YA!

Review1549.Review: Great service from Mr. Fang himself.  Food was outstanding.  Authentic, unusual, interesting and most importantly absolutely delicious.  Cost was incredibly reasonable ($147 for 7 people -- no drinks), we even had to check the pricing to be sure that they didn't make a mistake by undercharging us.    Would love to return for another meal.

Review1550.Review: Service was horrible, rude, slow. The fried calamari was quite good. The szechuan prawns were so so.   Might go back for take out, but will never dine in there again.

Review1551.Review: The food was mediocre at best. The servers were a bit surley . I would not return to this restaurant or recommend it.

Review1552.Review: Food was really tasty and definitely would recommend this place.

Review1553.Review: Poor service, dirty restaurant, over-fried food.  Never again.

Review1554.Review: Scrambled for a last minute reservation for 9 people and FANG had availability. We got a chef's choice style meal with vegetarian options for our non-meat eaters. Everyone left satisfied and full.

Review1555.Review: Pricing on the restaurant menu was hand written to be higher than pricing on the Open Table menu. When I asked for a knife, I was given a dirty one. Overall, not an experience I I would choose to repeat.

Review1556.Review: The food was very tasty but after being told about guests with celiac disease, waitors couldn't tell us if certain dishes had gluten in them...

Review1557.Review: Tried since we were looking for something new around SFMOMA.  While this restaurant has good ratings, the food is below average, not 'high end Chinese'.

Review1558.Review: The two receptionists (both female) were exceptionally rude and incompetent. Despite having a reservation, they wouldn't seat us, nor could they tell us how long the wait might be or when we could eat. They also allowed two other groups (of the same size) that did NOT have reservations before us and kept ignoring us every time we walked up to remind them that we had a fixed reservations and to ask for ETA. Terrible service and attitude.

Review1559.Review: It was okay. I wish they had a better service

Review1560.Review: Tables are really close together. Service was so slow. Never came to check on us during the meal. Took. Long time to get check. Food was good but did not wow me.

Review1561.Review: We went here for dinner on a business trip and when we sat down the owner came over and told us to not order from the menu. So, he brought us 5 surprise dishes that were all amazing!!!

Review1563.Review: We had the best Birthday dinner! The Chef took control of the table and ordered for us, All of his choices were excellent! We had a party of 10 with some vegetarians and we all left happy! The huge lazy susan in the middle of the table was awesome and made sharing easy. Will return and recommend. Thanks FANG.

Review1564.Review: Great food! Chef was very nice and loved the approach on selecting the food for 21 people

Review1565.Review: Fang is definitely an authentic Chinese restaurant.  You need to know this going in.  For the most part we really liked the food.  However the flavors on a couple dishes were a little different than expected.  This wasn't a bad thing.  It was just a little different.  Also the food will come out in a completely random order.  What you would think would typically be an entree happened to come out first and vice versa on what you might consider an appetizer.  You can order dishes for yourself but I recommend treating this as a family style meal.  It will give you the option of trying a wider variety of dishes.

Review1566.Review: Went to Fang in San Francisco recently with the family.  Very good Asian food, some different items on the menu.  Servings seemed to be quite hearty-we ordered too much food but the entire family really enjoyed it.  Service was a bit uneven, but to be fair, they were very busy.  We would go back.

Review1567.Review: The service was horrendous.  The noodles were had too much sauce and were returned.  The chicken was delicious.  Will not return. The building is really nice.

Review1568.Review: Best Chinese I've had in SF and it's a reasonable price. I've lived in Singapore and spent time in Hong Hong. This place is GOOD!

Review1569.Review: Great food, owners asked what we wanted and then asked if it was our 1st time. We said yes he promptly collected our menus and said he would handle it. They served us a variety of courses and all we outstanding!A definite repeat!

Review1570.Review: Fang was recommended to us from a friend.  We had one day in SF and this fit well into our schedule.  Caught a light dinner in the late afternoon and everything tasted wonderful.  We would definitely return as there was a wide selection and vegetarian options.

Review1571.Review: Random service, forgot to bring the wine. My wife ate alone whilst my dinner arrived some  time later. Luke warm . Won't go back

Review1572.Review: This is not a good choice around SF MOMA.  I made an open table reservation for noon. The hostess didn't seem interested in this and moved the two of us back to a table by the walkway to the bathrooms cheek to jowl with a family with a toddler.  The toddler turned out to be quite well behaved.  The stuff not so much.  Just flat affect and a rushed manner.  The food was pretty terrible.  The dumplings were the only thing at all worth eating. The noodles with chicken were bland and there wasn't anything green anywhere. Very oily:(. Just can't recommend it even for "cheap eats."

Review1573.Review: The manager took care to give us family style platters. It was delicious and just the right amount!

Review1574.Review: FANG is a great choice for  top SF restaurant for outstanding food in a fun environment. Its walking distance from downtown hotels and has many vegan and vegetarian choices.

Review1575.Review: Great food and service! We left our dinner dishes to Mr. Famg's discretion. He did not disappoint us!

Review1576.Review: Service was good when chef took over for waitress. Food was OK, not great; oversauced. Prices reasonable. Floors, restrooms filthy.

Review1577.Review: Worst Chinese restaurant I've ever eaten. The meat pieces were too large to eat with chopsticks and the meat was tough. The sauce was not flavorful and was greasy. Schechwan not spicy enough, rice noodles dry and stuck together.  Uggggh

Review1578.Review: Great dinner. We had seen Kathy Fang on Chopped and decided to try her new restaurant when we were looking for a place for dinner in SOMa. We were not disappointed.       Fresh, delicious modern Chinese. Peter Fang was waiting tables and asked if we trusted him, then used his judgement to send out food rather than take our order. Wonderful.

Review1579.Review: Dirty floors, dirty walls, less than precise work from the kitchen.

Review1580.Review: My mother has taught me if I can't say anything nice to say nothing at all.So: "nothing at all"

Review1581.Review: Absolutely filthy. The bottles they use to serve water have probably never been washed (they have thick grease deposits around the shoulder of the bottles). The restaurant surfaces (all of them) are dirty. The service is slow and the food is not good.  How this place stays in business is a mystery.

Review1582.Review: Fantastic! The owner swept away our menus and surprised us with tons of amazing dishes. I loved the shrimp w/apples best.

Review1583.Review: The owner/chef came by and introduced  himself, then ordered for us.  Nice guy & really good food (I've been traveling to China for 15 years so have a basis to judge).

Review1584.Review: The service was really poor. We have to wait ~ 30 mins to wait for someone to take our order. Plus communication was poor, didn't understand much in English. Finally, I wanted to decide which wine to try and they had no idea nor they gave me a small portion to taste.

Review1585.Review: Absolutely fantastic food, really cannot stress how delicious the food is at FANG. The only downside is service is slow and you have to flag down servers to get anything. That being said its great for groups especially when you opt to let the chef pick the dishes. They will come out quick and they will ensure that all dietary needs are met and that there is just the right amount of food (not too much not too little). If you're looking for a great place to feed a group or do a business meal you cannot beat FANG. If youre on a time crunch tho it might not be the most ideal.

Review1586.Review: They were flexible about us arriving 15 min later than our reservation (we did call), and I appreciate that.  Food was good, but I've had better.  Lighting was too bright.  Restaurant was a little dirty.  We sat next to the glass enclosed stairwell which was greasy from people's hands.  The water glasses were cloudy and unappealing.  The room didn't look like the website picture.

Review1587.Review: The food was healthy, tasted good and we were accommodated for gluten-free request.It was a Saturday evening reservations, the seating was a little tight, and I was a little disappointed because Kathy Fang was not there. My main reason for going there was to meet this winner of Food Network's "CHOPPED". It was suggested in a write up to forego the menu and go with Chef's choice. Mr. Peter Fang (Kathy's father) serviced our table and met our requests without issue.Thank you Mr. Fang! Perhaps next trip we'll try Nan King Restaurant (Kathy's parents' place)!

Review1588.Review: I've never had a bad meal, because I always let the owner serve what he thinks is best. He has never disappointed. Great location if you are at the Moscone convention center, with great food, and reasonable pricing.

Review1589.Review: I always order their fish soup dish. So delicious and I can't find it anywhere else. Many tasty, salty dishes there! Generous portions, and they have Chinese wines to go with the food.

Review1590.Review: The waiter didn't get our order right and we had to request items more than once.The food was very good.

Review1591.Review: Went there with family to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We had the family style dinner. It was great. We had may plates to taste and the food was delicious.

Review1592.Review: Flew in to San Fran & made impromptu reservations, the owner greeted us and picked out our meal. It was delicious & authentic, will definitely come back on our next trip!

Review1593.Review: This is my favorite restaurant. Where else can one go and merely say "food" with a two word clarification on any dietary issues, and be served with innovative food. I would on my own never would have ordered any of the dishes. Hope to keep going there often.

Review1594.Review: Took a long time to be seated even with a reservation. Then took st least 15 minutes for a waitress to come by with water. Soup dumplings were disappointing, very little soul and weak flavor. For entrees the basil chicken and string beans were tasty.

Review1595.Review: Terrific food and personal service from owner Peter Fang for our small birthday party. Food was delicious, with plenty of variety for the vegetarians in our party.

Review1596.Review: Fang never disappoints. Let Peter or Kathy put a dinner together for you. A world-class meal at neighborhood prices awaits.

Review1597.Review: Hadn't been to FANG in a year and won't be returning. The meal was expensive and not good. I love Chinese food but everything here was overly saucy and salty. Way too pricey as well.

Review1598.Review: This was our second time. First time we went because we saw Kathy on Chopped. She offers to design a dinning experience for us and it was awesome.So we came back with friends. Our waiter was great and his suggestions were perfect. We did repeat two of the dishes Kathy made for us and we added two new ones.There was a 98 yo celebrating her birthday behind us with a full table of family😊

Review1599.Review: Great food! Bad service! I believe the owner takes the orders and comes off extremely rude. Only received one glass of water. I've been here a few times and service has not improved. Won't be back.. sucks, cause food is really good.

Review1600.Review: Our fourth visit here...but still, while I stress again that the food itself tastes great, the general seediness of the place, coupled with a lack of attention from the servers, makes us hesitant to return again.  The prices are very high for Chinese food - even such delicious food - so paying well over $100 for a meal for three for Chinese food, with a dirty restroom, dirty floors, general disregard for keeping things neat at the hostess table, the use of empty Canton Ginger Liqueur bottles for water at the table, a broken elevator (either it keeps breaking, or its been broken since Thanksgiving, when we first ate there), crooked lampshades, dirty walls, dusty pictures, all are really unseemly in a restaurant that COULD be truly excellent.  Especially when there ARE other excellent Chinese restaurants half the price with none of the above issues.  If they could rise above these problems...well, we'd probably eat there every week.  But I don't like a dirty restaurant, and we probably won't be back.

Review1601.Review: Mr. Fang introduced himself and since it was our first visit, he took our menus and ordered for us.  The meal was fantastic.

Review1602.Review: EXCELLENT SHORT RIB AND NANKING SESAME CHICKEN SPECIALS WELL WORTH IT.  WELL DONE HOT AND SOUR SOUP.  BUT, THEY CHARGE FOR TEA.

Review1603.Review: Walked in and sat at the bar and it took 10 mins before anyone even acknowledged us.  The counter was extremely dirty and sticky and the drinking glasses were greasy.  We did not order the food since it was so dirty.  We were extremely disappointed and the web site doesn't represent the actual restaurant.  We celebrated Valentine's Day on Saturday and our hearts were broken by Fang.

Review1604.Review: We are attending the San Francisco Chinese New Year Parade at 6pm. So we were looking for a nice restaurant that is close to the venue and found Fang. We read the reviews and 50/50 positive and negative reviews.So we thought we'll give it a try.First of all, we've make the reservation for 2 at 3pm!We got there 10 minutes to 3. The restaurant was fairly packed! But since we've a reservation, we thought should be no problem.There was a couple ahead of us and they were seated by the front lady! Then it was our turn and I did mentioned we have a reservation but We don't think she understand what I've said to her! I want to make sure I'll received my points!She then showed us our table nextvto the earlier couple and was way along the back aisle to the restrooms etc.It wasn't the best table we were hoping for but that's the only table available then.But as we looked to 2 empty tables next to ours, the tables was piled with dirty dishes! They looked like dishes cleared from other tables/ customers and just left there! This is so unacceptable and disgusting! So we walked to the front again and demanded for another table! The guy up in front told us there's the only table available and he walked away leaving us standing there !We are not sure whether he's getting us another table or what! So we eventually left!This is the worst dining experience we had! For a restaurant that is located in a prime location, the service really sucks! We definitely not going back nor recommend to our friends!To Peter Fang! Your daughter might have won The Chopped but your restaurant definitely been chopped!!!!

Review1605.Review: We had a chef's choice tasting menu for 4 adults. It wasn't on the menu, but we asked what the table next to us was having (it looked so good) and that's what we got! The variety and quality of food was great.  Service was very good, except that the food all came very quickly so we had to concentrate on eating and not talking and relaxing. Not really a problem with such good food.          Would like to go back to try some of the other interesting items on the menu.

Review1606.Review: Terrible food, broken down torn banquette seating, stuffing coming out, poor service,and grungy.Yuk.

Review1607.Review: One of the best Chinese restaurants we've found in San Francisco. Ordinary dishes done right, and imaginative new dishes. Worth a trip.

Review1608.Review: The food was amazing. I feel I went back China. The dishes can even compete with those restaurants in China. I originally came from Shanghai. Some of the dishes are created based on the traditional Shanghai cuisine. You have to order the right dishes.

Review1609.Review: I guess it's gone severely downhill in the past year since it's been at least that long since I dined here.  Took a co-worker on our lunch break as a farewell/thank-you.  Took over 20 minutes to get seated in a dark corner downstairs so it was close to 1:30 when we got our menu which was the dinner menu. I pointed this out and was told lunch menu was sold out.  I informed him how we already waited so long for lunch and expected lunch price.  He was grumpy about it but agreed to give lunch price.  Others who ordered at same time as us were already half way through theirs before we got ours.  Friend's veggie lunch was served with chicken not tofu which she just decided to eat around.  Almost 2:30 and I couldn't find anyone to take our bill - or get to go container.  Found them to give my credit card then had to search for them again - restaurant was practically empty by this time.  I only left them a tip since they did give us lunch price for dinner food.  Still so appalled at the service.

Review1610.Review: Disappointed by the place the food was ok but not more. I had a nankin tofu is was not very tasty. Tofu was smushy.

Review1611.Review: Hi, as you know I booked reservations through open table regularly.  Frankly I am really really surprised Fang is on open table and worse it is rated 4.0.  I expect very bad service at Chinese restaurant in SF china town but not restaurant booked through open table.We had to wait for a while to be seated and waited a long while to get food.  I finished eating before my companion's food came.  Ordered wine but it never came.  Not even once anyone came to check on us.  The furniture was in very bad shape (booth seating is old and torn.  I could not wait to leave as the service was so bad.I expected a certain standard when I book restaurants through open table.  Fang was really really disappointing.  The food was not bad but I could not enjoy it as everything else was so bad.  There was no service what so ever.  Like I said, I expected the ambiance and service from Chinese restaurant in china town but not restaurant I booked through open table.

Review1612.Review: Service was fantastic,food was great. Location is a little far from where I'm staying but coming here was worth it

Review1613.Review: The bok choi salad was amazing. Fang is perfectly located as a quick lunch escape from a dreadful event at Moscone Center. They take reservations on OpenTable for lunch and the food is always superb.

Review1614.Review: Absolutely the worst dining experience ever.  Staff was rude,  had to beg to be helped.  When food was finally served the attitude was way too much to tolerate.  If it was legal, I would have left without paying.  Suffice it to say we paid without eating and not one of their vile souls asked what was wrong, completely indifferent. Perhaps it was because we were hispanic?  Sadly it was my sons birthday....  strongly urge all to avoid this "restaurant."

Review1615.Review: I can't wait to return. Ask Mr Fang to choose dishes for you. The food was interesting and delicious. A wonderful spot for our group after a long business day

Review1616.Review: Incredible food! The Peking beef buns were great.

Review1617.Review: After spending a nice rainy morning at SFMOMA we went to Fang for lunch and had a wonderful and tasty meal. Fresh ingredients and flavorful dishes, loved the pot stickers and the dumplings. Nice size servings and very attentive service, they recommended a variety of dishes and the food came in small waves creating a wonderful experience. Can't wait to go back.

Review1618.Review: We went here based on the distance to our hotel and the reviews we saw on Yelp. The owner/chef was seating people and we asked him what he would recommend on the menu. He asked if we had any allergies (one person is allergic to shellfish) and he went ahead and put in our dinner order for us. The food was excellent and came out quickly. My favorite were The Peking Buns - delicious. But every dish was fantastic. I highly recommend it. We brought our 5 year-old with us and he liked the food too. It was casual and loud enough that even though most of the tables were adults, we knew he wouldn't be bothering anyone.

Review1619.Review: Very high quality, well executed Chinese and Chinese-California fusion food.  Peter will select a menu for you and your party if you are having trouble deciding

Review1620.Review: Rude wait staff; mediocre and over-priced Chinese. Salt and Pepper shrimp were simply boiled and thrown together with large chunks of onion and wilted mushrooms. FANG is overrated and the lunch was fairly unpleasant.

Review1621.Review: Mefdiocre food.  The dumplings were heavy, they substituded green peppers for sweetpotatoes on a signature dish. It was not a good choice

Review1622.Review: Worst service ever ! They started mopping the floor with bleach all over the restaurant and close to our table while we where still eating ( it was just 10pm). They were trowing the food on the table with no manner, one waiter also transferred some food from a main plate on the table into a smaller one without asking if he could. They were also keep taking away our plates while food was still there and we were clearly still eating. They gave us the bill when we did not requested it, we really wanted to order a dessert but they told us was too late( why they didn't come earlier to the table to tell us that the kitchen was about to close,so that we could place the last order before then ? ). Very bad experience and the food is not even worth !

Review1623.Review: It was ok. Food was ok. Chef recommendations were disappointing

Review1624.Review: By far the best Chinese food in San Francisco and right up there with food of any kind!

Review1626.Review: One of my favorite SF restaurants. If in a group of 5 or more let Mr. Fang or daughter create the dining experience for you.

Review1627.Review: Was decent for a quick lunch- food's good and service was rude.

Review1628.Review: Very good restaurant for group lunch. Their food choices were more and you should try  group lunch

Review1629.Review: Let owner Mr Fang do our order( wife and I dinner before theater) GREAT food...one of the top 3 Chinese food meals I've ever had!

Review1630.Review: The service wasn't overly great and it took a while for the waiter to come over and take our drink orders. The food was very nice but I personally felt it was expensive for the level of food quality. Had many different types of Chinese food throughout the world and this didn't really stand out.

Review1631.Review: Terrific food, great suggestions from the waiter. Can't wait to go back!

Review1632.Review: This place has a lot of potential. Food is great but they have to work on their service. It took a while for anyone to even notice us by the door to be seated.  Spacing of the tables were awkward leaving my husband to get up several times during dinner.

Review1633.Review: Seems run down and the food wasn't good. Service was slow. Definitely a lower end establishment.

Review1634.Review: I was pleased with the food and drink, but their services was no good. The picture makes it look nicer than it is. It was still a good experience but I think people should just have the correct expectations.

Review1635.Review: We went for our New Year's Day family lunch. My husband and mother arrived in time for our 12:30PM reservations while I parked the car. My son and I joined our party within 15 minutes or so of our reservations. My husband had already ordered hot tea, three appetizers and wonton soup by then. When I arrived, there were already two appetizers on the table; the wonton soup came within 10 minutes, the third appetizer finally came after 20-30 minutes from my arrival.  Before the third appetizer arrived, we attempted to flag our server with no success. This went on for more than 10 minutes.A different server then came to our table and asked us if we were still waiting to order or waiting for orders. We were all frustrated by then, and I told this other server that we were still waiting for our third appetizer, plus the additional three items we ordered. This server essentially blamed us for ordering separate times. He then turned his back away from us while I was still explaining matters to him. Shortly after that rude encounter, our third appetizer finally came. Within 5-10 minutes, our noodle dish order came, except it was the wrong one. We had asked for  prawn with the stir fried noodle and they gave us one with chicken. Our son got up to talk to our original server who was at the other corner of the restaurant. This server proceeded to argue that that's what we ordered, but he would send it back. That's when my husband got up and walked over to where our son was. He told the server that that's not what we ordered.By then, with everything going wrong, our son urged us to just cut our losses and leave the restaurant. We then asked for the bill, paid, didn't leave a tip and left.For three appetizers, large wonton soup, two small hot and sour soups and four hot teas, our bill was over $100! And this was represented as two $$.  That bill was an absolute rip off!Even the food was not as tasty as the rating suggested; soups were watered down; everything else mediocre!

Review1636.Review: We had reservation for 9 PM it took them half an hour to seat us. When we were looking at the menu a gentleman came to our table said he was the chef and he asked us what kind of meat we liked. We informed him. He said leave it to him and he will take care of ordering for us. He sounded very convincing so we agreed. Horderves were ok, but the main course of chicken and tofu were horrible, chicken dish had tons of regular potatoes sweet potatoes and four pieces of chicken and same for tofu dish had four pieces of tofu and undesirable veggies. Obviously he was trying to get rid of what was left over in the kitchen. When we were leaving we ran into him and told him how we felt, he volunteered that we didn't have to pay, we told him we already paid. He didn't offer to rescind the charges and said next time he will make up for this experience. I will never go to this restaurant again.

Review1637.Review: Fang is awesome. We learned from House of Nanking that letting the boss decide your meal is best. Just go with it an enjoy. Mr. Fang picked an incredible shrimp dish with apples for us that was incredible. Equally delicious was a short rib dish with sweet potatoes. We try to get to at least one of his restaurants whenever we visit SF and will continue to do so.

Review1638.Review: Delicious food. Came out so fast didn't have time to enjoy it all . Pricing a bit high comparatively speaking . Forbes the money would rather have had more ambiance and more time between dishes

Review1639.Review: The owner offered to order for us since this is our first time. All his recommendations are spot on!

Review1640.Review: The food was excellent, we had the white fish, beef noodles and fried rice. Very efficient,  they sat us right away, we had a reservation and showed up 15 earlier. The owner came and asked us how things were. He is on the floor making sure everything is fine.  I travel to China frequently and the service is very good based on the culture. If you are looking for more, go to a French or Italian restaurant.

Review1641.Review: Excelent food and great option for large groups!

Review1642.Review: Great food!! Was surprised the shrimp app was full (head-on) shrimp, but it was still good and the other dishes we had were delicious.

Review1643.Review: Food was outstanding, the highlight of visiting this restaurant on our recent holiday to San Francisco. I would recommend asking the manager to order for you, he offered this and the dishes were delicious. Service post our meal being served was non existent, Fang are keen for diners to be in and out of the restaurant as fast as possible in order to turn over the tables. This is not a restaurant for lingering over a meal or a glass of wine. Fang has great food, well priced by San Francisco standards, good for families and groups of friends.

Review1644.Review: The food was delicious and I love to see and eat at family run restaurants like this.  I wish they would improve the service a bit more. The waiters and waitresses were okay but the little things such as, bringing the whole order together, or not throwing the bill on the table will change one's experience.

Review1646.Review: They forgot two of our orders and were incredibly slow. The food is ok, but nothing exceptional.

Review1647.Review: We made the mistake of reserving a table on Christmas night.. way overcrowded with too many tables crammed into first floor... service was terrible .No place to move even in your seat.  They should ha e turned walk-ins away to accommodate the reservations comfortably.

Review1648.Review: Service was horrible! Had to flag a person down for correct menus, to take our orders, bring our bill & correct or bill. No one ever came over to check on us but the table next to us received VIP treatment. The walls are dirty & the entire place is in need of some TLC.

Review1649.Review: We had a really horrible experience, I would never go back and never recommend.- the greeter/hostess tried to convince me I didn't have a reservation at the time that I did...was seconds away from giving away our table to someone else...I was forced to insist it was our table (we were not late...we were in fact 10 min early).- She was then answering phone calls right in front of me telling customers to come in even without a reservation, the wait would only be about 20 minutes...this was with a full restaurant and approx. 15ppl waiting in the entryway. Essentially she was flat out lying to people...a 20 minute was was not the reality. - didn't receive enough menus for everyone at the table, only two (5 ppl dining) and one of the menus was missing half of the options- our table inexplicably didn't even have a table cloth on it (others did)- the server/waiter tried to convince us to accept the "chefs choice" for our meal (and told us HE was the chef?!) We wanted to order specific things and had to adamantly argue with him about this. He took our order and then we literally never spoke to him again. - we didn't have one server at our table but rather a variety of different people who would come and go...and not one single person checked on us to see if we needed anything at any point. - we all received our dishes at completely different times...with my dish not coming at all, even after checking on it once.  Everyone else was done eating and my dish still hadn't come so we just ended up cancelling it. So I basically had cold leftovers from everyone elses dishes as my meal.- this was our family Christmas dinner, so it was very disappointing to have such a ridiculous meal.

Review1650.Review: Took the family to FANG for lunch on Christmas day. It was our first visit and we loved it. Delicious food in a relaxed atmosphere and good value too. Particularly liked the fact that Mr Fang himself looked after us and brought us an array of dishes, all of which were top-notch. No menu. So refreshing!

Review1651.Review: I don't like the preferential treatment.. had a reservation at 8.30pm and when we arrived (8.25PM) there was a family ahead of us waiting for a table... after 5 mins, a  group of Chinese dudes arrived and jump on the line and start asking for their table ( talking to the host in Chinese)... guess what happened - they got the table first and we waited for another 5 mins...

Review1652.Review: Very poor experience at Fang. I remember coming here a few years back and I disregarded the wear and tear because the owner was very hospitable, food was good, and service was great. Things have definitely changed for the worst. As the food quality, service level, and ambiance has gone DOWN, unfortunately the prices have not. No longer that level of service at all. In fact we were greeted and served with mostly grunts and nods. Sad to say the food quality is POOR - we received our potstickers still half frozen :(  The restaurant has visible wear and tear (torn bench seats), not very clean, etc. that definitely need updating.

Review1653.Review: Great place to take our family a few days before the Christmas holiday. Walked from the hotel. Enjoyed a variety of Asian cuilinary treats.

Review1654.Review: A disappointment. Food was average at best, portions small, priced too high. Under spiced, had to order extra hot sauce on the side to perk up every dish. Good location (next to SFMOMA) not taken advantage of. Caters to mostly a non-Asian crowd.

Review1655.Review: Very mediocre experience. Sloppy, not personable  service, barely adequate food, blah atmosphere and overpriced for what is offered. Second visit but will not be coming back again.

Review1656.Review: Food was excellent just missed the duck but the porky buns and crab was divibe

Review1657.Review: The food was tasty but the service was very bad. Overall it was not a good experience. I will not come back.

Review1658.Review: Great food. Ambience was non existent. It looked a lot nicer in the photos. In person it looked like a small fast food joint with a bar. But food was very good. We will go back with different expectations.

Review1659.Review: The owner ordered for our party of 11! It was all VERY very good. You will not be unhappy. Your taste buds will be singing. Your belly full. Kids and adults alike all happy! Not too pricey! Very reasonable for quality of food and service!

Review1660.Review: Food good, but wait staff very indifferent.  Tables for two tops very crowded and some are poorly located by the bathroom/kitchen.  Meanwhile, tables for 3 or 4 are large and well spaced.  A couple came in and were offered the absolute worst table in the restaurant and asked for one near us (set for four) and were told they couldn't have it - it was being saved for a larger party that might come in after them.  They left the restaurant -  good for them -  no one came in after they left and both  the larger table and the table they left sat empty the whole time.  The whole place needs to be painted.   Bathroom was very dimly lit, but appeared dirty and poorly maintained nevertheless.  Let's home the kitchen is kept cleaner.

Review1661.Review: Best gourmet Chinese food in San Francisco!

Review1662.Review: My friends were not as familiar with Chinese food, so according to them, the food was very good. But we all agree that the the service was terrible, we were not attended till we came up to them.It seems like they were understaffed and the people waiting to be seated had no where to sit while waiting.

Review1663.Review: We had our staff Holiday Lunch here. The food was excellent. Initially we had to wait to get a server but once she arrived we were in good shape. The owner stopped by our table at least twice to make sure we were doing well - very nice touch.

Review1664.Review: One of the servers was very rude and yelled at one of us. The guy who took our orders was rude as well!There was one incident that they were screaming at each other next to our table.

Review1665.Review: The food was good, standard chinese but the large shrimp (w the head still on-ick!) was not fresh. Difficult to pull the meat off, not fresh-tasting. I gave up. The other dishes were too salty (msg-y?), the place is not relaxing at all. Too busy for me.

Review1666.Review: Went there for lunch because it was close to Moscone where I was attending a conference.  It was a bit loud for a business lunch but we got along o.k.  The food was excellent.  The waiter simply "took care of us" and we didn't have to order individually.

Review1667.Review: The restaurant didn't honor the reservation at all. I don't know why they even subscribe to the service

Review1668.Review: Really fun if you let Fang decide and cook for you instead of ordering

Review1669.Review: Food excellent, but Open Table reservation has been meaningless in terms of waitupon arriving. Big crowds...waits of about 30 minutes beyond reservation time.Has happened two years in a row during visits to SF.

Review1670.Review: The food is hit or miss.  There are some dishes that are divine.  Others are meh.  Both times I have gone they have offered to just bring out a selection.  If I go again, I would pick and choose myself.

Review1671.Review: Don't expect your reservation to be honored. We waited 20 minutes past our reservation to even be acknowledged by the hostess. Once you are seated though, the food is worth the wait. It's fun to skip ordering from the menu and let the chefs decide for you.

Review1672.Review: Good foodService goodWe were unhappy because  open table said there was a table but there was none - ate at the bar which was not our preferred way to go

Review1673.Review: Always a must when we come to San Francisco.   Excellent food!

Review1674.Review: Amazing options like pumpkin soup with prawns.....crispy pot stickers with a mustard sauce and so much more..... Delicious!!!!

Review1675.Review: Food was selected for us by Peter Fang, proprietor - which was spectacular!!

Review1676.Review: The very best Chinese food in SF--and that is saying a lot.

Review1677.Review: Disappointed.None of the four of us had been to Fang before.  We really liked Mr. Fang!However, the dishes ordered were generally a bit disappointing. The best was the Pork Belly.  One of us had a starter of their chicken soup and thought it was also good.  For the other 5 dishes, it felt just a bit "off" in terms of flavors.  We were likely the only ones who felt disappointed though as the place was totally filled and had a positive vibe.

Review1678.Review: It improves every time I go there. Just let them select. This time the selection was the best. Will be back soon.

Review1679.Review: Service was deplorable. They didn't greet us. Tried to hurry us to order. Asked us if we were ready to pay as they handed us our food. And forgot our drink orders and one order of rice which we then had to ask for twice. They even turned on all the lights in the restaurant and put all the chairs up on the tables as we were eating. This was after booking a 9 pm reservation. It supposedly closed at 930. All of that was done by 928 pm. I've never been treated so poorly in a "high quality" establishment. The one redeeming experience was the food- which was decent. Will never go again. Would NOT recommend.

Review1680.Review: Good food, busy and wait staff was hopping. The kitchen is open and halfway thru dinner a female worker (chef?owner?) had a screaming meltdown berating coworkers. All in Chinese so all we could tell was the tone and volume of her voice and the faces of the other wait staff. What a bully! She needs a vacation or a new job.....

Review1681.Review: Fang is my favorite Chinese in the city. I always have excellent food, service and experience here. Highly recommend! Do ask your server for recommendations! Every time I've been (at least a half dozen). The owner has ordered for my table and we've loved everything we've had!

Review1682.Review: They did not manage to bring the food at the same time. 2 people finished eating before 2 people were served.

Review1683.Review: First of all, don't order off the menu.  Ask them to bring you a selection of what they think is good, and you won't be disappointed.  They ask about allergies, etc., and accommodate them.  The good was OUTSTANDING.  Delicious, perfectly prepared dishes that are quite different from your usual Chinese fare.  The Peking chicken was a real highlight.  However, the downsides ( which wouldn't necessarily stop us from eating there again) were: a messily arranged main room, dirty floor, distracted servers who don't appear to actually be trained to wait on tables ( which was a bit problematic in that it took about 20 mins to order, and dishes arrived too quickly and slapped down without telling us what they were), and a general inattention to details ( dirty silverware, a water pitcher from the bar with "tonic" taped on the handle, cracked water glass, dirty and worn menus).  If those could problems could be fixed...But the food was stellar, awesomely good, excellent.  Just don't go there expecting anything fancy except the food.

Review1684.Review: The food was not very good and not sure that the "beef" they served us was even beef!

Review1685.Review: On ordering, they asked about food allergies. We told them my son can't eat shrimp or shellfish. The waitress brought us fried flounder and asked, "who has the shrimp allergy?" I pointed to my son, and she said to him, "The fish is fried in shrimp oil, so you don't eat it," & then she walked away. I got angry and yelled, "Wait a minute. You can't do that. We ordered the fish for him. You cant just tell him not to eat it." So she took the flounder back and brought another one 15 minutes later. When ordering, i also asked them not to use MSG, but they said, all the food has MSG. So we decided to eat there anyway, as we had already waited 15 mins just to order, as they had ignored us even tho there were few customers. Very bad service. 2 of the 4 dishes had way too much vinegar, but eggplant & sautéed calamari were good.

Review1686.Review: Meh all around. I know it's off shoot of famous House of Nanking...but meh.

Review1687.Review: We went to Fang's after visiting SFMoMA. We had a party of 15. Our table was ready and the owner greeted us and offered to order for us. It worked perfectly! The food was fantastic and within an hour from sitting we were all full. Considering our ages ranged from 11 to 80, it was exactly what we wanted. Highly recommend!

Review1688.Review: Marvelous food Let to Peter Fang pick your dishes.

Review1689.Review: This was the third time I have been to the restaurant.  The first two times, I went with people who have been there before and the food just started arriving at our table.  The owner, Mr. Fang, delights in providing you a culinary experience.  It is a really good family style food experience.

Review1690.Review: I picked this place because Yank Sing was so busy, and my out of town guest loves Chinese and dim sum. Now it will be my first choice. Loved everything! and the cost is more reasonable than Yank Sing. Great Shanghai dumplings and duck.
