Review1691.Review: Really great creative Chinese cuisine. The owner of the restaurant can create a menu for you if you want.

Review1692.Review: We had a reservation for 6 and due to it being crowded we were seated downstairs. It turned out OK. Certainly much quieter than the main dining room where we always eat . I let the owner order for us this time since we are all vegetarians. The food was terrific, it always is.  We received our bill with no printout as to what each order had cost so it was hard to know why it was a bit expensive and we could not tell if he had included the tip. We left 18% anyway as the waiter had to go up and down stairs. All in all we had a great time but I'll order myself next time so I know what the real charges are and if the tip was included on a party of 6.

Review1693.Review: Every time I've been here, we've asked for the Chef's Choice selections and just let the servers bring us whatever the chef has chosen as the specialties for that day. And every time we get something fantastic that I wouldn't have otherwise tried. This option is not on the menu, so just ask your server for it. They'll bring a moderate amount of food then let you know when the last dish is coming so you can choose if you want to stop or have more. The sesame balls are excellent. Ask the bartender (or your waiter) for a pomegranate sake. Also not on the menu but so smooth and tasty!

Review1694.Review: うーん、特筆すべき美味しいものは、なかった…出張ホテル(コートヤードマリオット)の近所だから行ってみましたが、そうじゃなきゃプライベートじゃ絶対行かないですね。

Review1695.Review: Slow service, some food needed seasoning

Review1696.Review: The secret is to ask the owner, Mr. Fang, to take care of the ordering for you. I was very pleasantly surprised by the creativities of the dishes. I don't know the name of the dishes but they are mostly off the menu. The blend of seasoning is not traditional Chinese but it is very tasty with a contemporary flair. Absolute joy to have that meal there.

Review1697.Review: It was a fun spot, very casual with excellent food.  Great gluten free options.  Not fancy.

Review1698.Review: Not what it used to be.... I was visiting from Ny with friends. Came here years ago and it was delicious- possibly the best Chinese food I've ever had. Was not the same this time around. Soup and noodles were so overly peppered it was inedible. Manager came to ask if we liked it and we politely said no- and he ignored us. I would expect an offer to remake it or get something else- considering we didn't touch 2 dishes. Sadly I won't be back my next time in SF.

Review1699.Review: Second time at Fang, the quantity of food for the price is definately a factor for returning here. Both occasions were business luncheons for large teams, so the monetary value of the meal was important. Those who ate the non-vegetarian dishes (seafood, beef, pork) praised the quality of the dishes. Those who at the vegetarian dishes also praised the quality of the dishes; though the only downside was the fried rice was very oily.

Review1700.Review: Got there early, and they seated us right away (5:30, nobody else was there). Had some communication issues with young man who waited on us. Very nice, but didn't seem to grasp English well yet. He tookd good care of us, and the food was very good, not what you see at other Asian restaurants. Egg rolls were especially good, as were the steamed dumplings. Five spice whitefish was good, but a little strong on the sauce. I would return if I was in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip.

Review1701.Review: Excellent food. We let the chef/owner order for us.

Review1702.Review: Very good experience.  Food quality and diversity is the reason to go.   Short ribs were very good as well as the honey prawns.  All 6 in our party enjoyed our meals.

Review1703.Review: This is an outstandingly authentic Chinese restaurant. It is not romantic, or charming, it is authentic in the ambiance and food. Try the apple prawns, and the chicken with green pepper and ginger. Excellent, genuine food. Not fake, fast and furious. Enjoy.

Review1704.Review: Chef offered to make something to suit 3 vegetarians and 3 omnivores and it was great. Service was extremely slow though.

Review1705.Review: First time at this outshoot of the House of Nanking -- great Chinese food!  The owner kindly picked our menu and it couldn't have been better -- delicately steamed white fish in a light sauce, chicken in noodles, twice cooked short ribs with bok choy, and some super large prawns in a dipping sauce. Next time I'll order the scallion cakes, which was my go-to appetizer at House of Nanking.

Review1706.Review: We had a group of 7 diners and we went with the chef's menu instead of ordering a la carte.  They were able to accommodate a vegan diner in our group without much fuss.  The food was excellent and the vegan selection was very tasty and as good if not better than the main dishes.

Review1707.Review: We had a fabulous multi course meal created for us by Peter Fang.  He is a very personable host and we will definitely go back next time we are in San Francisco.

Review1708.Review: Like the stars indicate, this restaurant and the food is average but offers decent value.  Menu selection isn't huge and some of their dishes have an unusual twist on traditional Chinese food.  We shared 5-6 different entrees, their specialty noodles and an order of dumplings.  Nothing wowed us except the tea which included a "blooming" tea bunch in each glass.  But what was more bizarre was that they served the hot tea in what looked like a beer mug.

Review1710.Review: Fang is excellent every time - this ain't your momma' s cheap Chinese.

Review1711.Review: We had the pleasure of Fang ordering for us again and loved the dishes he chose!

Review1712.Review: We had been to Fang once before after a visit to SFMOMA and remembered it to be a bit better than the average Chinese fare.  This time we were a bit disappointed.  The calamari was very salty, the sesame chicken dish too sweet and the homemade noodles and vegetables a bit too oily.  Fang is convenient to SFMOMA, but I think we'll look for something else next time.

Review1713.Review: Chef Fang took over the ordering for our large group of friends and delivered a feast!!!

Review1714.Review: We loved our dinner at Fang. When we told our server (the owner?) that we'd never been there before, he asked if we were allergic to anything (shrimp), then said, "I'll order for you!" Have to be honest, I was a little nervous about letting someone else pick for me, but the food was excellent. I would definitely recommend Fang to my friends.

Review1715.Review: Inconsistent and disappointing service. It was unclear who are server was. We were taken care of by different people, but not well. The manager offer to order for us and we agreed. But it did not work well - one picky eater, one vegetarian, one seafood eater and me. No one was really pleased with the choices that were made for us.

Review1716.Review: The house fried rice was outstanding

Review1717.Review: FANG is a reliably great spot. I love it! Thanks so much for the tasty food always.

Review1718.Review: Great place to go for a special occasion and the wait staff was excellent. The cuisine was not extremely magical to my system but as a whole experience package, it was worth it. I would go again next time for lunch.

Review1719.Review: I have never before felt compelled to write a negative review but this was one of the most disappointing experiences we have ever had and we typically eat out six or seven times a week.  We were seated on time and the appetizer arrived quickly and was ok.  That was the end of the positive experiences because that was when the wait began.   Five couples were seated after us in the row along the windows.  We watched as their meals were served and consumed and still we waited.  We couldn't even see our server anywhere in the place.  Then we started trying to flag down any employee who came within ten feet of our table asking if they could find our server or our meal.  When the first of what we ordered finally arrived at the table, the sesame chicken, it was missing the sweet potatoes that were one of the main ingredients besides the chicken.  Our neighboring table ordered the same dish and their's clearly included them.  The person who delivered the dish asked us if we wanted some white rice.  We had ordered vegetarian brown rice with green beans and mushrooms.  He seemed to be unaware that it had been ordered.   Some  minutes later our second calamari dish arrived (seemed to be complete) and later the brown rice with edamame instead of the green beans.  All dishes were cold and all were very greasy to the point of almost being inedible, even the rice.  We picked through the food and then tried to get our check.  By the way, later we did spot our server on occasion on the other side of the room or behind the bar.  She never came  anywhere near our table nor  did anyone  in that capacity ... only those employed to deliver various items.  The food was terrible, the service was awful and basically we were just ignored.  We only complained to each other and now here as we never saw anyone to whom it would make sense to share our concerns and certainly we were never asked about our meal or thanked for coming into the restaurant.

Review1720.Review: I discovered Fang about 2 years ago and loved the place instantly.  I could eat the crispy short rib dish daily!!! I've told friends and colleagues to check it out.  Unfortunately my love affair with Fang ended last night.  My party of 7 was placed at a very long table with another large group at the opposite side of the table.  Halfway through our meal the waiter opened up a bottle of champagne.  The metal part of the bottle hit me in the eyelid!!!  The waiter had opened a bottle of champagne facing me from 2 feet away!!!!  He gave a very insincere apology while my friends said 3 other wait staff came over and laughed.  Thank god it was the metal piece as the cork would have done much more damage than my blurry vision and painful eye which I had to cover with a cold beer bottle as the staff could have cared less.  The waiter came back and apologized and said he lost his attention hence facing me while he opened the bottle.  I could have had serious eye or vision problems while he "lost his attention" and the other wait staff laughed at me.  The actions by the Fang waitstaff and inexcusable.  After our group was completely ignored. We waited 30 mins to have our table cleared and waited for our bill. We finally had to ask for our bill.  I will be taking my business elsewhere where I am respected.

Review1721.Review: Peter and Kathy do a great job of managing the restaurant. As always the food was fabulous. They did forget a few items but overall service is great. It was worth the wait.

Review1722.Review: Very nice Asian restaurant. Great food, you can choose by yourself or have the staff put together a choice of food for you. Would definitely come back.

Review1723.Review: Great experience. Special business dinner for 12 people. Fang owner came out and personally recommended dishes for our party. Basically told us to put the menus aside and he would take care of us. Waves of food arrived and it was all outstanding. What a great restaurant. Love the Fang!

Review1724.Review: Fang is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants. The food is delicious,  comes fast, and Peter/Kathy Fang run a tight ship. Convenient to the SFMOMA and convention center, it's always busy.....reservation recommended.Dr Ron

Review1725.Review: The chef came out and offered to choose our dishes for us.  Everything we were served was extremely tasty, especially the shrimp with apples - something I would probably have never selected on my own.  Only complaints were that the wine selection is pretty limited and our check was slow to arrive.

Review1726.Review: Brought a team of 20 people for lunch.  Fang suggested that they just select for us to simplify the process, which turned out great.  We needed to make a minor adjustment due to the number of vegetarians in the party.  Food started flowing quickly, and they fed us until we were full.  Green beans/potatoes; shrimp; short ribs; cauliflower;  chicken; duck bun; calamari.  Delicious.  Came to about $30/person including tip.

Review1727.Review: Older man who waits tables doesn't listen to your order and brings you what he thinks you should have and  not what you asked for. Took forever to get a check.

Review1728.Review: The food was outstanding, innovative and served very attractively. We had mostly vegetarian fare, one chicken dish and 2 shrimp noodle dishes for kids. Based on other reviews we enlisted the support of the serving staff for choosing dishes for the adults in our group. The appetizers and main dishes chosen by the serving staff was perfect - every dish was unique in texture and flavor. The soft bun with tofu was exquisite and when we asked them to bring us one more order their suggestion was to sample the other dishes and not just fill-up on the appetizer. :-) We had an assortment of cocktails as well. It was a delightful experience in every way and we definitely intend to return.

Review1729.Review: We were with our family visiting San Francisco and celebrating my youngest son's 16th birthday. He loved the restaurant and the food. The owner, Peter Fang, told us he would bring us our meal without us ordering. We enjoyed each course! Excellent food! It made the evening unique because we did not know what was coming out next. Fabulous experience!

Review1730.Review: outstanding food, service was slow but worth the wait

Review1731.Review: Owner is a little eccentric. Very traditional, but the food was good.

Review1732.Review: Fang is an incredible restaurant! The owners are attentive and one of them is always in-house. It's a great place for a group dinner too!

Review1733.Review: Never fails to impress. I never order from the menu, just leave Peter to select. Fantastic food, reasonably priced, and great Pomegranate Margaritas.

Review1735.Review: When owner Fang found out it was our first time there, he took us under his wing, and dished up his picks, taking into account our eating idiosyncrasies . Everything was fresh and delicious, especially the mushroom appetizers and the vegetarian pot stickers. Unlike a lot of Chinese restaurants, they use a light touch with the oil. It's our new favorite in SF.

Review1736.Review: Great find after visiting SFMOMA.   The spin on traditional Chinese was crafty and very well done.

Review1737.Review: We thoroughly enjoyed the dining experience here. We let the server decide what to order for our group. She asked about any dietary restrictions and and specific wants. A short time later, the first dishes appeared and each was a delight! The cuisine is extraordinary and each dish is prepared with care. If you go, be prepared for a fabulous evening!

Review1739.Review: The owner Mr. Fang took care of us.  Great selection of food & just the right amount.  Will definitely return.

Review1741.Review: Enjoyable take on traditional Asian fare. Definitely worth a try.

Review1742.Review: We picked this restaurant based on reviews and proximity to our hotel.  Food was alright.  However sitting at the table closest to the restrooms just killed the entire experience.

Review1743.Review: Inconsistent service, attentive upon arrival then no one, requested tea arrived at end of meal. Food was very good however.

Review1744.Review: Went there for my 15year old son's birthday.  There were six of us and only ordered 4 entrée and was full, generous serving size.  We were very happy with the food and service.

Review1745.Review: Don't ever tell the waiter it's your first time at Fang--they'll take away your menus and won't pay attention to your dietary restrictions resulting in an overload of courses that leave you and  your wallet feeling betrayed.

Review1746.Review: This was good for a big group of us. Really great food. The only problem we had was that a lot of vegetarians and we tried to ask for veggie options but the chef wanted to do a tasting menu. He sent out a bunch of fish dishes perhaps thinking our veggie folks could eat that but they couldn't. We wound up having to ask a couple times to send things back and replace with vegetarian or vegetable options.

Review1747.Review: One of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at

Review1748.Review: Excellent food and service! Wonderful dish recommendations! I will definitely recommend this place to others.

Review1749.Review: Server lacked detail with regard to food. No sauces, late bringing drinks. We told them we did not like hot food and both dishes were spicy. Did not listen.

Review1750.Review: Amazing food and overall taste. Some of the best I've had, once an issue was rectified. One dish, a beef dish, came hot on the outside and stone cold in the middle. Obviously the meat was in the fridge and being beef it didn't need over cooking. Unfortunately if just needed a bit longer or coming out of the fridge a lot sooner. Once redone it was all good. Had an issue asking questions about the food to 2 staff members who's English wasn't great. They didn't understand so we had to just guess. One of these was a a older guy with white hair who was a bit 'off!'I would go back though as the food was out of this world. They maybe just need to address how they handle questions and maybe not come to work if they're not in the mood. The Mongolian beef tower, the aubergines and the potstickers with a mustard chilli sauce were awesome.

Review1751.Review: good food, we taste different dishes.rapid service, attention to our requests.

Review1752.Review: Great lunch spot near SFMOMA.  We've been here several times now, and we love the interesting ingredients in the dishes.  Not your usual Chinese restaurant.  It seems healthier to me.  They add things like sliced sweet potato pieces to sesame chicken.  All the dishes we had were somewhat spicy, which we also like.

Review1753.Review: Fang has ruined me for every other Chinese restaurant. It is amazing. The owner took charge and ordered for us since I had not been there and it had been many years since my wife had eaten there. Absolutely amazing.

Review1754.Review: This is a great all round sharing place.  Service leaves a lot to be desired, but the food is great and the wine list is above average.

Review1755.Review: Always good.  Owner ordered for us and put together a great variety.  Every dish was delicious.

Review1756.Review: The best Chinese food I have ever eaten.  Let Chef Fang order for you.  You won't regret it.The value is also incredible.  Do not miss this place.

Review1757.Review: I loved Nan King-- and even saw the founder at FANG this evening.  The food was horrid.  We ordered three main dishes and the third, their famous sesame chicken came out after we had finished the first two dishes, the Mongolian Beef and the Pork, which were mostly inedible.   The service was ABYSMAL- we missed our movie.   They seemed more concerned with serving people upstairs than any of the paying customers in their main dining room.   A 9 year San Franciscan, now I know why only tourists go here.  They don't treat you like they ever want you to come back again.  We won't be and we'll tell all of the tourists we know to pass on this place too.  Terrible.

Review1758.Review: Terrible for groups.  Some plates took an hour to come to the table even after asking 3 times for an update. Waiters were beyond rude.  Will never go back.

Review1759.Review: Absolutely delightful dinner experience. The food was unique and superb. The selection and combination was orchestrated by the owner who's also an outstanding chef. After he thoughtfully chatted with us (the wife and daughter besides myself) about our preferences and dietary persuasion, we were delighted that Mr. Fang volunteered to orchestrate our dinner meal. Our confidence in him was rewarded: it could not have been better, more enjoyable dining experience. It was perfect!

Review1760.Review: Service was bad, but in the style of House of Nan King. They have a health score of 68. Fix it.

Review1761.Review: My fave Chinese restaurant in San Francisco! So delicious!

Review1762.Review: We  were visiting san faransico  ( family of 4)?for 4 days and we wanted to book restaurants in advance.  I came across Fang on trip advisor and booked the retaruarant based on very positive reviews.  it was a wonderful experience - the owner picked our dishes. He checked whether we had an dietary requirements & after that we were in his hands.  Range of food arrived including noodles, duck, chicken, prawns, & oriental veg. they were all freshly made and  delicious! Highly recommend it! Perhaps slow down on the service, the food comes out too quickly. When you are eating food like that you want the experience to be slowly enjoyed. Overall bill reasonable.  Definitely worth a visit. We"lol be back.

Review1763.Review: We were in town for the marathon, and needed dinner the night before the race.We wanted something close to our hotel (not a chain), and had good, pre-race options.FANG sounded interesting when I looked at reviews, and it was just a couple blocks from the Intercontinental.I explained to the owner that we did not eat dairy, and wanted some good carbs.  He ordered all food for us - chicken buns were yummy, as were the shrimp potstickers.  The short ribs weren't bad, but just different than expected. The chicken fried rice was interesting with zucchini and peas, and lots of egg - best we've ever had. And, the chicken with sweet potatoes also very good.The only negative - one dish came and it had dairy.  We explained that we had told the owner no dairy, and couldn't eat it.  No problem, and they were nice.  But, we gave our alternative choice, and then waited, and waited and had to re-order. . . staff was very apologetic, but we were tired and had enjoyed the meal so far, and the delay was a bummer finish!

Review1764.Review: I love Fang! The food is incredible and very reasonable in price. You also always get to interact with the owner Kathy who is a sweetheart. She's also like a local celebrity since she won Chopped

Review1765.Review: My friend recommended Fang and I'm glad we made the trip when visiting SF. The food was incredible, especially th White River Soup. The wine list wasn't too bad either. Portions are large and food is very fresh. Perfect for big groups or fun date night.

Review1766.Review: I was a vegetarian and I liked the options that were available for me. On the whole, me and my friend had good tasty food and a great time out there.

Review1767.Review: Service was slow. Didn't get what we ordered, but whatever it was they put in front of us was delicious.

Review1769.Review: We love coming here to eat for its convenient location, fresh high quality food preparation and deliciousness. The owner took our menus away and just ordered everything for us and did a good job. My only criticism is that we had an 8:15 reservation but stood in line like everyone else for close to 25 minutes on a Saturday night. Otherwise, service is fast and pleasant, and most important, it's a consistently great meal.

Review1770.Review: Don't bother reserving. We were seated 30 mins late and were never given any info about when we would be seated. When inquired the front person just kept brushing us off in a rude way with "just wait a minute". Nobody was around to take drink orders as well.

Review1771.Review: We had a very tasty dinner at FANG. The servers were a tad brusque but they were numerous and they were very efficient.The food was deftly prepared with very bright flavors. They make great use of fresh vegetables here.

Review1772.Review: Food was outstanding and good reasonableWine prices. All in all excellente . You notice that the owners is overlooking the place

Review1773.Review: The service was absolutely ridiculous. We had a reservation, and a table was ready for us fairly quickly (w/in 15 min). Once seated, we were completely ignored for over 20 min. When we finally were approached by staff, the "waiter" came up to the table, looked at us with an irritated face and nodded his head like, "ok, what do you want!" I had to ask, "ok so should we order now?".  He wrote down our order and all items were wrong. Everything was delivered by a different person, and they came and went so fast we had no time to ask for water, or a napkin. Water was never once re-filled. We had to walk to the bar to ask for water and when we did the server slammed it down on the bar. We thought it was a joke, like we were on some sort of prank show. Never in my life have I had such horrendous service. Needless to say, no tip!

Review1774.Review: Mediocre noveau Chinese food. Not for foodies. Am puzzled by the reviews that I based our visit on.

Review1775.Review: After visiting the San Francisco MOMA we were in the mood for asian cuisine and I remember wei wanted to try Fang. Not really crowded so we were immediately seated . The menu was concise and the lunch was really good we had a crispy rice salad that was excellent and some egg rolls.We also has a spicy shrimp dish that was great.Want to go back!

Review1776.Review: Why are so many Chinese restaurants tacky?  The banco seats were cracked;  the tables run down;  the rag they were using to wipe the tables was suspect.The waitstaff was inconsistent.  I'm guessing that the fabulous server was a family member and the others were not.  The food came a bit too quickly for me, but that can also be a good thing.The pork dumplings were wonderful, but I love port dumplings!The lightly fried zucchini were  crisp on the outside, but not laden with coating, and cooked through on the inside (no cold center) and the dipping sauce was define.5 season whitefish was also wonderfully prepared...cooked just enough;  flavorful but seasoning not overpowering the fish;  tender fish with no bones.  So, I'd go back but hey!  it's time to replace/repair the decor.  You are just around the corner from SFMOMA!

Review1777.Review: The food was mediocre and server acted as if she was doing us a favor. Never going there again.

Review1778.Review: Service was NEXT LEVEL. Super attentive. The appetizers were fantastic and our entrees fabulous! We really enjoyed every bite!

Review1779.Review: My fiancé and I visit House of Nanking (Fang's sister restaurant) each time we are in SF so wanted to try something different. The food was good but not as good as Nanking and MUCH

Review1781.Review: We celebrate a family reunion with members from all over the United States - the food was outstanding, the attention by the owner was fantastic and the ambience was incredibly wonderful.  I would recommend this to anyone.  We feel fortunate that we discovered this restaurant at the time our family was here from the rest of the country because we shall come back as soon as we can.

Review1782.Review: Service was fair food was excellent.Took some time before we could order

Review1783.Review: Timing was all off for service....multiple servers/runners weren't coordinated...long gaps, no offer for second glass wine. Had to get up to pay bill. 3 of 4 fishes tasty and unusual. Chicken Fried rice tasteless.

Review1784.Review: Tasty spin on Chinese food. Small but delicious food. Make reservations.

Review1785.Review: Not sure what to think. If you are looking for same food as the other associated restaurant in Chinatown forget it. I had to ask for food to be spicy. If you are a tourist and want good Chinese food not the place for you. If you are a tech SF person who wants a  place to hang out, and look like you are part of the "fu fu" foodies , it would be a great place.

Review1786.Review: The food was good, but it is definitely on the pricey end.  Service was indifferent - neither bad nor good.  They took our orders; brought out our food; and brought our checks.  There was no checking on us to see how we doing and if we would like anything else.This won't be a regular dining destination for me due to the high prices, but I would consider coming back for special occasion regardless of the indifferent service.

Review1787.Review: We had a large group and a number of people were running late but the waiter was very accommodating.  We also had a hard time picking out what dishes to order so she chose a handful of favorites which was super helpful.

Review1788.Review: We were craving Dim Sum and decided to try Fang for the first time. Upon learning this was my party's first trip to the restaurant, the Chef took our menus, said "I got you" and proceeded to bring out plate after plate of the best Dim Sum I've ever had. Thank you Fang!

Review1789.Review: Food was great! It was our first time, so Mr. Fang took over ordering for us. Everything was a surprise and was super tasty.

Review1790.Review: Took a group of work colleagues here for dinner when we were in town for a meeting. Mr Fang asked if we had been before and when we said no he took the menus away from us and said he'd take care of us and did he ever!We were served several dishes family style and everyone raved for days about our meal - was the best Chinese I've had and one of best meals in general. I'd highly recommend going and enjoying to anyone - especially as a group!

Review1791.Review: We had 14 people, including a 6 and 3 year old, at a high school graduation celebration.  We were seated downstairs where it was quiet enough that we could all talk to each other.  We ate family style, and Mr. Fang took care of the menu.  The selection and portions of the food he served up were perfect for our crowd.

Review1792.Review: My friend and were pleasantly surprised when the owner said he could pick dishes especially for us. The dishes he chose seemed to be the leftover ingredient dishes - a fish soup that was filled with bones, a beef meatball dish, and two small pork buns. They tasted alright but not worth the $68 we paid. Special treatment was definitely not worth it.

Review1793.Review: We had a great experience at Fangs.  My wife and I must have looked a bit bewildered because the "waiter" that first came to our table informed us he was not the waiter at all, but was the head chief!  He asked if we'd like him to plan our meal, and promptly took our menus away when we happily accepted.He brought us a delicious meal that was the perfect size (not too much food) and the perfect price (probably slightly below average at this restaurant for two people).  I was happy that he didn't take this opportunity to give us all the most expensive items on the menu.

Review1794.Review: Awesome restaurant!  The owner took away our menus and said:  I know what to bring.  And, boy did he!  Plate after plate of amazing food.  Just when I thought I tasted a favorite, the next one was even better.  I don't eat red meat and I'm allergic to eggs (total buzz kill for most restaurants), but not a problem here.  I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Review1795.Review: Love the ambiance. But the food is not all that. For lunch we shared the Peking buns with duck (very good), signature egg rolls (good) and a salad that was overdressed and not good.

Review1796.Review: We've frequented this restaurant in the past.  We will not go again.  Food just BAD.  Service has always been bad, but food normally makes up for it.  Disnt even bother taking left overs home

Review1797.Review: Fang is channeling the old Sam Wo - not just rudest waiter, but entire staff. From the hostesses who barred the entrance to the waiters who just forgot we were there. Had we not asked for the check, we wouldn't have gotten it, but then we were accused of not having it when another waiter had picked it up. If we had been dishonest, we could have just left.Luckily the food was great. But we won't be going back. King of Dumpling - better prices, amazing service.

Review1798.Review: I've been to Fang several times for weekday lunch but I recently went there with my husband on a quiet Sunday afternoon after visiting SFMOMA.  We got a table that was so isolated in the corner that the neighboring diner had to get out of her chair to let us pass.  It took a long time for someone to take our order, and it was by leaning over the side of the bar behind us.  One order came several minutes before the second order, and even then we didn't get any eating utensils or napkins.  No one refilled our water.  Then it took a long time again for the bill to arrive, and then they forgot about our leftovers and I was certain they had thrown it away (but we did get a take-out box after much waiting).  We still enjoyed the food very much, although I believe we also were overcharged on our bill.  It was disappointing, but the other visits had been good and I would still go again for the food.

Review1799.Review: When Chef Peter Fang asked us if we had ever been there before and we said "no", he replied, that we would have to let him take care of us. That he did. We had three delicious dishes: duck in a bread wrapper, short ribs with baby bok choy and chicken with fried rice cakes. It was all delicious. The bill was reasonable for the city of San Francisco. We lucked out with FANG that night.

Review1800.Review: The food was overpriced and flavorless.

Review1801.Review: My husband had eaten at another of Mr Fang's restaurants years agobut did not remember his name. Mr Dang waited on us personally and we loved everything served.

Review1802.Review: It is actually one of my favorite in SF. I love this place!

Review1803.Review: This was a great spot to bring my business partners. We were almost 20 people, so they just kept bringing us food. Everything was tasty.

Review1804.Review: As many have written in earlier reviews, we trusted our dinner to owner/chef Peter Fang.  He took our dinning restrictions in to account and sent out two starters and three main dishes (for three of us).  While one of the dishes was on our list the others were not and all were amazing.  Yes, it seems overly trusting to let someone else make the decisions, but in this case we ended up trying dishes we would have missed.

Review1805.Review: Good food and very nice owner/manager who "ran the show" in regards to bringing us his recommendations. Fairly loud and tables were tight but it didn't matter and actually fits with the laid back vibe.

Review1806.Review: Great food and wonderful location next to the SFMOMA!

Review1807.Review: Very creative, delicious chinese cuisine with many options.  Family owned.  The owner made a personal visit to our table and selected dishes for us. We were not disappointed. Atmosphere lively with quite a few large parties.  Only disappointment was that our daughter's Birthday was not recognized in any way, even after we mentioned it on reservation and when we entered. It was Sat. night and staff was scurrying to serve the packed restaurant. Patrons seemed enthusiastic and happy.

Review1808.Review: Food and service was excellent. Peter Fang himself selected our menu consisting of pork wonton soup, shrimp fried dumplings, short ribs and honey prawns. Everything was excellent.

Review1809.Review: The food was delicious, and well worth the wait. I definitely recommend reservations if going for lunch, and do go with friends, because the serving plates make sharing so easy.

Review1810.Review: Peter Fang has excellent recipes for really good food.Try the sesame chicken and the tomato and shrimp salad

Review1811.Review: It was my second time at Fang - both times with a larger group. The staff was helpful and can be trusted by bringing great food without you having to look at the menu

Review1812.Review: A pretty good fushion for western people. The owner has pretty good idea of how to combine traditional Chinese food  with Western tastes.

Review1813.Review: I fund a cabbage caterpillar inside my vegetable. The taste of the food is ok but not worth that price. I will never come again.

Review1814.Review: I love the food at Fang which is authentic asian, but with interesting and tasty variants. Great xiao long boa, and other dumplings, plus incredible Fang's Buns with beef, duck, chicken, etc. Everything's delicious and presented well.  I regret they discontinued their happy hour with more affordable small plates and drinks until 6, but I expect they had a great audience who would all stop ordering after 6pm when prices rise.  I'll keep going as they're well worth the price to me.

Review1815.Review: I've eaten at Fang several times and always do the "chef's choice". I haven't gotten a bad meal yet. Not your typical "Chinese" restaurant, but more of an Asian fusion. As long as you know that going in, you'll hopefully enjoy it as much as I have.

Review1816.Review: Most of the dishes were fried, so to much oil for me.  the other three diners thought it was all fine, so I was in the minority.  The seafood/fish was very fresh.  Service a little haphazard, but we eventually received everything we ordered.

Review1817.Review: This was our first time at Fang's - I was treating a friend for his birthday .Both of us are quite familiar with most of the Chinese restaurants in San Francisco -no matter if it is Chinatown or Clement Street , Balboa St ,Noriega, Irving, etc --plus being familiar with House of Nanking --It was great to see a mixed of selection of dishes - some from House of Nanking and then Fang's signature dishes --I have to say this is the first time in a long time - that we thoroughly enjoyed all of the 5 dishes that we ordered --- and of course doing our own comparison - stating that these were the best prepared we have had in a long time as well.With the dishes so excellent - and numerous to choose - I do recommend that your lunch or dinner party to be 4-6 people so you can order more dishes to experience.One other huge plus - they take reservations for lunch ---I truly recommend to fellow San Franciscans to make Fang's their "go to" restaurant for amazing Chinese food.

Review1818.Review: Wonderful restaurant. Loved the food.  Loved the prices for wine. Let the kitchen put together a meal for our family of 4. It was reasonably priced and delicious.  All 4 of us agree it was our favorite meal in San Francisco!  Must try!

Review1819.Review: Don't let the owner tell you "he's got it". In a city of amazing Chinese, we were not impressed.

Review1820.Review: Great food as usual, leave the choice to the owner , never fails. Service was very slow downstairs

Review1821.Review: Rude and mindless staff. Food was cobbled together with no skill or care. Absolutely horrible.

Review1822.Review: Had a wonderful client group dinner. Kathy Fang gave us a wonderful experience with the food, service and environment! We will be doing this again!

Review1823.Review: Sent two CEOs to Fang for lunch and everything was perfect from their personal welcome to their chef chosen dishes. I got huge kudos for making the reservation - Fang is Fantastic!

Review1824.Review: We didn't get served for 15 min after arrival. We didn't receive the correct order after requesting part of meal 4 times. The refills cost full cost which is stupid and needs to be known to customers.

Review1826.Review: I have never yet ordered here myself, in fact, I've never opened their menu.  Just tell the grand master to keep the food coming - and he will - and it is all just sooooo good!  Wine list is short, but the selection is good w enough variety.  I would recommend some dishes but again, I don't know their names - that shrimp thing is very very good, as well as that beef thing, and the white fish, and...  Well, haven't had a thing I wouldn't like here.

Review1827.Review: Rather than ordering off the menu, we asked Peter to put together a meal for us after telling him that we eat fish and chicken, but not meat. He chose a perfect combination of flavors and textures for us: a highly flavorful steamed fish, little  flour pockets stuffed with duck, braised pea shoots, a tofu tomato and nutty rice dish, and a mushroom dish. It was heaven.

Review1828.Review: I love the food at Fang.  Unfortunately, we were at a table for 4 placed downstairs next to very large noisy groups. We were celebrating out son's birthday and we couldn't talk and felt like we were in the way.  His birthday was not acknowledged either. Disappointing overall

Review1829.Review: waiter suggested he order meat and chicken dish for us, they were just ok.

Review1830.Review: Went to FANGS for my wife’s birthday which is on Valentines Day!  The food was delicious and service was above average.   Highly recommend!!!

Review1831.Review: First I want to say the people who work there are very nice. The food is just spectacular. I travel to mainland China several times a year. The food at Fang is just as good, if not better than China. The short ribs are awesome, and the delicious wonton soup is imaginative. The shrimp and apple dish was just great......and the pork buns are to die for. Truly a great diversified menu. HOWEVER, they need to learn some western manners:1. Do not carry plastic bins of dirty dishes past the customers. We don't want to see how you collect the dirty dishes. Especially when you're dragging and banging them past my chair as I'm eating.2. Do not place the chairs on top of the tables surrounding your guests while they are eating. Its not polite or sanitary. Its customary in the US to wait until the diners have left. 3. The owner means well, however he's a bit pushy. I'm quite capable of ordering and asking questions. However his suggestions of the pork buns was spot on. 4. Its not cheap......$45 per person is steep for Chinese food. At least act the part of a higher class restaurant. The people who bring the food is reminiscent of China. They're going through the motions, nothing more. Bottom line, the food is worth all the craziness around you . Kathy Fang is very nice and from what I hear is quite famous in cooking circles. She knows her stuff. No doubt her Dad has had some influence.

Review1832.Review: Really tasty and creative modern Chinese.   The Sesame Beef was really good and the wonton soup is delicious with a touch of crispy rice.   Crispy spare ribs were uniquely delectable.   Definitely a gem in the competitive SFO food scene,

Review1833.Review: Sat for half an hour at our table and no one even tried to take out order... Restaurant wasn't even half full. Very disappointing.

Review1835.Review: The Chef offered to select our dinner for us.  We were very happy to have said yes.  We had a wonderful meal.  Not exactly cheap, but well worth it!

Review1836.Review: There is Chinese food and then there is FANG.  The food is fabulous--light yet bursting with flavor and texture.  The chef offered to order for us--I would highly recommend that!  We had dishes we probably wouldn't have been smart enough to order--and we will go back for all of them!  In fact, we haven't stopped talking about them....

Review1837.Review: The food gets better every time I go here.  The choices one gets here are not available at most comparable restaurants.  Will be back soon.

Review1838.Review: FANG has great Chinese food. Better than most places which are a lot more expensive.  It is not in Chinatown so the food has to be really good. It is not touristy.  It is not in a hotel. It was filled with people who were probably locals.

Review1839.Review: I made a reservation to take my sales team to Fang for a work/birthday lunch for 8 ppl. It was awful! The woman who served us was not even a server- but I think a cook who simply went and told our order to a server and the food came out at different times. We each ordered individual plates so this was really off. And by the time I got my plate everyone else was done. We asked for two separate checks and when they didn't do that, and so I asked them again and then they split it up in some weird way that didn't make sense. The food was also pretty bland. I could understand if they were busy but it was before the lunch rush and no one was really in there. So in short, terrible.

Review1840.Review: Fun for a large group just let them bring you yummy food

Review1841.Review: Unfortunately one of the worst dining experiences I have had in SF for a while. Food was awful (really awful). Not even close to authentic chinese, odd unthoughtful ingredients, and ugly presentation. To top it off - not cheap and the waitstaff were friendly but unattentive and had no idea what was on menu. Really disappointing. I could write a paragraph on how bad each dish was and have been ribbed for 2 days by my co-workers who I took there. 1 out of 5 and that is generous.

Review1842.Review: Upon learning it was our group's first time here, Mr. Fang, owner and chef, proceeded to tell us that we should not worry about ordering from the menu ourselves. He instead sent us dishes he chose himself and we were not disappointed at all! Thanks you Mr. Fang!

Review1843.Review: This was an amazing experience. The owner came to our table and asked us about food restrictions. Then he said leave it to him and it was wonderful. He started us out with Peking Duck in the little white puffy taco like shell. Melted in the mouth. Then we had squash and seafood soup. Both light ad creamy and so delicious. Our next course was honey prawns which are my very favorite Chinese food and these were as good or better than any I've had. After that we had a coconut beef on a skewer that was fall apart tender and delicious. The last course was a huge bowl of sticky brown rice with black beans and whole mushrooms that I didn't think we could possibly finish but we did. Very special and wonderful dinner.

Review1844.Review: I won't even get into all the details of every issue that I faced dining at Fang. Quite frankly, I should have heeded the reviews that I read about the service and not set foot in there at all. The food is good, but in a city like SF, which has a plethora of good restaurants, it's simply not good enough. The food would literally have to make me lose weight and grow money in order to justify it's preposterously bad service.

Review1845.Review: I went on New Year's Day for lunch with my brother. We noticed quite a few items listed on their online menu were not on the menu in the restaurant. We asked if we could order those items and they said yes. We ordered 6 dishes; 3 which were not on their restaurant menu. The food was amazing the service was mediocre but everyone was friendly for the most part. When we got our bill, we noticed it was almost $40 bucks more than what we anticipated. In checking each item, we noticed the 3 items we ordered from their online menu was doubled what the price was listed. We asked why and they said on New Year's Day it was dinner pricing all day. However even looking at the dinner pricing there was still a $5-$7 difference in what their online menu priced versus our bill. We didn't fight it and just paid the bill although we pretty bummed with this situation. Not only should every one be notified when ordering but they should also update their menus to be the same. The family next to use had the same situation happen so I'm sure it was an ongoing surprise- issue for people who attended the restaurant midday on New Years. I most likely will not return.

Review1846.Review: On our first trip to San Francisco we found that we hadn't made dinner plans for New Years Eve. I went to Open Table and found Fang, a fantastic find. We were seated very quickly and the staff was fantastic, but was surprised at the owners reaction when we wanted to order from the menu instead of having him "create" a meal for us. Had we not read prior reviews, we would have probably left the restaurant. I realize he is an accomplished chef but toning down the reaction might help. Once we made it over that small hurdle it was a wonderful dinner with great service and we will return on our next trip to San Francisco.

Review1847.Review: Mr. Peter Fang approached our table and asked "Is it your first time her?", and we truthfully answered - yes. And he said - let me take care of you, and quietly took back the menu card, and drinks list. Then walked away.For a while I wondered if it was foolish of me to have left in his hands the fate of our dinner that night ... what a surprise did it turn out to be!We had a most delightful dining experience to close the year.Our heartfelt thanks to chef/owner Peter Fang. We look forward to dining with him again.

Review1848.Review: well worth a visit the chef d'cuisine called on our table personally and made us a custom lunch based upon our request for vegan cuisine.  just delightful.

Review1849.Review: Best Chinese I've had in s long time.

Review1850.Review: Best Chinese food in the bay area

Review1851.Review: This restaurant met and/or exceeded our expectations. After perusing the menu (in both English and Mandarin), an older gentleman came over to our table, introduced himself as the chef, and quietly asked us if there was anything (beef, chicken, fish, etc) that we would ordinarily not include in our diet. We stated our preferences and he suggested that we leave the rest to him as he kindly took our menus. Within minutes, the servers began to bring out one delicious offering after another, each dish a unique blend of the best of what this restaurant has to offer. Don't miss this place!

Review1852.Review: Maybe this restaurant is better on a regular day. Christmas Day was a disorganized madhouse. But the food was good!

Review1853.Review: I just want to preface this with , we had a reservation and  went for dinner at 6.30 on Christmas day so understandably busy.I chose this place as a Christmas Day option since the last 2 times I went (granted over 18 months ago) I found the to food to be flavorful, the cocktails were amazing, all was well presented and the ambiance on par with a decent fine dining restaurant. What has happened since my last visit is this place has become a notch or 2 higher that House of Nan King (the owners original restaurant) and that place is organized chaos. Its now a quick in and out place, food was not hot, zero presentation skills and the service had gone awry. I hope it was just due to the day but in any event, a bad choice for us on Christmas day, it really put a damper on the evening. We even sent one dish back and got out of there as fast we could. The line was backed out the door!

Review1854.Review: Christmas dinner. Website says they can accommodate gluten allergies but the waiter was surly and said he would have to pick our dinner. They brought a soup and two entrees and then the check. No rice, no offer of dessert, no asking if we wanted another round of drinks. This was meant to be a treat and it was rude and rushed for no reason.

Review1855.Review: Fang doesn't come close to living up to its hype, and all the reviews that tell you to beware of being taken care of by the host are true. You don't get taken care of - you just get taken.  We thought it would be fun to have Mr. Fang order for us, especially after he picked up the menus and told us not to choose anything ourselves. What followed was a travesty - a flurry of dishes including a soggy and greasy imitation of Peking Duck, something that should have been called Yesterday's Seafood Soup, Miracle Whip and Honey Pineapple Shrimp, Leftover Generic White Fish and Spinach in Sweet Cream Sauce, Fatty Mysterious Beef and Dried Out Chicken with Lettuce. After the soup, everything came at about the same time, in what seemed a pretty blatant plan to pawn off the most expensive items on the menus and turn the table as quickly as possible. Most of the dishes were cold and bland, none was especially interesting and no one stopped by to see how we were doing. For $210 (lunch for 5, no drinks but tea), we got a sampling of what can only be described as things the kitchen needed to get rid of.  I'm surprised they didn't serve pigeon.  After eating at Fang for the first and last time, I sure felt like one.

Review1856.Review: Fang has many Chinese dishes that you've seen before, but every one of them is just a bit different from what you're used to.  And it's all tasty.  Come here with a group to try lots of things.  If the owner is there, ask him to choose your food.  He'll find out what you like, and give you a delicious feast!

Review1857.Review: They got rid of the sweet potatoes and replaced it with undercooked potatoes. Panda Express's orange chicken is now much better.  Also the soup the owner picked for us was gross and bland. Other dishes were good. Service is always weak there.

Review1858.Review: Great place to take the fam when they're in town and want a San Francisco staple (same owners of the ever popular and long lines out front hole in the wall House of Nan King.) Owner/Chef orders for you (just go with it!) Bar drinks are overly sweet so go with wine or beer if that's not your flavor.

Review1859.Review: Owner came to our table and suggested the assorted dishes.  The combination of the food taste was really excellent. We especially enjoyed vegetables in the plates.After several plates, he came and ask if we had space for another plate.  Great!!

Review1860.Review: The chef came to our table, asked if we had dined there before, and when we said no, he took our menus and offered to choose for us. We were up for the adventure and he chose well! The only things I didn't love about the experience were the clang of dishes from the exposed kitchen and the long wait for our check. We will definitely be back!

Review1861.Review: The food was, as always, quite good, and came very quickly. We had one of our favorites, the fried beef cubes, plus some new options, like the mushroom rice, which were really good. I think the vegetarian/vegetable options are always really great, and they're very accommodating for those who don't eat meat. The food is a great deal, as it's never too expensive even with large groups. Our only concern on this trip was the long wait time for a table, even though we had a reservation.

Review1862.Review: I had a great meal here during a convention at the Moscone Center. The food and speed of service were both great. I am looking forward to returning here next year when I return to SF.

Review1863.Review: I had a reservation for lunch with a group and while I could see the restaurant was busy and understand what that means for the host, I wasn't impressed by how we were greeted. Or rather, how we weren't greeted. The hostess/cashier was downright rude to us. She didn't even say hello and kept rudely telling us to just wait. Really off-putting! When we finally were seated, the chef came to take our order. He clearly wanted us to be happy, which I appreciated. Overall, it wasn't so great, between the rude host, long wait, even with a reservation, and very loud noise. The food was OK, not great. I won't be returning.

Review1864.Review: The food here is fabulous and they have a perfect downstairs room for large parties. Our waiter suggested going "family-style" and sharing a number of dishes for our large group (16). It was perfect! Made the bill easy, and undoubtedly easier for the staff. I tried dishes I would normally not order, and they were all wonderful!

Review1865.Review: I have eaten at Fang 15 times or more over the last decade.  I attend a professional meeting in San Francisco every year.  Fang is close to the Moscone Center and their lunch service is usually reasonably fast.  I can't recall a dish that I didn't enjoy and a few stand out.  This time I had a stir fry that included breaded shrimp (prefried) and chunks of apple stir fried together with a cream sauce.  It sounds unusual but it was delicious and I would probably never have ordered it myself.  That day I was lucky and the "chef" offered to bring me dishes for lunch.  That's happened before and I have never been sorry.  My only regret about Fang is the service and the evening meal I had a few days ago was particularly bad.  The server, a young woman who was dressed like someone who would work the front of the house, took my order.  She made it clear to my dinner companion and me how bored she was with the process, leaning against a wall, staring into space, and sighing as she wrote down our selections.  Thoughtless, is too kind a word.  She was rude.So, go for the food and enjoy it.  Ignore the poor service as much as you can.  And, if the "chef" offers to select food for you, let him do it.

Review1866.Review: After we had some time to browse the menu, the waiter/chef came to our table and asked if it was our first visit. We said yes, and he took our menus away and said he would take care of us. What followed was a stream of delicious platters. Appetizers, main dishes, the whole nine yards, as they say. All was soectacular. I can't wait to go back!

Review1867.Review: Scrumptious food- the chef asked us what we'd like (a group of 6 for lunch) and after listening carefully, suggested that he'd prepare some dishes accordingly. I was a bit apprehensive about such a loose arrangement, but the food was exquisite! Dish after dish arrived, all interesting and delicious, including vegetarian ones. Not a single one was stereotypical Chinese (i.e., chow mein, Kung Pao chicken, etc.), but rather novel, well-balanced, and yummy. Definitely recommended to creative foodies. Meal was $26/person, including tip.

Review1868.Review: They seated us and promptly forgot we existed. They took 15 minutes to come ask about drinks, and then 30 minutes later there was no sign of a waiter. I even asked the host to send someone over and no luck. We left hungry after being at the table for 45 minutes.

Review1869.Review: We visited FANG on a Saturday night with a group of 5 people. We started to look at the menu when Chef Fang himself asked us if we've ever dined at the restaurant before. We all said no, so he took our menus and told us to trust him! We were surprised, as everything he picked out for us was delicious. Here's a list of what we had:Steamed buns w/ duckPumpkin soup with pork and shrimp (My favorite)Sizzling fish dishHoney glazed prawns with apples (Loved it!)Beef with Bok Choi (Not sure what the name was, but delicious!)Mushroom fried riceBill wasn't too steep. About ~$200 total for 6-7 dishes. Would definitely come back!

Review1870.Review: The chef is extraordinary and amazing!

Review1871.Review: A California twist to some traditional dishes.  Very fresh, seasonal, delicious.  We appreciated the personal attention from Peter, the owner/chef.

Review1872.Review: The food was outstanding. The maitre d came to our table and asked If we had any allergies, we said no, he said he was the chef, took our menus, and ordered for us. We were not disappointed.

Review1873.Review: The menu at Fang is varied and interesting, and everything we ordered was delicious, even when the execution wasn't quite right.  That said, be prepared for a somewhat slapdash experience.  Everything arrives almost at once, so you've only just begun to eat your appetizers when the main dishes arrive.  And some dishes might be missing key ingredients.  For example, the pea shoot salad didn't have any pea shoots in it.  They had run out.  They also have a full bar, but no bartender, and no one seems to know how to mix anything beyond the most basic cocktails.  But Fang has a very energetic vibe and the food is great, so be prepared to go with the flow and enjoy!

Review1874.Review: Fang is an outstanding example of authentic Chinese cuisine near New Montgomery and Howard. I had dinner there recently with by step-daughter, a native of Shandong province. We were very pleased with the menu selections, the use of the freshest ingredients, and the chef's willingness to add extra spice to dishes at our request without canceling the intended flavors. Highly recommend.

Review1875.Review: They seated us in a corner table that was blocked on one side by the bar and the other side by the table next to us. They literally had to pass our dishes over the other table and have the other guests hand it over to us. The BBQ pork short ribs I ordered were very tough, but the Shanghai soup dumplings were good. After the meal, we had to walk up to the front for them to finally take our cards. Decent food, but subpar service.

Review1876.Review: Best dining experience in SF.  I had a couple of other nice dinners (Ichido, Scomas, Fog Harbor, Boudin) during my stay but FANG was the best.Amazing nanking chicken!  I had 2 other dishes and those were good, but the chicken was the best I ever had.  Service is Ok, but could get better.  My wife ordered a beer and they came back with a different brand, so we had to ask them to change it (they had no issues on that).  When placing the order I found interesting the waitress never wrote down anything, she completely relyed in her memory... and she forgot a  dish (side rice).  Anyway, the main courses were abundant so we decided to cancel that rice order (again, they had no issues).Will come back for sure!

Review1877.Review: Very average Chinese food.  Think deep fried and fatty.  The service was also very flat.  Very disappointing as it was not inexpensive.

Review1878.Review: We had a group of 22 friends and colleagues.  The waitress did the ordering for us and it turned out just great.  One of the guest said this was the best Chinese he ever had - and he have been to many Chinese restaurant worldwide.  It is another one of those fusion chinese food - not typical cantonese.  I was great and definitely at the M.Y. China level.

Review1879.Review: We didn't find the food bad.... But rather weird. It was fresh and the potions large but we didn't care for the flavors. We are pretty well versed in Chinese food but could not figure out what region this was supposed to represent.

Review1880.Review: This was close to the worst service experience I have ever had, especially for the mediocre food served.  I will not return to this establishment.

Review1881.Review: There were 12 of us and the waiter asked us if we want family style.  We said sure and they brought out a mix of food and each one was tastier than the one before.  The whole group enjoyed the meal.  Highly recommend.

Review1883.Review: We had a delicious dinner here. The pork dumplings were divine and the fragrant chicken with its lemongrass flavor was really wonderful. The hot and sour soup was incredibly salty and we sent that back, but everything else was wonderful. Attractive contemporary setting in good downtown location. And best of all, the whole dinner was really inexpensive.

Review1884.Review: I  love that the Owner designs the menu for our group. He always takes care of vegetarian guys and food is awesome. It is little pricey this way but I  guess it's worth it.

Review1885.Review: You don't have to go to Chinatown to find tasty Chinese dining.We have been here several times, and the food is so good and flavorfulthat we keep coming back. With vegetarian options and fresh fish on the menu,we let owner/chef Peter Fang order for us.The selections were perfect, with a good variety of dishes that complimented each other.Prices were reasonable, service was prompt, everything was tasty. Recommended!

Review1886.Review: I can't wait to come back here, love this place....all their food is delicious.

Review1888.Review: Five us on a business trip dined on a Sunday evening at FANG. Though we had a reservation, it may not have been needed as there was plenty of open tables. After ordering drinks and looking over the menu, Mr. Fang came to our table and introduced himself. After checking for allergies and significant likes/dislikes, he said he'd take care of us. Seven wonderful dishes later, we all agreed that he took very good care of us. The food was spot on and appropriately varied from dish to dish. The price was very reasonable and the whole experience was memorable.

Review1889.Review: This was our first time at Fang, The crispy short ribs opened my eyes to the level of cookin and recipes. Delicious all around!

Review1890.Review: The food was not great. I was expecting very impressive cuisine because this is the sister restaurant to House of Nanking, which I remember as being excellent. Good news is that the prices are reasonable

Review1891.Review: Booked this location for 3 friends to catch up and have a great Asian meal.I was embarrassed the whole evening. We were seated in a horrible location - server could not get to us.  Service was absolutely horrible!! The worst ever!The food was pretty good - but we waited forever. They served us what they wanted to serve that night - they did not want to take our order, so we just went with suggestions.The place really needs an update or a cleaning service - just a mess at front desk and beyond. The construction area outside was distracting, no ambiance anywhere.  The restaurant may do well because of it's location to Moscone Center, but I am not going back.

Review1892.Review: There aren't many great places to eat near the Moscone center and Fang is one of them. The food is mouth-watering and the teas are beautiful (get the blossoming flower). Service can be spotty but once you are able to order, the food comes out quickly.

Review1893.Review: HelloI had a reservation for a group of 8 and assumed from the great reviews that the food is clean and free of MSG.  When I telephoned the day of the reservation to inquire if we could come earlier I also asked about MSG usage.  I was told it is in all dishes and many things are pre-prepared using MSG.  They COULD NOT ACCOMMODATE a request for "NO MSG".  What a pity.  We will never be going to Fang.

Review1894.Review: The food was delicious, the servers had a continuous stream of plates delivered to our table. We went with the chef ordering for us and we were not disappointed. Comfortable seating and reasonable pricing

Review1895.Review: I have had lunch at Fang's many times and it's ALWAYS fantastic. This past week was no different. Mr. Fang waited on my 2 friends and I, he asked what we ate (and didn't eat) and then brought us 3 dishes that were perfect! I will be back for sure!

Review1896.Review: Whether it's your first time or you are a regular, you will not be disappointment at Fang's. I fell in love with this restaurant last December and make it a point to dine here every time I am in San Francisco. All my guests are extremely impressed with the food quality and special touch that Peter Fang has to offer. My suggestion is to have Peter select the courses for your party and be sure to let him know if you have any food restrictions. Enjoy!!

Review1897.Review: Outstanding food. Fang himself welcomed us and asked if it is our first time. When we answered it is, he suggested that he will pick the dishes for us. It turned to be a very good decision and all the dishes were very very good.The only comment I have is with regarding the service - we were completely ignored for the whołe evening...

Review1898.Review: When we walked in the hostess just simply pointed to where we should sit. Then later brought us menus. Should have known at this point, even poorer service would follow. Multiple waitstaff walked by us and did not acknowledge us. Finally the owner, I'd presume, came up and took our order. With no personality or greeting. Ordered soups, asked to have them first. In addition to an appetizer and entree we asked to be delivered to our table afterwards. App came out first, then soup. Ok fine. But then we were delivered lo mein instead of the ordered house rice. At that point we just took it, but regret it as it was super salty (soaked in soy sauce).  The onion pancake and drinks weren't bad, but honestly the service and mixed up salty order of lo mein ruined it. We had to track someone down even to pay our bill! And they were not busy. Don't recommend this place.

Review1899.Review: My wife and I dined at Fangs with two other couples on the Sunday evening of Labor Day Weekend 2015.   Soon after we were seated, Peter Fang greeted us and asked whether we had dined there before.  I mentioned that I had visited on two prior occasions, both of which were remarkable.  Mr Fang smiled, and said, "Well then, let me take these from you!"  And he gently gathered and removed our menus.After asking if we suffered from any food allergies or religion-based food restrictions, Peter promised "to design an amazing meal for us."  Just a few minutes later, the courses started to arrive one by one- in good time, and with just enough food for each to enjoy without being overwhelmed by anything other than Fang's culinary excellence.  A cold, zesty snow pea dish was followed by a tray of delectable mushrooms- and then by the best, creamy wonton soup you will ever taste.  Mains included chicken with vegetables, fried fish, barbecue beef, an awesome sweet shrimp and apple dish (a table favorite)' and pork ribs.  The meal was concluded with sesame seed dessert balls.  Every course was impressive.Now back home in the Midwest and after two weeks since our visit, all of us are saying that our dinner at Fangs was a favorite memory of our five day journey to NoCal- and one that we all would strive to repeat in the future if at all possible.  Particularly if you want to to enjoy a broadening experience with excellent food and delightful service, please make a reservation, take your group and ask Mr. Fang himself to treat you to an evening you will not soon forget!

Review1900.Review: The service was good as well as the ambiance but the food was less than enjoyable.  All of our dishes were very spicy but not in a way that was tasty.

Review1902.Review: The food at Fang was just uniformly excellent. Every single dish we had was spectacular--that never happens!  The appetizers were amazing (scallion pancake, dumplings, mushrooms). The short rib was to die for. Both  fish dishes were out of this world and the pea shoots with edamame were delicious. It was so good that I came back a second night and brought another friend. One of the most special parts of the whole experience were our interactions with the young chef who came to our table, made suggestions and even tailored portion sizes and dishes so we could sample more things without filling up too quickly. She was very impressive.

Review1903.Review: Great food but they ripped us off by charging a flat 'open food' fee that was more than the menu prices of what we ordered.

Review1904.Review: If you enjoy good food and cocktails, you will love this place. The service, however, is erratic. There doesn't seem to be any organization to who is being served by whom. Three different people took our order, and forgot our second entree. When we received our bill, we had been charged $25 for  two "open food items." The server did correct our ticket, but I am suspect that this is typical behavior. We now call this CF Fang.

Review1905.Review: The food was good, not great.  The service was not very good.  Slow, inattentive and the food all came out at different times.

Review1906.Review: The best way to experience Fang is to let them bring you food of their choosing. Identify any likes/dislikes up front and then turn it over to their very capable team to delight you with a variety of favors that are unique. One of my favorite restaurants when visiting SF. Vegan and veg friendly.

Review1907.Review: Went for a recent corporate dinner. Great food but with our group size we didn't get as much attention when it came to getting more food. Fang did a great job seating us but table was very long and we had requested a lazy Susan so we didn't have to pass dishes all the way down. Unfortunately we didn't get the lazy Susan (understandable if it didn't fit the table) but we were still needing more food at the end for our group size. It was harder to get the servers attention but eventually the manager came out to ensure we had enough. He seemed disappointed that our group asked for more food but when it came out, it was the highlight of the evening, culinary-wise. Still had a great dinner and appreciated the manager coming over twice. Good food.

Review1908.Review: We had read reviews that the food was amazing and the owner/chef would surprise you with his choices. We were not disappointed! He asked if there was anything we didn't eat, and then brought us appetizers and main dishes in succession. Each was delicious and pretty too. Our teenagers LOVED everything as well. We will definitely return and recommend.

Review1909.Review: Kathy and her Dad, Mr. Fang have consistently chosen menus that delight everyone around the table. The comments I get most from my friends are, "This is the best Chinese food I have ever had and never tasted these type of delicious dishes anywhere before".

Review1910.Review: Mediocre , very salty Chinese food made  with just average quality ingredients . We had the seafood soup which was salty and they used red snapper which had many small sharp bones in the fish meat of the soup.  The ground pork topped with a drizzle of fermented fish was too salty and swimming in a quarter inch of pork oil. The roasted duck was okay, edible, but not outstanding. Finally, even the white rice was mediocre as it was a bit hard and chewy, perhaps it was undercooked or had been sitting on the hot plate too long and became dehydrated. Will not eat at Fang again.

Review1911.Review: Very Good Chinese Cuisine in SOMA SF near downtown;  Authentic menu items; Busy atmosphere; Very attentive and responsive  wait staff

Review1912.Review: First visit to this nice local place.  Owners welcomed us at the door and took care of the entire experience from there.  Can't wait to come back.

Review1913.Review: Had some of the best Chinese food here ever!  The food was great and we killed every bit of it.  Very authentic and very delicious!  My wife wasn't crazy about the mixed drink she ordered but they really aren't knows to be great bartenders....again, the food....yummy!

Review1914.Review: Tasty food but over salted. Owner threw menus at us and looked away distracted as we made orders. We were also charged more on the bill than the price on the menu for a few dishes because we were "many people." Whatever that means. Lousy and loud music in background. That written, the food was generally tasty.

Review1915.Review: Very original Chinese food.   My mother said it was the best Chinese food she ever had & she's from New York.

Review1916.Review: Peter Fang, Chef/Owner, of Fang Restaurant is an exceptional chef and delightful host.  He directs his kitchen staff very closely and produces exceptionally delicious Chinese food.  As an out of town guest, we agreed to take up Peter's offer to order for us...my, my, my, everything brought to our table was to die for!  Phenomenal food!  I highly recommend Fang.

Review1917.Review: The seven family members were making their first visit to this San Francisco restaurant, and were delighted with the owner's/chef's offer to save us the trouble of ordering.  He asked about any  dining limitations insofar as allergies or dislikes, then said he'd decide on our appetizers and courses.  We were thrilled, and certainly not disappointed.  Everybody ate everything...and no one left hungry or disappointed.  The décor is so-so, as was the service of the regular staff, but we didn't come for that.  And we'd certainly go again, or recommend it to others.

Review1918.Review: Brought some business colleagues here for lunch and had yet another memorable meal. Good to know that I can come here any time and expect great food.

Review1919.Review: Mr. Fang will customize a menu for you on the spot based on your preferences. We were served a great dinner for a reasonable price. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Review1920.Review: This was our first time to eat at Fang and it was great!  The owner and chef, Peter Fang made sure that we try his specialties.  If you are unsure what tot order, Peter will choose and recommend for you.  The dishes have a unique twist on traditional Chinese food.  If you are used to eating Chinese food, this place will certainly introduce unexpectedly delightful reinvention of traditional fares.  Yes, we will be back to try the other items on the menu.  The service was swift and efficient.  Thank you, Peter for a wonderful meal!

Review1921.Review: On vacation we tend to eat later than usual. Made a 9 pm reservation. Was out of the restaurant by 9:45!  While their page takes spots until 10, we were obviously their last customers & they were ready to go!  Our food came out very quickly and while it was good, the whole situation was not relaxing or comfortable. Being in a hotel, we didn't really want the leftovers to go.  They kindly took an entree off the bill, but I would not go back-there are just too many other options in San Francisco!

Review1922.Review: Fang is a very tasty restaurant and I have been in there a few times.  On this occasion I needed a place that would easily accommodate 20 people for a casual birthday dinner.  Since Fang is close to Moscone, the freeway and BART, it was also convenient for people coming in from elsewhere in the Bay Area.  I booked via Open Table and then called the manager to confirm some details.  My call was returned promptly and the Manager Kathy sent me some menus to chose from, since I wanted to pre-order some food.  Turns out Fang has a series of reasonably priced and intriguing pre-fix menus, so I went with option 5, a full 10 course meal.  Fang also has a reasonable corkage fee which is perfect for my family full of wine snobs.   The service was great and the food was enjoyed by all.  Our menu included a pot sticker, an open faced pork bun, several vegetable dishes, 4 proteins (chicken, fish, shrimp, rib) and a sesame ball dessert (very tasty).  It was actually the perfect amount of food - some dishes were served on a 1x1 guest ratio, some were served family style and allowed for generous portions.   It was a great meal; I would entertain a client or some family/friends there anytime.

Review1923.Review: Seems like the table accumulated stickiness for years

Review1924.Review: Ask the waiter to have Mr. Fang order for you. The meal is OUT IF THIS WORLD! The BEST  Chinese food!!!

Review1925.Review: We went from work for Friday lunch. They were very flexible with reservation. We did family style. Food was just getting delicious dish after dish.

Review1926.Review: Never fails to excel. I come here as often as I can. One of the best.

Review1927.Review: After a work event, I was searching the area for a great dinner place that was reasonably priced, and I am so glad that I stumbled upon Fang.  I made a reservation for 10, and Fang was prepared and ready for our group.  As we started the meal with some tasty drinks from the full bar, we were lucky to have Mr. Fang greet our table and begin taking our order.  Everything on the menu looked delicious and we couldn't decide, so Mr. Fang said he would take care of us.  It was the best experience.  The trays of food kept coming, and each course was delightful as the last.  The two most memorable dishes were the pork sticky buns and the mussel soup.  And the bill was very reasonable and fairly priced (and we left the restaurant thinking WE got the better deal)!  I highly recommend Fang to anyone in San Francisco looking for a truly unique and tasty dining experience.

Review1928.Review: Place settings were not rinsed clean.  We had to ask for new water glasses and plates.  Silverware was the inexpensive stuff, cheap.  However, the food was very good.  Mr. Fang asked us if it was our first visit and we said, yes.  He took the menus away and said he would take care of us and asked if anyone had any food sensitivity.
