Each plate came out with fresh ingredients, unique flavors and just enough for our table of 7, very delicious.  Hot tea was a budding flower in a huge mug and free refills on soft drinks.

Review1929.Review: The OT reviews sum this place well.  While some report some pretty harsh moments - our servers did fine - even though the place was packed.   She took our order soon after we sat - was reasonably friendly for the few moments it took - and then food came out quite soon after.   Including our beers.  There are so many dishes worth it - our favorites include the peking duck buns.    And while the prices are totally reasonable - going during the happy hour prices has got to be one of SF's best deals!   No doubt I'll be back.

Review1930.Review: Had a good time with some friends for a last minute get together at Fang. Had them decide the menu for us, got a bottle of wine, and enjoyed an easy evening.

Review1931.Review: I had appetizers at a party at Fang and liked them, so I invited some friends back the next night for dinner.  The service was awkward.  We had to ask for more than one menu, had very little assistance ordering and were told to leave after we paid the bill because they needed the table.   This would have  hard to take except that when the food came out it was all amazing. We had onion cake, pork ribs, mongolian beef, and prawns to die for.  So go for the food; be patient with service.

Review1932.Review: Excellent and attentive service from the wait staff at Fang the night a group of 10 had dinner there.  We had wanted to order off of the menu, but the wait staff convinced that we should order family-style.  I was skeptical at first, because we had some eaters in the group with special needs.  The wait staff asked about those needs up front and gladly accommodated them.The family-style dishes were large and plenty.  There was more than enough food for the 10 of us.

Review1933.Review: other dishes were pretty good but service was poor

Review1934.Review: The place was packed. We had a reservation but they had no tables available . They tried to put us at a long table in the basement with a bunch of other people This was a business lunch so that didn't work. The noise was so loud you couldn't yell to each other. No one took our order. I finally got the owner to come over and take our order. We weren't offered drinks. We had to grab anyone who came buy to throw food on our table to get drinks. The food was left so fast we couldn't ask for anything. No one asked us how we liked the food or was it alright. The flavor of the food was very good. The service was awful!

Review1935.Review: Food is not as good as it used to be.  Veggies and meat thrown together.Clear flavors are not there.  Beef particularly poor.  Food brought to tablein bunches--as though thrown at you.  Fang needs to shape up.

Review1936.Review: The concierge at our hotel recommended this restaurant when we asked about a Chinese restaurant within walking distance.  We were a little hesitant when we read some of the negative reviews especially about Mr. Fang insisting on ordering for diners.  Mr. Fang pleasantly took our order without trying to steer us to other dishes.  The food was excellent. We have dined in many Chinese restaurants nationally and internationally so we feel we are good judges.  The servers were extremely attentive.  We met Chef Kathy who is delightful.  We highly recommend this restaurant and will return whenever we are in San Francisco.

Review1938.Review: Hostess was busy on cellphone. The seater seemed to not wanting to be there at all. 3 different people asked for our drinks. Lack of communication between staff. Owner (older gentleman) sneak up from behind without saying anything. Standing there until we said we are not ready. Finally order , and got our food. One dish was luke warm while the other was hot.  Maybe they have an off nite cuz we usually to come here when we are in town. Disappointing service and awkwardness makes the dinner unenjoyable.

Review1939.Review: Creative Chinese Food - always ask what is recommended on the day you are ordering.

Review1940.Review: We celebrated my son's graduation from Cal at Fang's on Saturday night.  We were a party of 12.  The food was excellent, service was great nad friendly.  We has a fanctastic time. Highly recommend.

Review1941.Review: Some dishes good, some not so much. The egg roll appetizer in particular was not very good. But it's hard to beat the prices in the SOMA neighborhood. Just order lots of food and you'll get a few things you like.

Review1942.Review: Went here for dinner with a group of seven people. They sat us down and gave us menus.  We spent a fair bit of time and effort deciding what to order, family style, for our group.  But that was wasted effort, because the owner (or whoever he was) came over, and said he'd order for us. I started saying what we wanted, and he just repeated that he would order for us.  The dishes he ordered were good, but why give us menus if they won't let us choose for ourselves?

Review1943.Review: Been here several times and only once did I order the food myself. Always better to let Mr Fang pick the orders for you. It's always just right and every dish compliments each other.

Review1944.Review: Nothing fancy about this spot - so if you go online and see the pictures - well, this isn't elegant dining.  And service can be a challenge.  It can be tough to get someone's attention.   Plus - my bill had several overcharge errors.   However - the food has some wonderful highlights and the Happy Hour values are extraordinary.  I'll likely go back - and I'll definitely check the tab...

Review1945.Review: Disappointing experience, disappointing food. Waitress was surly. Greasy lo mein. Greasy short ribs. Pork dumplings had a tasty sauce but were slightly under cooked. No check arrived, so we wandered up and paid at the hostess stand.

Review1946.Review: We dined here during a large conference at Moscone center and it's right next door, so if you plan to eat here make a reservation and get there early.  Smaller groups of 2 or 3 seemed to get in quicker and sometimes even without reservation but 5 or more seemed to take longer as we waited 20 minutes beyond our reservation time...I emphasize again the large conference but you need to prepare in either case.Since we were on limited time at this point, the waitress suggest she could select from meat, seafood and vegetable dishes for us and everything was absolutely delicious.  Our server forgot multiple time to bring our drinks but the great food was distracting us from that fact.  Definitely recommend trying out FANG with observation to the reservation delays especially if for business purposes and time is limited.

Review1947.Review: I've been to Fang a number of times for lunch and dinner. It was always a great experience. I would recommend it to anyone.

Review1948.Review: The man comes out and asks if you want him to take care of you.  You say yes.  Wonderful, delicious food keeps appearing at your table until you are full.  The bill is less than you thought it would be.  One of our favorites when we are in SF.

Review1949.Review: We had  reservations for a Saturday night. When we arrived there was a note on the door that said they were closed for private event but a lady was standing outside with the clipboard and took us in through the back of the restaurant. The restaurant was quite full and when we were seated at our table the server asked for our drink order. I had not even had a chance to look at the menu or even take off my coat. They came back a little while later and got our drink order: a diet coke and a cocktail.  The soda came first but unfortunately was regular coke and we asked the server to switch it. He yelled at someone to get a diet coke... But that beverage never came. Luckily, there was a pitcher of water on the table so my friend drank it instead. The same server took our dinner order: 3 main dishes and rice for two.  The food came pretty quickly, but no rice. I attempted many times to flag down another server to alert them of the mistake. I couldn't get anyone's attention. Two larger parties had arrived so our two top table was now less important. No one ever came back to our table to check on us, offer a refill... Nothing. We ended up eating our Chinese dinner with no rice. We were about halfway through our riceless dinner and a different server breezed by and slides our check on the table without stopping. Again, no concern regarding our experience, no offer of takeout boxes for leftovers... Nothing. It was obvious the goal of FANG that evening was to churn out as many tables as possible. We were in the place for a grand total of 45 minutes. I'm definitely not high maintenance and I worked as a server in college, so I know things can get crazy when you have large parties and therefore the service might be slower. But this was a blatant disregard of our meal experiwnce and left a bitter taste in my mouth. I will never be going back or referring FANG to anyone. I'd rather go to Panda Express... At least there I know I'll get decent service.

Review1950.Review: We were cared for by the chef/owner, who selected our food.  Pacing was great, every dish was unusual and good. A bit spendy, but worth it for the recipes. Highly recommended, but get there early.

Review1951.Review: I felt very unwelcome in this restaurant the minute I stepped in the front door.  I visited Fang based on the recommendation of a colleague.  He raved about it.  My experience was quite different from his.  I was not greeted and welcomed upon entering the restaurant, event though there were two women at the front desk.  Come to find out later one of them was the co-owner.  They finally acknowledged my presence and took me to a table.  They were very cold and unfriendly.  The waiter was a little better but did not seem very interested in ensuring I had a good experience.  I ordered egg rolls for an appetizer and they were nothing to write home about.  I have just as good of egg rolls from the frozen food section at Costco.  The entree was also very subpar.  The rice was not very good either.  I have had much better Asian food experiences at Panda Express and PF Chang's.  I was in San Francisco for a conference and I was very much looking forward to coming to Fang.  I felt like they could not get me out of their restaurant fast enough.  I did not feel welcome in the restaurant which is a crazy way to feel in a business that makes their living on making people feel welcome.  The service as awful and the food quality was not much better.

Review1952.Review: Amazing space and amazing food! The chef was awesome and made sure we were taken care of. I'll for sure be back!!!

Review1953.Review: I recognized the owner of Nanking when we got seated.  He placed a special order for my boss and I. Every platter was delicious - hot, flavorful and intersting. I will certainly book FANG for work lunches and family celebrations.

Review1954.Review: You just tell him any dietary restrictions/preferences and put your meal in his hands.  I have never been disappointed and tried things I would never have ordered myself.

Review1955.Review: Just as OT reviewers said.  We arrived to a room that is basic NYC Chinatown - nothing Fancy.  While empty when we arrive at 630 - by 730 the place is full on a Thursday.   Chef comes over as we are reviewing the menu and asks if we've been there before - but it's our first time.  He asks only if there is anything we don't eat - and then walks away menus in hand asking us nothing more.  The peking duck appetizer rolls are superb.  The honey shrimp was also a favorite - we ordered another of this same dish.  The short ribs were also excellent.  The fish dish we had was the only disappointment.   But I'll definitely return and see what else Chef wants to bring out.    Oh yeah - the brown rice was not great.  And the glasses they give to drink beer are about 4 oz sized for some odd reason...   Secret hint - before 630 there is a happy hour!...

Review1956.Review: We made the reservation on the strength of Open Table and Trip Advisor. It was near the Convention center so could be busy if there is a big convention in town, but it wasn't. We came with kids, usually not a favorite of restaurants,  but another positive surprise it was great. We started looking at the menus preparing to order the same boring Chinese  but The owner and Chef took away our menus and  said he would take care of it and he did. We ended up with several really great items we wouldn't have orderd: DUCK BUN Appettizer (to die for)MARINATED SUGAR PEAS, CRISPY SHORT RIBS(absolutely mouth watering),  HONEY PRAWNS( kids loved them). Highly reccommend this place.

Review1957.Review: Had an another amazing dinner at Fang.  We go here, or to it's sister restaurant House of Nanking, for a meal at least twice a year when we are in the City.  It is one of our favorites.  The food is consistently amazing.  Service can be hit and miss.  Some visits the staff is SUPER attentive, other times there is a bit of lag between courses or getting the check.  My favorite dish is the dry braised green beans. They are amazing, but truly everything is good.  The sizzling rice soup, peking duck and sizzling rice soup are our favorite starters.  We always order way more food than we can finish, but enjoy the take out.

Review1958.Review: We decided to go beyond the Mongolian Beef and Sesame Chicken standards we regularly eat.  We tried the Pot Stickers and braised Short Ribs and both were excellent additions to a very tasty meal.

Review1959.Review: The food is delicious .  Additionally, they easily address various food needs elegantly - easy to dine with vegetarians, pescatarians, gluten-free etc.  And you'll never know it.  Peter (the owner) has it all figured out !    Absolutely great for groups !

Review1960.Review: This was my 3rd time at Fang and the food was great as usual. The service lags a little behind though. The owner was a little a curt maybe because on this occasion we didn't let him pick our dishes and my friends needed some time to find something for their picky son on the menu (he loved the chicken and the brown rice despite his mum being apprehensive about the sauce and saying he only eats white rice)). The rice we ordered did not show up until we asked for it again. The check was left on our table while we were still eating and we were  not asked if we wanted to order dessert (it was 9.30pm).

Review1961.Review: Having booked from the UK  for a group on strength of reviews there iis always slightly trepidation that everything will be ok for our guests. Especially as we were at congress and our numbers suddenly increased from 16 to 30. I did not need to worry. The restaurant was  extremely accommodating and welcoming. We opted for chefs selection of dishes and what a treat. The food was divine and elicited  many compliments from our guests. Particularly loved the beef , crispy duck pillows and shrimp. Best Chinese food ever.

Review1962.Review: Had a group of 12 and we had a great time here and food was great. Chef came out to make sure we enjoyed the food too.

Review1963.Review: Was in town for a meeting, had an hour for lunch and did an OT search on my phone.  Saw Fang, read the reviews, and could walk to it (literally right behind the W on 3rd Street).Restaurant was quiet, very low-key, and the food was excellent.  Three of us shared appetizers and entrees, hot tea was delicious, and everyone left feeling they had a great lunch in a town famous for Asian food.Would recommend for anyone in the area who wants to do something a little different than the usual haunts by the convention center.

Review1964.Review: It was pretty crowded here since it was around dinner time. I had made a reservation online, which didn't seem to provide us with a table since we had to wait for a table to be available. It took us a long time to order and it wasn't clear who we should be ordering from. When we went to order, we were told from the Chef taking our order that he would take care of us. We had wanted to order the Xiao Long Bao, Crispy Shortribs, and Garlic Shrimp and were given Xiao Long Bao, Crispy Shortribs, and Honey Apple Prawns. The Honey Apple Prawns weren't bad, but a little too sweet for my tastes since I like savory things - I would have been happy ordering the dishes I wanted to order.

Review1965.Review: I would like to thank Chef Peter Fang for his one on one personal touch last night.  Your attention to detail was phenomenal.  In particular,  your attention to the food allergies my wife has.  The dishes you chose and prepared for her were all fantastic.  The next time we are in SF, we will make it a point to stop by for another meal.  Best Regards, Troy and Melinda

Review1966.Review: I had out of town guests and wanted to find a place for dinner in the city.  Based on reviews and my desire to have Chinese food, I selected Fang.  We were 30 minutes late due to the Chinese New Year celebration.  They still seated our party of six immediately.  We were greeted by the owner, Mr. Fang.  He offered to make a special meal for us and only asked if we had any dietary concerns.  From the appetizer to the main course everything was fresh and delicious.  Two people in our party are not adventurous when it comes to eating so they were concerned about allowing the chef to select.  Well at the end of the meal, they were raving about how good the food was.  I will definitely be back!

Review1967.Review: Fang is good and there can be personal recommendations from the owner. But, if there is a conference at Moscone, watch out. The service goes way down.

Review1968.Review: Food was outstanding!  Loved the fried short rib and sesame chicken.  We had a reservation and waited for 10 minutes to be greeted at door.  Waitstaff not friendly.  Food arrived quickly.

Review1969.Review: Chef Fang approached our table when we arrived. We asked if they had a special menu for Chinese New Year. He said trust me, I will make you a great dinner and he did. The meats were melt in your mouth tender and the flavor was great!

Review1970.Review: Many thanks to Peter Fang, the chef, who is absolutely on top of everything in his restaurant and creates fantastic dishes with a small twist. Good place for a get-together occasion, interesting wine list.

Review1971.Review: I love coming back here, even though I am typically not a huge fan of Chinese food. The food here isn't oily, has sophisticated flavor, and creative ingredients/vegetables. In addition, they offer to make life easy and just bring you an assortment of dishes that meet your dietary restrictions and spice level tolerance--takes the hassle out of figuring out what's good. Service is good, there's enough space between tables, and prices are moderate. Overall a great spot!

Review1972.Review: Food is great but you have to decide if you can put up with the rough service!

Review1973.Review: I love Fang and will continue to go there, but their service isn't the best.  We had to wait a long time before someone came to take our orders, and then the food took a long time to come after that.  We had a large party of 10, and the meals came at vastly different times (the last person was served as the first person was finishing their meal!).  The kitchen staff appeared to be having a heated argument in Chinese while we were there.  The food is EXCELLENT, but you do have to put up with so-so service and a noisy atmosphere.

Review1974.Review: Once my party arrived we were seated at our table. The owner came by our table and I asked him what would he recommend as the specialties of the house. He asked if we were allergic to any foods and once we said we are open to try anything, he smiled and took back the menus and told us "leave it to me". Each plate that arrived was excellent. Not only was the presentation and the food really good, the total bill was surprisingly not expensive!! I would highly recommend.

Review1975.Review: Took a large group of 10. Experience was great and food was delicious.

Review1976.Review: This is hands down the best Asian restaurant in SF!  We have never ordered for ourselves and the food that they bring each time is fresh, original, creative, and most importantly delicious!  Go now!

Review1977.Review: I actually enjoy Fang and think that they have great food. I reserved a table for four, for my wife's birthday. The front desk seemed surprised that we had a reservation, and offered our choice between two tables: one next to the front door and reception, the other in a corner by the front windows. We chose the window seat. We were seated and given menus and the wine list. After that, nobody came to take a drink order or talk to us for at least ten minutes. Finally, my friend went back to the front desk and asked the woman there if we could order drinks and appetizers. She said yes, and sent a young man over to take our orders. We ordered cocktails and a pair of appetizers, and said that we'd order our entrees when he returned. Within a few seconds of his departure, the owner showed up to take our entree orders, despite the fact that we hadn't decided yet. A couple of us ordered a pair of entrees (Short Ribs, Sesame Chicken) and the owner said that if we trusted him, he would "take care" of us. We have eaten there before with the same offer, and had a positive experience.This time, however, we only recieved the two entrees, and nothing else came. We had to again flag down a passing server to get some rice. In all, it was a disappointment. The food that we did get was fine, but we were splitting two entrees between four people because we thought that we were getting selections chosen by the owner. My wife was looking forward to sampling a variety off of the menu, instead she only had the two dishes that we've had (and enjoyed) before. We left still hungry, and stopped by a grocery store to pick up desserts and a nightcap. This was a Saturday night at 7pm, when a restaurant should be at the top of their game. The service was, frankly, baffling. Nobody seemed to be in charge, and we weren't certain who our server was. Nobody on the waitstaff seemed to have any specific responsibility to our table; at no point could we definitively say "that person is our waiter".

Review1978.Review: In a city with so many Asians we found it hard to find excellent Chinese food we like.  This is one of two that does it right for us (Oriental Pearl is the other ). This food is original and oh soooo tasy. The Sesame Chicken and Tower of Mongolian Beef are memrable.

Review1979.Review: If you find yourself near Moscone, and peckish - you have four choices on Howard St within the first block - Thirstybear, Chevy's, The Gold Club - and FANG.I've been to all of them except the Gold Club, and I've been to FANG several times now.  It's by far the best food in the area.  It's Chinese near a convention center without being tourist Chinese [see Westfield & Metreon].  They have an option where you can give them free reign to fix a meal for you based on foods you like or want to try.  This, to me - is where FANG gets special. We've never been disappointed doing this.  The chefs seem to enjoy the opportunity to be creative, and we have had some of the best food we've had here in the City.The service is attentive without being intrusive.  In addition, the servers always ask the table if anyone has food allergies, so they can prepare the meals with that in mind. Such conscientiousness and attention to quality and detail make FANG a great place to eat - as well as accommodating friends, family, and/or business associates.

Review1980.Review: My Mom and I visited FANG during weekend trip to SF. FANG was recommended to us by a local couple we met during our trip. The restaurant was easy to find. With our reservation we were seated immediately. We were told in advance of our visit that "if we were feeling adventurous" we should ask Mr. Fang to order our meal for us. We took this advice and the result was fantastic! The food was prompt, refreshing, and delightful. We will definitely be back for more on our next trip to SF!

Review1981.Review: We dined at FANG while vacationing in San Fran. We were looking for some excellent Chinese food while in the area. We got exactly that at FANG. Food aside, the service was DEPLORABLE. We were greeted by a woman who motioned for us to follow her. She stormed ahead, literally threw two menus on a table and pointed. About 2 minutes later, an older gentleman in a hoodie sweatshirt stood over us with a pad. Said nothing. I asked if he was looking to take our order, he stated "what you eat". So unfriendly. We were clearly not ready, as we had been there literally a minute. He looked angry and stormed off. I had to get up and go get him nearly 20 minutes later so we could place an order. Our food came out, out of order (I got soup, then entree, then appetizer). We never got the rice we ordered, even after I waived someone down. I had to beg the bartender for the two cokes we ordered. We would not recommend to anyone!

Review1982.Review: Our last visit to Fang was a disappointment.   The food is still good-- but the service has deteriorated to the level of near-abuse.  No food is that good to put up with the brusqueness of the treatment.  The food was very swiftly served, one quick dish after another.  Any request, if one managed to convey it, was treated like an annoyance.  Next time I might try take-out.

Review1983.Review: We were expecting a hushed room, much higher prices and a certain level of pretension. At 8:30 Saturday the place was packed, waiters were bustling about and the kitchen was jamming. The food was unusual- flavors familiar but put together unconventionally but in an approachable way. Very surprised by the rather low prices. Lots of big groups and families. We ordered a lot and had great leftovers.

Review1984.Review: I had hoped for a great Chinese meal with it's ties to Nanking, but this was so very disappointing.  We were seated immediately, the waiter came to take our order a bit later, and we never ever saw him again.  No second drinks, no ordering more.  We had to stop busboys and ask them to clear plates from the table.  I helped myself to a pitcher of water I found behind the bar.  Just absolutely terrible.  The food was fair, nothing different that we could get at home somewhere.  I would never ever return.  Ever.  I'm SO disappointed I had one chance for a great Chinese meal in San Francisco and it was wasted.

Review1985.Review: this  was our first time here and we arrived while they were still getting ready for lunch.  We had read enough to state our selections and not let them choose and the sesame chicken and Mongolian beef were simply outstanding.  I had never seen sweet potatoes  in any Chinese restaurant and in the sesame chicken they were fantastic.  I wish the service were better but we were there to eat not criticize.

Review1986.Review: Been here several times before, same thing, servers & staff are so rude, too bad because the food is good.  A girl threw our menus on the table, and my husband kept getting his chair bumped into by  servers while eating.  The food is good, but not that good to be treated like I should feel honored to be dining in their restaurant.  To top it all off, our server brought our check to us before we even finished out meal.  They seem to need attitude adjustments, not on my time.

Review1987.Review: The worst service I have seen in 30 years. Waiters walk by and ignore you. You have to beg for service. Forget having the water glasses filled. We went during the holidays prior to a show. They ruined the evening.

Review1988.Review: Very poor service.  The restaurant seemed disorganized.  Somehow they were out of chicken dumplings and the vegetarian version subsisted of peas and shredded zucchini (very bland). Also they were not served as an appetizer (though they are listed as such) but more of a dessert,  given that we received them near the end of our entrees.  Additionally my curry chicken sauté was more of a soup that I ate with chop sticks and no rice (picking pieces of onion and zucchini out individually). The ingredients seemed to be of decent quality but the cooking,  service, and presentation were not even remotely worth the cost.  Hopefully it was just an off night for them.

Review1989.Review: This restaurant came highly recommended by a foodie so we were excited to give it a try when some of our family was in town. We went with the chef's choice menu and were ready to be impressed. While two of the dishes served (a fish soup and honey shrimp with apples) were original and delicious, everything else fell short. The the beef buns and short ribs were solid, but not anything I couldn't have enjoyed in a no-name Chinese restaurant anywhere else in the Bay Area. The chicken dish, which wasn't even explained to us in terms of what it was, was outright boring, and sadly was on par with a dish from PF Chang's. If it wasn't for the two highlight dishes, this review would have been a one-star. We expected more given the positive recommendation and the promise of a chef's choice.

Review1990.Review: I usually love Fang, but they kept us waiting a long time for my past two visits, even though we had reserved through Open Table. The last time, we waited over 30 minutes for a table! The staff was clearly overworked, with the same woman handling the reception, the clearing of the dishes, the setting of the new dishes and the collection of the money. Why so few workers? I'm sadly going to avoid them for a while and hope they can correct this issue.

Review1991.Review: It was our first visit. We let owner Peter Fang choose our menu - we had beef buns, spare ribs, mushroom app, and white fish. All dishes were very good. There were a few veggies on the side of some dishes. I would have preferred more veggies but I'll try those next time. We were originally seated in the center area near the open kitchen. I asked if we could move to the window booth seating to avoid being in the path of the servers. Also, we were seated near the bar so it was a bit noisy. The waiter moved us. The owner did not like us taking a 4-top for 2 people however in the end he ended up using the other table for our dishes so it didn't really matter. I was also surprised they didn't bring a glass for my beer. I will definitely return to try other items like the eggplant. This food seems far more authentic than some of the typical greasy, oversweet Chinese restaurants.

Review1992.Review: Food was tasty but the wait staff could not be bothered for the most part. Had to wait 15 minutes for chopsticks and 10 minutes for warm tap water (that's right, no ice).

Review1993.Review: We told the owner/chef our food dislikes and he then prepared a menu around the things we liked to eat. it was a lot of food, but delicious

Review1994.Review: A good place for an interesting meal. One can either order off the menu or ask the owner to bring his own recommended dishes. A procession  of wait people bring these selections which as hot, delicious and intriguing. All make the evening's visit well worth partaking. Not many decent restaurants serve "inexpensive fare" and FANG is no exception.  One departs well sated, satisfied and would consider their next visit.

Review1995.Review: They have an option for them to bring out a chef's selection. I highly recommend going this route. Been to this restaurant three times and have never even opened the menu. They even take into account food allergies and preferences. Consistently amazing food.

Review1996.Review: We knew House of Nanking when Peter Fang made his pan fried buns and fish soup himself and the line went out the door and around the block.  I understand it's still popular and the Chinese branch is at least three times its original size.  Fang out in Yerba Buena Center area, is quite upscale and has an interesting menu that we'll explore in much greater depth I am sure.  It's a convenient location to the Metreon as well as Yerba Buena Center and Moscone Center.

Review1997.Review: We didn't feel like ordering so we had Chef Kathy Fang just bring us dishes and they were amazing. The sesame chicken, pork dumplings and shrimp dumplings were perfectly prepared. There were two vegetarians who had apps and dinner as well that both agreed FANG was a great pick. Kathy read our minds with her food selections and it was reasonably priced.

Review1998.Review: Had Birthday Dinner here, no recognition from the restaurant about that from opentable, food was good to great - especially the short ribs.  Service was really slow for no reason on the uptake and we were an early group so the place was not busy - it became more attentive as the night went on.  We had to walk over several times to get help with orders and menus for a group of 10.  Happy hour prices are great!

Review1999.Review: I have been going to Fang for a long time.  The best thing to do is ask if Peter is there and have him visit your table.  He will just select dishes for you based on the size and you can do an amazing family style dinner.  It is chinese with some modern twists and honestly I have never had a bad dish at this place.  Great food and Peter is the best!

Review2000.Review: Their family style cuisine is absolutely delectable! The staff is very friendly and explained each dish. The prices are very reasonable, a great place for a work lunch. They had the best buns I've ever had!

Review2001.Review: The restaurant is set up for Family style dining, big roundtables and platters to share.  I have to say the ability of not having to choose -pricelss! Especially when with a group of indecisive, nonStop talking ladies who don't often take the time to look at the menu although the server is present. Service was fast, efficient and nonstop. The food was delicious! Our diet restrictions were taken and the dishes just kept coming. I loved when the server asked "have you had enough??" to which we all answered "Yes!". bonus points for also not feeling like the LOUD ones in the joint or being so noisy we could not hear one another. Overall a great experience and all were happy with the meal and experience.

Review2002.Review: My friends and I were going to order separate dishes for lunch but then eat them family style but then the waitress suggested the chef's special.  The owner came by and also suggested it.  We had 4-5 dishes including an excellent fish soup and the braised short ribs were tender and seemed to melt in my mouth. It was well worth the extra cost.

Review2003.Review: Overall experience was fine. But this restaurant has no real personality or strong vibe. Food is good, not great. Service the same. Ambiance not much to speak of. It's a great location next to the W, I guess that's where the business comes from.

Review2004.Review: Fang has a small menu which is refreshing for a Chinese restaurant.  A small menu means that what is on the menu will be terrific.   We loved the Wor Wonton soup.  That was perhaps the best I've had.  And the Nan King Sesame Chicken dish was super tasty, well prepared, and a nice sized portion.  They do something a little unique on the menu.  They have a list of vegetables, mushrooms, beans.  And then you tell your server how you would like it.  And then made us a wonderful tofu dish, crispy, beautifully flavored, with crisp bok choi and other vegetables on the side.  I think this is some of the best Chinese food around.  And it's inexpensive for fine dining.  This is a restaurant I would definitely enjoy going back to many times.

Review2005.Review: Always had a good experience. It's bit on the expensive side, but the food is just too good.

Review2006.Review: Service was a bit too rapid. We ordered an appetizer and it was brought immediately along with the 2 entrees. The salt pepper shrimp with mushrooms was bland. Our favorite part of the meal were the appetizer dumplings. Tables were busy on a Monday night.

Review2007.Review: had the sesame chicken wok lunch - drool drool good. they had the food out fast which made it easy to make it back to work in my half hour time frame.

Review2008.Review: While the food was good and very inexpensive it did not make up for the total and utter lack of service. I am always willing to give an establishment the benefit of the doubt, we all have an off evening, but the folks we sat next to ate there often and said the service is consistently lacking. It was one of those experiences where patrons bonded over the bad service, we were all in it together!!! If you are a practicing Buddhist and want to practice intense patience by all means go. If you want to focus on your dinner conversation and not flagging down your waiter all evening pick one of the many other fabulous restaurants in the beautiful city.

Review2009.Review: We asked for dim sum and he brought us 4 dishes that were amazing. We all loved it. For my daughter's birthday, they sent out a variation of an apple pie with a candle in it! Very sweet thing to do. Loved it.

Review2010.Review: This is very good Chinese restaurant, and the food can be a great value.  Go at happy hour at get great appetizers like onion pancakes, salt and pepper mushroom for $2.50 or duck Peking Buns for $6.95.  The BBQ Pork Spareribs were excellent and I'd rate the Nanking Sesame Chicken as very good.  Service was prompt and pleasant.

Review2011.Review: i've been here twice with a big group and been frustrated with the huge gaps of time between dishes arriving at the table. Politeness dictates that we all wait until everyone has food before we start eating but it's awkward when that means we're sitting for 10-15 min while some of our food gets cold. I like the food and the price is right so I'll be back, but it's a problem I've never encountered anywhere else in the area. Fang needs to figure this out!

Review2012.Review: The BEST Chinese I've ever had! The meal was delicious ... not your typical Chinese meal. A culinary work of art that introduces you to the wide range of this culture's repertoire of food! A definite MUST while in San Francisco!!

Review2013.Review: Choose between the western or Chinese menu and let them decide what you are going to eat You cannot get wrong

Review2014.Review: Our party of five had a very pleasant dinner of tasty intentional fusion cuisine, with Asian style.

Review2015.Review: The dishes in this fusion chinese restaurant are outstanding and unique.  Even the green tea is served uniquely in a large glass mug with an interesting tea leave ball the unfolds and transforms into a flower while steeping in the hot water.  The braised short ribs and sesame chicken are oustanding.   There is also an interesting display of color chinese art showing chinese emperors/leaders of a particular era in history.   I highly recommend this restaurant.

Review2016.Review: We had the manager bring us food that the chef recommended, and it was great!  Unfortunately the service was very poor.  We were not even asked what we wanted to drink.  10 minutes later we were able to waive the waiter down and get water.  After food was served there was no more service.  We then had to waive the waiter down to get our bill.

Review2017.Review: After being seated, the hostess quickly informed us that we should order family style and they would decide what plates we got. When questioned about this strategy she snottily responded that if someone was going to pick out our menu it should be the owner. We said okay and then they brought out about 8 different plates within 35 minutes. It was probably the fastest dinner I've ever had at a restaurant. The food was only so-so and the space wasn't anything special. I'm glad I can say I tried it since it gets such rave reviews, but I won't be going back.

Review2018.Review: Menu choice and food preparation excellent, moderate prices as well. Tables for 2 are way too close together, our neighbors had to squeeze to get past our table, expected better seating at an upscale restaurant .

Review2019.Review: When chef or owner found out we were newbies to Fang he decided on our meal. We were not disappointed had a wonderful sampling that included 2 dim sum dishes,  Portabella,dish salad and whit fish that melted in the mouth. Individual flavors and combination of food was a treat to the palette. Service was pleasant but slightly rushed. Would return when we return to San francisco.

Review2020.Review: We search for restaurants in this area to meet with our niece for lunch.  This was first time there and I would not go back.  I thought the food was very mediocre, service was OK, but the it was noisy.  Price was good, but I would rather play a bit more and have better food.

Review2021.Review: The fusion Chinese was very very well done!! There was not a single dish that we didn't like and were in a group of 5 people and we got like 6-7 dishes each of them outstanding.

Review2022.Review: The quality of foo has deteriorated in recent couple of years. The restaurant is overrun with techies, the servers are not exactly rude but very brisk and rushed.  Salt and pepper shrimp last time were just boiled, and the mix of vegetables in different meat and seafood lunch plates looked and tasted suspiciously similar.

Review2023.Review: I am from out of town travelling with my friend, I am not a fan of Chinese food after too many bad food court experiences.  We had to try a Chinese place as San Francisco is know for their Chinese food.  When we sat at our table we saw some lovely dishes are neighbours were eating, when we inquired we were told they were not on the menu and were chef specials.  Our waiter was really friendly, once we inquired our the off menu specials, he asked us our food restrictions and said not to worry he would make sure we would be in a special treat!  I was nervous but my friend said to go with the flow- we were not disappointed, dish after dish all was amazing and portions huge and great for sharing! Lots of freshness and good quality foods.

Review2024.Review: They were very accommodating to our large group. Service was a bit spotty but on par with other similar restaurants. They prepared a special menu for our large party which was pretty good and made it easy for us. However, it would have been nice to have a chance to choose the dishes.

Review2025.Review: The food at Fang's is authentic and very tasty.  We had the onion cake, crispy short ribs, honey chicken and green beans.  All were quite delicious.  Highly recommended.

Review2026.Review: I was looking forward to this after visiting the website, but there were 3 things that were real disappointments:(1) if you are 2 people, then you will be forced to eat along the wall (french cafe style) and the seats are too close together; (2) the restaurant needs a new exhaust system because you could smell the grease and see the smoke coming from the "open kitchen"; (3) it was noisy... but not because of the house music or the diners, but because of the cooks, constantly talking to one another in a loud voice.  When I tried to move to another table and requested a square table (4 settings, when we were only 2), they said no. We winded up pulling in another table next to us because we simply needed another table for the 4 large plates!

Review2027.Review: Very conveniently situated by the convention center. Quality food and presentation.

Review2028.Review: We've only lived here for a short period of time but Fang's quickly became one of our favorite restaurants in the Financial District.  In this last visit, we took friends who were visiting from out of town (Canada) and we elected to let Mr. Fang (I think?) surprise us with a selection of magnificent foods, every single item was amazing.  We had been to Fang's previously a number of times but always ordered off the menu.  While the food has always been fabulous this was truly a unique and wonderful experience which we will definitely repeat again in the future.

Review2029.Review: Food is real good, service fair, mens bathroom run down. Clean the fan off in the bathroom

Review2030.Review: And nice atmosphere too! Perfect location after the new SFMOMA opens - right next door.

Review2031.Review: We were the first ones in the restaurant for dinner and the owner came and greeted me and my husband. He asked about any dietary restrictions and I informed him I am vegetarian, but my husband is not. He said he'd make something special for us. The evening was filled with delicious, unexpected plates with our preferences in mind. It was by far the best dining experience we had in San Francisco. It was great to be surprised with each dish and every single one was just outstanding. Can't wait to visit again.

Review2032.Review: We were dissapointed with our experience at Fang.  Unlike other reviews, we found the service outstanding - no issue there.  The food however was mediocre at best mostly because of the sauces used. We've been here before and had a memorable meal, but this time it wasn't good.  The pot sticker appetizers with peanut sauce were fine. We should have kept the peanut sauce for the other entrees. The calamari dish had vinegar sauce which was pretty bad.  The short ribs dish had some unknown crusty stuff on them which hurt the flavor of the meat and the sauce was nasty. The Box Choy in the short rib dish was fine.   The apple crisp desert was like a cracker - not much apple in there.  Don't order that one.

Review2033.Review: The food here is shockingly good. It's rivals the best you can get in Hong Kong itself. The absolute best place to do a business lunch around Moscone. Don't pick from the menu instead just tell the server to keep bringing you dishes until you are full.

Review2034.Review: My wife and I took another couple there for the first time. We were first attended by an elderly gentleman who I assumed to be the waiter. He looked at us, asked us if we'd been there before, and when we said no, he said, "I'll take care of you." and started writing down thinks on his pad. A short while later, plate after plate of delicious foods started arriving, each new, distinctive and delicious. In the end we had an excellent meal of surprise dishes, and paid a quite reasonable price for the experience!

Review2035.Review: There was no one to welcome us or seat us. The restaurant was hot! We left!

Review2036.Review: The chef came to our table and upon hearing this was our first visit he took the menus and said he'd take care of us. If you're not comfortable with that don't tell them it's your first time. He sent several tasty dishes to our table and we were very satisfied. Not sure we would visit again but definitely worth trying if you've never been!  Also it's a very small place and the decor is very interesting.

Review2037.Review: The beef tower was fantastic, as was the salty pork dish.  The chef gave good recommendations for the meal.  The hot and sour soup was too spicy four daughter

Review2038.Review: Went here for a team lunch and it was great. We didn't need to worry about what people were ordering, the guy came down and gave us food. Only complaint was, we had some people that didn't want seafood, but we got quite a few dishes with seafood in them. I'd still recommend this place and we will head back there for another group lunch.

Review2039.Review: I enjoyed Fang.  Good food, reasonable prices, friendly staff.

Review2040.Review: Fresh inventive food. A real pleasure for my palate.

Review2041.Review: The food is simply amazing at this restaurant, the flavors are incredible.  We have been here several times and we are never disappointed, and look forward to our next time we return to the city so we can eat here again!

Review2042.Review: Agree with other reviews- food overall is inventive and excellent, but too much garlic in some dishes like sesame chicken. Short ribs are like candy, and whitefish melts in your mouth. Service is chaotic and distant, food coming whenever they feel like in any order  regardless of whether appetizer or main, forgot a dish, and slapped check down without asking about dessert. Decor,inside is modern and clean, next to a strip club so be aware.

Review2043.Review: A friend recommended that we visit Fang and allow the kitchen staff to select the courses, instead of ordering off the menu. We took his advice and were not disappointed! After confirming if we had any allergies or special dietary restrictions, they began bringing dish after dish of amazing food, including several that we likely wouldn't have thought to order on our own. The service was excellent and the price was very reasonable: three terrific appetizer courses and one shared entree for less than $60. Everything was so delicious, we ended up going back for lunch to try more of the menu and everything was terrific the 2nd time as well! Be sure to order the Beef Peking Buns - they are outstanding!

Review2044.Review: Very interesting flavours in these dishes. Best Chinese good I 've eaten in a very long time. Added bonus is the very reasonable price!

Review2045.Review: The dishes are very unusual Chinese fare. The flavors are assertive and the portions very ample. We always have to remember to order less than in other Chinese restaurants. The short ribs and the spare ribs and the crispy chicken with sweet potatoes are outstanding.

Review2046.Review: Outstanding food quality for the price. A great lunch option.

Review2047.Review: Upfront, I will say that I was disappointed with the BBQ pork spareribs. In fact, we order a "give me a good beef dish" dish which had the beef perfectly cooked so I was surprised that the ribs weren't also as amazing.The salt and pepper fish is epic, make sure to order it. We also ordered a "give me a good beef dish" and got a bunch of beef with red pepper flakes that would melt in your mouth. The pork dumplings were also a hit with our group (some from Beijing). All in all, I believe that if you know how to order off Fang's menu, you can find yourself with a 5 star meal and excellent service.

Review2048.Review: I wish the waiter can understand our order. The food was tasty just like my $6 meal from red jade. If I will spend money for a Chinese restaurant that is marketed for upscale dining I rather go to My China.

Review2049.Review: Great place to get authentic Shanghai cuisine, can bring anyone including business partner as the tastes are amazing tasty!

Review2050.Review: Waiters were indifferent. Food was good, but not as fantastic as I had been told it would be. After main corse they simply slapped down the check. No dessert menu, tea, or even a question from the waiter if we even wanted anything else. I got better service in Chinatown.

Review2051.Review: Nice place in SoMa with really delicious food with a twist. For example the Chinese buns with beef come with flash fried strips of tender beef--crunchy on the outside and tender in the inside. This was replicated in the chunks of short rib that came atop a noodle dish. Pure indulgence. I call it m"meat candy" because it's soooo irresistible. The sesame chicken comes with strips of sweet potato and a zesty flavorful sauce--not the standard cloyingly sweet stuff of standard Chinese-American fare.  Love this place for its unique interpretation of Chinese food!

Review2052.Review: We have eaten at the sister restaurant and thought we would try this one. It was wonderful. The chef Kathy asked what we wanted and prepared a sampling for us. We would highly recommend this place.

Review2053.Review: The food is excellent at a central location.  staff is helpful even  if a bit distant

Review2054.Review: The food is awesome at Fang. Don't expect the usual Chinese dishes. In fact, you won't even find traditionals like Kung Pao Chicken on the menu. Ambiance is good. Service was excellent.

Review2055.Review: Food was really good and the prices were a very pleasantly surprising not over priced as many places can be.

Review2056.Review: This is our second visit to Fang's and we enjoyed again.  On our first visit in 2012, the Chef/Owner ordered for us (a group of five) so we were impressed with his choices.  This time around, we each ordered a dish and thought every single one was delicious and had flavors of their own.  We couldn't believe how reasonably-priced a chicken dish was ($11.95 I think).  Nowadays, you'd have to pay $18-$20 for a comparable dish elsewhere.The only drawback was the lack of warmth and friendliness of our female server from this year's visit.  However, on our first visit, Lily, was nice and great to work with.

Review2057.Review: My friend recommended this restaurant. She said when you order tell the waiter "bring it on". I wasn't sure when our group of 4 ordered and asked the waitress about it.  I gave her a price of what my friend spent and she ordered what she thought we would like. It was excellent. So many different varieties of food which we all loved. Fish, chicken, beef, vegetables and appetizers.  Wonderful. They were left overs!  The price is so reasonable!  I've already told many friends about it.  Will definitely go back!

Review2058.Review: The food was good but there seemed to be lots of confusion in getting our order. Several people tried to take our order and then re-took it. Experience was ok but not stellar. Not foodie level. Good for a local neighborhood if it's convenient to where you are. I would try something else if in the area again.

Review2059.Review: Every time I come to Fang the food is as good as the last. The short ribs are my favorite dish. The staff are accommodating to food allergies/ dietary restrictions.

Review2060.Review: We really enjoyed our early dinner at Fang on Monday evening. We chose some items from the Happy Hour menu. I would definitely come back for the mojito and Fang's Peking buns, as well as to try other things. The appetizers are half off for HH and they have drink specials. For our dinner we chose to ask the restaurant to surprise us with a few items. The end result was an eclectic and delicious sampling of dishes - one beef, one chicken and sauteed green beans. All were excellent and we really enjoyed our experience here and will definitely come back!

Review2061.Review: Staff always does a great job a specially creating a meal choice based on food restrictions and customer input. Each time makes for a wonderful dining experience. And lets the chef/restaurant be creative as well!!

Review2062.Review: Fang is nicely located since it avoids climbing the hills in Chinatown.  The portions are generous, the prices reasonable and the food is innovative. It is, however, incredibly noisy with the wait staff screaming their orders to the kitchen.

Review2063.Review: We have now had our niece's graduation as well as a special lunch with dear friends from Italy and their Italian friends and everyone was raving about the food.  Ask for the chef's choice, you will not be disappointed.

Review2064.Review: The lighting was bad. The food was mediocre. Parking was ok.

Review2065.Review: My guest had never been. We had an amazing meal and great service. Look forward to our next visit.

Review2066.Review: This is a lively, very popular lunch and dinner venue.  Food was very good, tasty and freshly prepared. Staff was VERY busy but were attentive and service did not suffer. Wait time was reasonable. Would definitely go back when I'm in San Francisco.

Review2067.Review: Love having a round table for a group!  Family style/sharing of dishes is the way to go.Portions were too small (for a Chinese restaurant) in my opinion.Tasty food!

Review2068.Review: Food was disappointing, compared to their sister restaurant House of Nanking.

Review2069.Review: This is HON's slightly prettier and edgier sister. Restaurant is small has a vibrant, upbeat atmosphere. Our waitress had zero charm and could not be less interested.  Don't expect to be welcomed, told about the specials, etc. We made selections based on Yelp reviews, and once she took our order, we never saw her again. But the busboys were very efficient with bringing food, clearing plates, re filling water glasses, etc. Now for the food- delicious, everything single dish was flavorful, fresh & perfectly prepared. Highly recommended the 8 Treasures salad and Five Spice fish. Only regret was not being able to try everything.

Review2070.Review: First time here.  I wanted something close by the Marriott Marquis for a group work dinner.  Superb food, nice distance from the hotel, good choices for meat eaters and vegetarians as well.  The entire group loved it and recommended that we return on the next trip.

Review2071.Review: I love the food here. Great, great, authentic chinese. If you are stuck at Moscone at some insufferable conference (e.g., Dreamforce) and need a way to grab a good lunch nearby, lock in a reservation via OpenTable and have at it!

Review2072.Review: I along with a work colleague were looking for a nice restaurant close to the Marriott Marquis and walked over to this gem. We started with the Pork Confit egg rolls - a bit oily but tasty-- and the special app of the day fried shrimp dumplings which were good. We shared a couple of dishes a Beef Shortrib dish with baby bok choi and chicken dish. Both were very tasty with great crisp veggies and a lot of flavor. Prices are very good for the quality of the food. We had a chance to chat with the owner's daughter who actually took our order and recommended dishes. Freshness was a theme and we enjoyed our meal and would go back.

Review2073.Review: Title of the review says it all! Be sure to get pork spare ribs; like nothing else u have ever tasted!!

Review2074.Review: I have eaten Chinese food all over the world and I was simply not prepared to be blown away by the great food at Fang.  After providing a short list of likes and dislikes and a list of food allergies, the chefs went to work to create the perfect meal.  We started with shrimp dumplings that were the best I ever ate, and it only got better from there. The Wonton Soup that followed was creamy -- a bit unusual in that aspect -- but far better than any I ever had anywhere else.  A portabella mushroom was magical, followed by lo mien served perfectly cooked. Next, the worlds best sesame chicken, and for dessert an apple crisp.  It was like a symphony of flavor from beginning to end.  And the price was also right! Don't miss Fang!

Review2075.Review: Most of our items were just ok but the steamed buns were great.  If I go again I might just stick with that.

Review2076.Review: Don't know what happened, but this place has gone downhill fast. It's gotten so dirty and slow and unappealing since I first bought guests here from out of town. The hosts desk looks like a a hoarders living room, the floor and furniture is dirty, the staff was throwing around table tops and chairs like they were packing up after a Salesforce event....not very friendly, the service was an afterthought.

Review2077.Review: Delicious food!  I will definitely go there again!

Review2078.Review: We were looking for a place within walking distance of our hotel in the financial district. This fit the bill. Although tiny and unaircondioned on a 90+ degree day, our server was attentive and made great recommendations. We did find a fried rice with chicken to be a bit bland, but on the whole a positive experience.

Review2079.Review: Loved the soup dumplings!  Food was great...Got to meet owner, Kathy...was thrilled as I had read much about her, Fang and House of Nanking...

Review2080.Review: We live 1 block from Fang and frequently take our friends for dinner there. The service and food are outstanding......and the price is right. There were 7 in our party Saturday night and the total bill was under $200; try that in San Francisco. And, we actually took food home. Fang isn't a large restaurant, so I do recommend a reservation through Open Table. Be prepared for hot, family-style dishes.Enjoy!!Dr R

Review2081.Review: Recommended by concierge at SF Marriott Marquis & several locals confirmed it as a good choice.As recommended by previous reviews, opted to take the recommendations of Michelle who waited on us and we were pleased.  Each dish was a hit and we even reordered a round of appetizers - loved the openfaced pork buns and the beef short ribs. Can get very busy during lunch so be sure to let wait staff know if you have time constraints. I highly recommend it!The outside was rather bland.  The inside especially downstairs where our group of 8 sat was reminiscent of many restaurants I see in China with tables capable of seating 10-12 comfortably. The area we had was open but had 3 call so felt semi-private and worked for business discussion.

Review2082.Review: Such good food. I revisit this place every time I'm in town. All appetizers are yummy. Mongolian beef and their barbecue spareribs are crazy good!

Review2083.Review: My last meal at Fang was sorta flat in excitementWhen I leave House of Nanking my taste buds are very happy usually!

Review2084.Review: It was a decent enough lunch. Wouldn't take out of towners to wow them or anything

Review2085.Review: Instead of ordering from the menu, this time we decided to let the chef decide what to serve.  It was a wonderful mix shrimp, beef and fish.  It  was easy, and truthfully, we may not have chosen these dishes.

Review2086.Review: Went to this establishment on a whim with 2 friends. As we looked over the menu, our server asked us if we had been there before. When we told him we hadn't he took our menus away and said he'd take care of us. I honestly don't know what we ate (4 different dishes) but everything was quite good. Will go back.

Review2087.Review: do not come to this restaurant.  It was obvious that we were first timers for them and we waited a long time before somebody even took our drink order. We were ignored several times after that, as well. Unless you order directly as it is stated on the menu, I would not go here.  Substitutions are not welcome.

Review2088.Review: If you want something different than traditional chinese menu you have to go here. They have very interesting dishes with lots of different ingredients. The buns filled with either beef, pork or duck made for very delicious appetizers along with steamed bok choy. We were there during happy hour so the prices for the apps were only $5 each. The entrees were excellent too.We were first in the place around 5:00 but by the time we left the place had filled up. The service was brisk with not much attention but didn't need much with the food being so perfect. Also try House of Nanking in chinatown which is a sister restuarant.

Review2089.Review: Went for quick lunch.....loved the duck buns and crispy short ribs!!!Went back 36 hours later and had the same items for dinner.Ate the other nights at $$$$ restaurants and must say enjoyed Fang more!

Review2090.Review: I have dined at Fang's each time in San Francisco. Excellent pot stickers with peanut sauce. Must have the sesame chicken &'the short ribs were great also

Review2091.Review: I was with 4 girls who all pretty much like everything. It was our first time to Fangs and we were not sure what to order. We asked the waitress what were her favorite dishes and instead of tell us she asked if she could just order for us. That was the best! We love every dish she sent out. All were perfect for sharing and still getting great portions for all 4 of us, the food can at a steady pace and not too fast. We all agreed that was the way to do it. We loved it!!

Review2092.Review: Fang is a block from us, so convenient for walking. Our party size was 6; I do recommend a reservation for Friday or Saturday nights. The food and service were very good. The Chinese food came In family style platters and was served quickly and hot. The total for the 6 of us was under $150; hard to beat in San Francisco's SOMA district.

Review2093.Review: FANG is a must-visit for me in downtown San Francisco. My sole recommendation is that you allow the chef to select your dishes. This works especially well if you're dining as a group. Every dish that was set in front of us was amazing, from sweet buns to dumplings, to an amazing course of crispy prawns in an apple glaze along with perfectly cooked whitefish. The others in my group have been talking about this place days after eating there.

Review2094.Review: Much to our surprise, this restaurant served about the best Chinese cuisine we have experienced. We are world travelled. But the biggest surprise was how everything on the menu is so very reasonably priced.

Review2095.Review: Fun restaurant. Good food (although a little sweet for my taste) And best of all, it didn't break the bank. :)

Review2096.Review: the best way to dine at any of Peter Fang's restaurant is to order your drinks and put yourself in the hands of the staff -- let them know the courses you want, any allergies or please avoids. Then wait for the magic to happen. The staff will begin to bring out amazing food -course after course all perfectly sized for your party of two or large group. Consistently wonderful food and service!!

Review2097.Review: From start to finish the place provided horrible service. I will not be returning.

Review2098.Review: They push you through because they are busy! The great thing is that to speed things up they dont even wait for your order. They ask if you want them to chose for you (we said yes). They brought fantastic dishes, good selection, fast, tasty, creative, good value.

Review2099.Review: Must visit when going to San Francisco. Very good place to enjoy Asian fusion

Review2100.Review: I wanted to like this place, I really did. I went with a large group and we were seated right away, even though the entire group had yet to arrive, which was a treat considering how strict most places in the city are about that. The menu looked fantastic, especially because it caters to vegans and those with gluten allergies. We were all set to order when the owner came over and decided he would order for us. We warned him of our restrictions and let him decide for us. As the food came out, the waiters did not tell us what any of the dishes were and when we asked, they didn't know if they were gluten free or veggie. It would have been infinitely easier to have just ordered our own dishes. Overall, the food was decent but drinks were bad.

Review2101.Review: Let the chef choose for the table and you won't be disappointed.

Review2102.Review: Each dish was flavorful - the country rice chowder being the stand out. The restaurant is tired - service on chipped plates. The wait staff seemed dazed and confused in general.

Review2103.Review: A better space than Nanking though. It was nice to see Chef Fang again.

Review2104.Review: Staff is really helpful -- ask them to order for you, and they will not disappoint, especially when there is a big group!Food was great and flavorful, though the mixed drinks were pretty poor in quality and watered down. Ambiance was quiet, but in the lower level there were a few flies, which was a real turn-off.Overall I'd recommend mainly because of the service, but they have some improvements to make on the drinks / ambiance.

Review2105.Review: I try and go every time I am in San Francisco. Simply amazing Chinese food! Don't even look at the menu. Put yourself in Mr. Fang's hands. Every dish that he puts on the table is a revelation and he has steered us to things we would have never ordered otherwise. This time it was a delicious fish dish. Always impressed!!

Review2106.Review: If you ask Mr. Fang to order for you (and tell him of any allergies), you will get an incredible 5-course meal (not too much, dishes are light, just right) off-the-menu. And not expensive! Love this place.

Review2107.Review: Having met our son, we enjoyed excellent appetizers and drinks. It was a pleasant and enjoyable event.

Review2108.Review: We appreciated the proprietor's offer to order for our party. This allowed us to experience the best dishes on the menu, notably the pork buns, shrimp salad and sesame chicken. However, service was quite slow.

Review2109.Review: We were in for a trade show, which is why we happened upon Fang. While waiting for our table I chatted w/a woman who was eating at the bar. I asked her what she was eating and she told me...it looked awesome. When we sat down, a man - who happens to be Peter Fang the owner of the restaurant greeted us. He asked if we had been there before and when we said no, he said OK... I have got this... anyone have allergies or anything that they don't eat?? I don't eat meat (I do eat fish and veg) but everyone else said we eat it all... bring it on! What we had was the BEST CHINESE MEAL of my life. I live in NY, I thought I had great Chinese food. This blew me away - a must stop. House of Nanking in China town is also owned by him.

Review2110.Review: Very good food. Peter chooses the menu for you if you don't know what to eat and would like to adventure trying dishes you have not had before. Service was fast but difficult to get their attention when you need something.

Review2111.Review: I had heard that Fang was amazing so a coworker and I went for lunch. Our look of uncertainty most have been noticed by the staff. They took over and told us not to worry -they made selections for us. We started with some tasty dumplings, then were served the most amazing beef sliced thin. We had to ask, it was their short ribs! We could've eatin that dish all day. The final dish was the pork buns. these were no ordinary buns, shaped more like tacos with a puffy bread shell filled with fried pork in a sweet sauce sprinkled with thinly sliced veggies. we were stuffed, it was just the right amount of food for lunch. We only wish we had more time to return for another meal! You must go and enjoy this gem of a restaurant.

Review2112.Review: There are so many great restaurants in San Francisco I am so sad I chose this one to take my friend for her birthday dinner. The service was rushed and the food was so so.I will never go back.

Review2113.Review: I had never been, but chose this establishment for a reunion with dear relatives after 50 years apart. Luckily, Peter Fang himself took an interest and we put the menu in his capable hands. We never had a better Chinese dinner. Thank you Mr Fang for an extraordinary experience that made the reunion that much more memorable. Two thumbs up!!

Review2114.Review: We asked for advice about the menu, explained that we are vegetarians, and the man who took our order asked whether we liked mushrooms and eggplant, and after we replied in the affirmative, he said, "I'll take care of you." And he did. There were four wonderful dishes: Mushrooms and Chinese barley; vegetable dumplings; a revelatory Chinese salad (apple, tomatoes, basil, puffed rice, cabbage); eggplant, mushrooms and tofu in a hearty sauce; and brown rice. The ambiance was simple and tasteful, soft lighting, and the service attentive.Great dining experience!

Review2115.Review: Fang has some of the most creative and delicious Chinese food I've ever eaten. Unfortunately, the service is no where close to the level of the food.The waiters are disorganized and inattentive. Worst of all there is almost no consistency to the flow of service. One of our entrees actually ended up arriving before our appetizers, and the table next to us (who ordered ten minutes later than we did) received their entire meal before we had even got our onion cake.Mr. Fang also famously has the habit of ordering for customers. While nearly everything on the menu is excellent, he tends to go for the pricier items and some of the specials can be a bit hit and miss.I love this restaurant, but wish that they could get their act together.

Review2116.Review: I picked this place because it looks fancy from the outside, as well as from the website. However, once inside, it proved to be a little dingy. We were among the first customers there that day, a few minutes after noon when it opened. However, the tables seemed to have a film of grease on them, one of the plates on my table had something on it (looked like a big bread crumb), and a dirty dishcloth was clearly visible on a table nearby. I wouldn't have given any of these a second thought in a more downscale, hole-in-the-wall place, but Fang is supposed to be more upscale.Most of the food was not spectacular either. Potstickers and soups were quite bland. The whitefish with 5 spices was pretty good though.

Review2117.Review: The menu isn't huge .... but if Mr. Fang comes over to your table and tells you he will take care of you, let him. Delicious dishes appeared with the right proortions of salty/sweet, light/heavy.

Review2118.Review: They are horrible customer service. They don't pay attention to customer needs. Owner is good but waiters are horrible at attentiveness.

Review2119.Review: Delicious food but very loud and the server wasn't very attentive. I'd decimate ly go back for the food but not for a special occasion. We had stated in our reservation that it was out anniversary but they have us a terrible seat by the bar and no congratulations. A window table in the corner would have been appropriate and a mere "Congratulations" would have been nice.

Review2120.Review: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Everything feels like they are cooked to perfection, the drinks provide a nice balance of flavor. I often come here in small groups due to the taste and ambiance, and because I also know they are good at handling food allergies.This last time was the first time we went in a good sized group, about 10 of us. Taste and service was as good. We were given plenty of space to interact with each other and didn't feel rushed. Service was attentive and dishes were presented with personalized information to prevent allergic concerns and to respect food preferences.An absolute gem.

Review2121.Review: Great experience but the atmosphere is loud and crowded, not a place for a quiet dinner, but the food is quite creative and tasty, maybe a little high for Chinese in San Francisco, but pretty good value.

Review2122.Review: Although we enjoyed our food, the ambience was dreary, with dirty dishes left sitting out on the table next to us and distinctly ambivalent service. Also, the tables and chairs were distinctly tattered. This place needs to be refreshed.

Review2123.Review: Restaurant appears dirty and worn. Little hospitality, cold, efficient service

Review2124.Review: The Sesame Chicken was wonderful but T=the Shanghai soup dumplings were disappointing. The sauce was too sweet and they were heavy, not delicate. Service wasn't the best. But will try it again.

Review2125.Review: Nice overall, but be careful about what you order

Review2126.Review: I enjoyed my first visit to FANG for a friends retirement luncheon. I enjoyed everything on the set menu - we all did and looked forward to returning. We did for a co-workers birthday lunch and this time I tried the famous sesame chicken. It was luke warm, sauce had an aftertaste and the portion was small. My rice was not hot and a little water logged. Id come back but only for the beef and the braised ribs. My companions felt the same way regarding their dishes leaving a lot to be desired. We would come back but with lower expectations. Price range good, service was fast, able to accomodate big groups conventiently.

Review2127.Review: the food was well-priced and for the most part,well-prepared, but almost every dish we ordered is spicy. That might be a problem for people who're not fond of spicy food. The restaurant was spacious with 3 floors but the low ceiling made it busy. It has a large room in the basement which is good for group parties.

Review2128.Review: Really enjoyed some different Chinese dishes. Well prepared and enjoyable. Highly recommended

Review2129.Review: We came for Chinese New Year and went with Chef Kat's recommendations: the radish cakes and their savory sauce were an excellent start. The pumpkin prawn & meatball soup was an unusual combination that worked very well. Some of my other favorites are their lettuce wraps, whitefish, and Nanking chicken. Every dish I've had here was a well-executed traditional favorite with a surprising but harmonious modern twist to it.Service was prompt, friendly, and efficient.The decor is modern Chinese with traditional elements. Combined with carefully placed colored spot lighting, it makes for an ambiance that matches the food.

Review2130.Review: We chose this restaurant based on Yelp reviews and were pretty disappointed. The soup dumplings, which is what we were really looking forward to, were mainly bland. The short ribs were really nice, cooked perfectly. The Mongolian Tower was ok but nothing special. The fried rice was awful. It had no flavor at all and we ended up sending it back after one bite.

Review2131.Review: The food is decent though you can get the quality of food for a bette value. Nothing special of this place.

Review2132.Review: I work in SOMA and have been to FANG several times. The food is unique, fresh, and fabulous Chinese. Everyone I take there loves it, too. I think it's the bet Chinese food in SF. It's busy so be sure to reserve. It's also noisy during lunch, but so worth it!

Review2133.Review: From a flavor perspective, this is one of the best Chinese restaurants in SF and it's located near Moscone. I prefer the lunch, which is a similar menu to dinner and which better fits the ambiance. The one downside for me is that the service always feels brusque and rushed.

Review2134.Review: The food on the menu is unique and delicious. Ask the manager to choose your dishes and you will have an even more unforgettable meal!

Review2135.Review: I love Fang. Have eaten there many times. We had Mr Fang decide on our menu. Food was delicious but came too quickly and 3 dishes all at once when there were only two people. The good news was our waitress noticed and took one of the dishes back and replaced it with another warm dish, before we even said anything.

Review2136.Review: I happened on Fang's during a business trip in 2013. When I returned to SF in 2014, I returned. Both experiences were very good, although On 2013, I think I arrived between lunch and dinner-the staff was eating and service was fair. This time, I arrived during the dinner hours and service was excellent. I have steamed pork dumplings which were delicious and the famous Nanking Sesame Chicken. The latter was crispy, sweet and the chicken was very moist, tasty. Fang's was also within a 7 minute walk from the hotel I was staying at- the whole experience was very good.

Review2137.Review: The food here is absolutely terrific. Interesting and different Chinese cuisine. Rpidly becoming our favorite.

Review2138.Review: The best Chinese restaurant -- anywhere! Fresh ingredients, creative dishes, wonderful favors, excellent service. Don't miss this gem.

Review2139.Review: Happy we went and will be back.

Review2140.Review: Poor service, two out of five items were not what I ordered and the server had no interest in correcting the mistake even though the ticket showed they were wrong.Food extremely salty.

Review2141.Review: Everything came at one time. Some dishes were cold. Some very hot spicy although it did not state that. We ate 10% of our food and refused to have them pack it up. Will not go back....

Review2142.Review: Excellent food, great environment. The pot stickers were fantastic!
