Review2143.Review: The owner of Fang follows a unique food selection process -- you tell the owner what you like and he sends dishes to your table. I've been there several times and the choices are always different and delicious.

Review2144.Review: We chose Fang based on Yelp reviews and its location within walking distance. Oddly, we couldn't get a reservation for anything other than 5:00 pm, but even when we left at 6:00 pm there were very few occupied tables. Food was tasty but the menu was very limited, especially for a Chinese restaurant.

Review2145.Review: We brought a group of 7 for a late lunch following a small wedding at City Hall. The food and service were outstanding and I would highly recommend Fang to anyone! The chef was gracious and picked our food so we didn't have to order off the menu. The bill at the end was completely reasonable for the food we received and the service.

Review2146.Review: Personal service from Peter Fang such a treAt! Wonderful food, gorgeous decor..Loved it!

Review2147.Review: Food is not very good - we tried a mushroom appetizer, and it tasted like a very old mushroom. Salads and some other dishes are full of farmed shrimps. Prices are high for Chinese food, even downtown SF. Seating arrangements are very tight making it difficult to get in and out.

Review2148.Review: Horrible serviceRestaurant smelled poorly and menus were soiledOur waitress was not helpful and we over ordered food

Review2149.Review: This place is great for groups -- consistently good food at very reasonable prices. We let Mr. Fang order for us, and everything was great. The appetizers were particularly good. We had the mushroom dish and the shrimp dumplings, and both were perfectly cooked with great flavor. I also really enjoyed the fish soup. The pork spareribs were huge, and the portions were suited to our group of 10. We enjoyed everything and the service was great!

Review2150.Review: Walk in with a group and the server or perhaps the owner himself will suggest a menu for you. If you're into not having to worry about picking the right item, you're in luck! The food is yummy. It's not the best Chinese food I've had but worth checking out!

Review2151.Review: Simply delcicous! The best gluten free Chinese food we have ever eaten! The owner created special gluten free and soy free entrees for us.

Review2152.Review: The food is always good here, wish there was one in Los Angeles ! The service is OK, not so attentive, very robotic, they just want you in and out and you will be aware of it. Make reservations, gets quite busy.

Review2153.Review: Peter ordered for us-- mistake. It's not that his choices weren't good. But we should have checked the prices. The crab custard was a good dish, but much more expensive than we could have guessed. The food at Fang is very good, definitely not run of the mill Chinese, and beautiful(!). We will return.

Review2154.Review: Wanton soup was great. Other dishes: basil chicken and dry string beans were very salty. Service is very unfriendly.

Review2155.Review: If you are in SOMA and are craving for some amazing Chinese food (specially if you are with a group), there is no better place to go. Family style Chinese food. Service could a bit more friendly and interested, but overall one of the best Chinese restaurants in town.

Review2156.Review: We had an outstanding lunch at Fang! It was bustling with servers, patrons and folks trying to get a walk in table! Glad we made a reservation. Most of our party had not dined at either of their restaurants so they were really wowed by the experience. I've been going to the House of Nanking for at least 25 years and have always enjoyed the experience. Fang is great because it is a nice large space for happy customers to enjoy the delectible treats! Our food was beautifully prepared and delicious! Three cheers for the Fang family!

Review2157.Review: We had a group lunch at Fang's. The flower tea is exceptionally good. We told the waitress what types of food we wanted and left the specifics to her. What she brought was perfect. The meal was excellent.

Review2158.Review: I booked 2 weeks in advance for 4 people. I rolled in and was asked if my whole party was there. Unfortunately no. Big mistake. So bookings at Fang apparently mean nothing if the whole party isn't there. Finally we had 3 of 4 people. Surely we can sit down now…. Nope. I stood in their little alcove for 50 minutes!Once we sat the food was fantastic and the theatrically disorganised service staff were helpful. Unfortunately my legs were so sore from standing and waiting so i couldn't enjoy the food.Never again

Review2159.Review: Really loved the food, it was excellent. Our first time there and Mr. Fang took our menu's and just brought what he wanted, it was all excellent! My only complaint is it felt like they were trying to get us out of there. When we left I saw why, the line was out the door, but still, I felt very rushed.

Review2160.Review: I have been to FANG several times, but the last time made me not want to go back. The waitress seemed put off at our questions and recommended food that just was not very good. We never saw her again after our food arrived even when we got the bill which was just dropped on the table without asking us if we wanted anything else. I will probably not return.

Review2161.Review: We have visited this restaurant many times over the last few years. The food is good but the service has been deteriorating over time and on this occasion was chaotic. Our selection of food arrived in a random order and cooled so quickly that it became inedible, particularly the noodle. They should invest in the heated trays that most Chinese restaurants use.

Review2162.Review: An SF favorite of ours. We sat next to a couple of guys well into their fourth or fifth bottle of saki - loud but friendly. They shared each course of the many they ordered with their immediate neighbors ( including us ) and poured a drink for anyone who'd take it - certainly entertaining! The food excellent as usual, soup dumplings hot and spicy, duck buns luscious, spare ribs thick and meaty and Szechuan shrimp cracklingly hot. Mr Fang is everywhere - taking orders, adding final touches in the kitchen, cooking entire dishes and making sure everything runs smoothly. We will keep Fang on our go to list!

Review2163.Review: We went during happy hour and ordered a Sapporo ($2, great deal!) and pomegranate margarita ($5). The drink was small and just okay. Not sure why they put Seagram's vodka into that and just about every one of their signature mixed drinks, but I am not a fan. For apps we had marinated bok choy and deep fried onion cake. I liked both, esp the bok choy which had some bite to it with the red onion and garlic and chili. We wished the onion cake had come sooner, and not 3 min before our entrees. For entrees, I had the whitefish (delicious) and my fiance had their special bbq spare ribs (way too sweet). Service: although the place was very quiet/slow, our waiter was pretty inattentive and very unenthusiastic when asked for recommendations.

Review2164.Review: Upscale version of House of Nanking, Peter Fang's other restaurant. Currently doing contruction next door, but walkway was open. Salt and Pepper shrimp and beef spare ribs were delicous. Server recommended pea shoots, which were good and appeared a popular item ordered by other diners as well.

Review2165.Review: Fang offers excellent food. This is the third time I've eaten there and I Love Chinese food. We had their onion cake with peanut sauce, eight treasure salad and barbecued pork ribs. It would have been nice to sample more dishes, but there were only two of us and everything they serve is designed for sharing. It would be ideal to have six or more people in the party because just about anything can be split at least four ways. But it's hard to complain about food this good. The eight treasure salad includes cabbage, peashoots, red peppers, spinach, winter melon, scallions, apples and cilantro. Each bite is wonderful. The service is okay and the decor is very nice, but the food is the star.

Review2166.Review: If you want an authentic Chinese food experience this is the place. Nothing real fancy just super food. For three of us we order a few items and ate them all. It was an excellent find.

Review2167.Review: Everything we ordered had either too much 5 spice or ginger. They were noted for their shanghai soup dumpling however they forgot our order then when it came it was cold and flooded with sauce with poor presentation.We had five dishes and all were too sweet. Will not go back and definitely not recommend it.

Review2168.Review: We just told them a few things we liked and they did the rest. Brought out a lot of things we wouldn't have thought to order and they were all great. Came back for lunch the next day and got the same treatment. Great food.

Review2169.Review: Initially chose Fang on a whim for a group of 5 business associates following a conference at Moscone Center - To my surprise when we walked in I quickly found that Fang was same owners as House of Nan King which itself is an interesting place to eat.... Within the group we had 1 vegetarian, 4 no beef, 2 no pork and 1 no seafood - ugghh! - Our waitress was wonderful working within and away from the menu to suggest 5-6 dishes that satisfied everyone! Food was delicious - far less greasy than what I recall at Nanking - the restaurant is beautiful and atmosphere was great. I nice addition to the neighborhood.

Review2170.Review: Great service. Great food. If it's your first time, let your waiter know and they will probably suggest that you tell them what you like and let them bring you a selection. If they do, let them! Our selection was varied and delicious!

Review2171.Review: Having read the other reviews on Open Table and Trip Advisor decided to give this a try. The food was very good and the wait staff extrememly helpful.

Review2172.Review: Excellent food !impressive young owner-daughter-father collaboration ; well spoken , provided great selections . Personal favorite was the whitefish ;the southern fellows loved the prawn with cream sauce on apples .. Everything was delicious . The next night I was at kokkari (always outstanding) and told locals we met at the bar they had to try Fang.

Review2173.Review: Everything from top to bottom on the menu should be ordered!The Cod, dumplings, and glazed prawns had me smiling from head to toe!Heaven!Fantastic Service!!!!!! Cheers!!! Enjoy!!!!!Go!!!!!!

Review2174.Review: Awesome Shu Mai! Shrimp firecrackers were amazing. Nanking chicken had sweet potatoes, odd, and didn't include rice. I never knew a Chinese non-noodle dish to not come with rice. The lo mein had awesome flavor, but was SALTY!! I would return, but would definitely try other dishes.

Review2175.Review: White fish dish was outstandingNoodles were okPotstickers were greatVery very dark, my table mates couldn't read their menus

Review2176.Review: This restaurant was recommend by out hotel concierge. It was one of the best meals we had in SF (which says a lot because we enjoyed a lot of great food on our trip). The prices were good, the dishes we perfect size for sharing and the flavor/tastes were spectacular! We wish we would have found it earlier in our trip so we could go again. The only downfall was they were very busy, so our 7:45 reservation was looking more like an 8:30 dinner, so we saddled up to the bar and ate there instead. It worked out perfectly.If you are in SF...this is a MUST!

Review2177.Review: I was attending a conference, staying in the area. I figured I should check out at least 1 Oriental restaurant before I left. While certainly not traditional Chinese food, the menu is varied and has many favorites with a slight twist. I had the stir fired short rib with Bok Choi, excellent, as well as a seafood noodle appetizer that I really enjoyed. If this restaurant was in my home town I would be a regular. I din't realize until I got there that I had eaten here several years ago. At that visit, the owner personally attended to me, and gave me small samplers of a variet of dishes - got to taste far more than I would have if I had just ordered off the menu. All the dishes were delicious and the special attention was appreciated.

Review2178.Review: We must have missed something. Hot and sour soup - some of the best I've had. Steamed dumplings - also great. Everything else - near inedible. The "world famous" sesame chicken was just strange, and the crispy short ribs had such a strong taste, we couldn't eat it. Add to it the random service (with 3-4 different people showing up at odd times at the table), the main dishes showing up before appetizers, and the kitchen staff (which is in the dining room) arguing loudly among themselves. Maybe an off night, but we won't be back.

Review2179.Review: We went here for my wife's birthday with friend's following a performance at the Yerba Buena Center. The ambience was perfect -- nice, festive, not overpowering or too loud. FANG has a tradition of letting the server order for your table (within restrictions you specify). You can order on your own, but we put ourselves in our server's hands. The dishes were pitch perfect, especially the pork spare ribs. One negative -- the non-alcoholic fruit beverage was wayyyy too sweet. Otherwise, everything was delicious.

Review2180.Review: We visited the restaurant because we wanted something different in the Bay Area. We were not disappointed booking with Top Table was so easy and the welcome at the restaurant was spot on. Our eye sight is not what it was but we had managed to get through to what we thought might be a good set of choices but were not sure. We need not have worried Mr Fang appeared very charming and self effacing explained that he was the owner and the chef and if we trusted him he would ensure we were well fed. We were the food was great and the team kept an eye out to ensure that we had wine to accompany the excellent food.A lovely evening well done team.

Review2181.Review: FANG is a very good restaurant, however some of the items ordered from the menu weren't availabie. The owner made other suggestions with his apology.

Review2182.Review: The food can be superb. This evening was the best we have had at Fang's....a truly excellent meal.

Review2183.Review: We were on vacation in San Francisco and ended up going twice to Fang. We found the food to be consistently good. There were no thick sauces and the fried potstickers were fabulous. It's not a lingering place as most Chinese restaurants are not but we weren't rushed.

Review2184.Review: Great Chinese food with a creative flair. Impeccable service. Recommend letting Peter Fang himself select the dishes for your party after providing him with basic desires and any special food limitations. Peter will direct his staff to serve your dishes with spot-on timing.

Review2185.Review: We sat down and service was immediate. We started ordering a couple of things and the waiter asked my wife if we were vegetarian. Yes, we are. He then said that he'd take care of us and took the menus. Ok then.We got 4 courses, all delightful. One after the other. Prepared and plated perfectly for the 3 of us. Super tasty. I would not recommend this option if you have food aversions - unless you tell him, because they throw a lot of ingredients at it!

Review2186.Review: I made a reservation using OpenTable but when we showed up they didn't even acknowledge that we had a reservation. They just put us on the bottom of the list. The place was packed. It was weird. I don't mind waiting for good food but don't take reservations if you're not going to honor them. The server was also odd. We got the wrong drinks, a wrong dish, other tables that sat long after us were served before us. It was just a mad house.That said, it really was the most amazing asian food I have ever had. It's on an entirely new level. I've never had anything like it. The truth is I'm going to go back. But this time I will adjust my expectations and gear up for an adventure. If you can do the same...you're in for an amazing meal.

Review2187.Review: Our hotel concierge recommended Fang when we asked for Asian cuisine in the area. The chef and owner was friendly and chatted with us and recommended special items for our needs. We have 2 young children that have particular tastes. We enjoyed the food and had a wonderful dining experience.

Review2188.Review: Each time at Fangs the good was outstanding! Peter Fang restaurant is magic. We will be back!

Review2189.Review: We loved Fang - our family of 5 went there late on Fri night and Chef Peter asked us what we like - and then ordered for our table!what a great and personalised experiencse. Tender fish, fantastic onion pancake, great eggplant....definitely recommend!

Review2190.Review: From the same guy (Fang, hence the name) who drew lines outside House of Nanking in Chinatown comes this elegant, refined and pricier take on Chinese food a few steps up Howard from the W hotel. We've eaten there three times and it's always been great. Food is tasty and beautifully presented. Menu isn't huge but has a nice mix of spicy and savory choices. My favorites include the Melt in Your Mouth Calamari and the Shanghai dumplings, but really everything was delicious. Service is activist--the waiter frequently suggested alternatives, some of which we liked, others we rejected. But he kept our water and beer glasses filled, and the food arrived quickly (probably because we ate early to make a movie at the Metreon). Plan to return often.

Review2191.Review: Ate off the chef's menu- delightful!

Review2192.Review: My girl friend is Chinese & was surprised the "special " house dishes were only written in Cantonese on a separate menu. For example next to us the tourists were from Conn. & asked about what we had ordered . They liked it ( we gave them a taste ). And they were sad those dishes were offered to Chinese people only.

Review2193.Review: All the dishes are light and not greasy like usual Chinese food. This is my second time coming here and I have recommended it to a lot of people...

Review2194.Review: Much smaller then expected. Not ready with our reservation and sat at "bar." No real bartender and no one interested in serving us. Waited for 20 min before drink order taken. Table small menu stained and old. Food was ok. Won't go back.

Review2195.Review: The food was fairly bland. I would not go back again. Very good hibiscus margarita.

Review2196.Review: We sat down and reviewed the menu and couldn't decide what to order--everything looked great. The owner came over to take our order and asked if we had any allergies. The he ordered for us and small tastes of many dishes started rolling out of the kitchen, each one better than the last. A wonderful meal.

Review2197.Review: A group of three businesss associates and I went to Fang for lunch. As it was. Our first time there, out server--an older gentleman--took our menus away and said, "We'll take care of you." The staff proceeded to bring us plate after plate of Really Good Food. What a great lunch it turned out to be!

Review2198.Review: Peter Fang knows his stuff. Let him order for you and you will get a great, delicious meal.

Review2199.Review: Great restaurant and fabulous food. Amazing.

Review2200.Review: Turn the decision making over to the owner - he'll bring you the most delicious dishes! We do this every year for a company team dinner. We've loved everything he has offered us!

Review2201.Review: I always take any guests who are visiting. It's truly a unique SF food experience. Very unlike other Chinese food in a good way. It's unique and very very tasty. Every guest I've brought here loves it. My favorite is the Honey shrimp, which is not on the menu.

Review2202.Review: My husband and I liked this restaurant but the food did not live up to our expectations. It wasn't bad just not fabulous. Like others, the owner asked if she could order for us and we agreed. The downside was that we had no idea how much food was on it's way so it would be nice if there was more communication

Review2203.Review: As others have commented, the owner helped choose our menu for us & his choices were great. The food was very tasty & service very quick.

Review2204.Review: The owner of this restaurant wants to order your meal for you. After indulging him once, with mixed results, I told him I would order for myself and my table. He dressed me down in front of family and friends, telling me I should "respect the owner!" I believe the customer's choices should be respected. Will NEVER go here again! The food and prices are ok here, not stellar, but who needs the attitude?

Review2205.Review: As always, Fang delivered an amazing experience with fantastic food that surpassed expectations. Too many superlatives? Try this page and try not to gush about how great it is.

Review2206.Review: The service and food was wonderful. All four of us loved our dishes.

Review2207.Review: We wanted vegetarian and the ownerordered delicious dishes that kept comingto the table. Last time we had delicioussea food. We have never been disap-pointed. We have been here 5 timesand it was always delicious. It is notnoisy for being downtown and next tothe new Modern Art wing's construction.There is a downstairs for private parties.

Review2208.Review: There is classical Chinese cuisine, Asian fusion and Fang represents---Modern Chinese Cuisine.All the dishes are 21st century versions of classics. Refreshing breathe of new taste and flavors for the adventurous palette!

Review2209.Review: As before, the chef created our .unch with 2 appetizers, soup and 2 entrees for 3 persons. Every dish was new to us, and it was all light and delicious.

Review2210.Review: I took my parents here over the weekend as it was highly recommended by a friend. Shortly after having a seat, the chef and owner dropped by our table to introduce himself. After informing him (Peter) that we had never dined there before, he took our menus and said he "would take care of it".Shortly after, soup and an appetizer came out, a beef entrée and a shrimp entree. It was wonderful to have such great food brought to our table without needing to pick for ourselves! Well, it was great until we noticed the table next to us was receiving the exact same items we were. The concept is great, but it would have been much better if it was a little more personalized and not dished in mass.

Review2211.Review: We've had a hard time finding a good restaurant when visiting the area - we were here to see a Gilbert and Sullivan performance, but also visit the area for SF MOMA and our experience was nothing short of great. We were stuck in Golden Gate traffic in Marin County and called to say we would be late and that we had an 8 o'clock performance to attend. No problem. They sat us immediately although we were 45 minutes late, suggested that they do the ordering and proceeded to bring on dishes that were nothing short of delicious. We will definitely return.

Review2212.Review: The food is wonderful! The tastes were great. When we arrived we had Fang himself come over to the table and ask us if we had been here already. When we said no he asked if we trusted him. We said yes and he took our menus away and asked if we had any allergies or food dislikes. I am not a fan of sea food so he said ok.A few minutes passed and the food started to arrive. It was awesome food! Excellent selections. I would highly recommend.

Review2214.Review: Sunday eve-First Time Visit. Group Of 8...Out Of Town Visitors. Mr Fang Took Personal Care Of us,AskeAbout Our Food Preferences And Then Designed Our Menu .....Wonderful Variety If Food AndFlavors At A Reasonable Price. Would DefinitelyReturn

Review2215.Review: Being new to town we decided to check out Fang based on previous reviews and we weren't disappointed. We had the dumplings for entree and they were one of the best dumplings I have ever had - great flavour. We ordered our mains based on the waiters recommendation and they were both full of great flavours. Drinks are cheap and the overall restaurant has a great vibe. Excellent service and very accommodating. Would highly recommend.

Review2216.Review: The pot stickers and the beef tower were delicious. The curried chicken had no curry in it and the cocktails were watered down to nearly nothing. We told both of the latter issues to the server and ordered another cocktail - no ice. the cocktails arrived identical to the first and she stood and stared at us when we asked if there was something to be done with the curry. Not exactly sure how to rate this visit. Not sure we'll return actually since communication was a problem.

Review2217.Review: Excellent Good. Chef asked our restrictions and prepare dinner for the four of us

Review2218.Review: On the last day of our 10 day trip to the Bay Area we made last minute reservations through Open Table at Fang. We left the meal ordering to Mr. Fang the owner and were served dishes that we would never have ordered on our own. The food was absolutely delicious. We vote this meal the best on our trip.

Review2219.Review: We had a great family dining experience with the "surprise" menu. All we told our server was that we wanted a vegetarian meal and how hungry we were! After that, they proceeded to bring out what seemed like a 10-course meal! Each dish had its own charm and used fresh ingredients and unique flavors. Must go for foodies as you will get a unique taste of Chinese cuisine.

Review2220.Review: Tucked away in a lesser visited part of SF Fangs seems not particularly special. The printed menu is OK but not that exciting. Then Mr Fang arrives and takes your order. The journey begins - it doesn't really matter what you order, you'll get what he thinks you'd enjoy better. Our order of pork loin morphed into the most delicious falling pod the bone pork spare ribs ever. Szechuan shrimp arrived as honeyed shrimp in a light tempura batter - delicious and neither item on the menu! Go take a chance and prepare to be amazed by this SF gem.

Review2221.Review: Don't bother looking at the menu. The chef and her father are food artists and they love the chance to do something just for you. They know what's fresh. They know what's good they found at the market that day. So let them amaze you. You'll be glad you did. They'll ask if you have any allergies and work around that. There's a certain thrill of not knowing what's coming. I've never ordered from the menu here and never been disappointed.

Review2222.Review: A nice restaurant with good to excellent food. Make sure to ask for the owner and tell him what you would like to eat and let him order it for you. You can, if you wish, tell him how much you want to spend. It seems to me that you can get something very good for $30 without drinks.

Review2223.Review: Close to Union Square without being touristy. Cool place. Healthy, fresh Chinese fusion. Not the typical sweet-saucy Chinese place!If you are lucky enough to to have the owner Peter Fang offer to pick out a selection of dishes for you, you say YES! Enjoy it. He will ask about any dietary restrictions ahead of time so the meal will be tailored to your liking! Also you can tell them when you are full so they stop bringing out dishes. They serve fast so pace yourself, slow down and enjoy. Lovely blooming tea "flowers" in bear mugs, fun.If you are on a budget, order off the menu. If not, just go with it and let him chose for you...it was still reasonable and a lot of fun to be surprised.Nice decor, hip space, great service and bar too.

Review2224.Review: A friend had recommended this place though she said that the waiter had ordered for her. I would of liked more of that just for the old world charm. But i have a feeling that anything you order is fantastic. The food came out in a funny order. My friend got her crispy honey steak before we got the egg roll apps, That meal was divine for two reasons: the steak was in cubes with absolute crispness on the outside and the bok choy was equally as crispy! I LOVE bok choy raw and have never had it served near raw in a restaurant! I was impressed! next the pork confit egg rolls which made me pause whilst eating. Egg rolls don't really do that generally. They had a lovely texture. finally, the Nanking Sesame chicken IS all that!

Review2225.Review: This is our second time at Fangs and whereas I loved it the first time, our second meal was awful. I actually left there hungry as I couldn't eat the food. The calamari was soggy and too much lemon, the chicken which I asked for stir fry with vegetables and sweet and sour was one of these things. It was dried out peppery chicken with a couple mushrooms. Overcooked and tasteless. The dumplings which should have been shrimp were pork and the covering was thick and tasteless. My husband said his fish was good. We left there vowing never to go back

Review2226.Review: We walked in and the place was booming, we were sat promptly thanks to OT reservatons. Mr Fang, came by to take our order (after we had been served 2 ice cold beers) and asked what we wanted, he looked at us and asked if we trusted him? We said sure! He then asked if we were allergic or had any religious food issues, we said "no" and hoped for the best...The food that came out was spectacular! nothing we would have ordered ourselves (pumpkin soup, steamed bread taco looking thing, etc.) the more we ate the better it got, we didn't even have to ask for additional flavoring (salt/soy)We then were worried about the bill....and were pleasantly surprised....5 import bears, and a 4 course meal for $70...Don't miss this gem....

Review2227.Review: This was a great group dining experience. The food was excellent and any mix ups (only minor) with the order were corrected immediately. The food came out fast, especially for a party of 14. Either the manager or owner came out and offered to do a family style menu for us where he would bring out recommended dishes for the group. Extremely attentive and thoughful in regards to our occasion and group. We did not do this option due to restrictive diets of several guests. However, we semi orders family style in groups and the bill was already seperated between the people who ordered together when it came out. Water glasses were always filled and the service was very attentive, friendly and fast.

Review2228.Review: As others suggested, we asked for recommendations, at which point the menus were taken away and we were brought a series of dishes that were things I'd never have ordered for myself, but were each amazing. If you go this route of having the staff order for you, you may want to define boundaries such as allergies or price range.I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking for amazing and unique Chinese food in this area of San Francisco.

Review2229.Review: Have Peter Fang or one of his staff order for you when you go as a group for lunch.It is always a hit! I have never had a disappointing dish. Excellent food.

Review2230.Review: A wide-ranging and distinctive menu, easy access (I never have trouble getting in, and yet it's rather busy), and central location make this one of my regular spots.

Review2231.Review: I'm Chinese and my friend is Russian. We went there because it's so close to the convention center and thoroughly enjoyed the lunch there. The tastes are so authentically Chinese! I won't name the dishes here because we ordered purely based on the menu without any reference or recommendation. I bet every dish will satisfy your appetite!

Review2232.Review: Forget the menu and ask Kathy Fang to select the freshest and the best within your parameters then sit back and enjoy the gastronomic ride. Our group of 10 had tastes all over the board yet left feeling fully satisfied and attentively served.

Review2233.Review: My first time at Fang. I brought my 93 year old father to dinner and normally, when he goes somewhere he is shown additional attention and respect because of his age. I was a little surprised by their lack of any concern or appreciation that we were even there. We had a reservation through Open Table and arrived about 5 minutes early. They seated us at a table located directly next to a divider separating us and the front desk. I immediately noticed that the Chinese statues and other items on top of the divider, directly at eye level to us were covered with dust and the divider itself was spattered with grease. Not a great first impression. The servers were acceptable but not overly friendly. More bad than good - wouldn't go back.

Review2234.Review: Simple no fuss great american style chinese in the center of SF, you don't come for the service, you come for the great food

Review2235.Review: When a group of us sat down, the chef and owner personally assisted us. Since it was first time,we didn't know what to order so he took care of it (basically bringing us food not on the menu). We all loved what he chose and enjoyed the outstanding service he and our server, Lily, gave. Parking was a breeze (so long as your parked the next block which was Folsom by Hawthorne), and our table by the window and close to the end made it cozy and conducive for the five of us to have conversation. To top it off, since the chef knew about our birthday celebration, he provided us with complimentary desserts. What a treat!We would definitely come back!

Review2236.Review: My group and I had a very good experience here. The man who took our order (I believe he was the manager/owner) took the liberty to order some appetizers, per our request, and he made some great choices.All in all, it was a good place.

Review2237.Review: I usually love Fang (and House of Nanking) and we always happily eat what they bring us, but the food was just not up to it's usual standards this time (pumpkin soup was bland, too many beef dishes, lots of similar flavors). And the owner kept yelling at the staff - one server in particular - so vehemently it was really distracting and painful. We'll be back of course, was just a disappointing experience overall, especially for a $30 lunch.

Review2238.Review: We had excellent experience. Being Vegetarian is sometimes a challenge. Mr. Fang took over and provided us with an excellent vegetarian experience.

Review2239.Review: First time visiting. Was enroute to Commonwealth Club presentation and needed something early and in the 'hood.This was perfect. Will be dropping by again.

Review2240.Review: Owner was very welcoming and selected all courses for us.

Review2241.Review: We took advice from reviewers in Trip Advisor & didn't order from the menu. The Chet's creations are magical. Worthy of more than 5 stars! It is family owned & run & they are involved every step of the way from cooking yo serving. They want the customer to be happy. We stuffed ourselves & left feeling like we had a magical culinary experience.

Review2242.Review: We accepted the "let us prepare a meal for you," and didn't order off the menu. Everything was fried, salty, greasy. A couple of interesting dishes like (fried) short ribs in 5-spice powder, but there was nothing special at Fang. Service was way too aggressive. We told them twice that we wanted to slow down the courses to allow for conversation, but they basically ignored the request. This place is just a basic neighborhood Chinese restaurant...nothing special.

Review2243.Review: Location is not the best. Moderate pricing for a decent chinese food in a semi high dining ambiance!

Review2244.Review: What was supposed to be beef, felt, looked and tasted like a completely other species. Worst dining experience I have had in the 9 years I have lived in this city.

Review2245.Review: Fang serves up good Chinese fare, open late, the owner always comes by to check , which makes you feel special. The highlight is that you can totally put yourself in their hands, we told them our preferences and they kept bringing amazing food out! We went back to having a good time while they took care of the food, perfect!

Review2246.Review: We were unable to get to the restaurant!! San Francisco had all ways of getting to FANG blocked off for construction!! When I called the restaurant to cancel, the woman who answered said she knew they were blocked off!! Why in the hell didn't someone from FANG call us or send a message to let us know??

Review2247.Review: Just like Naan King, but you can make a resrvation so no waiting. The food was incredible. Highly recomment the Fried short rib dish.

Review2248.Review: This is the second time we have gone to Fang for a company event and the staff is so gracious and helpful. We love coming here and the flexibility they provide! Thank you!

Review2249.Review: After asking the ubiquitous (and generally silly) "have you eaten with us before?" question, the chef/owner suggested that, since we hadn't, we let him choose for us, which turned out to be a good idea. The asparagus salad starter was outstanding, as were the BBQ pork buns. The entrees were just okay (we had short ribs, which tasted overwhelmingly of Chinese five spice, and a rather bland fish dish), but I could have eaten the bok choy that accompanied the beef for a week straight without complaint.

Review2250.Review: The food was fantastic. Well executed delicious and flavorfull. The staff was a bit confused about their responsibilities and who needs to do what. This made the wait long and getting our food a chore. I finished my entre by the time my husband got his.Too bad since the food is something I will come back for but the service will make me hesitant when I am on a scheduale.

Review2251.Review: Menus were taken away & we were told we'd get family style. Arrived at 11:45, the place was pretty empty, but we were stuck in an odd spot that had a 4-top behind us, which meant I had to get up for people to sit there. I was asked to get up once on the 1st course, for a group that did not want the weird seat behind us, so they left. On the 2nd course I was asked to get up again for a group who did sit, and food and drinks proceeded to be served over my head (literally) for the next 20 minutes. No one refilled our drinks & after the 3rd course (about 40 min into the 'lunch'), someone came by & dropped a crumpled receipt in front of me & walked away. A very embarrassing client meeting experience -will not be back. Was I on candid camera??!

Review2252.Review: The food was amazing but the service was definitely lacking. Had to flag down our server several times and the restaurant wasn't that busy. Once we finally placed our orders, our food was ready quickly. Nice happy hour specials and dinner portions were nicely sized. Had read that this restaurant was a little closer to AT&T ballpark than it actually was, but despute the slow service we did make it to the game in time.

Review2253.Review: We had reservations for lunch and they tried to sit us at the bar. After a 10 minute, we finally got a table and ordered as soon as the waiter came over since we were both starving. My Nanking Sesame Chicken came out fairly quickly but the Crispy Honey Steak took 20 minutes later. I had a difficult time eating my lunch with my friend staring at me. I know what you are thinking, and of course I shared my chicken. When the Crispy Honey Steak finally came out, it was mushy. I'm really disappointed with Fang's and will not come back with Chinatown so close by.

Review2254.Review: Have Peter (owner) pick your courses; you will not be disappointed.

Review2255.Review: I wouldn't go back here, the service was terrible, they messed up our order and we were waiting for 30 mins w/out being comped for anything. The food was mediocre at best.

Review2256.Review: One of the best Chinese restaurants in San Francisco. Great flavors and texture contrasts. Even the more traditional dishes have a unique flair.

Review2257.Review: I would recommend Fang for take out but the staff is REALLY abrupt and hurried!!! they want you in and out FAST! with NO TIME for niceties! or SERVICE!!! It does get busy though because it's in a heavy tourist area! I think they could do even a lot better if they had SOME customer service, they'd get more locals. I for one don't like eating at places that have such a lack of service, makes me uncomfortable.

Review2258.Review: We loved our experience at Fang. The food was wonderful and Kathy did a great job ordering for the table, even though we had meat-eaters, a vegan and a non-seafood person. They really worked to accommodate all of us. We had one of the downstairs, private rooms and loved it. It was quiet enough for my 78 year old dad to hear the conversation. However, it is not child-friendly. There were many lovely, but breakable objects in the room, so we had to constantly keep the kids focused on small toys and activities at the table.

Review2259.Review: Made reservation for 8 people but we had to wait almost 45 min past the reservation time for a table to be set. We get our drinks ordered fairly quick and then it would seem every table being seated after us was also being served food before we could even get a waiter to look at us. They give us 3 menus for 8 people and after about 30 min we finally got someone to take our order, mind you they took the order with the most unpleasant attitude some of us had ever seen. The food took a while to come out but it was all correct and tasted good at least. Then it took another 40 min to get the check to get out of the place... so overall the dinner went for well over 2 hours, which is absolutely ridiculous.

Review2260.Review: Great food, fantistic flavour. Loud, fast, delicious. Chicken buns are great.

Review2261.Review: There was a special event that we were not alerted to when making reservation. I had a business group with me and expected to sit upstairs. Instead we were routed through a backdoor to the downstairs which is a terrible environment. The food was marginal the wine list fairly priced but underwhelming, the service was good. I might go back with a friend if we could sit upstairs. I would never take a business group again.

Review2262.Review: Terrible, virtually inedible food. Years ago, when Fang first opened and they were still trying, the food was decent. No longer.This place is an overpriced failure at trying to replicate Asian food.

Review2263.Review: It is "modern" Chinese. New flavors but still oily food. The Chinese chefs seem not to be creative in cooking without large amounts of oil and cornstarch. Marinated bok choy is creative but salty. Fang's is an interesting concept and restaurant but the owner and his daughter cannot manage it like a Michelin 3 star restaurant. The waiters are poorly trained and paid. They do not know how to serve or very attentive. Not professional wait staff. Though not in Chinatown it is still "Chinatown", Mr. Fang. Try it and enjoy it!

Review2264.Review: The food at Fangs is always amazing. We have dined at Fangs many times. The service can be hit and miss. If Mr. Fang is in the restaurant, the service is excellent. If he is absent, the service seems to diminish a bit. Nothing really major just small things like drinks not being refilled or a large gap between being seated and having an order taken, waiting a considerable amount of time to get the check, etc; I will certainly return and even though the waiters have tried to talk me out of ordering the salted pork belly more than once, I will order it again happily! It is delicious.

Review2265.Review: Perhaps the worse Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Such a good location for such bad food.

Review2266.Review: The food is delicious and creative. Not the same chinese dishes you see everywhere. I have to eat gluten-free and dairy-free and they are very accomodating and careful about this (although I don't know how it would be for a sensitive celiac, I don't know if they use separate utensils, you should call if you need that). I go there with business groups of people who don't have the same restrictions I do, and we are all able to find delicious food that we like and can eat. If you aren't sure what to order, ask Mr. Fang to choose for you (he will work with your limitations) and you will get the best dishes! Last time, they were busy and the service was a little on the slow side, but not too bad. I've also been there when the service was good.

Review2267.Review: Peter Fang is very friendly, he took our menus and said, "I'll take care of you", and asked if we had and dietary restrictions. The food was nice, although unremarkable. We were totally stoned from the MSG. I would ask to omit MSG if I were to return.

Review2268.Review: Greeted at the table by the owner who chose all our dishes for evening - each one better than the other!

Review2269.Review: The food was divine, even though we had to wait a half-hour, even though we had reservations. And the chef's selection was a bit pricier than I expected. I still recommend Fang because the food is so good, but aim to get there early for lunch.

Review2270.Review: FANG was swamped when my party of 4, which grew to 5, was arriving. At first, we thought the service was a little harried and rude. But the owner came over and, waving his hands, said "You talk business; I bring food!" He and his staff brought us the most delectable dishes!! Notable were the sesame-crusted and fried tofu, the fish in a delicate sauce, the spicy pork belly, and the delightful appetizers! I highly recommend FANG for business lunches, and will definitely visit again on my next trip to San Francisco!

Review2271.Review: The best thing about Fang is you can just ask them to bring you interesting dishes, after explaining any dietary restrictions or preferences pertaining to your party. They will bring delightful and surprising treats that you probably have not experienced before. They are very creative in terms of options for vegetarians and vegans, and can come up with good off-menu options.

Review2272.Review: Friend told me about this place. Not your typical chinese food. Healthy alternatives reasonably priced served quickly. Loved the five spiced white fish- YUM. Will definitely return when in the area.

Review2273.Review: Really enjoyed our meal and the special attention from Peter who created a custom menu for us. Great food, lots of fun.

Review2274.Review: I think the staff and the person who takes the order should make we get the correct items and smile as that is part of customer service Peter the owner is very nice.

Review2275.Review: food was too salty and i expected more from a Chinese restaurant in San Francisco

Review2276.Review: We had a reservation, but they seated another party of two who came in after us and did not have a reservation. We were seated in a spot that required the guest next to us to stand up so we could get to our seats. The service was very chaotic - many different people coming to help us. The food did come out quickly and the best part of the experience was the food itself - the wonton soup was amazing. However, the biggest reason I cannot give this restaurant more than a fair rating is the fact that they lost my credit card. They took it for my payment didn't address the situation until we asked 10 minutes later. They were very apologetic and comped my meal, but this didn't make up for the stress/hassle of cancelling my card on a Sat. night.

Review2277.Review: Large egg shell in my food! Took 15 minutes to get seated, even though we had reservations. Would not come back to this restaurant...

Review2278.Review: It was a lovely surprise when the owner took our dinner selection in his own hands so we could just sit back and enjoy.We savored the pumpkin soup with bits of shrimp and a small hunk of absolutely delicious house-made sausage. Then followed a light bite of roasted porcini in vinaigrette. Mains were succulent cubes of wok-fried short rib and then a very generous portion of delicately ginger sauced white fish and greens.The tea is not the usual anonymous brown slop in a pot. Oh no! Steaming water is presented in a tall beer mug and a delicate tea/herb/flower blossoms in it. A tasty little gift, really.Fang is a very welcome addition to the YBC area. We'll be back!

Review2279.Review: We were expecting a more sophisticated dining experience. To note: We went on Valentine's day - which may have been the problem - and the host sat us downstairs next to a very loud and large table of 20. We couldn't hear each other speak. The food was just OK. All in all, we were hoping for better.

Review2280.Review: Fang is always great. It seemed as though our dishes were not quite as spicy/flavorful as my first visit several months ago, but the food still tasted very good.Fang is best enjoyed, in my opinion, when you have a group of four or more people so you can have everything done "family style" and get to try a lot of different dishes. This visit I dined with just two people, so we didn't get to try as much, but I still loved it.I will always visit Fang when I'm in San Francisco.

Review2281.Review: Work through the menu. Some unique/modern Chinese cuisine. Have been there with friends and they all rave about the food because of the selections I made. Try the bok choy marinated salad. Unfortunately it is noisy and dishes, tables are getting beaten up. Needs to freshen up and better train the wait staff. Will go back again.

Review2282.Review: Chef customize order for our lunar new year gathering

Review2283.Review: It was amazing. The chef's put together our meal for us since we kind of had no idea what to order.

Review2284.Review: Our group of 6 sat downstairs hence it was quiet night -for upstairs is noisier.

Review2285.Review: We had a 12:30 reservation and didn't get seated until 12:50, which was annoying. But as usual, Peter Fang took our menus away and just brought the food out. We ate things we probably wouldn't have ordered, and everything was just delicious.

Review2286.Review: Great place to eat but not to stay for drinks, table rotation is big.

Review2287.Review: It is the fourth year in a row that I have my Univeristy's Center dinner there - everything is great.

Review2288.Review: The common complaint in Yelp is true: the owner, Mr. Fang will come by your table and ask if you've eaten here before: half said yes, two said no: at that moment he takes your menus away from you and says he'll "take care of you" we pleaded with the guy to include the one dish my wife liked from the last time she was here (Shanghai Soup Dumplings). He nodded yes, but never brought them out, and we only liked 2 of the 7 (!!) things he brought out and charged us $35/pp for the experience. A horrible experience, and I am upset we brought our two guests here. We'll never to again.

Review2289.Review: Same owner and type of chinese food as House of Nanking. Not your typical authentic chinese food - but some semblance of chinese food. For example, friend shrimp in mayonaise and walnuts here was done with fried apples instead. Overall, had an ok experience and would not return, not a destination spot...unless you're visiting the gold club next door.

Review2290.Review: Choosing the chef's menu is the best option for those unfamiliar with the menu or chinese food. They will just keep bringing dishes until you say enough.

Review2291.Review: Great authentic food. Chef Kathy Fang is very creative!

Review2292.Review: Not a place to go. Worst service on our SF vacation. Food taste did not match the hype. Will not be visiting again.

Review2293.Review: Let Mr Fang take the menus, ask for extra sure, and put yourself in his hands. You won't regret it.

Review2294.Review: One of the best Chinese food experiences ever. A gentleman came to the table, asked if we knew what we wanted and I responded with a what do you recommend...He replied, "I will take care of you! I'm the owner". The chefs, most who were female, prepared exquisite array of dishes...delicious. Nothing strange, just perfectly prepared variety of meats, veggies and flavors. Will return!

Review2295.Review: The three of us went for dinner. As others have mentioned, the owner grabbed our menus and said that he would take care of us. While this sounded intriguing,what I did not appreciate was a bill for $30.00 per person. This was much more than we planned on spending. I think the owner should recommend dishes, but not have the freedom to charge customers whatever he wishes. While the food was fine, we will not eat here again.

Review2296.Review: The owner always tries to force us too refer what he wants to sell..

Review2297.Review: This was a disappointing second time to the restaurant, after a really satisfying first visit for lunch. Mostly, it was uneven service: my companion's food came out five minutes before mine, and at the table next to us, it was closer to a ten minute wait between dishes for each diner. However, Mr Fang stopped by to say hello, which was a nice touch. The seafood pot I had was not as flavorful as I had expected but I still enjoyed it. I'll still go back, since it continues to get raves from my friends.

Review2298.Review: They were very nice to bring out extra food for the people who had to arrive late.

Review2299.Review: Went here with a group of 6 and had a great meal! Like many others have indicated you can turn you meal over to the chef and enjoy what htey prepare. We did just this and all of us loved each and every dish. We had Sauteed portobello mushroom with garlic, prok buns (my favorite), crab wwonton soup, papaya salad, dumplings, steamed ginger fish amdd many more. All were excellent. This, coupled with reasonable prices and fast service woudl make this a must go destination for the next ime I visit San Francisco.

Review2300.Review: Food good. Service unprofessional and poor. We had 3 different waiters come around at various times and neither knew what the other had done. Our drinks came at two different times and one was warm.

Review2301.Review: The food is delicious and served in generous share-able portions. (We ordered way too much, but our wonderful server helped us be slightly more reasonable.) If I live in San Francisco, I'd go regularly to Fang. This restaurant is loud and lively, not a place for a quiet chat.

Review2302.Review: What a fantastic, delicious meal! We were given menus but soon noticed that the locals take the advice of the owner and we decided to do the same. He suggested the calamari and dumplings for appetizers and they were unbelievably amazing. I had a chicken and green pepper dish to follow and my husband the bass which he said was the best bass he has ever eaten. My chicken was so yummy. We were way too full for dessert but will definitely return on our next visit to San Fran. Not expensive at all

Review2303.Review: This is a great place for a group. We didn't order any food, the owner (I think) came by our table, looked at us and said "OK, I'll go get your food." What he brought us wasn't something I would normally order, but it tasted amazing. So if you are looking for a little adventure and are open to trying new dishes, this is a great place to go.

Review2304.Review: Food was excellent. Restaurant was a little worn.

Review2305.Review: My husband ate at House of Nanking weekly when he worked downtown, so when we heard about Peter Fang's restaurant (which somehow had escaped our radar when it opened) we took a family group there for dinner. We were seated promptly and given menus, but as noted by other diners Peter offered to plan our menu for us, being solicitous of the vegetarians and children in the group. It was truly outstanding in every way, and there wasn't a dish that disappointed. The service was very good, the space is lovely, and parking is easy in the nearby garages by Moscone center. I highly recommend dinner here, and they are open for lunch as well.

Review2306.Review: My 3rd visit and I'm wondering why I've given it 3...The food is fair the service is poor.I wont be going a 4th time.

Review2307.Review: The food is amazing...it looks delicious and tastes even better. The service is quick and efficient.

Review2308.Review: Once we told the owner/manager it was our first time he took our menus and said "I will take care of you" and I'm glad he did. The food was awesome and the service excellent.

Review2309.Review: The owner, Mr. Fang, asked if our group of 7 wanted to leave the menu to him. We did and it was a wonderful meal. Among the many outstanding dishes were an out of this world fish soup and a very delicious wild prawn dish. The perfect ending was when Mr. Fang made us a perfect rice wine with dumpling dessert on the house.

Review2310.Review: Poor service from Mr. Fang himself.Took my order, repeated it to me, yet looked right through me.Showed up as the wrong dish 10 minutes before the rest.Sent it back, same dish back w/ "beef" added to it - on top of the now cold dish.Thanks for almost acting like you care about your customers - all this while you have one eye on the dining room, yelling at your servers while you are taking an order - micro-managing gets you NOWHERE with your employees, and it looks really bad in your (full) dining room.I know you've been in the business forever, but my dining experience tonight was enough for me to warrant not coming back for another visit. Maybe you shouldn't work the floor any more - the others servers were top notch, and h

Review2311.Review: This restaurant is our go-to restaurant for large family dinners, and our last visit was the best yet. After Mr. Fang makes sure we do not have any special needs or allergies, he presents dish after delicious dish of his choosing, and it's difficult to select a favorite. Just trust and enjoy!

Review2312.Review: Peter Fang has created a gem. The food is remarkable, even if the presentation is unpretenious.

Review2313.Review: Trust the chef and you'll have a memorable meal-- among the best I've ever had at a Chinese food establishment.

Review2314.Review: Great chinese restaurant, not the tipical food, will be a must next time on san francisco

Review2315.Review: Arrivals may be a bit chaotic with people waiting in line vs. reservations, but the restaurant does run like a clock work.Owner/chef greats the guests at the table, inquiring about dietary restrictions or favorites. If you are willing, he then "takes care of things" depending on your hunger level, which I highly recommend. Bar is extremely well stocked, so you may want to MUNI back.This place is great!

Review2316.Review: The food, as usual, was top-notch. However, we had one of the worst service experiences of my life there. It was clear they over-booked and then let in parties without reservations. We had 6:15 reservations and waited for almost an hour at the bar for a table. Then we sat at our table for about 20 minutes before getting a menu or any attention. I finally took to just raising my hand and keeping it there until someone came by. The owner came over and asked what we needed. When we said menus, he disappeared. No menus. Finally we convinced a waitress to give us some menus. The same thing happened with ordering; had to keep my hand in the air for about 3 or 4 minutes.The only person who seemed to care at all was the bartender. He was great

Review2317.Review: Excellent ! Have been to House of Nan King many times before, this is much more upscale.Food was really good, service was fast. Glad I made reservations, gets quite crowded.

Review2318.Review: It was good and fun but not all that i expected. Some things were excellent and others not so great. Wanted to believe that Fang would select great items but while they were tasty were often not that special or different and it was much more expensive than we expected as a result. Also very chaotic and noisy.

Review2319.Review: We went to Fang on Christmas Day.My overall impression is the Chef/Owner; Mr. Fang was a little presumptuous.Before learning more about what the guests like and dislike, he picked up the menu and ordered for us with very little knowledge of who the diners were.It turned out the dishes were okay (but not great) for most except for one guest, who cannot eat any of them and had to ordered a disk just for himself.For their quality, the dishes were little on a pricy side for a Chinese restaurant.I would not want to go back again.

Review2320.Review: The food is excellent. one thing, if you order with the manager, he orders too much afood and you dont get an itemised bill. they must give a itemised bill.

Review2321.Review: Outstanding dining experience. The owner after hearing it was our first time took the liberty of ordering for us and they did not disappoint!Would highly recommend.

Review2322.Review: Peter Fang, the owner, chef came by our table several times to make sure we were happy with the food and service. Once again, we asked them to order for us. They brought out 8 delicious courses and we left full and pleased with the selections. The only complaint was that the food came to the table faster than we could eat it making us feel rushed. We finally asked them to slow down which they did. The rest of the service was very efficient and we wanted for nothing.

Review2323.Review: Good food but the decor is as tired as the service

Review2324.Review: Mr. Fang greeted us. After we were seated he asked us if we had been there before and when we said no he offered to take care of ordering our dinner for us. We handed oer our menus and very soon aftern several courses started arriving one after the other. we were very happy with all the selections he made. very fresh ingredients for all dishes, not standard chinese...very unique and flavorful. would definetly go there again.

Review2325.Review: Really enjoyed the owner taking care of us. Most of the dishes - sweat fish with spinach, pork and pumpkin, pork in fluffy buns, garlic mushrooms - were awesome! The seasame beef was a little disappointing - meat was a bit grainy - but overall a very solid experience. Not a lot of real dim sum choices, so if you are looking for dim sum, this is not the place.

Review2326.Review: Wait staff paid attention to us only occasionally and had a rather indifferent attitude. We ordered soup, were asked for how many and responded it was for 4, but only one bowl of soup arrived. Our requests for bowls into which to serve the soup were initially ignored. Ultimately, we ordered 3 more of a different soup, which came in 3 small bowls, while other tables appeared to have large pots of soup from which the soup was individually served. When a nearby table was needed for a large group, the staff proceeded to enlarge that table with a new top and add chairs around it, forcing one member of our group to move her seat to a new location, but the staff didn't ever communicate about this process or ask her to move.

Review2327.Review: Let them order for you as you will get delicious items which you might not otherwise have chosen. You get two appetizers,a a fish platter and a chicken platter. All to share and enjoy.

Review2328.Review: I only gave Fang's a 'Good' overall rating instead of 'Very Good' since the bill was a little higher than I planned for the group. There were 16 of us so the owner of the restaurant, Fang, offered to just bring different food out to us instead of ordering from the menu. He insisted so I complied. The food and service were great but the bill was definitely higher, so instead of it being ~$20 per person it was ~$40. This wasn't a problem for anyone but it would've been nice to how much it would be per person, approximately, so we could decide this as a group. I understand that it was easier for the kitchen, but still needed to know the price. In summary, great food and service but if you're a big group get the price before hand!

Review2329.Review: Noise level was low as my friend and I dined earlyThe zucchini side dish is very goodThe waiter was really poor - he didn't even clear away the finished dishes when he brought new ones to the tableI don't know whether I would recommend this place; I would have to give it another try but not anytime soon.

Review2330.Review: great Chinese cuisine, prepared innovatively and always delicious.

Review2331.Review: Bring a crowd and have Mr. Fang order for you. You won't regret it. You'll have a dining experience with multiple tastes and wonderfully fresh combinations.

Review2332.Review: We had a wonderful time at FANG. Mr. Fang himself visited our table and we did not order off the menu, instead requesting that they serve us whatever they thought we would enjoy. Particularly good were the chicken buns, salted pork belly with pumpkin, ribs and white fish with spinach. The baby bok choy with the ribs was the best I have had. For our party of 7, the meal was less than $30 per person and it was the perfect amount of food.

Review2333.Review: The food was nice, a unique set of dishes quite unlike the usual take-away fayre. However everything was far too salty

Review2334.Review: The owner helped us order because werent familiar with the menu. He recommended a fish soup with chilli and tofu that was amazing.

Review2335.Review: This restaurant serves excellent Chinese food -- fresh, seasonal and unusual. The key is to inform the owner what kind of food you're interested in -- e.g. meat type, fish type, veggies, etc and he'll make up a menu for your group. This part of it was great. The service, eh, was so so in that there are alot of servers but you can't necessarily get their attention. We had to ask for water three times before it came. Another problem is that there's no indication of what a meal for a group that is selected by the server will cost! While we felt that the meal was great value for money...the check was still a surprise. There were six of us and a meal consisting of three appetizers, four main courses and rice was $150 plus the cost of tea.

Review2336.Review: Just told them to feed us, and the chef prepared plenty of food. We asked for more, and it was good too. A mix of flavours and textures in each dish--nothing ordinary Chinese. Not inexpensive, but clearly a good value.

Review2337.Review: Peter Fang is one of Bay Area's great Chinese chef. After his huge success at House of Nankin, he opened this place (Fang's)to live his dream which is to create Nouveau Chinese Cuisine (NCC) for modern day Chinese and non-Chinese alike. I am a fan of his for years and this is the Chinese restaurant that I take my Asian visitors to when they come to the Bay Area. His version of the NCC impresses the pickiest of my friends from Asia.

Review2338.Review: We did not enjoy anything about this restaurant. The waitstaff was very an annoying throughout our entire meal. Never to return or recommend.Sorry!

Review2339.Review: It helps of you can read Chinese script

Review2340.Review: In a City known for great Chinese food, Fang is another solid contender.I'd suggest going a little lighter on the garlic though.

Review2341.Review: This is my third time at this restaurant and I always look forward to going. I always have the owner make my dinner selections.

Review2342.Review: We took the entire extended family--10 people including children. We were seated quickly and the food came out fast and every dish was delicious. Would definitely return.

Review2343.Review: Service was questionable...it took a while to be seated. When we first walked in we were not even acknowledged even with a wait staff standing right there at the hostess desk.

Review2344.Review: enjoyed the food and restaurant. Service can be improved. eg, wait staff needs more training.

Review2345.Review: I guess it's ok for lunch. Unfriendly servers with attitude. And they're sloppy. Gal filling water glasses spilled it all over the table. We pointed it out to her. She came back and dropped some paper napkins on the table and walked away. The food is pretty good for Chinese, but not reliable.

Review2346.Review: The chef owner took our menus away as soon as we arrived and brought us (with our permission of course) some amazing dishes. The food was fantastic. The service however was average at best. The food came well, but follow up for drinks ordered, more water, etc was very lacking. Still, the experience and the food was worth it.

Review2347.Review: As a Chinese person, I feel Fang is a good balance between authenticity and western adaptation. All my American and other foreign friends like it too, including some foodies. I like to just ask the chef to put a menu together for us. And he's always come up with a good combination of dishes that are very reasonably priced. I've noticed that if he sees more Asian people at the table, the menu he put together tends to be a bit more "adventurous" whereas if the table is mostly foreigners, the menu is slightly more "conservative". I'm pretty sure you can ask for more authentic dishes if you like though. Don't bother asking for fortune cookies. There is no such thing in China and they rightfully do not have it. :) Overall a great restaurant.

Review2348.Review: We ate family style and the owner chose the menu for us. It was great! The glazed apple and shrimp dish was outstanding.

Review2349.Review: I think House of Nanking chefs are better, it doesn't seem the quality is consistent at Fang.

Review2350.Review: This is owned by the same people that do House of Nanking. Great menu and personable service. Most times I go, the waiter has recommended me something that sin't even on the menu and I've never been disappointed! The onion pancake appetizer is excellent. I usually make a reservation for weekday lunches.

Review2351.Review: Really wanted to love Fang but the experience was very poor. The inattentive hostess was nearly unforgiveable. She didn't check us in for our 7:30 reservation, she did not update us 30 minutes later when we were still standing in the lobby. Waitstaff didn't come to take our order until I flagged them down. They didn't bring us one of the three items we had ordered and - after paying the bill - they gave my credit card back to the table next to us. The food was creative and well prepared but didn't make up for the overall poor customer service. I won't be going back.

Review2352.Review: Unbelievable food. UNBELIEVABLE! And that's a lot given that it is in San Francisco. Best Chinese EVER

Review2353.Review: Upscale sister restaurant of House of Nanking but misses the mark a bit as it is in the middle between a really great dining experience and casual food. The food was actually quite good and will come back to try a few other dishes. The service was quite poor with waiters not speaking English, no checking if everything was ok or whether wanted more drinks etc. Normally I am quite happy with Chinese style service as it is quick and efficient but if not quick nor efficient and it a more upscale setting it just brings the whole experience down. Again, will be back for food though!

Review2354.Review: Pleasant experience fo 6 conference attendees. Had to wait quite a while to get to our reserved table, but once there it was very pleasant. Food was considerably better than average, beer cheap, noise level very acceptable. Non-pork-containing dumplings a plus.

Review2355.Review: This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in San Francisco (and one of the few on OpenTable). The food is always fresh and tasty. We usually let the boss bring us what's cooking. Highly recommended!

Review2356.Review: Good food and a noise level that allows conversation. I enjoy sharing several of the appetizers and the dishes and service make that easy here.

Review2357.Review: We made reservations but it didn't matter as there were some free tables and the maitre'd didn't even check her list, which was odd. We had to wait though for 5 minutes before we got shown to the table. The appetizer and hot sour soup and blooming tea were great but greatly disappointed with entrees especially this one food item whose name I can't remember (yea it was that bad, it was almost inedible). Their entrees are mostly the combined flavors of bell pepper, onion, black pepper and red pepper flakes. I suggest just go for the appetizers. Other than that, the decor and ambiance is nice so I give it 2.5 stars.

Review2358.Review: In all honesty I thought that our lunch was unusually bad. I have had incredibly good food at Fang's before. So this Sunday I decided to drag my foodie friends who were visiting from abroad to share the experienceUnfortunately the food was mediocre. We did not even touch the fish. We asked the specials like I do usually, but it was bad. Chinatown has better restaurants on Sundays. Having had excellent food before, this was disappointing. Maybe it was because it was Sunday.... but still, for a restaurant of this caliber and this reputation, I was expecting the best, as they have been.

Review2359.Review: Wonderful food and great menu selections. Very close to Moscone Center. Highlight of the convention, sneaking out for an outstanding lunch. So very good.

Review2360.Review: The food was good but the service was bad. Different people were helping us at different times and in general they were not nice nor did it seem like they wanted to help us. We had to get ther attention for things, even for ordering drinks.

Review2361.Review: service started out good but we couldn't get our bill. After asking staff twice to please find our server, we finally went to the front desk and managed to pay our bill. It didn't help that the restaurant was very hot. The food was good but I probably wouldn't go back.

Review2362.Review: A group of ten turned into 12 then back down to 9 and they were gracious through it all. They suggested letting them pick our menu which was so nice and easy. The large selection was tasty with no misses. and to top it of they split the bill nine ways with nine cards. Thank you Fang!

Review2363.Review: An unusual experience in some respects but very enjoyable. Mr Fang asked of our preferences and dislikes then produced an excellent 5 course meal ( which we extended to a 7 course meal!) which all our party agreed was delicious. Whist this approach may not be everyone's cup of tea it reminded me of the best dining experiences with my Chinese friends and their families when I never really knew what I was eating but was nearly always fantastic. Beef fish and vegetarian dished were all very good.Overall service could certainly be snappier - we had booked but still waited over 20 minutes for our table but in the overall judgemet this didnt massively affect our rating. Cocktails deserve a special mention if mainly for potency

Review2364.Review: If you love Chinese you'll love this place. No frills but delicious.

Review2365.Review: Unfortunately my expectations were high given it's affiliation with HofNK. However, the food was mediocre at best. I got the basil chicken and my friend ordered the sweet chicken. Basil chicken - way too salty and dry. The sauce was not good. The sweet sesame chicken was extremely dry and the sauce was so salty it was barely edible. We also ordered the pot stickers. Average, but expected more. They were not crispy, but soggy. The hot and sour soup was good. Atmosphere wasn't bad, a bit out of the way from the financial district. There's a reason why the place was fairly empty. Won't be going back anytime soon!!

Review2366.Review: Great food...followed the advice of other reviewers and had the owner do the ordering for us...not disappointed and the right amount..

Review2367.Review: Great food - A Peter is right there to help you out!

Review2368.Review: The downstairs area is great for group reservations. I have booked both larger groups 10+ and smaller - under 10 and the space works for both. For groups of a smaller size - you can reserve a private room space enclosed in glass that feels really special. For smaller group size, I always let the owner choose our dishes after providing guidance about vegetarian and other needs. Each time it's been amazing. This meal in particular featured dishes I would never select - shrimp with fried apple, lobster soup, spare ribs, other yummy dishes that were phenomenal. My group was so pleased, they were glowing after the meal. After checking availability for your group on OpenTable - call restaurant and request this room.

Review2369.Review: Disappointing. Food beautifully presented but bland. Chef took our order with no conversation, no recommendations...maybe he was tired.

Review2370.Review: Wow. Fang is fantastic. An only-in-San Francisco Chinese dining experience. The quality and variety and uniqueness of the food here is almost impossible to match anywhere else in SF. Don't miss this gem or its other operation, The House of Nanking. Simply great food.

Review2371.Review: Chef Fang comes to your table. Let him take your order and be ready for an adventurous treat!

Review2372.Review: Superb Service, YELP reviews happily didn't match the experience. The food was traditional with a flare. Snappy flavours, and unexpected ingredients like carmelized red onions made FANG a preferred alternative to China Town Chinese. We had Green Beans, Eggplant, Whitefish, Chow Mein with chicken, Mushroom and Prawns. The food was not too heavy, plus we got great guidance from our waiter, who even suggested a less expensive dish to replace one we had selected--which of course made us trust his guidance. Also portion sizes were perfect--we left with NO take out containers and everyone was full but not stuffed. The only complaint was the menu font was small and the lighting was low, bring your magnifying glasses. :)We will dine here again.

Review2373.Review: I expected unusually good Chinese food and instead got ordinary Cantonese style, the type of which I have not had since I first arrived in SF in 1971! The place itself is nice and great locale but I do not plan to return to Fangs in future.

Review2374.Review: seems to have gone downhill a bit since it first opened and is becoming like a fst food restaurant. The dishes we ordered all came at different times and 1 did not appear at all.

Review2375.Review: We were recommended Fang back in London where we live as apparently it is Jamie Oliver's favourite Chinese restaurant. Our expectations were high and we were not disappointed. On arrival we asked for a random selection of their best dishes as we found the menu overwhelming. The staff brought us dish after dish which were continually delicious. Best Chinese food I've ever tasted. I wish we lived in San Francisco so we could visit more often. The staff could be more friendly and polite, but ultimately we went there for amazing food and that's what we got! The cocktails were disappointing so I'd suggest sticking to wine or beer if you want to drink

Review2376.Review: We.ve been here several times and it is consistently good. Excellent Service and very different Asian food.

Review2377.Review: I had a mighty craving for Chinese food last week and remembered Fang's, which I had eaten at for a work event last year. If you're looking for authentic Chinese cuisine in a modern setting at reasonable prices, Fang's is a great place. I had the fried rice, potstickers, and fried pork belly for lunch which were all pretty much hit the spot on my cravings. I'm definitely visiting this place again.For large groups, the owner comes by and will make great recommendations based on what kind of flavors and tastes you like. He's been a restauranteur in SF for at least a couple of decades and definitely produces some of the best Asian food in the city.
