Review2378.Review: Met an old friend for lunch here since it was near my office and sounded interesting. Food was tasty, service was fast, prices were very reasonable. This will be on my go-to list for work lunches. There was a rather loud table next to us, but otherwise the noise level wasn't bad on my visit. If the place was full at night, I could see it being noisy.

Review2379.Review: Good food and you can make a reservation, which is nice in this area.

Review2380.Review: Wow! We had an incredible time, and will definitely go back. Chef was our waiter! We went off menu, Chef's selection, and he took care of us. From the mushroom cap app to the white fish and spinach, all four courses were excellent. Service, perfect. I wouldn't change a thing! Best night in SFO!

Review2381.Review: We had a nice pre-theater lunch at Fang, hard by the Novellus Theater. I liked the Mongolian Tower but my wife was disappointed in the spare ribs, which cooled down rapidly because they were served with cold vegetables. She liked the pork dumplings; I found them bland. Our lunch companion found her fish tasteless. The rice, cooked American style with separate grains, was hard to eat with chopsticks. The flower tea was pretty but weak and not particularly tasty. But the star of the show was the pizza-like onion cake. All of us thought it was superb. Service was attentive and caring. Noise level was blessedly low, though that might have been due to the small patronage early on Sunday afternoon.

Review2382.Review: The food was pretty good but the service was HORRENDOUS. Couldn't get the staff to bring us another drink...and we were drinking booze, probably would have had at least two more rounds each so that was a business mistake on their part since our bill would have been higher and we would have been happier. The decor was pretty cute but super run down. My seat had food in it that I had to clean off prior to sitting down. All and all pretty disappointing.

Review2383.Review: The service was not that great, very rushed. We were seated and within 20 minutes our food and check was on the table.The salad (pea shoot) was over dressed with a cloyingly sweet taste. The "Tower of Mongolian Beef" consisted of about 4 pieces of beef in a very salty sauce. The spare ribs were deep fried with a too sweet taste, and both dishes were lousy with thickly sliced red onions. And the drinks we ordered never came. 'Nuff said.

Review2384.Review: Let the house choose a combination for you!  The house's selection for brown rice and veggies was truly outstanding.

Review2385.Review: Excellent food and service. I came in a group of 6 and the waitress ordered our food for us and we couldn't have been happier. The price of the food is also very reasonable. Would have gone back if I would've had time!

Review2386.Review: Fang provided awful service. They brought menus which was fine, but 5 min later they brought the menu for the speciality drinks. Before we had a chance to look at the drink menu, the waiter arrived to ask for a drink order. Well, you could tell that he was ticked off that we were not ready to order and he disappeared. 10 minutes passed and we had to ask the busboy to get our waiter. We placed our order for drinks and food. We have allergies and asked for accommodations. At this time the waiter said that they could not make anything for us. He did not even try to find something that would work, and he just wanted us to leave. We do not recommend Fang to anyone.

Review2387.Review: The star at FANG is definitely the food. We went for dinner and introduced some friends to the place. The service in general is a little spotty but Mr. Fang himself took our food order.

Review2388.Review: Visiting from out of town we were looking for some good Chinese food . . . and lucky for us, we found it in the same block as our hotel. Even with a reservation we had to wait a bit standing in the cramped foyer. Once we sat down, the staff moved briskly to get food on the table. It is crowded and noisy, but that is because the food is good and lots of people obviously want it! All in all a successful meal. Thanks.

Review2389.Review: The food was really delicious. The wait staff was very helpful in ordering for us. They brought us a variety of tasty things to try. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Review2390.Review: Hot and Sour soup was very good. Fang's BBQ Pork Spare Ribs were more like country ribs, which is not what I expected and the House Chow Mein although good was more like low mein, which again was not what we expected.

Review2392.Review: Excellent food, really reasonably prices for San Fransisco, great servive. Highly recommend!!!!

Review2393.Review: Great food, efficient service, bossy owner who likes to select your dishes (in a good way). Easy access and an easy meeting point downtown.

Review2394.Review: SO GOOD i hesitate to tell you ...Let Mr. Fang order your food for you !GREAT for groups too.

Review2395.Review: Terrific, imaginative Chinese food. Just let Peter Fang choose your meal and you will be happy. Service was very courteous, perhaps a bit slow but fine. Owner Peter Fang checked frequently as to how we enjoyed the meal. Reasonable cost. Clean, attractive surroundings. Definitely worth a repeat.

Review2396.Review: Make a reservation if there's a convention at Moscone. Neighborhood Gem because it's cheaper than most restaurants in area and the value of the food is good. Hot spot because a lot of people go there for lunch which makes for a rushed atmosphere.My only complaint about this restaurant is they bring your food out as it's ready, so someone is always last to get their food and depending on the group you're with, it can be awkward because you're sitting there waiting to eat or telling everyone to go ahead and eat and you're sitting there waiting for your food.

Review2397.Review: Sesame chicken - great. Fried pork dumplings - great. Garlic shrimp - great. The "house special chow-mein" - not so great. The old man who looked like the owner asked the table next to us for their order then took it again a few minutes later like he'd never seen them before... he then went into the open kitchen and yelled and the chefs one by one. All in all, hilarious and good food.

Review2398.Review: Everything was delicious. Each dish had a unique wonderful sauce. We enjoyed ourselves & will return

Review2399.Review: This is a first rate restaurant! There were 4 of us and we let Peter Fang, the owner, order for us giving his our restrictions etc. It was outstanding and I'll return often!

Review2400.Review: Had great meal after picking up friends from SFO. The owner decided for us after asking some important questions and each dish was delicious...especially the sparkling rice soup with crab.

Review2401.Review: Fang's home made, gourmet Chinese is outstanding. Leave the choices up to Fang himself who is often there and you'll never be disappointed. Only downside is that they wont seat full groups prior to having everyone there on the weekends.

Review2402.Review: I love this restaurant and diner here often for lunch. I always ask the owner to order for us. It is always delicious and he serves things I would never pick myself.

Review2403.Review: This is the sister restaurant of the other restaurant in SF's Chinatown: House of Nanking. The owner is the same. And you can order the same favorite menu from the House of Nanking. One of my favorite is the sesame chicken with sweet potatoes. Those are really good. The tofu and eggplant with peanut sauce is also delicious. And make sure to order the Fang's Potsticker with peanut sauce. 6 pieces in an order - they are to die for!

Review2404.Review: Just super food. Also great house margarita. Very good, invesntive drinks, Rib and fish to die for.

Review2405.Review: The food here is very good. We were in a group of 6 and the owner asked about our food restrictions and then just ordered for us. His choices were good and we felt taken care of, but but the bill was a little more than we expected and I think we felt a little taken advantage of.

Review2406.Review: The food was good but came all at once in an odd order.We had a lot of trouble getting someone to take a drink order and that happened after our food order and then two of the specialty cocktails they did not have the ingredients for...So, I think it may have been just really really busy due to the US Open being in town. Lots of hungry golfy types around.

Review2407.Review: The wait staff were pleasant, helpful, and attentive. The food, on the other hand, was so-so - there was nothing memorable about it. Underwhelming is how I would describe the experience.

Review2408.Review: Delicious, casual Great spot near hotes

Review2409.Review: Good food, good prices. Lov that the servers will just recommend things like their sister restaurant does.

Review2410.Review: Mr. Fang helps you choose from the menu and you are in great hands with his knowledge offood. Excellent choices--especially the small sesame ball soup at the end of the meal.

Review2411.Review: Peter ventured over to our table of 7 to say hello, we asked him what to order, he asked us if we trusted him, took our menus away and presented us with a marvelous meal of assorted dishes, from his kitchen. Highlight of our visit to San Francisco.

Review2412.Review: For a purportedly upscale restaurant from an experienced restauranteur, its operation is curiously "casual" and home-spun. The food is superior to your run-of-the-mill Chinese eatery, and the decor is gorgeous, but the service does not match its quality and ambiance. Our waiter was knowledgeable and helpful with his recommendations, but was not very attentive. The wait staff and food runners often congregated to chit-chat in the dining room. We saw more of a distinguished-looking gentleman whom we assumed was Mr. Fang checking up on us and other diners. I had to practically trip our waiter to make him stop at our table every time I needed something - water, tea, the check. Go if you're in the area, but don't go out of your way.

Review2413.Review: The food was good but not remarkable, but the service was atrocious. The inattentive waiter acted as if our mere presence was a huge inconviance and we almost felt the need to apologize after asking for our water to be refilled.

Review2414.Review: While some equate this to PF Chang, having recently spent 3 weeks in China, I can say this is authentic Chinese food with an upscale twist, and as all guests agreed, this is a far cry from PF Chang's Americanized food. All the guests among which there were a fussy eater and a vegan were accommodated and everyone raved about the food. A lot of food was served and virtually all of it was finished.

Review2415.Review: Food was delicious! Service was great!

Review2416.Review: It is nice to see the House of Nanking branching out to other neighborhoods. a definite update to the 'look' of the original 'HoN' location, this Soutb of Market spot is right in the heart of the 3rd St Corridor around the corner from SFMOMA and YBCA museums.Loved the 'signature' Seasme Chicken, pork dumpling and onion cake!Will return again & again

Review2417.Review: Eaten here a lot. Always best to just let Peter (if he's there) or the hostess make recommendations on what to order. Just tell them what meat or seafood you like and it's always been great. They usually end up giving you things not on the menu. Not cheap but not expensive either.

Review2418.Review: The owner came to help take order and recommend several dishes to us. It was 6 of us. We did enjoyed the most of our dishes, yet it was a bit too much food. The service was excellent an the owner returned a few times asking for opinions. Later on, I returned again without ordering too much food. The service was okay. The owner never troubled to stop by again after taking our order.

Review2419.Review: Specials recommended by the server were not listed on the menu, nor were prices of specials given verbally.

Review2420.Review: The Chef got to pick our entrees for the evening. I've forgotten how good this place is for 30 dollars a person.

Review2421.Review: Been there a few times and my opinion remains as is: Food is excellent but service is horrible.

Review2422.Review: We went with friends who have gone there for many years. The chef greeted us at our table and gave us the option of letting him choose our items, subject to constraints on food allergies and/or other constraints on ingredients. We got a wide variety of flavors, textures, and preparation styles - some steamed, some stir-fried etc, Highly recommended, especially if you can go with four or more people to get more variety.

Review2423.Review: Like many other reviews, we too were first timers and Mr. Fang offered to take charge ::: In a way that's nice - no decisions to make - and we were asked if there were any food restrictions, which they should be inquiring of ::: We had several very good and unusual dishes, well-balanced and bright in flavors and textures - definitely NOT your standard SF Chinese food experience ::: We all felt the food tasted fresh, it was a great opportunity for newbies to try Shanghai soup dumplings - soft pillows of noodle with an explosion of hot soup inside, they are outrageous if you haven't tried them before ::: We'd recommend Fang to others, but DO ASK what the price per person will be if Mr. Fang selects for you :::

Review2424.Review: Fantastic food! We let the chef choose for us, providing some difficult constraints (two vegetarians, one gluten-free, one diabetic). Everyone raved over the wonderful dishes, and we all left satisfied & thrilled. Will definitely be back!

Review2425.Review: The owner/chef came to our table and asked maybe two questions without knowing what we had previously decided brought items our party had decided upon ordering!! With a couple extras we hadn't anticipated that were delightful! Very pleased; will be back!

Review2426.Review: I spent a lot of time in Shanghai in the late 90'sand after sampling the food there was never able to find credible Chinese food in the bay area until my dinner at Fang.Mr. Fang selected our courses and our group of 10was thrilled beyond speech with the experience.

Review2427.Review: Went here because we were looking for good Asian food in that area.The owner immediately came to our table and said (insisted) that hewould bring us wonderful food if we were open to that. We were. We hada vegetarian in our group and asked to go heavy on veg items. The foodwas interesting, very tasty, and very fresh. Unfortunately when we rec'dour bill he had charged us $25 per person. We were served 8 plates of food.That comes to $18.75/dish. One was tofu and bok choy, one was corn and squash,and one was pea shoots........I think wew were taken!If I were to go back for the food I will order off the menu so that we are nottaken advantage of.

Review2428.Review: Love the food here. Very authentic. And the location is very convenient to Yerba Buena if you are attending a performance there. Highly recommend their homemade wonton soup, crispy ribs and chrysanthemum tea. Beautiful bloom in a big mug of tea.

Review2429.Review: We let them bring us what they thought best, and it was all delicious. Can't wait to go back.

Review2430.Review: We were served us a delicious sampling of appetizers, entrees and even dessert. Everyone in our group of 7 got something they liked (and in a lot of cases, loved!) and it was so fun to try things on the menu we probably would not have ordinarily ordered. Our favorites included the five spice whitefish, the BBQ pork spareribs, and the sesame apple crisp for dessert. And it was all for a very reasonable price considering the variety we got to taste. And no one left hungry!

Review2431.Review: The food was good but super pricey and served much too quickly.

Review2432.Review: The wait staff was extremely helpful and took great care of us. The drinks were pretty good, but go with house specialties.

Review2433.Review: Service was good, but the food was a bit greasy.

Review2434.Review: Bad service, poor food and generally just grim. This is a shame because I suspect that actually this could have Ben better if I hadn't arrived late. However I did ask if they were still happy to take my reservation. I won't be giving them another chance anyway. As a single diner it's hard to find good places to eat and I don't need bad treatment.

Review2435.Review: The portions are a little small for the prices, but the quality of the ingredients is great! Very tasty (not too greasy)Chinese food.

Review2436.Review: Tell the owner to just order for you, and he'll give you a very delicious 3 course dinner.

Review2437.Review: We were sent to the bar to wait for our table. The bartender was extremely rude and non attentive. The food was just okay.

Review2438.Review: Bringing business customers to this restaurant was a pure delight. The owner stopped by our table, introduced himself, and insisted we put away the menus and leave the meal up to him. It was fantastic and made our business lunch extremely interactive as we anxiously awaited the next course. It was a bit noisy as we were right outside the kitchen but at the same time, we got to watch the crew prepare the other meals which all looked delicious.

Review2439.Review: Delicious authentic Chinese food in a nice looking place. We've dined here twice and found it consistently good. We read that the chef enjoys being asked to feed the table whereupon he asks just a few questions about favorite proteins, allergies, level of spice. Then you just sit back and enjoy each course as it arrives. I thought I might be full before the last course arrived but it worked out just fine. You leave the place full but not stuffed, and happy that you ate several things that you wouldn't have ordered on your own. We look forward to dining here again on our twice-yearly San Francisco trips.

Review2440.Review: We had a fantastic meal at Fang. The waitress/manager asked if we wanted to order off the menu or have them choose for us, and we had them choose. Every dish was terrific, from a cold salad with vegetables and shrimp to fish, chicken and vegetable dishes. We will definitely be back often, and have them choose for us.I should note that this was after having a lackluster lunch there--we tried it again for dinner needing a place near Yerba Buena, and I'm glad we did. The restaurant is pleasant, not fancy, and the service can be brusque. Go for the food, be appreciative, and you'll have a great experience.

Review2441.Review: They have a great menu and are flexible when ordering. Our reservation was early so they were not quite set for dinner it seemed.One might request a little less oil and salt when ordering. Otherwise very good.

Review2442.Review: Delicious food and very crowded at lunch. Yum!

Review2443.Review: Outstanding quality. Nice to see the owner and executive chef around on a Saturday.

Review2444.Review: We took our team there for a surprise lunch and had Chef Fang treat us to his Chef's table selections. It was AWESEOME!

Review2445.Review: The owner/manager came to our table and asked if this was our first visit to the restaurant. Then he took our menus and said he would bring us a great lunch. To say that it was outstanding was an understatement. A beef dish, very unique, noodles with chicken/vegetables were off the hook and an appetizer in a soft bun kind of like an asian taco was incredible.Great place!!

Review2446.Review: Just give over to the Waitrons and let them order for you.....it is better that way.

Review2447.Review: I arrived early and my dining companion arrived 5 minutes after our scheduled reservation. The hostess chose to give away our table to walk-ins, forcing us to wait an additional 10 minutes to be seated. Service was poor; no one checked to see if we were enjoying our food. We allowed the chef/owner to choose for us, and the steamed fish with spinach was delicious. However, the wonton soup with clams and the crispy beef salad both disappointed. The soup was gummy and had too much coconut in it, and not enough clam. The salad confused us, since the beef tasted more like lamb. This isn't a place to seek out, but it's OK as a fall-back option if better restaurants are booked/closed.

Review2448.Review: Every dish was excellent. The best perhaps was the appetizer, small sandwiches with crisp chicken in a fluffy bun. The owner was very present and friendly. As often is true in Chinese restaurants, our little boy (now 6) was treated warmly. Not cheap, but a fair price for what we got.

Review2449.Review: We have gone to House of Nan King for years, the food here is just a bit more delicious.

Review2450.Review: I love Fang's but sometimes the service is not up to par.That is the only complaint I have ever had, the food is so good and fresh.I love going to lunch at Fang's.

Review2451.Review: We were on business travel and the owner personally came over, took our menus and selected our courses.  It was an excellent dining experience.

Review2452.Review: Had a luncheon here.   I impressed everyone with my choice.   Guests gushed about the food and service.

Review2453.Review: The food was great, inexpensive and the service was really good. We were in a group of 12 people and didn't even see the menu, the chef got out and offer a "family style" dinner, several dishes, very good from al, points.

Review2454.Review: We had the following:Beef Salad - 5/5Wonton soup with fish -4/5Fish with Spinach - 5/5Shrimp with fried apples - 5/5Ribs - 5/5Beef with Yams - 4/5We had the owner/chef pick the dishes and they were all great.The service was 3/5. It was better in the beginning and tapered off as we were getting our last dishes. To clarify, the earlier dishes the server would serve us and the last dishes they just put the dish on the table and we helped ourselves. A bit odd I think.Anyway, the whole experience was great. I'll come back again!

Review2455.Review: We love the House of Nanking. This time we heard about Fang's and wanted to try it there because we had guests in town from the B'way show MammaMia and they were missing some really good food after their last city. Since we have children, we wanted a place that could sit a group comfortably. Again, love the HofN, but with children, group, noise level (can be loud), we opted for Fang's. It was just as good as HofN and the ambiance was perfect!!! We were able to chat and hear each other without screaming (not good for singers). The service was great!! Can't wait to go again.

Review2456.Review: Delicious food. Owner chef Peter Fang takes good care of his guests. Nice private room downstairs.

Review2457.Review: The place is ok. My appetizer of spring rolls was excellent, best I ever had. The white fish with 5 spices was ok, nothing special. Service is fast, so the restaurant is a good choice for a good, not disappointing quick bite.

Review2458.Review: Good potential, but neither servers nor menu helped the kitchen show it's stuff. Staff seemed friendly, but were not imformative in helpful ways. The young man was nice: Hot tea was offered & accepted. Flowering tea came. At check out we found rather than free tea (like most Chinese restaurants) our tea was $3/each. Had he pointed to tea on the menu-showing the charge-we'd have had a choice: perhaps water if the tea isn't free. He assured us the potstickers weren't deep fried--they were. We didn't order from 'rice dish' section, but that's what came. The waitress was nice, but took over w/o clearly explaining of her choices. Family members required to work for the restaurant, too young to appreciate their place there? Not sure.

Review2459.Review: Odd experience. We were a party of 4 who had never dined at FANG so we did not know what to expect. We were squeezed into a table next to the bar. Owner came over asked if we had any food allergies and without even a chance to ask questions or let him know what we would like to eat, he said "he would take care of us". Half our party was "ok" with this, the other half was not. Food started to come out quickly and overall we had 2 appetizers, cold salad, 3 dishes. Liked half, the other half we could have done without. The best part is the alcoholic drinks, like wine and beer are cheap. If I were to return, I would quickly order what I wanted. Odd experience, but not bad.

Review2460.Review: The Best Chinese/Asia fusion food in SF!!!

Review2461.Review: We had terrible service as we had to ask waiter for both our drinks and then many minutes later, for our dinner order. Food was basically thrown on the table followed by the bill. Food was over priced for the portions provided. There are much better restaurants at half of the price in the city.

Review2462.Review: Food was great although seating was very tight and it was very loud. It was lunch hour and we felt a bit rushed. But it was great for a quick lunch.

Review2463.Review: This was our first experience at Peter Fang's restaurant, and we did not expect that the owner himself goes around to each table to discuss the menu and take orders. Generally he gets to know what the visitors like and don't like, and then recommends letting him put together an individualized menu for each table. It is an unique experience, but one that we would enjoy having again and again. We are from the East Coast and it was a pleasure to experience new interpretations of old Chinese favorites. This is a restaurant experience not to be missed. We heartily recommend it.

Review2464.Review: Loved the food, will definitely be back.

Review2465.Review: The owner is such a wonderful person. he comes to each table, and personalizes the food. We were a table of 6, and he personalized our entire menu.. Its a really fun experience to dine there. However, the service of waiting staff is just ok..!

Review2466.Review: Phenomenal food, ambiance and evening. Brought my work colleagues for dinner and we had a fabulous evening. Would heartily recommend!

Review2467.Review: We had reservations at 12:00 and they didn't seat us until 12:40, but the food was great. I recommend the bok choy salad to start.If you go for lunch try to avoid the noon rush

Review2468.Review: Close to the Moscone Center we stumbled upon this on a Sunday in search of lunch during a conference. The food was outstanding, very modern yet very Chinese. We liked the menu they put together for us, rather than ordering off the menu. However, the second time (the next day actually) they really pushed the "we know what's good for you" menu on us, even after we said we really wanted to order ourselves off the menu - didn't like the pushiness quite that much.That aside it's a great place, excellent food both times!

Review2469.Review: The veggie options are outstanding! I love the Honey Tofu, pea shoots and green beans. They offer the best hot and sour soup I've ever had. The service is a little spotty in the communication department as there is often a language barrier and they sort of rush you to order quickly. I keep going back because the food is fresh, of the highest quality and perfectly prepared. Defiantly one of my go to favorites in a city full of substandard chinese food.

Review2470.Review: Delicious food! I do agree with others that the service could be improved.

Review2471.Review: This place doesn't honor it's reservations. We waited for 45 minutes.

Review2472.Review: Chinese food with a wonderful contemporary touch!

Review2473.Review: The food was excellent, and the service was as expected if you are familiar with House of Nanking. It was a bit abrupt but fine, and the food was brought quickly. I would eat here again.

Review2474.Review: I am not always pleased with the service, but tolerate it because I love the food. The Brown Rice special with the Oyster Mushrooms is one of the best things I have ever eaten, so I always get that when I go. On my last visit the food was great, but our server was very distracted and missed our appetizer (the Onion Cake). It is good too, but we didn't get to enjoy it this go-around. All in all I like the place. Just needs to get less focused on moving people in and out and more focused on serving those that are eating.

Review2475.Review: Very disappointing. I'd been there before and had a great experience. Don't let the chef order, do it yourself and don't let them rush you. Not a relaxing evening at all.

Review2476.Review: When the wrong food was brought to us, instead of apologizing for the error, the waiter tried to convince us he was doing us a favor by bringing a"special" and "better" dish for us. We had to convince him to take it back and bring the food we'd actually ordered!

Review2477.Review: No service. Left after 50 minutes without being served.

Review2478.Review: The food was quite inventive and, at times, ingenious. The Shanghainese Soup Dumplings were made to perfection and each sat on a slice of cucumber for that added crunch and protection from breakage. The roasted Peking Duck Buns were quite sublime with perfect slices of duck nested in individual steam buns.The service, however, was quite a different story. This one particular waiter seemed to possess a service mantra of Jekyll and Hyde, particularly when I tried to figure out seating. When we finally sat down, the meal began with a four star table service, but the third dish, it quickly fell to one star where courses were "dropped" onto the table and attention were shied away from our table as they began closing out at 9pm.

Review2479.Review: The owner Kathy ordered for us and everything was amazing, suiting all ages and food preferences. Each dish was better than the last!

Review2480.Review: The best Chinese I've ever had. Every dish was amazing. The sesame chicken explodes in your mouth!!!!!

Review2481.Review: Our large party was seated in a private room, and our server asked if we had any food allergies, preferences or dislikes, then reappeared with the first course of soup. It was good, although not something we would have ordered on our own. Then, the parade of delights began to come to out table, and one by one we gobbled them up. It didn't really matter what dish they brought out; each one was a surprise and delight. This is not the place to go if you are a control freak. Best to just relax and have your server serve whatever the kitchen thinks looks good. Everyone was pleased and no one went hungry. We will be back.

Review2482.Review: I can't say it was enjoyable. The waiters and waitresses were shouting in Chinese. But, it was Christmas Eve!!!! Food was ok, just. :(

Review2483.Review: A great combination of fusion with authentic Chinese - great cooking, a cultural gem, wonderful chef who takes orders and will create dishes. It was great for a Christmas dinner for non-Christians - elegant food in a pretty but relaxed atmosphere.

Review2484.Review: Always wanted to do Chinese on Christmas day and this was my chance. And it worked out well. Although the restaurant was busy our reservation at 5PM was met promptly and we were waited on quickly to order reasonable wine by the glass. Mr Fang did take our order and was very pleasant. Food came out very fast but dumpling appetizer was the last thing we got, not the first. The food was tasty but not terribly imaginative. I especially liked the Bok choy side dish that came with the pork spareribs. It was wonderfully flavorful and crisp. It was all I wanted for my Christmas dinner

Review2485.Review: Tasty with ample portions. Tables are VERY close together.

Review2486.Review: We went on Christmas day and had a great meal that the owner/chef said he would send since we had no food allergies or dislikes. We were very pleased with the array of dishes selected and provided. There were too many kids around for out taste, but luckily the food made up for it.

Review2487.Review: Unfortunately after a nice start (the salad was excellent), the dishes went downhill. Perhaps if we had avoided the last dish, we might have walked away with a better impression. The last was a pan-fried noodles with some veges, lugubriously slathered in oil (soy) that reminded us of Panda Express. I would stick to Fang's salads, soups, and beef ribs.

Review2488.Review: Fang is terrific. One of the best Chinese restaurants in the City. As he did at House of Nanking, Peter Fang has really come up with a creative menu where every dish tastes better than the one before it - unusual ingredients, no gloppy repetitive sauces. Just let Cathy order for you, sit back and enjoy.One complaint: the food comes out so fast, one dish after another, that it is hard to enjoy a leisurely meal with friends and family. We were in and out within 1 hour - and we had a lot of food. At the same time, the wait staff does not do a good job refilling water glasses or asking if you want another cocktail..

Review2489.Review: Food comes in whatever order it is ready in. In our case we got the appetizer, followed by an entree a few minutes later, and then 20 minutes after that, the soup arrived. Food quality was mixed. There are more consistent and better chinese restaurants nearby.

Review2490.Review: We dined here before a performance at Yerba Buena Center and, instead of ordering off the menu, were persuaded by Fang himself (I think it was him) to allow him to order for us. While he made sure none of us had food allergies and one of us did not eat meat, his selection - while tasty - was perhaps not what we would have ordered for ourselves. Also, for a dinner that cost north of $100, why was the table set with paper napkins??!!

Review2491.Review: House of nan king on steroidsAwesome!

Review2492.Review: Service needs work. Our appetizers came before the wine did; very difficult for our waiter to understand our accents and vice versa--had to keep repeating what we were ordering; had to wave down a waitress to finally get our bill. Food was quite good though.

Review2493.Review: I loved that they put the menu together for us so we could try things that we might not have picked out on our own. The Crispy Chicken with Yam was delicious :)

Review2494.Review: This place was good. Price is good, food is good and service is good. My friends and I have our annual holiday dinner/gift exchange here every December. We don't order from the menu. We ask the owner or waitress to give us a family-style meal and they mix it up for us, which is fun! It's nice to see the owner is a hands-on type of man and personally greet his guests.

Review2495.Review: One of my favorite places for lunch. We let the owner order for us and it is always delicious and we then try new things that we probably would not have ordered ourselves. Go early (11:30am) because it gets really full closer to noon.

Review2496.Review: I booked a lunch reservation for 15 people for our holiday lunch via opentable. Called to confirm the day before. When we showed up, they had us seated at seperate tables. When I pointed out other groups were seated together, I was told those groups had reservations. Um, so did I. They eventually pushed a couple of tables together, put plywood on top and covered the whole thing with food-stained table cloths. The food was not good. About half of our party were Chinese-American, and they were most critical. We were told we couldn't order off the menu (no-one mentioned this when we called to confirm). They forgot to serve one of our courses. Every employee seemed either miserable or openly hostile. None of us will be back, ever.

Review2497.Review: Delicious! We allowed Mr. Fang to select the meal for us and we were pleasantly surprised. The best won ton soup I have ever had with the clam and crispy rice. Asian pear in the salad was just such a nice flavor. Peking duck bun an explosion of flavors. Take some friends and go. Be open and let Mr. Fang select for you.

Review2498.Review: Had 6 dishes, all ordered by the chef/owner. BTW, the chef/owner doesn't actually do any of the cooking that I can observed. The dishes were on either ends of the spectrum from very heavily spiced/salted/MSG'ed to kind of bland. They did attempt to use differentflavors as accent to standard dishes. For instance, the typical "black bean clams" usedpreserved olives as the black bean which gave the dish a different flavor profile. However, the dish was still too salty. The fish soup had a slight spicy/hot flavor kick which again made the soup's flavor profile unexpected and interesting. Pricing is higher than the average chinese restaurant, but the with setting/location/decor, that would have been the expectation.

Review2499.Review: Fang came highly recommended from a friend so I had high expectations. The service was horrible. When we had our order taken the owner/manager (??) wouldn't even look at you. I had no idea if he was paying attention to what I was saying. The drinks did come out in a timely matter, but good luck trying to a get a refill on anything. It took 10 minutes to flag down a waiter and you had to remind them at least once that you asked for another drink. The table next to us had to do the same thing. Our water glasses were never re-filled. We were squished between two other tables and their water glasses also remained empty the entire time. The food was okay. Although I'm always a little skeptical when it comes out 4 minutes after I ordered it.

Review2500.Review: Good place to get some Chinese fusion. I always look forward to Chef's Seasonal vegetable Rice soup.

Review2501.Review: Terrible boss. Unfortunately went on a busy lunch hour. Had reservation for 4, went 10 minutes early and had to wait for the one latecomer in a tiny entranceway. Another party of 20 came in, the boss was shouting to find out if everyone arrived. He almost tried to ask the crowd to wait at the same entranceway, sigh! Too busy to let us order, hustled all tables to take their prepared canteened food, on par with Panda Express.

Review2502.Review: The owner came over and after hearing it was our first time there, proceeded to just send out dishes from the kitchen, and each one was more delicious than the next. Best part at the end of the night, the bill was very manageable given the amout of food and drinks we had.Probably in my top 3 favorite chinese restaurants in the city, if not the top most.

Review2503.Review: I have come here 3 times, twice with large groups. It's great to do a family style meal and just let Chef Fang order for us based on the dietary restrictions of the party. We had several vegetarians and pescetarians as well as several of us who have live in China for several years. This cuisine is not super authentic per so but close enough and certainly closer to the real thing than the usual Hong Kong style Americanized Chinese food you get elsewhere. We were happy with the selection and I particularly love the soups at Fang.We all would come back here again.

Review2504.Review: Food is always great. Service is good as well. Much better than 'Henry Hunan'. Food tastes fresh, not so covered in sauce and salty.

Review2505.Review: Absolutely a great find in this neighborhood. Good for business lunches and friends gathering together. Service was very attentive. Food is very fresh and the selection at lunch was very good. Will definitely return for lunches and will try for dinner, too.

Review2506.Review: Great time here. The chef took our menus away and ordered for us. Don't miss the beef salad or the ribs.

Review2507.Review: Peter Fang acted as our waiter and ordered the complete lunch for the four of us, after asking if it was our first time to eat at FANG. He was most gracious throughout. We loved especially the "flower tea" the beef salad, the duck bun, and the whitefish. The restaurant is around the corner from MOMA which is wonderful for a special place to eat. For us it was an unforgettable experience, and I will take other guests there often!

Review2508.Review: Enjoyed lunch with a friend at Fangs. We made reservations at 11am, but the restaurant looks like it was still opening. The floors swept & windows cleaned. I think we got to early. However, this vist was the second time. We still enjoyed lunch & really good tea. Yes, I would definitely go there again.

Review2509.Review: Food was better than average. Service was not so good. We got overcharged on our bill too.

Review2510.Review: fresh made to order asian food with some interesting twists, across from the convention center.

Review2511.Review: Love a restaurant where the owner, already famous for his 1st place, takes your order and then offers "to take care of you" and then he proceeds to and boy , how - not only extremely delicious but reasonable bill at the end

Review2512.Review: The food at Fang is fabulous! Certainly not your run-of-the-mill Chinese fare!!

Review2513.Review: Was somewhat disappointed in food. Friends and family had raved about it, but only great food was appetizer and dessert. Mongolian beef tower was uninspiring and not at all spicy as I requested. The staff was in constant motion and trying to move patrons through quickly. Meal could well be result of too many mouths to feed with too little time for quality. Being from out of town, this was my only chance to visit and one meal on a busy night can't be used to define the restaurant.

Review2514.Review: Good food. Rude service. Long wait even with reservation.

Review2515.Review: Fang is convenient to SFMOMA and Yerba Buena Center. The service was very fast. The food was a disappointment. The dough of Shanghai soup dumplings was too thick, the vinegar dipping sauce was made of dark vinegar instead of red vinegar and too heavy. We had a chicken-choy dish and the choy was surprisingly served intentionally cold. Not appealing. The Mongolian beef tower was the best of the three dishes. Tender slices of beef stir fried with carmelized red onions and the fragrance of smoked peanut oil.

Review2516.Review: Excellent restaurant. Let Mr. Fang, or his daughter, Kathy order for you or help you order.Sesame ball soup as a dessert is fabulous.

Review2517.Review: Great for a quick bite to eat. Noisy. Picked it for a business lunch since it was close to Moscone Center. May not pick it again for ambience. Food was satisfactory

Review2518.Review: The food is very creative, well prepared, and attractively presented. When the owner learned we had never been to the restaurant, he said "I'll take care of you," and took away the menus. He then served a great selection of food for us, from appetisers to soup to main dishes. All excelent

Review2519.Review: I am not sure what all the hype is about this place. I go to a lot of restaurants, especially Asian restaurants, and this one was not that great. The food was so-so, and was typical of the usual Chinese food you get around--greasy, salty, etc. The service was terrible--they don't even try to be nice to you. For me, why go out and eat if they are going to treat you like you don't matter? No thanks.

Review2520.Review: Great service. Attentive. Wait staff made some great recommendations not on the menuWe will return

Review2521.Review: Fang always has excellent and creative food that make it worth the trip. The service tries to do it right, but - every time we visit - seems to come up short someway or another. The surroundings are pleasant and comfortable. All that said, we come here for the food; it is always full of flavor, freshly made and a pleasure to eat.

Review2522.Review: Food was excellent as always, the owner order for us and all the selections were perfect. I highly recommend the Peking Duck Bun as an appetizer, yum!

Review2523.Review: The food was phenomenal, and in unexpected ways. We let Peter order for us, as suggested in the menu, and were delighted with the items he chose for us. He read us quite well, and everything we had tasted wonderful and was a lot of fun. That, despite the fact that my 85-year-old mom REALLY wanted eggrolls, and never a one did we see that night. She loved it, and so did my husband and I.

Review2524.Review: Very noisey, waitress need to be a bit more polite. Due to the noise level, i would not return for lunch. The food was great, but we could not talk

Review2525.Review: Ordered a chilled sesame noodle appetizer special that was excellent, as was my entree. For dessert, the waitress brought me their crispy apple pie, which was small, but sufficient, along with a warm cashew cookie and a small cup of plum wine, all arranged and presented nicely on a square plate. Definitely enjoyed this place.

Review2526.Review: We were seated incredibly close to other diners in the little row of 2-seat tables, to the extent that I was say close to my neighbor than my friend. Ambience was not as high-end as I had hoped but not awful. Prices were reasonable for the soft and hard product.

Review2527.Review: This is a pretty standard Chinese restaurant. Nothing special in terms of food and presentation which is disappointing given its location.

Review2528.Review: Fang was fantastic. We let Peter Fang order for us and everything was delicious.

Review2529.Review: Came early to beat the crowd...it does get very crowded!  The atmosphere is a bit hectic and that might have be influenced by the service staff, especially as busy as it gets.  Food was good and when in the area we might consider to return  to try more dishes.

Review2530.Review: We came here after House of Nan King was booked full.  We are glad we did.  The food was wonderful.  We had our server pick our entire menu and are glad we did.  It was some of the best food I've ever had.  Try it---you will be glad you did.

Review2531.Review: Food was pretty good, but a little pricey given the small portions. The hostess ordered for us. One of the dishes was really good--clams in black bean sauce over noodles. She also ordered pork ribs, which were very tendor and flavorful. The decor was good.

Review2532.Review: meh. The first few bites of each dish were okay, any more and you realized the food was pretty greasy.

Review2533.Review: love FANG'S over the top cuisine.

Review2534.Review: It really is just an updated, upgraded House of Nan King.

Review2535.Review: We let the chef decide our meal and we were very happy with what was brought out. Food was excellent!

Review2536.Review: My partner speaks mandarin. He told the waitress to bring, at her discretion, 7 plates. Wow. Was delicious and fun to share. Was also fun not to know, or care, what was coming next. All was great.

Review2537.Review: The problem here is some snooti kids of owner. They know how to cook but want to control what you eat and they insist their tastebuds are the standard. Otherwise they know how to cook good chinese food.

Review2538.Review: I've been going to Nanking in Chinatown for about 25 years, watching it double in size without losing the unique flavors of the dishes. I had heard a sister restaurant had opened in SOMA, and finally got a chance to try it. The wonderful tastes were still there, although I couldn't find the Tsing Dao Chicken or Shrimp on the menu. But the sauteed peappods were wonderful, the mushrooms still tasty, and the lettuce cup fish a wonderful combination of cool and hot. And as is always the case with the Nanking food, my tastebuds felt energized. I missed some of the Chinatown ambience of the original restaurant, but it was nice to have a bit more room at the table and not feel so squeezed into place

Review2539.Review: Absolutely fantastic Chinese food with incredible service. This place is owned by the infamous House of Nanking -- it's kind of it's chi-chi sister restaurant. Highly recommend letting them choose the dishes. Tell them your restrictions and preferences, and they'll bring what they are inspired to bring. It's amazing food, amazing service, in a wonderful ambiance.

Review2540.Review: I am not quite sure how i like FANG. It was strange that both dishes that I ordered the server recommended an alternate preparation and/or meat selection. The result was that I got mei fun with beef (instead of shrimp) in soup instead of wok preparation, It was good but I didn't really want a soup noodle. The lettuce wrap with shrimp was delicious (it was with beef that i had intended to eat). The most delightful thing about my meal was the Blossoming tea. The tea came in a bell shaped glass with a walnut size tea bulb floating. Before I knew it the bulb was transformed into this beautiful "flower" in my tea-glass. The tea is made of jasmine, chrysanthemum and green tea leaves, a MUST try.

Review2541.Review: FANG was great! Some diners didn't like how the owner just brought out food, but we loved being surprised with the owner's favorite dishes. Everything was delicious! The dim sum and fish dishes were excellent. Quick service, clean, familiar and unexpecting dishes. Wonderful! Prices were very reasonable too. It's in the financial district,so great for family lunches or business lunches and dinners. Not super romantic, but is good for a 3rd date or a group.

Review2542.Review: I keep going back for the 5 spice white fish. Each dish had it's own flavor and different ingredients. Not your average Chinese food place. They even made a decent margarita.

Review2543.Review: We were excited that proprietor took over the ordering us for us, as the food he chose for us was delicious and things we probably wouldn't have ordered on our own. However, the bill was a little pricey. We felt like he should have explained the price structure to us if he was going to do all the ordering. But for the most part, we were very happy with the experience.

Review2544.Review: First visit here after morning at SFMOMA, around the corner. Learning that this was our maiden voyage, the waiter offered to serve us the manager's selections family style,which we accepted. What followed was six (or was it seven?) "can you top this?" courses, one better than the other. The six of us chuckled when we began guessing what the tab would be. With two bottles of moderately priced champagne + tax/tip, the cost was $40 each. We'll be back.

Review2545.Review: FANG was awesome - everything tasted amazing. We are coming back!

Review2546.Review: The service is a bit awkward and our table wasnt ready on arrival ... But the speed and food quality more than made up for it ... The bok Chou appetizer may be one of the best veggies I have ever had!It was so tasty that I went back with a customer two days later ... Ideal if you are at moscone;-)

Review2547.Review: The fact that the host wants to choose your food for you makes this a hit-or-miss experience. But reviews where people didn't let the host choose their food sounded like they didn't get good food. So after looking at the menus and deciding what we wanted, the host arrived and asked us if we have any food allergies, and then he collected our menus and told us to leave it to him. The first dish was described as Chinese tomato-mozzarella- beef salad which was excellent and gave us high hopes. The rest of the dishes were very bland (shrimp with rice noodles, fish with vegetables, a vegetable which I think was pea shoots (?) The price was very reasonable, but it would be better if the host would ASK you if you want him to order for you.

Review2548.Review: Food was good...The dry green bean dish was very tasty as was the sesame chicken..Reccommend going early before the dinner rush as staff gets a little antsy-lol.

Review2549.Review: Seemed to be busy but tables were crammed together so we couldn't enjoy our own conversation but had to deal with others peoples. Food wasn't that great either. Plus, if you put people on a small table, and they order a bunch of dishes, don't serve them in huge oversizes dishes! I don't want my dining experience to be about balancing dishes on the table!

Review2550.Review: Fang was recommended by a work colleague of mine who knows tons of great spots around the City so I was looking forward to taking another couple along for a nice meal. The place had decent ambiance and we each found something we were interested in on the menu. A gentleman who I assume is the owner came over to ask if this was the first time we had been to Fang, it was. He then said "Don't worry, I'll take care of it" and took the menus away saying that he would bring out different dishes. At a nice restaurant this can be great. However here he did not explain what he was doing nor did they let us know that you had to tell them when to stop. We ended up spending 2x as much as we would have. It's a scam to get you to spend more money!!

Review2551.Review: Fabulous! We were a group of 10 people with a vegetarian and a picky eater but wanted to order family style. Our waiter (that we're fairly certain was also the owner), took charge letting us know that most of the lunch menu was served with rice and not meant to pass around. He asked if we'd mind him simply bringing dishes for us, checked for special needs and then proceeded to wow us with each dish served.I highly recommend FANG!

Review2552.Review: We loved it and plan to go back.

Review2553.Review: The food was some of the best Chinese we've ever had. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the garlic. My rice dish was full of it, and that eventually became the only thing I could taste. The sesame chicken wad incredible. I highly recommend the crispy zucchini for a side.

Review2554.Review: Great addition to a neighborhood that desperately needs more restaurants, especially that are open in the evening.

Review2555.Review: Wow!! I think that Fang will definitely give Heaven's Dog a run for their money. Absolutely mouth watering unique dishes. Presentation perfect

Review2556.Review: They put MSG in everything.The chef made me a special fried rice with very little meat for $14.Quite a rip off.I will not go back.

Review2557.Review: This was our first visit and the owner/chef offered to order for us and we jumped at the chance. He brought out course after course of delicious food until we could not eat anymore. Classy guy, great food..one of the best places ive been in a long time!

Review2558.Review: The king of the House of Nanking, Peter Fang, has struck again. FANG is absolutely outstanding. I took well travelled friends from Ireland here Friday night and they pronounced the food the best Chinese they have ever eaten. It was my third visit and every trip gets better. I dream about the Shanghai dumplings. My recommendation is to tell Peter Fang about any food allergies, ask him to bring you Shanghai dumplings, and whatever else he recommends for that evening. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.

Review2559.Review: Not good. read about some pitfalls on opentable.com - true to form. wrong drink order came, had to ask to have our order taken, no menus when we sat down, arrived with reservation and had to wait. all in all - I would NOT recommend this restaurant. horrible

Review2560.Review: fantastic dim sum!! very unique flavors! menu small but very good.........simple dishes such as sizzling rice soup and sesame balls take on totally different presentation and taste! WOW!a bit quiet on sunday? surprising!

Review2561.Review: Had reservation and still had to wait more than half an hour to get seated. Very busy place but food is great (worth the wait I guess).

Review2562.Review: a bit too saucy but other than that, it was quite good food.

Review2563.Review: Went there for lunch on Saturday. I live a few blocks away and hoped that this would be my new neighborhood Chinese place. The steamed pork dumplings were good, but the sauce on top of them was too sweet. Same with the eggplant tofu and mushrooms in black bean sauce; the sauce was too sweet. I don't think black bean sauce should be sweet and I do not like sweet Chinese food. Thank goodness for the chili oil on the table. The house made egg noodles were chewy (in a good way), flavorful, and I'll definitely get that again. I'll try this place again for lunch and I'll makes sure to tell the waiter - not sweet after placing my order.

Review2564.Review: This is definitely a frustrating place. The food is fantastic and if that's all you care about, then go. If you care about the service you get, since it is a restaurant after all, then FANG leaves a lot to be desired. They did work with us on our seating, since the other half of our party was 45 mins late, so I really appreciated their flexibility. But we sat at the bar for the longest time before anyone acknowledged our presence. And then once we were seated, the servers seem to be multitasking to the point of not really paying attention to anyone. If I'm paying good money for food, I expect to be paid attention to. We also observed the chef/owner yelling at the kitchen staff at one point - not good in an open kitchen!

Review2565.Review: The "we order for you" style was a failure. The food was mediocre and the selections were not things we would have chosen.

Review2566.Review: I was excited to try this place after waiting in line years ago to go to the famous Nan King... however, i found that while the chef does come to your table and check on food allergies or other aversions, pretty much every table i saw got the same menu. it is not at all a custom menu. and we specifically ordered the eggplant dish, and it never arrived. also there were very few vegetables served, even when we told him we had 2 vegetarians in our party. At $25 a person for the chef's menu, it wasn't terrible, but i won't be going back.

Review2567.Review: The hostess slammed our menus on the table and walked away. I ordered Mongolian Beef and the waiter brought what he thought we might like better. Wrong! It was inedible. The restaurant had 4 tables of patrons and they situated us all together along the same wall about one foot apart. All in all...a bad experience.

Review2568.Review: The hostess seemed like she resented being there and all the servers seemed rushed althought there appeared to be enough to handle the full restaurant. We ordered an appetiser and had to remind the server twice before she brought it. The same was true with drink orders, all three times. Food was very good but the service was the poorest I've had in recent memory. Because of the food quality we will try it again in case this was just an off night.

Review2569.Review: Had some great dishes, Nanking Sesame Chicken, Onion Pancakes, Duck Buns, Pork Spareribs. The lettuce wraps were the one weak dish.

Review2570.Review: We let the owner just bring us food until we were stuffed and it was amazing!

Review2571.Review: Good but expensive Chinese. But more than Chinese, its sort of Asian fusion with interesting dishes. Great Szechuan Prawn but not as spicy as expected. The Peking Buns with duck were also great but at $3.50 each for 3 bites seemed a bit precious. The wok stirred pork suggested by the owner was also tasty but the pork chunks were rock hard and cold, suggesting they had been just added to the dish and not cooked. At the end, the waitress stacked all the dishes and garbage in the center of the table so she could carry it all in one trip. Not an appetizing image to finish the meal. Water refills had to be requested.Despite all this, I'd give it one more try because of the different approaches to traditional Chinese fare.

Review2572.Review: Some downgrade - been here 3 times in the last 4 weeks, always same menu...

Review2573.Review: Fantastic service -- attentive from the beginning...owner ordered for us, and wow...he really impressed us...will definitely recommend and will be back soon!

Review2574.Review: Let Peter Fang make your order. Fantastic. We had: Poached sushi grade white fish tossed with blanched spinach leaves and a very light oil vinagrette. Shrimp served ice cold with crispy rice and diced peppers and celery.Whole braised fish soup with won-tons and creme. Spare ribs with steamed bok-choy.Peter judges how much food is just right. He picked the saki also--excellent springtime, with soft fruit. Nam coffee a must--best in town. Glutinous sesame balls for dessert.

Review2575.Review: Great for a last minute large party.

Review2576.Review: The best way to order from Fang is to let Peter choose for you. He does a great job selecting dishes that complement each other.

Review2577.Review: Excellent service and food is delicous! Price is affordable and reasonable.

Review2578.Review: Fang was great! We were 20 minutes late for our reservations and they were packed but they still got us in. We weren't hurried. The service was nice. Might have been the best hot and sour soup I've had. They updated it a bit with zucchini and a little cilantro on top so if you're a traditionalist you might scoff but i thought it was delicious! Same owners as House of Nanking and my friend recognized the owner right away and we had a nice chat. Go and try it.

Review2579.Review: I've eaten at FANG twice and I can't wait to go back. I love everything about it: the location, the service, the ambiance, and especially the food. We let the food come to us (chef's choice) and were treated to a fantastic array of dishes. Every bite is amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Review2580.Review: The owner, Peter, greeted us, and instead of ordering off the menu, he asked us what sorts of things we liked and disliked, and then just "took care of us". It was terrific, and gave us more variety, and presumably featured the restaurant's best items, compared to what we would have gotten if we'd ordered normally.

Review2581.Review: Our choice of this restaurant was on a whim and boy, did we find a gem! There were seven of us at our annual event and the owner, Peter Fang, asked us to trust him as he decided which dishes to serve. Each and every one of the dishes was superb in taste and presentation; in addition, the service was great.

Review2582.Review: I had high hopes for Fang but came away quite disappointed with the service. A grumpy old man took our order, didn't even say hello. I later realized it was the owner! Maybe he was having a bad day. We were only given chopsticks and forks. Are knives forbidden in this restaurant? When we first sat down, the waitress immediately assumed we'd be having beer and their particular brand at that, very cheeky. However, the food was good. We shared the Nanking sesame chicken with sweet potatoes and fried short rib. Would recommend both, however we were charged for a large rice even though we ordered small. I might order takeout in the future but not planning on coming back to eat here.

Review2583.Review: I hesitate to tell you how great this place is for large groups because I don't want it to stand in my way to get a gang of friends in in the future. Love this place. and the best is when they CREATE THE MENU for you. don't be afraid -- they don't overestimate what you can eat and in fact, they do it so right that you actually think HMMM, MAYBE I'll HAVE SOME MORE.WARNING: this place is habit forming!

Review2584.Review: The food is very heavy and fatty. Make sure you don't order too many 'crispy' things...

Review2585.Review: could be a better restaurant if the wait staff could better communicate - certain specials only included in chinese menu

Review2586.Review: The restaurant has delicious food. I would kill for another bite of the whitefish and some more hot and sour soup. Fang, please come to Chicago! The waitresses are attentive but having so many doting waitresses can be confusing.

Review2587.Review: More than we expected. Great food and great hospitality.

Review2588.Review: This was my second time at Fang for Lunch and it was exactly what I remembered the first time. The food was absolutely delish! Service was fast and the wait staff was very helpful with recommendations. Look forward to going back. If you are in the Moscone Center area, this is a MUST!

Review2589.Review: I liked the place as soon we entered the restaurant. I was with my 4 other girl friends for lunch and we all relished the food. The appetizers - chicken buns and the onion cakes were awesome. Main course was good too. Their rates are pretty decent as well.Nice place, would certainly recommend to others.

Review2590.Review: Good Chinese food close to Moscone. Menu has many more interesting dishes and a slightly more upscale ambiance than your typical neighborhood Chinese spot (except for the chintzy paper napkins). Recommended for a small group that wants good Chinese food in a better than average Chinese restaurant setting. Our greeter, whom also chose our dishes, was a personality dud and seemed like she didn't want to be there. Other than that, good experience.

Review2591.Review: I'd eaten here for lunch & some clients were in from overseas and staying at the W on a Sunday night.  What is unique to Fang is that the owner, Peter, is always there to host and wait tables.  I have never ever ordered off the menu.  As I was with a Brit who was not adventurous and another that didn't want any seafood, they told Peter what they liked and he inquired about their appetite.  Note: Peter was not offended at all by their pickiness! I should note that I'm a native Chinese San Franciscan so I eat anything.Peter came back with nice Lotus tea, ribs, spicy chicken wraps, pork dumplings, some greens over rice and another beef dish that satisfied everyone.  It was the perfect amount.Price was moderate on a business expense.

Review2592.Review: Even better food than their House of Nan King in a nicer room. Better seating, wine list, noise level and service. Great find!

Review2593.Review: Loved FANG! Really. We had a group of 11, easily got a reservation and were seated at a large table in a quiet part of the lower dining room. We put ourselves in Peter's hands and he kept bringing out the most amazing dishes until be said stop. Highlights were the beef buns, the swordfish, the Fang chicken, and the dumplings. But there was not a bad dish in the bunch. Even the pickiest eaters with us sampled and enjoyed it all. Simply delectable! Highly recommended!!!

Review2594.Review: We went during happy hour - before 6:30 and had appetizers for a great price. 1/2 off. Same with cocktails. Great bargains on already inexpensive food. Pot stickers and dumplings were both really good. Service, as other Open Table and Yelp reviews say, was spotty. Had 4 different people and had to ask for one of our drink orders 3 times. They were nice however, just a bit of a communication problem with a few. We ordered crispy short ribs which I didn't like but my wife did. Also sesame chicken which we both enjoyed. Large entrees- we took home enough for another complete meal. Next time we may just order more appetizers at happy hour. The crisy wonton with apple shavings and peanut butter was interesting for desert, kind of tasty.

Review2595.Review: As with others, the chef asked if we had any allergies and brought 4 outstanding dishes to our table. Definitely will return. Outstanding service, great food, great prices.

Review2596.Review: Food was very greasy and overpriced for what it was, and I am someone who will pay $12 for a good salad or $9 for a good sandwich. In other words, I am not a cheapskate. Owner came over right away and said he would take care of us. Okay... I wanted steamed vegetables with chicken. Instead, they served the greasiet green beans and chicken I have ever had-- practically inedible. Five people in my party, no one ordered drinks or alcohol, appetizers, or dessert, and the bill was over $85. Rip off. On a plus side, two in my party liked the shortribs. This is not Chinese food. This is Westernized takeout $5 takeout served as $16 white porcelain entrees.Will not be back. Still, it you need to entertain a client after work..the atmosphere is a +

Review2597.Review: Pre fixe option is an amazing deal! Food was great and plentiful.

Review2598.Review: The chef approach our table and asked a few questions about our food taste and allergies and then asked us if we would trust him to make a special meal for us. The meal was exquisite.

Review2599.Review: Great food. Waited 45 minutes to be seated despite having a reservation

Review2600.Review: Really nice chinese in the midst of san fran. Chef actually took our orders. Have the eggrolls...yum

Review2601.Review: Chef Fang was a tremendous host and his dishes were excellent!

Review2602.Review: Definitely more unique take on traditional Chinese cuisine, but don't expect very much by way of service.

Review2603.Review: Do not order a cocktail, you will be sorry

Review2604.Review: The food was okay, nothing really stood out. The cocktail I had was delicious though. I had the Green Dragon. It was original and had a nice bite to it while remaining refreshing.

Review2605.Review: Let Mr. Fang decide for you what to eat! Most amazingly delectable Chinese fodd I have ever had and trust me I have eaten aorund the world...While every item that was brought to the table was "to die for" the Fang's Peking Buns makes my mouth water every time I think about it (like right now). And the house fried rice is a must-have.Easy on the pocketbook and overload of food. Even 5 of us couldn't finish 6 dishes. Thank you Mr. Fang for bringing such a gastronomic dining experience to the exclusive SOMA district.

Review2606.Review: The restaurant can not handle large groups (we had 16). The wait staff was unorganized - we had 3 servers who did not talk to each other to make sure the correct orders went to the right people.

Review2607.Review: A really bad service from the hostess to start it off- completely ignored even when she was looking straight at me as I was trying to check in for my reservation. English limitation is one thing, but they need ppl, who at least acknowledgse you at a minimum, especially when you are talking to them.The food is overloaded with MSG, so be aware if you are sensitive to it. A lot of Chinese places typically use MSG, but Fang's uses a LOT. We felt like zombies aterwards and this was the worst MSG experience I ever had. I already wrote a Yelp review on this place because I really think people ought to know how MSG affects you. The food is pretty good and well presented, but you'll feel the MSG kick in and wish you ate elsewhere. We sure did

Review2608.Review: So-so food and bad service. I felt like our waiter was mad at us for being there. This place survives on it's location.

Review2609.Review: We were at FANG on a night with special big parties going on everywhere. We were seated downstairs which seems like a basement and then back in a corner. The restaurant should have closed for the private parties instead of ruining the ambience.

Review2610.Review: Food was alright, but their sister restaurant, House of Nanking, has better flavors.

Review2611.Review: Great chinese food! Some of the recipes from House of Nanking are reproduced here, plus there are some new originals that are equally delicious. We ate family style, and I had a friend who did not eat seafood. So for every dish, they brought a version that did not have seafood just for my friend. It was great service and perfect for our large party.

Review2612.Review: It was a rainy day and the two of us ordered a medium sizzling rice soup. It was unlike any sizzling rice soup - I think it had coconut milk in it and very little of anything else and cost $8.95. The green onion pancake was okay, but with smothered in sauce which made it more soggy. I did like the sesame chicken though.

Review2613.Review: We gave our meal over to the patron to plan something interesting -- and he DID. Not your typical Chinese restaurant. The standout was the soup -- but all the courses were delightful. Great location too for Yerba Buena performances. We'll be back.

Review2614.Review: For the best possible experience, allow the host/owner to choose the courses. Anything on the menu is absolutely delicious. Because Chinatown in San Francisco is a bit touristy, the best Chinese food is found at gems like Fang. All courses are served piping hot, and it's obvious that great care has gone into the selection of quality ingredients. Service is impeccable, even for the most discerning diners. The prices are very reasonable for the level of service and the quality of the dishes. It's easily my favorite Chinese restaurant, short of dining in Hong Kong or China.

Review2615.Review: Excellent fresh and tasty Shanghai cuisine. Let Mr Fang order for you.

Review2616.Review: Food is just average. Service is rushed and abrupt. Way too many great restaurants in the area to choose from to return. This was my third visit and last.

Review2617.Review: I had a few dietary restrictions and the chef surprised us with a custom menu suited to my needs. Each dish was unusual and excellent.

Review2618.Review: I do love the food here. Portions are not small-ish, but the flavors are great and the dishes well executed overall. Now onto the problem areas: 1) they have no idea what a reservation means. We showed up for our reservation only to find that there were 4 other parties waiting already, all with opentable reservations. All the hostess could offer by way of explanation was "the tables are full, have to wait" Waiting 45 mins for your table sort of defeats the purpose of a reservation. 2)service is terrible, takes ages to get water/drinks/food/bill. 3)cocktails are tiny and miss the mark. 4)tables are WAY too close, might as well be family style tables. Too bad, the food could make this place great, but every other aspect drags it down.

Review2619.Review: Having the owner choose your dishes is the best option. The bun appetizers are awesome. I bring all friends from out of town to Fang because I truly believe it is the best Chinese in town. Most of my guests agree.

Review2620.Review: FANG literally was the best Chinese food that I have ever had! The hot and sour soup was amazing! We ordered the Sesame Chicken and Chow mein both were ample but left us wanting more. I wish I lived in San Francisco because I would keep going back for more. The food is really the only thing that would keep me going back though. Service was extremely awkward, slow and inconsiderate. They utilize the team waiting system, but no one really ever seems to make eye contact with you. The owner awkwardly appeared to take our order and seemed very upset that we didn't have him order for us like the table next to us. We sat without beverages for nearly half of the meal and no one ever even glanced our way to ask if we wanted more.

Review2621.Review: I usually let the owner to make menu recommendations. So far I had loved everything that hwas recommended. THe food is not greasy, lightly seasoned, and ingredients are well balanced. We had the warm, shrimp and tomato salad for appertiser which is unusually tasty. The fish soup with rice noodle was heavenly. The calamari was very tender but a tad salty. The pork ribs had a slight smoky flavor but was a bit dry. I loved the stir fry zuchinni with duck egg yolk.

Review2622.Review: We've been there twice with small groups. The chef chose our meal, and each dish was novel and delicious. Beyond the usual Chinese menu.

Review2623.Review: I probably would have given this place more stars if we weren't seated in the far back corner with pretty spotty service. We waited for about 10 minutes for our water. Aside from that, the food was delicious! Try the pork buns - not at all what I expected - delicious.

Review2624.Review: The food was amazing! My friend and I are both vegetarian and we kept trying to figure out how the food could be so flavorful. We liked how the chef prepared a customized dish just like they do at House of Nanking.

Review2625.Review: It was pricey for the food we got. We actually left it up to the owner to pick our dishes for us, but we did specially request that we get a noodle dish. Unfortunately, the food wasn't that great or special (the only really good dish was the soup), and on top of that, we never even got the noodle dish we specifically asked for. AND - the "special dish" we got cost TWICE the price as the other dishes, and it was just some egg omelette dish that probably shouldn't have cost that much.It's too bad - the restaurant is in a good location and is really nice in terms of decor and ambiance. It's the prices and food aren't that great.For the money, we'll go back to our tried and true, favorite Chinese restaurant in SF -- R&G Lounge.

Review2626.Review: It is one of the owner's tricks, which I experienced years ago at House of Nanking, his original restaurant in North Beach. The owner will dissuade you from ordering from the menu and promised to put together a few dishes to your liking, and then charge you more for it. So, you end up not knowing what you are going to eat, have to accept what they serve you, and have to pay for it later. He probably just recommended the same things to every table so he can manage inventory in the kitchen. I wouldn't mind that if the food was good. I lived in Shanghai in the past five years and am from Taiwan originally. The food at this place was NOT GOOD AT ALL. IT's a shame. We really deserve much better Chinese food in this beautiful city....

Review2627.Review: The food is good. The location is great for lunch. The ambiance and decor is good. But, the service leaves something to be desired - efficient and perfunctory, but not welcoming and nor done with pleasantness. It is like waiting tables is a chore.

Review2628.Review: We really enjoyed the dinner very much and thanks to their Owner/Chef, Mr. Fang, tried a variety of items on the menu. All of which were excellent with our favorite being the Shrimp pouches. Great place to go for a date or just to hang out.

Review2629.Review: Just wonderful. Asked the manager to just start bringing dishes out and everything they brought was great. I had a group of 15 people and everyone loved it, no complaints.

Review2630.Review: Splendid. In our case Mr. Fang did all the ordering. Haven't experienced the quality of food in a Chinese restaurantfor a long time. The bill was steep though and at $27 per person, I am not sure I can recommend it.

Review2631.Review: The food is a more modern take on chinese cuisine however the twist is too much geared towards non-chinese palates. The waitress was very pushy towards eating "omakase" style and also put down some dishes we had picked out for other of her recommendations (that all other tables were having...). Her attitude and sales demeanor made the experience uninviting, but almost comic. The atmosphere is nice but having lights dimmed and music switch off as there are two tables left would be expected from a hole in the wall in chinatown but not a higher-end chinese restaurant.

Review2632.Review: I've been to House of Nanking a number of times.  But this was my first trip to Fang.We had a reservation.  We were more than 15 minutes late.  They did not seem to mind.   Just after we were seated, the owner-chef came over, picked up our menus, and told us to not worry about ordering.  This is usually a good side.  I am not sure what all of the dishes were.  But they were all good.The following is a list of what we had.  But only by my general description.  I do not know the menu names.Shrimp rice dish - This was a bit of a kitchen sink rice and shrimp dish.  It was very good.  and for some reason, the raw tomatoes just made the dish.Nice touch, there was someone at our table with a shrimp allergy.  A server came back

Review2633.Review: This is the best Chinese food I have had in a long time. Great service and the waitress selected our courses so we tried a variety if excellent dishes.

Review2634.Review: The Daughter of Feng served us and made some great recommendations. Food was great.
