Review2635.Review: I went there for a business "cocktails and conversation" event. It was great for appetizers. I didn't have dinner, so can't comment on the entrees, but the apps were great. Kinda noisy, but not too bothersome. Servers were a little slow, but quite friendly and helpful.

Review2636.Review: Karen Fang helped me set up the perfect surprise birthday party for a friend - she placed us in the private Tibet room and recommended the Chef's Surprise. That allowed us to assemble the celebrants in the room ahead of the birthday guest and truly surprise him.Her father, Executive Chef Peter Fang came and talked to us then cooked up a 7-course meal based on our preferences and restrictions. We had great conversations over the course of 2.5 hours and didn't have to worry about ordering or any of that. Small plates of great food just kept coming!All for $25/head (excluding all the Tsing Tao and Sake we drank, taxes and gratuity). Amazing.

Review2637.Review: Overall a very disappointing experience from start to finish. While the traditional menu fare was decently taste (sesame chicken), all of the special chef surprises were either tasteless or too salty.In terms of ambiance, we were seated in the basement area which felt cold with bad cafeteria lighting and a lack of any good background noise / music. The service was mediocre & factory line, with missed drink orders, no rhyme or reason to the order in which the food was brought out, and they forgot the rice altogether.All in all I would not recommend this place for dinner, but could see grabbing a quick & cheap workday lunch here.

Review2638.Review: The person taking our order was pushy and very unpleasant - I will never eat here again.

Review2639.Review: Love this restaurant. The proprietors check on all their guests and are more than happy to recommend or choose your dishes for you - I highly recommend letting them do so. Great, interesting food, incredibly friendly service, very reasonable prices!

Review2640.Review: The Sizzling Rice Soup is absolutely incredible! Went here for dinner and can't wait to swing by for lunch and take out this amazing delight :)

Review2641.Review: We got the owner for a server and he took away the menues and picked the dishes, so I'm not sure what we had. It was a lot of fun and the food is distinctive. Service was a little ragged. I will go again for the food.

Review2642.Review: Wow! We had a group of eleven on a Sunday afternoon. We were provided a fixed menu that was truly delightful. We had no idea what was coming next! Everyone in our party had a positive experience at a very reasonable price. The owner/chef greeted us personally and checked on us periodically throughout the meal. I would highly recommend FANG for a memorable dining outing.

Review2643.Review: Fang is in an ideal location--right near Moma and Moscone--for a nice lunch. The food is fresh and the presentation is lovely. Prices are quite reasonable.

Review2644.Review: Best Chinese food I have ever had! The owner offered to order for us and the food was delicious!

Review2645.Review: Fang is my new go to for Chinese food. I am not a huge fan of chinese food and only went to Eliza's. Now they are closed and I am happy to have found Fang. It is fresh tasting and you can usually get in. The restaurant is beautiful also but not too pricey. The best is if you let them decide what to order for you. The beef buns are quite yummy. We had a great NYE here.

Review2646.Review: Our favorite CHinese in the city. The Hot & Sour soup is wonderfully tangy. Ask Mr Fang to recommend dishes for you. You won't be disappointed.

Review2647.Review: Food is fresh, well-prepared, and in many respects quite unique. The sesame dumplings for dessert are a real treat. Fish soup was outstanding The owner does a great job of ordering for the table if you want his assistance.

Review2648.Review: Very nice Chinese food. Very clean place that has a lot of energy to it. Overall, a good experience. Get the green tea its flower based tea that is awesome. The service is ok, but does not hurt the experience.

Review2649.Review: This restaurant was extremely busy on Christmas day and the available staff tried to do their best but appeared somewhat overwhelmed. Portions of food were smaller than on prior visits here although still tasty. Recommend going here on quieter days/evenings.

Review2650.Review: The food is truly wonderful, but let Peter Fang order for you....

Review2651.Review: Take what you love about The House of Nanking, add even more exploration and breadth and put it in a much more sleek and upscale setting and you have Fang. I will definitely be back.

Review2652.Review: As it's near my office, I'm a regular at lunch, but this was my first time having dinner at Fang. And what a dinner, it was. Fang took excellent care of our party of 15, seating us downstairs in a private dining room, and serving 8 delicious courses (chosen by the management) that suited all of our tastes, including those of the 5 children in our party. There were barbecued beef buns, potstickers and a wonderful chicken dish that the kids consumed with gusto, as well as a cucumber dish and a superb fish soup that had the adults swooning. We are already talking about returning again.

Review2653.Review: The restaurant did not look like the photos on website, that was disappointing. The food was very average to poor, unless one is not familiar with authentic Chinese cuisine, then one would enjoy this place. The service was average to borderline unfriendly. The staff explained and answered our questions with no smiles and a condecending attitude. The chef interrupted our dinner twice without introducing himself first. We only found out he was the chef through the conversation. We gave constructive criticism regarding the food because we were asked, and it was obvious he was not happy with our feedback and became almost confrontational. It was a disappointing experience overall.

Review2654.Review: We had a group of 11 for dinner. It was truly outstanding. Everyone was very impressed and pleased with the Chef's selections. I can't wait to come back for another meal.

Review2655.Review: Fang is fangtastic. It is a slight step up from Nanking. The beef buns were out of this world, as was the fish soup. Delicious.

Review2656.Review: The owner came and talked to our group and recommended his specials, which, is what we had! Was the soup the best or not??? Everyone loved every dish but the soup was the best!

Review2657.Review: While the food is good the service was poor and we felt rushed. Check was almost thrown on the table by waitress. Could not get refill of tea. I doubt I will be back

Review2658.Review: Peter, the owner, was at the restaurant and selected our dishes. They were all very tasty and satisfying. The space was tight which made the restaurant loud. We could over hear the conversation of the table next to us. I bet they could her us too. Overall, I would go back.

Review2659.Review: The food is excellent. No better Chinese cuisine in the area.Unfortunately, the service was terrible. To the extent that the food was impacted.Main course was served almost immediately after the appetizers and soup, so it sat and got cold.

Review2660.Review: Best business lunch experience with Peter taking care of the order!

Review2661.Review: The space we were seated, it was a spot for 2 tables but management thought it would be "good "for business to add an extra table squeezed into the space. The result was chaotic and uncomfortable for all of the three couples seated. The waiter took orders speaking from the 3Rd table over the first couple. The food was passed throughout the bar and my boyfriend had to turn around and get himself the food since the waiter could not fit throughout the tables. This was humorous yet not funny when you have to stand up to let the first couple out.

Review2662.Review: Fun place to take friends and groups of people. We had a group of 12 people and we had a blast. Our food was excellent and we let the chef take care of us, and we were not disappointed. We got to try three of the appetizers, and 5 entrées. The food was delicious and our entire group had a blast. Only issue I saw was a lack of clear pricing on the family style meal. Was a bit surprised at the end by my total when compared to the prices we saw on the menu. That aside, it was great!!!.

Review2663.Review: Extraordinary dining. Don't use the menu.. just tell Peter your preferences and he'll organize a meal to die for..... Love'd it!!

Review2664.Review: Went for lunch. They seemed to have overbooked the lunch hour because we had a significant wait even with reservations. There were other parties also waiting for their reservations. The long walkway/stairway into the dining area is a strange way to start the experience. Once in the dining area, another short wait for them to clear our table. They forgot to bring us water and then a long wait for our food. The food was fine. Guess it's a new place so they just need to work out the logistics. But this first experience wasn't great.

Review2665.Review: Good food - fair service. Two waiters kept leaning over our table (over our food) to serve other customers until we told them to stop. This total disregard for appropriate manners should be stopped immediately. Good food was ruined by a total lack of professionalism by the wait staff. Get some real waiters!

Review2666.Review: The first times that I was there with my wife the Chef took the liberty to order for me. The food he ordered for us was excellent. The second time I went with my family and again the chef ordered for us. And again he surprised us and the food was most excellent. We will definitely come back again.

Review2667.Review: Amazing flavors. They were very accomodating. We had 18 people in our group, 2 of which are pescatarians and 1 vegetarian. They accomodated the 3 in the group and made separate dishes. The server were attentive enough considering the amount of people in our group. This is a great place for big groups, family and dates. The appetizers are delicious!!!

Review2668.Review: Contemporary and innovative, excellent, beautiful dishes. Let the chef make the menu and go with it. You won't be disappointed. The best Chinese food i have had in the United States.

Review2669.Review: Awesome food, so good I wanted to go back the day after! Service was average but I didn't mind due to the quality of the food. Brown rice delight is a must try.

Review2670.Review: Our lunch was for a group of 8 and we had a lovely private room downstairs filled with paintings, a beautiful collection of tea pots and very special china for our meal. The service, including Mr. Fang's delightful choices and informative presentation, made our lunch a special event. The fish soup, beef dumplings, shrimp pancakes, shrimp salad, to name just some of the favorites, just kept coming - and it was all delicious. We will come back again and again.

Review2671.Review: I went for a lunch with a couple of other people (clients). We ordered two appetizers and each a rice plate. Food arrived in very random order. This is not unusual for a Chinese restaurant, but a little unexpected at a place catering to the business crowd. One entree got forgotten completely until we followed up on it. Service was not bad, but more like highly inattentive. Serving sizes were generous, and food overall was pretty good, and I would be willing to eat there again, and try a few more dishes, but not with a client!

Review2672.Review: FANG was wonderful. I've been there several times now and its always great. The flavors are wonderful and for Chinese food, its quite light. Make sure to ask Mr. Fang to help you select your meal. His picks are terrific.

Review2673.Review: The food was tasty, although the menu didn't seem as innovative as a friend had said. After we placed our order with a waitress, she suggested we should re-select based on her recommendations. That was a little off-putting. We had to remind servers of our entire order and didn't receive all utensils. A young woman dropped our check on our table, without asking if we wanted dessert or coffee, no "thank you" and no instructions on to whom we should pay.

Review2674.Review: The chef took the menus and just brought us a series of things - perfect! ;)

Review2675.Review: This is not your typical Chinese restaurant. The dining rooms on the main floor and downstairs are beautiful and elegant, and the food is well-executed. Service is prompt and efficient. I have been there several times both for lunch and dinner. Every dish has been well thought by the owner chef, Peter Fang who also owns The House of Nanking in S.F. Chinatown. Some of my favourite dishes were the fish soup, steamed dumplings and steamed eggs/prawns as well as the brown rice with king oyster mushrooms. There is also a full bar and good selection of wine. It was great that Peter or his daughter, Kathy are always there and spend time to make sure that their guests are satisfied. They also do a wonderful job for parties and special occasions.

Review2676.Review: Excellent!! We came with a group of 8 and didn't know where to start & asked for their suggestions. They took our menus and proceeded to delight our tastebuds with dish after enjoyable dish! We passed each dish around and loved the variety of flavors and textures. Each dish was also just beautifully plated. The price was more reasonable than I'd expected with great atmosphere. We loved it.

Review2677.Review: Peter Fang greeted us, found out we were first time diners, and then proceeded to take our menus and had his kitchen prepare a meal for us. We knew to expect this and weren't dissapointed. The food was excellent and the selection of dishes was perfect. The beef buns were great and something we would definitely order again. Having Peter select menu options for us in smaller portions than they were available from the menu allowed us to sample more dishes and at a reasonable price. Dinner for two with drinks came to under $60.

Review2678.Review: best thing to do is let them pick the food for you. you'll not be disappointed. whether it's just two of you or a group of 15. they'll ask about your preferences and bring you something that will both surprise and delight you.

Review2679.Review: Service was very fair and the food was also mediocre. Food came out in a strange order and we were almost finished our entrees before the rice was served.

Review2680.Review: The chicken chow-mein was incredible however the other items were a bit too greasy for my liking.

Review2681.Review: we took the suggestion from other reviewers to just our waiter to "take care of us" and order what he thought best. the dishes were all great, and enough food to have our college student take home one more meal. the quality of the food was very high.would definitely go back.

Review2682.Review: I came here with a big group of nine others and got to use the glassed in area downstairs with not much notice.  It's great to tell the story of House of Nanking without having to experience that location.  The chef picked out the food -- and was especially helpful with vegetarian dishes but it was still reasonably priced.  Based on this -- I just brought another large group there and everyone was very pleased with food and service family style in the lower dining area.

Review2683.Review: Wow - went with a group of 10, had Chef Fang arrange for our meal - we didn't order anything directly - and had a stunning 8 course meal for an amazingly moderate price. Food was simply delicious. One of my best Chinese dinners in years. Cannot recommend highly enough. Superb!

Review2684.Review: Don't waste your time reading the menu -- just let the owner put together a meal for you. what a find!

Review2685.Review: Left the ordering up to Peter Fang the owner. He asked likes and dislikes and ordered dinner for us. Only problem we had was we did ask for crispy short ribs but were served crispy beef instead.Otherwise meal was wonderful. Slightly more expensive than China town restaurants but clean and attractive decor. Asked to sit downstairs but was told did not have enough help that night to serve us. Not sure if true as there was a party of eight already seated downstairs. All in all tasty, reasonable definitely a repeat. Convenient location in SOMA next door to the W Hotel and 1 block from Moscone center.Did not encounter any of the service issues others have reported. Seems like he got the message.

Review2686.Review: Great to find an excellent Chinese restaurant in this neighborhood. We let the chef-owner select dishes for us and loved the results.

Review2687.Review: Even better than the original House of Nanking, which I love. Peter and his daugther do an outstanding job of odering food for any size group, and the food is FANTASTIC! The ambiance is very nice, the service is excellent, and the experience is just top notch.

Review2688.Review: After reading the reviews it was very disappointing. The best thing on the menu was the Peking buns which were very good. The calamari was flat. The garlic prawns were not prawns, few overcooked shrimp and mostly noodles. Service was very dis-coordinated and made us feel we were a bother.

Review2689.Review: Innovative Chinese cooking incorporating lots of interesting fresh veggies. Best were the "Brown Rice Delight" combinations - the other dishes we tried (Sesame chicken, spicy fish) were extremely salty or too sweet. Service is lackadaisical, but friendly. Close to SFMOMA - we'll certainly go back next time we are in the neighborhood.

Review2690.Review: Mr. Fang ordered for our group of 10 (10/22/10). Impeccable choice of dishes, from appetizers to main courses. I give FANG extra points for accommodating our vegetarian friend's requirements.

Review2691.Review: Don't even think about picking something out on the menu. Ordering the Chef's choice is absolutely the way to go. I have been a couple of times and I won't even consider looking at the menu. This place is hands down one of the best Asian infusion places around. Skip PF Changs and hit up FANG

Review2692.Review: I attended a conference at the Moscone Convention Center, and we discovered FANG by accident. Great location, excellent service and delicious food. Their hot and sour soup is one of the best I've had, and our group shared 5 entrees, including the eggplant/tofu, sesame chicken, and brown rice with pork and vegetables. It was so good that we took another client there for lunch the following day. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Review2693.Review: Excellent Chinese with interesting and enjoyable combinations of flavors. Servers confused order and eventually recovered, but food was worth the mixup.

Review2694.Review: This is a very lovely Chinese restaurant where the owner chef helps one choose a menu that is right for them. Very nice.

Review2695.Review: The best part about this place is that you don't have to order - and the team takes care of it for you. They will ask about any special restrictions, but then it's up to the chefs to decide. You may ask yourself - what if you don't like it? well thus far - it's never happened. The food is really good.

Review2696.Review: FANG was recommended to me by a friend who has great taste in restaurants, so I was excited to try it. It was not at all what I expected. First, the staff was unfriendly and acted like they didn't want to be there. When two of us ordered the same thing, the waiter suggested (or rather insisted) that we each order something different, so we could share. When we didn't want to do that, he seemed very irritated with us. Do you have to share your food there? We ordered the rice soup, which was bland and tasteless. The sesame chicken was so over-cooked that it was hard to chew. We ordered a second round of cocktails, which took forever to get, and they came back looking much different than the first round...not sure what that was about.

Review2697.Review: Creative menu, healthy , tasty choices and reasonable prices. Definitely going back.

Review2698.Review: Same owner as House of Nanking although here much more upscale Chinese restaurant. Service is good; owner will come by and speak with you at the table (weekends), decor is also upscale. Ask to be seated downstairs if you wish to talk because upstairs is cacophonous. Dishes are very creative although not those that you'd see at a Chinese restaurant frequented by Chinese folks.

Review2699.Review: Being the sister restaurant to the House of Nan King, I was expecting the food to be at least as good. No such luck. The main courses were relatively bland and disappointing. The only saving grace was the appetizer - the chicken buns. Everything else was pretty downright mediocre. The service was just as bad as at the House of Nan King. I don't think I'll go back here anytime soon.

Review2700.Review: the food was very good but the service was flat out bad. the veggie dishes were served after our main (fish and chicken dishes). they brought our rice very late and then it was the wrong type of rice. The drinks were great, even though we had to remind them to bring them. if they work through the kinks and the kitchen and wait staff can better time things,,, this will be a great restaurant.

Review2701.Review: Excellent food, excellent price. Another Peter Fang success.

Review2703.Review: We were treated well. We did not order from the menu, instead they built us a dinner with our parameters of no pork and one of us could not eat shellfish. One of the courses was shellfish and they made him a special bowl with chicken instead. Plate after plate of delicious food with interesting flavors came our way. All for $140 for six people before tip. Highly recommended.

Review2704.Review: Having once been a fan of House of Nan King, I have to say that Fang is no different and in fact is not as good as I remember Nan King being. The food was mediocre...meager portions, served to us luke warm (not hot the way it is at Nan King), and I'm guessing they charge more for it...oh, and I left feeling hungry. They do offer brown rice instead of white rice which is nice. With the exception of the owner Peter Fang who was there and took our order, the rest of the wait staff are rude, just as they are at Nan King. I doubt I'll go back.

Review2705.Review: Service was very attentive and generally excellent. We tried couple of different appetizers and a main course, and everything was great. Happy hour deal of half price appetizers and reduced drink prices is nice.

Review2706.Review: Fang was 'fantastic'. Food was not your typical Chinese food and was wonderful. We got a tip from a SF local - let the owner pick the menu and matching wine for you. Well worth it as we got some unusual dishes that we would not of thought to pick. A total cost of the meal was an even better surprise.

Review2707.Review: The owner was awesome! Family style for $20 per person!! There were 15 of us, and they handled it very well.

Review2708.Review: Great time and loved the food selected for us by the owner/chef.

Review2709.Review: Enjoyed having the host choose our meal. Great twist on Chinese cuisine. Good bar too.

Review2710.Review: We were a party of five, first time at the restaurant. The chef ordered for us, with a vegetarian dish for one of us each course. All the dishes were new to us, and we had a wonderful meal. We plan to return.

Review2711.Review: Fabulous dining experince, food was yummy. Delicous, delicious!!. Service was warm, friendly and excellent. Prices are very good too. Ambience very calm and beautiful.

Review2713.Review: Great food, been there numerous times and it always been great. Ask the boss to feed you, don't even look at the menu.

Review2714.Review: consistently excellent food: wonderful place to savor innovative Chinese food. What a treat.

Review2715.Review: Really above average Chinese food in a more upscale setting. Mr. Fang is a welcoming host.

Review2716.Review: The food is brilliant. If you have the opportunity, get the owners attention and ask him what he recommends. He'll ask a few simple qualifying questions, give a knowing nod, and place the order for you. You won't be disappointed.

Review2717.Review: I was there with a group of people and we love the food. It was delicious! The service was great and definitely we'll go back there again

Review2718.Review: excellent food: Mr. Fang recreates what Chinese food should be. I dine here regularly.

Review2720.Review: This is the hidden gem of all Asian restaurants. Peter Fang is a genius and his food is delicious. He will make whatever you want. I have brought visitors from all over the country, including some very famous people, and everyone says, "This is the best Chinese food ever!"

Review2721.Review: The owners know how to make good food but their service can be improved. For an upperscale theme of their original house of nankinThe service is still mom and pop

Review2722.Review: Love this place - so glad we have an upper scale Chinese restaurant in the neighbourhood. The food as prepared by the executive chef - who has classical French training - is fresh and tantalizingly delicious - especially the shrimp pockets. In keeping with the traditions established at its elder sister restaurant, House of Nan King, it's best to have Peter just bring you food - he always knows how much to bring to the table.  Oh and they know how to cater to Vegans.Also threw a 400+ person party here earlier in the year - spectacular success - the executive chef worked with us on the menu selections creating the perfect finger food dishes and the bar and wait staff worked really really hard for us - great evening - took over two floors!

Review2723.Review: Decided to check it out due to reputation of sister restaurant (House of Nanking). We had different foodservers which not only made it confusing but our order was messed up a few times and service was spotty (they brought out wrong drinks, added in an extra entree which we didn't order, and progression of food was disorganized). We tried 3 different appetizers (vegetable eggrolls were VERY greasy, potstickers were average, and beef buns tasty and only notable item throughout our entire meal), sizzling rice soup (overly spicy due chili oil floating on top, and hardly any sizzling rice), and Mongolian Beef (average). With so many good Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, you can probably skip this one until they make improvements.

Review2724.Review: We're not accustomed to staff practically insisting that we order as instructed. Food was both too salty and too sweet--unlike any Chinese food we're accustomed to eating, but then we didn't see any Asian customers.OK for those who don't care about authenticity, but, those sensitive to salt should alert staff. Food was also unnecessarily oily.All that said, dishes were tasty and colorful, often with a caramelized element. Bok choy salad would have been really good if not for sweetness.At least it offers brown rice! And great, warm, complimentary almond cookies!

Review2725.Review: This is the place the waitress brings your check before asking if you want to order anything else like dessert and is not located in airports. It was very obvious that they wanted to turn the table REALLY quickly. Food was good. Maybe better for ordering to-go.

Review2726.Review: We went for lunch as a group of 6 - we were trying to decide on dishes to share and the chef came to our table and offered to come up with something for us - he asked a few questions about what we liked and took it from there. It was excellent! Fun to eat and delicious. We had a great time and would all go back.

Review2727.Review: The owner came to our table to greet us and suggested that he order everything for us. We got two appetisers and three entrees. Plenty of food for six. Different items than I would have ordered, but everything was terrific!! Bill for six was just over $100.00.Great food--great service--great value. Everyone at the table was very impressed

Review2728.Review: This place has all the makings of a wonderful restaurant, but just missing the finishing touches.  The food is good, but not oustanding.  The service was nice but quite scattered.  I would go back, just because it is near my place, but otherwise I would not go out of my way to come here.

Review2729.Review: Good food, reasonable prices. Good for flexible eaters, not for picky or selective eaters.

Review2730.Review: A warm welcome and attentive service by servers and management made this a memorable experience - not to mention the wonderful food! A value added happy hour would make this my first choice if I lived or worked closer. Definitely a permanent on my favs list. Nice decor, too - a cut above the typical Chinese restaurants, a modern bar, nice lighting, nice ambiance.

Review2731.Review: Fantastic and delicious ! The chef owner asked if he could take care of us rather than to have order. He was great! The food and service were amazing abc reasonably priced!

Review2732.Review: Great Food, an improvement over house of nanking for sure, and house of nanking was great to begin with (the owners other restaurant). For a real treat have Mr. Fang order your meal for you, you won't be disappointed. The restaurant looks more expensive then it is as well, which is a nice suprise

Review2733.Review: Great food and a wonderful experience. Staff was generous in helping select food for my Vegetarian wife and very intuitive. Food was not your average Chinese but a few steps above!

Review2734.Review: The food was so great that I'd go there again, even though the service was comically bad. The staff was friendly and pleasant, but seemed very inexperienced and distracted. I'd suggest not going if you're in a hurry or impatient. Duck buns and clay pot pork both were unbelievably good.

Review2735.Review: This is now the best Chinese restaurant in San Francisco with innovative, sophisticated and delicious food. Also a great place to take client's for lunch.

Review2736.Review: Nice to finally have a Chinese restaurant in SF with a more modern, upscale atmosphere and food that ventures beyond the typical beef-and-broccoli fare. Last time I went I let the owner order for me -- he ordered just the right amount of food and everything was terrific.

Review2737.Review: It was a great experience for me and my clients. We requested that the owner order our meal and it was a delight.The food was lighter than traditional Chinese (i.e. sauces, etc.). It also used a lot of fresh, seasonal ingredients.We all loved it...b

Review2738.Review: Fantastic spot for groups. It's like they took the menu from House of Nan King and found a posh venue. Love it and a wonderful value. We went with a group of 10 and dined family style. Everyone had a few drinks and the bill was about $400!!! Where can you do that in SF???

Review2739.Review: Our group of 7 asked the owner to serve us whatever he thought would be best, and the DELICIOUS dishes just kept coming and coming! When we received the bill, we were surprised at how reasonable it was considering how much we'd eaten and how tasty each dish was. And oh, the clamshell pork buns - OHHH MY GOODNESS. I went back the next day with my husband for those.

Review2740.Review: Excellent food and service. made us feel like we owned the place! definitely coming back for more great food!!!

Review2741.Review: The best Chinese food in the city. Opened by the owners of House of Nanking, gives you the same great food, but in modern venue that's a nice change from the normal chinese food dive. Definitely let the Chef Peter Fang or his daughter Kathy order for you and you'll get the best of their menu. If you're lucky, by request Kathy will make off-menu Asian fusion dishes that are unique from any restaurant in SF.

Review2742.Review: Peter does it all. Wasnt sure what to order but Peter took care of that. Food was excellent. Staff was very friendly. Would go back for sure. Let Peter take care of you and you won't be disapointed.
